We have reviewed your comments with our team and we are making adjustments so that this will not happen to others in the room category.  Again, I apologize for this and hope you will give us another chance to earn your loyalty and business.  Sincerely, Bob Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Almost perfect
review: I will say the room condition is about the average. The bathroom's design is not conformable , there are not any spaces for you to put your shampoo, conditioner and any other shower supplies when you take a shower. There is an only one moveable shelf outside of shower curtain, when you open the curtain to get your soap or shampoo , the shower water will go to whole bathroom floor. I also didn't like the toilet,  It makes very loud noise and water sprinkled out when you flush the toilet, so you need to stay away the toilet when flush. If you do not flush more times, the paper will not completely go away. The house keeper did not leave enough toilet paper(only one roll, no spare one) in the bathroom, and never replaced the tissue paper as well while we stayed there for 5 nights.…

title: Construction
review: Nice room, clean but don't get a room facing highway. Very noisy on balcony.  Very fast check in and out. High parking fee with only valet parking. Family vistors or any vistor will be charged to park at motel.

title: Will not stay here again
review: Dear A1574QEgeorgeb,  Thank you for your review.  I do apologize for the inconvenience for our front drive construction, however has needed to happen for a long time and we are proud of the enhancement to the hotel that this will make.  You are correct that this hotel as most of the major hotels in Fort Lauderdale only have valet.  I can say that our charges for valet are some of the lowest in the beach area.  Again, thank you for your review.  Sincerely, Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Great rate for a beautiful view close to the beach
review: The location is great but the rooms are dirty and smelly. I had to change rooms 2x before getting one that was clean and did not have bugs! I had problems with my bill being charged for additional car valets that took several attempts to correct. I feel bad for the front desk staff, housekeeping is not keeping up and all the rooms are in bad need of renovation.

title: A bit dissapointing
review: Dear R7526NEamym, Please accept my apologies for what you encountered at our hotel.  This is certainly not the standards you expected or the standards we set for ourselves. You can rest assured that this has been reviewed by our housekeeping department so that no one else will have to endure this type of service.   Again, please accept my apologies  Sincerely, Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Another Fantastic Time, This time with the family
review: For the price, we had a great experience at the GalleryOne. We had asked for an early check-in, as I had a meeting at noon. I received a text around 2pm that we could check-in, so at least my boyfriend could get settled. The front desk staff was very helpful, and I understood that they got us in as soon as possible. Also, the front drive is under MAJOR construction - as in, there's no front drive and massive congestion. Check-in/checkout was a little hectic because of this, but it was fine. Once we got to the room, the view, balcony, and amazing bed made everything worth while! We got to witness a gorgeous evening sky, with views of the intracoastal and the ocean off to the right. The balcony and some of the features in the room seemed a little on the older side, but everything…

title: BAD STAY
review: I normally always stay at this location and Im not a person that complains. For starters I brought my girl friend there to propose, thinking that this would be the perfect place NO.. The Room smell like there was mold, then the drapes had stains 4 feet from the bottom on up don't know if it was mold or what. The carpet in the hallway looks like it hadn't been clean in years not a long the hallway had a smell of trash. The balcony had cigaretts buds as if it hadn't been swept, the soap holder was brown from rust and to top it off the construction out front i understand what was going on but they were loud as HELL drilling at 8AM.. I was very very piss to spend my money in this type of fashion, i started to post the pictures i took from all of my concerns and my dislikes but my…

title: 6 Nights and 7 Days "At Home" at Gallery One
review: Dear neisacb,  Please feel free to contact me directly as we want to make this right if you were in one of the Hilton rooms.  I do apologize for what was certainly an unacceptable stay.    Regards, Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Construction, not accommodating
review: The bed was luxuriously comfortable, the bathroom was clean and spacious, the kitchenette was a real asset, and the view from both rooms was awesome!  We felt comfortably at home as we munched on the chocolate chip cookies.

title: Girls Trip
review: Dear charla2017,  Thank you so much for your review.  It is great to read how much you enjoyed your stay.   regards, Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Great Location, Front of Hotel Under Construction!
review: We booked for a wedding far in advance of our August 2017 stay. 2 weeks out from the stay we got a text from the bride and groom, not the hotel, that there is construction and we will get a courtesy discount and free parking/valet service. We couldn't change hotels at that point so we stayed. The room was great. Beautiful views over the waterways, spacious and clean. Service at the front desk was courteous and the valets were polite but overworked. 'Construction' is an understatement. One way in, one way out. Difficult to get your car, not allowed to get it yourself. Our son was in the wedding but not allowed the free parking because he wasn't in the 'wedding block' ( though we learned later that others were given the allowance. Very inconsistent.) Many of us were late for…

title: A quick visit for 2 days
review: The hotel was clean and staff were very attentive. Its situated approximately 10 minutes walk from the beach and has a river boat taxi platform/stop if you are wanting to get about and see the sights along the river. The room was very spacious with a kitchen and living area and the food was nice within the hotel. Within 5-10 minute walk there are also shops/restaurants/bars and the mall is very close within walking distance too.

title: Great for families
review: Dear Michael W  Thank you for your review and letting us hear about your stay.   we hope the next time you plans call for you to be in Fort Lauderdale that you will return.  I personally want to thank you for your business.  sincerely,  Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: A 5 Star Experience
review: Booked a 2-bedroom room which was spacious and nice. A small kitchenette and good beds.   Located next to a channel and close to the beach. Has a small pool, gym etc.   Great breakfast, with a chef that makes your personalized omelette. Friendly and good service personnel everywhere.   Only valet parking.

title: Nice stay!
review: Dear Reijo B  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us and we all are looking forward to your return.  Sincerely, Bob  Robert Keesler  General Manager

title: The Galleria Doubletree Fort Lauderdale offers plenty
review: This hotel is such a gem.  The location is fabulous.  Safe.  Across from the Amazing Hugh Taylor Birch State Park.  It was clean, beautiful and well appointed.  Exceeded my expectations in every way!  Staff was friendly.  And the Cookie!!! Yum!

title: Mold in sleeping room ducts
review: My room had a bad smell. I kept asking for assistance. After two days, I discovered black mold in the air vent. They moved me to a new room that was better, however, the hotel isn't very clean. Needs new carpet and upgraded elevators.

title: Parking fees
review: Dear J8538ZBpatrickc,  Thank you for your review.  Please accept my apologies for this incident.  You can rest assured that this is unacceptable and has been quickly remedied by our engineering team.   We appreciate your review as this only helps us improve our services and makes sure we are always improving.  Sincerely, Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Love the 'suite' style rooms and the staff!
review: I booked a private condo for 6 nights through my RCI vacation getaway.  When I arrived I was told I did not have access to some of amenities, i.e., hotel cleaning.  This is performed by a cleaning service by the owner. No problem, however, I was told that parking per day was $35 which total $209.00.  I was not given any options for parking my rental.  This is ridiculous. I don't know if I was charged this amount because I booked a private condo and/or all of the hotel guest are charged this amount.  I am reporting this to my RCI vacation getaways so anyone booking a stay here are aware of these fees.

title: Wedding Stay with family and friends
review: Dear rosiefayson,  Thank you for your review but as you pointed out you were not a guest of GALLERYone DoubleTrees Suites by Hilton.  I am sorry the owner of the unit you rented did not inform you of the daily parking charges incurred by all guests.  I can tell you that all major hotels in the beach area have valet parking only and our rate is one of the lowest on the beach. You are correct that these units do not have Hilton amenities or daily housekeeping.  I do hope the next time you return to Fort Lauderdale you will book your reservation through Hilton and have a different experience. Sincerely, Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Nice Hotel Great Staff!!
review: Perfect location to enjoy Fort Lauderdale's waterways, beach and Galleria shopping.   The rooms are all 'suite' style and worth every penny. The front desk was well managed...Guy is my favorite. And the valet parking which is mandatory, but has the best crew I have ever seen...Yea Edress and the boys!

title: Not a typical diamond level experience
review: This hotel does not live up to the normal Hilton service.  The rooms are spacious but need updating.  The hallway on the fourth floor smelled like fish.  The rooms did not but getting to the room was not fun.  We had four rooms with 10 people and will not be staying here again when we cruise out of ft Lauderdale.

title: family vacation
review: Dear Shermantt,  please accept my apologies as our Diamond members are our most important guests.  It is disappointing to hear about your experience.  We are in the process of refurbishing all our corridors before year end as well as doing other work within the hotel.  I do hope the next time you return to Fort Lauderdale you will give us another try and experience the improvements we have made.   Sincerely  Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: So much potential
review: The only concern is house-keeping. They do not do a good job at cleaning. Upon our arrive there was a dirty wash cloth that was left on the chair in the bedroom, hair on the toilet and floor. Third day of our stay. We went to the beach that morning, came back to the room around 2 pm and house-keeping still had not been in to clean the room. We showered and left for dinner. Returned to the room and house-keeping made the bed, left clean towels, but  did not sweep or vacuum the bathroom floor or bed room because there was  sand on the floor where we went to the beach. They need to work on this issue. I was given a 30 food voucher, but still cleanness is NUMBER 1. The hotel is a 10 min walk to the beach. The amenities in the area is in walking distance. We did not need to rent a…

title: Weekend trip
review: feliciam307, Thank you for letting us know about the poor arrival experience you had with housekeeping.  Please accept our apologies for this over site.  You can rest assured that this has been addressed with our team.    Sincerely Bob  Robert Keesler General Manager

title: Hotel Survey
review: Hilton Honors gold member but first time staying at a Double Tree. The "rules" were SO different than any other Hilton property I've stayed at so I was let down before even checking in. For example, I would've had to pay $25 just to check in early when the hotel had clean rooms ready. No thanks. I was told I couldn't leave cash for incidentals that I must have my credit card authorized for incidentals. There's not even a minibar in the room so I was confused as to why I couldn't use cash. The bell boy wouldn't allow me to use a luggage cart to put my groceries on. Both him and the front desk associate said they could bring my groceries up with my luggage but I had cold food and needed it in the fridge right away.   It was apparent that the room had seen better days. The glass…

title: Horrible customer service/Don't rent private Condos
review: We are frequent travelers and staying at Gallery One has been one of the worst experiences we have ever had.  We bought through Travelocity and we're not aware this was a private condo situated in a hotel.  The front desk people could care a less about you, the manager of the condo is not helpful, you get one roll of toilet paper and no fresh towels or cleaning, plus you pay 33.00 for parking.  We stayed in Miami in a way nicer place for cheaper with better amenities.  Condo is dingy and needs remodeling.  We were woken up early due to a fire alarm test we were not aware of until we checked in at midnight. So much for a relaxing vacation.  Save your money.  Stay at The B hotel on the ocean

title: terrible customer service, ignorant supervisor
review: Dear April B,  I am so sorry that you did not stay with GALLLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  Unfortunately your accommodations was through one of several private owners that rent their suites themselves.  These units are not part of the Hilton Brand nor have our standard or our daily amenities, such as housekeeping.  I am sure if you had rented through the hotel and not a private owner your experience would have been very different.  The units that are not part of the hotel carry no services and unfortunately we cannot provide services to these units.  I do thank you for warning others about these units that are not part of our hotel. I hope that on your next visit you book with the hotel and see the difference.  Sincerely  Robert Keesler General Manager of GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.

title: Several issues
review: I am a Hilton Honor member. We drove down to Fort Lauderdale on the 22nd of July to check in to two rooms. The check in time was 4pm. One room was ready and we were asked to wait 15 minutes for the second room on the same floor. After 20 mins we were asked to wait 5 more minutes. Then after 15 minutes we were asked to wait for 5 more minutes but at this time I was told by the receptionist " I am waiting just like you".  WHAT KIND OF CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THIS? After waiting 1 HOUR and 20 MINUTES at 5:35 I went and asked about the room. The receptionist told me it was ready LONG AGO and the key was in front of her. Both of the receptionist were disorganized and unprofessional. Eventually we got the room key and before I left the reception I asked the receptionist to let the bell…

title: Had a great Time!
review: Dear Dawn S,  It is so disappointing to read your review. Please accept my sincere apologies.  Obviously we have a several new team members on our Guest Relations Desk that still have not fully been trained properly.  The response you received is not our standard or the way we treat our valuable guests.  I apologize again and thank you for bringing this situation to my attention.  You can rest assured that corrective actions are already in place with the proper training.   Sincerely, Bob Keesler General Manager

title: Disgusting, Dirty, and Dated
review: This hotel has a $33/day valet fee and is a valet only hotel, not disclosed on reservation but at time of check. Room needed maintenance. Front entrance under construction. Seemed like one mishap after another. Complimentary breakfast was ok, but the table I was originally sat at had bugs crawling around on it and the server acted as if it was not a problem but did move me to another table.

title: Tons of potential ,but a dissapointment ....
review: This property has a ton of potential ,but a real disappoint ,located between the beach and a shopping mall (walking distance)and a water taxi stop , but the room it self need a makeover blotches of discolored paint on the ceiling ,cabinets,are swollen appears to have water damage ,carpet in hallway in front of (rm922)worn to the backing . The pool bar was having a Happy Hour,when we arrived ,but closed because it was "too hot",room was never cleaned after our first night stay (we were there for two nights ). Valet was the only option for parking and the first day it went smooth text them for our car and it was waiting when we got down stairs ,the next day they said they were having problems with the texting system ,even though I got a confirmation text saying they received it

title: Awesome trip!
review: We have never been to Ft. Lauderdale, but we're glad we did! Everyone was so kind and the hotel was fantastic! We checked out many restaurants and were never once disappointed. Drinks were great as well. Definitely on the spending side, but it's a vacation! Thanks again!

title: Great Hotel, Staff and location!!!
review: Guy (pronounced Gee) from Haiti, speaks 6 languages, asks EVERYDAY if there is anything he can do to make your stay better! Chris & Justin outside are there to take care of all of your transportation needs & remember me well from each year when I stay there while judging the Southern States. Even check-out was super professional! Next to Galleria Mall & 2 block walk to beautiful public beach & great restaurants, pubs, bars

title: I enjoyed my stay!
review: My stay at The Gallery One Doubletree was excellent!  From arrival to departure the staff was very nice.  Awesome service throughout hotel.  My suite was comfortable and clean!  The water view from the balcony was beautiful.  Can't wait to visit again.

title: Nice Hotel-Sort Stay
review: This Hotel Looked Nice and the inside was nice as well. I mean, it was unfortunate that we were only booked to stay here one night. The staff seemed very nice and they were helpful. A lot of food locations in walking distance. We stopped at the bar late before they closed and the bartender was great! There was a wedding or a wedding party there and the set up seemed very nice. I was almost ready to go into the party myself. LOL LOL... We will definitely try to get back down here to stay again.

title: Fantastic Staff AND Great Location!
review: Guy (pronounced Gee) from Haiti, works front desk, speaks 6 languages and has impeccable customer service skills. Checks on you every day! Chris & Justin outside for ALL transportation needs are super! ALL inside hotel employees are SUPER personable & helpful!

title: A nice hotel along the Inter coastal waterway
review: I stayed in Gallery one for 3 nights and had a great time. The hotel Is located close to the beach and along the inter coastal water way.   Reservation was easy and the check in was a breeze. Hotels staff was friendly. Even though the hotel is small Hilton has the same outstanding service here and the rooms were maintained very well. The room had a small kitchen with all utensils, dish washer, a small living room, a bed and bath room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean.   The hotel has a restaurant and a bar and there are many restaurants nearby as well. It's very close to the Galleria and to the beach. Another main attraction is this hotel has a Water taxi stop. One can board and get off at this place which is very convenient.   Overall a great stay and I…

title: S. FLA NPC education
review: This was a business trip to South Florida to deliver health and wellness information to a disabled population. We were able to talk to the business center to get an audio visual specialist. The staff was more than accommodating and anytime we needed something the front desk was more than available to help us or get what we needed delivered to us  promptly.

title: Every amenity I wanted for fair price
review: Friendly professional front desk staff Very clean, well-decorated suite. Especially liked that the comforter was wrapped in 2 clean white sheets. Liked fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Nice gym. Beautiful ocean view

title: Nice hotel
review: We stayed here after the  bad experience with Hampton inn. The staff were very nice. The room were very room. It was walking distance to the beach, restaurants, and stores. They helped us with our luggage and parked our car. The hotel is a little bit expensive well worth it if you want to be pampered.

title: ignored
review: i have been going in to this hotel for two years now ...its a good location.  you can see the lack of attention of the personnel, and the food , i think they are in a confort zone, and its starting to show ..!!!! food is average , cleaning is average, services is average, wifi average, room services is average, valet parking (those guy are great) and super funny ....but the rest is average and rate is premium

title: Disgusting, Dating, and Dissatisfied
review: Please don't stay at this hotel unless you don't have any other option or unless cleanliness and organization is not a factor to you. I will post a longer review with photos using the same title no later than tomorrow. This submission is through the property's survey.

title: Nice Location close to the beach
review: Clean and spacious suite with a balcony.  Nice view of water ways.  Car parking is expensive and valet only but a safe place for the vehicle.  Good Food.  Close to the beach, major highways and quite a few great restaurants to chose from.

title: Very disappointing for a Hilton Hotel. Do not expect that.
review: I´ve stayed at GalleryOne for 2 weeks, in a business trip.The hotel is just dirty. It´s a dirty hotel. The elevator has left overs on the ground everyday, the room itself was not proper cleaned. I had hair on the bath floor every single day. some of my colleagues that stayed at 4th floor, found cockroaches in their rooms. I got the feeling that there is a lack of maintenance. My door only opens if I pull with my hand very hard up and pull with my body (that "tip" was given by the maintenance guy) Another issue is the safety. The hotel allows many events, like weeding, party at suites and so on, so it´s a lot of people getting around the floors that are not guests. The elevators doesn´t have security access. Besides, the balcony has access to other rooms.  Internet isn´t good…

title: Comfortable beds and nice staff, but cockroaches and bad cleaning
review: The rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable and the location of the hotel is very nice. The valets are very pleasant.  Here comes the reason for the 2/5 though:    - The breakfast buffet is awful. The food is really bad, and if you're a bigger family you'll get fined for it by the hotel (Yes, it's true. We had to pay a "big party fee" of 25$ for being 6 people). Do not eat at the hotel.  - We had cockroaches in our room  - The cleaning is bad and the dinnerware and cutlery is dirty, so you have to clean it yourself.   - They play obnoxious music extremely loud every day, all day, by the pool.   If the hotel was cheaper I would rate it better, but it's not and it's simply not deserving the price it's claiming.

title: Good location, bad hotel
review: With all the hotels in the Ft. Lauderdale Area, I suggest you use another hotel. Overall experience fell way below the standards of Hilton properties.  From the time I arrived to the time I left, service was less than satisfactory.

title: Nice hotel but infastructure issues
review: Had issues with power in room on first night,when I got to the room i had no lights, no TV and had to wait for someone to come and fix. Lots of noise from sliding glass doors in other rooms. While taking a shower water from above floor leaked into my shower on me. Service was nice, hotel was in good location, room was clean. But the infrastructure needs updating.

title: Good Value
review: The employees were awesome!   Darraneisha and Kay were amazing.  The check-in and check-out process was smooth.  Starbucks in the lobby was a definite plus.  The cleanliness let a little to be desire but it wasn't horrible.  Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

title: Definitely not Four-Star!
review: Booked through Priceline. Immediately called hotel to verify type of room we would have. Room description was very misleading. We walked into a room so small we were literally walking on top of each other. The balcony was not really a balcony as it only went out about a foot. With bed room for closed, the bedroom got no air conditioning. The room appeared to be used infrequently as the clock was way off and everything was covered in dust. The bathroom door did not lock. Hallway carpets dirty. Front desk staff quite rude upon check-in. We were moved after two nights to a bigger suite, but the hotel is definitely in need of a thorough cleaning and updating. Staff may also want to be more aware of how they are treating guests. Valet completely ignored me to help someone who walked…

title: Nice vibe
review: I really enjoyed my stay. Our room was nice and our view was perfect. The beach was just a short walk from the hotel, lots of great food options and stores are so convenient. The art gallery adds so much value to the hotel. Thanks

title: Excellent
review: Will definitely book again at this hotel. Thank you for making this stay a very special one. Every one in every depart was very helpful especially Mariana and Kevin on make no me plan and help with my daughters ceremony. The front desk staff to the bell boys, everyone was very kind and profess.

title: No follow up
review: Had to ask 3 times to get pool towels. WiFi did not work, they were looking into it and never got back to us.  Housekeeping did not leave more dishwasher detergent so we could wash dishes on second day.  Valet did not bring our car up on first call, we had to ask again.  Location was great and rooms were comfortable.

title: Worth the price
review: As Hilton Honors members we were upgraded to a suite that had windows nearly all the way around the room. Great views, clean and very good service. We loved the cookies at check in, nice touch! I was worried reading prior reviews. We saw no bugs.   The breakfast was a little pricey but literally the best omelette I've ever had!   As with all properties in Fort Lauderdale, the mandatory valet for $33 per night is excessive but we were able to call for the car ahead and never waited long.   Bring your own drinks to the pool, a double Jack and Coke set us back $14 each. Ouch.   All in all, I'd stay again with a few adjustments. You can bring your own food and drink to make it more affordable. If you are coming from out of town, use Uber from the airport. Many things in walking…

title: Great Position
review: Having visited this hotel twice before we were a bit disappointed to see it was now in need of a bit TLC. When we arrived we were early but given access to our room which was good but as there seemed to be a wedding party going on we were given our keys and no information at all about the hotel. We were not offered the warm cookies they just seemed too busy to be bothered with us. We had a water view which was lovely but our suite needed a bit of attention . Just little things like the holder for the iron inside the wardrobe was off the wall ,the handle on the wardrobe was loose.the curtain in the bedroom would not open and the inside of the bathroom door needed a good clean it was mucky. That aside the bed was clean nice sheets,comfortable and the bathroom was a good size with…

title: I'm coming back
review: Great service all over. This hotel made me feel at home. I'm glad the kitchenette came with dishes and pots to use. My room was very roomy. We 4 adult ladies and we didn't feel all on each other. I'm coming back!!

title: Convenient, but Watch Out If You Have Your Own Car
review: This hotel is ideally located. It is excellent for people who fly into Fort Lauderdale and don't need a car. There is a short walk to the beach, and a block away is an elegant, enclosed shopping mall with restaurants ranging from inexpensive to outrageous.  One caveat:  no parking of one's car is allowed.  Valet parking is required, and the charge is $33+tax per day.  In every other Hilton property, parking is around $20 at most - even in cities like D.C.  Cars are parked about two blocks away, so one can wait for 20 minutes to get one's vehicle and get underway.  Not only that, valets are particularly careless, and it is not unusual to hear motors bursting into speed and brakes squealing.  The valet parking assistants are also the people who control the luggage carts one can…

title: Dishonest Employees
review: We stayed at this Hotel in March and left a watch in the night stand drawer. When we got home that night we call the Hotel they went to the room found the watch. Housekeeping was going to lock it up an call back in the morning to handle the return since Housekeeping was close. We called the next morning to verified my address and supposedly mail the watch. Two weeks went by and no watch. Called back and seems nobody knew the about the watch and the employee I spoke to doesn't remember either I won't mention any names. After trying to contact the Housekeeping manager for over a month he calls me and sends me to the claims dept they called once and would never return my calls or email for a month. I then went to Corp Hilton and they sent an email to the Manager and to this date no…

title: Excellent Customer Service
review: I was relocating from another Hilton property to this property and what an amazing difference. The staff was very helpful and the rooms are amazing. This is a perfect hotels for people traveling with children and need the suite style room for the vacation. I would highly recommend this property.   The staff goes above and beyond to make sure their guest are taking care of. The valet team is very prompt on getting the cars.   Tips- There is no self park only valet.

title: Great Hotel on the Intracoastal
review: We had a great long weekend in a roomy suite with a view of the Intracoastal waterway.  The hotel is an official stop of the Water Taxi, which makes getting around Ft. Lauderdale very easy.  It's an easy walk to the beach, the Galleria Mall, and several nice restaurants.  Pack earplugs if you're a light sleeper, however, because the hotel is right next to a drawbridge and cars driving over the steel plates make an incredible racket.

title: DHS 25th Class Reunion
review: We had a blast. We truly appreciate Mariana Steetle, Amy Luczak, Nicole and Kimberly Miller for their hospitality, courteous staff assisting with our class reunion, Top Chef for excellent food... for everything.  We could not have done this without their expertise....   Our 25th class reunion was REMARKABLE.

title: BUGS inside the room. Front Desk didn't find our reservation. Charges double for already paid room
review: Nightmare! We sent a message to our host saying that we would arrive after 11:00 pm and got their reply about a 24 hs desk and that our keys would be ready for us! We got at the desk, they dind't find our reservation. We showed the emails and messages. They refuse to give us the room we had book. Instead they gave us room 603. Dirty, full of bugs. We were able to get into the room after 2 am, paying double for a terrible room plus 33 dollars for parking!

title: Family reunion
review: We have a family reunion every 2years, and we love to stay in Hilton's, however this was the worst experience I've ever had. We didn't like the idea of the prices we ven for the valet. I'd rather have parked my car and saved a few extra dollars.

title: serious updates needed
review: Customer service is EXCELLENT but...the hotel is in desperate need of renovation. Carpet in hallways and rooms are torn, dirty and smelly. Roaches crawling on the wall need elevator, door to my first room looked like someone had previous busted it, molded in shower. Not what anyone expects for $282.00 per night. I have stayed here many times over the last 10 years and this was the worst. I will never book this hotel again

title: Be Aware of Roaches!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: ROOM # 823!   Kitchen was filthy! We finally ( after a long miserable day of traveling) lay in bed- start to fall asleep- felt something on me - A ROACH!!!!! not just one! two of them! We also found one in the bathroom and one in the kitchen. We are told to contact a different number for housekeeping ( NO ONE ANSWERS!)  We went downstairs @ 11pm to get bottled water and a snack- guess what!? THEIR CLOSED! And with the "private condo" you are not allowed to use their room service!   ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!!!!  I WILL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN! VERY DISAPPOINTING!

title: Great Stay
review: Stayed at this hotel for my 40 year class reunion. Took the upgrade offered. Well worth it! First class suite! Didn"t spend a whole lot of time at the hotel but the time I spent was quite satisfactory. Went to the pool bar and enjoyed the room.

title: Very Nice
review: I love this hotel! The rooms are very spacious and the staff is very friendly. I always stay at this hotel when I'm visiting Fort Lauderdale Florida because it's in an awesome location. It's right across from the mall, across from a very nice grocery store, and 3 blocks from the beach! With all the rooms being suites, it's an excellent hotel for a family vacation or a romantic getaway. I  feel this hotel is my home away from home!

title: Beware of roaches!
review: Have stayed here in the past and it was a better experience. Room #818 was full of roaches! Need a better cleaning crew! The breakfast buffet had plenty of items, but couldn't really enjoy for thinking about all the roaches!

title: Great Staycation...
review: It was a great weekend gateway. I had a nice peaceful staycation away from a busy life. The hotel location is great if you are on foot, shopping center and restaurants just minutes away. Five minutes walk to the Galleria mall. Guy (that's his name) at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly.

title: Good place to stay
review: My husband and I stayed at Gallery one every time we take a cruise they're very nice and helpful and if you do have a problem they go out of their way to make it better . You will not be disappointed if you decide to stay here

title: Great location - Great hotel
review: Went for fun weekend in the Fort Lauderdale area.  Hotel location is awesome.  You can walk to a great mall, excellent dining, and  three blocks to the beach.   Rooms also have a great view of the intercostal.

title: Cleanliness an issue
review: Room needs upgrade; Chairs, sofa noticeable stains. Bathroom floor had clumps of hair on floor and closet was filthy with lint. Service Desk attendant was not friendly---but was super friendly with people before me.

title: Great Hotel and Location
review: Went for a mini staycation with family and had a great time.  Extremely friendly and welcoming staff.  My room was very large and decorated very nice.  Bar, Pool and Restaurant all good with very nice staff.  I recommend this hotel for the room and its location.   And the cookies were delicious!!

title: Lack of security by housekeeping
review: When I returned to my room the first full day of my stay, after the first service by housekeeping, I found the door ajar (and unlocked). A call to a customer service number yielded nothing other than "I'll make sure to discuss this with housekeeping". At checkout, the front desk person said the same thing. No compensation was offered, nor was any offer made to change the person assigned to clean my room, to the point that I felt uncomfortable having the room serviced the next day while I had to be out and had to leave my laptop and other electronics in the room, so I only asked for a couple of clean towels.  Additionally, upon checkout the staff asks you to provide them a "perfect score" of 9s and 10s when you receive an email survey from Hilton. At that point, it is entirely…

title: Travel agent
review: Absolutely a beautiful hotel, service is great and the food is awesome. My compliment to the chef. My suite was very comfortable, like I was a home. I will be thrilled to suggest my clients to stay in this  hotel.

title: great hotel BUT they still have not fixed the jacuzzi
review: fix the jacuzzi or take it out. I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years. but the last two times over the last few months the jacuzzi has been broken and there is no indication that it will be fixed... they should either fix it or take it out. at least explain what the problem is

title: Great People Beautiful Place
review: We stayed in a condo there and it was spectacular.  The room was amazing and the view of the canal and ocean beautiful.  The gentleman at the desk was friendly and informative, the bartender made great Long Island ice teas.  Some construction on the water Taxi stop, but otherwise clean and functional.  The breakfast was too costly for what is offered.  but the area has limited choices in walking distance until the mall opens.

title: Excellent place to stay
review: Room was very nice and accommodating. Room service was very quick. Bed super comfortable. My only complaint is the air conditioner was super loud turning on. Made it hard to stay asleep. But overall I'd definitely stay again

title: Like Gallery one and Guy's customer service excellent
review: We had just left the Orlando Double-Tree, which was spiffier, but I liked the room layout at this location much better. We had a suite with the bedroom and living area and kitchen, and though it was older, it worked better than the Orlando location.  Guy, was friendly and very helpful.   I liked the pool and the location.

title: Average Stay Experience
review: I stayed in a 2-bedroom suite for 2 nights. The GalleryOne hotel looks terrific on paper but I can see myself changing to the Hilton Marina after seeing both hotels.   The noise level of this hotel with a room facing the Sunrise Blvd can be an issue. The draw bridge siren can disturb your rest, and if the boat passing does not get to you the hi-way traffic for sure will.   The suite is adequate for my party of 4 but not too roomy. About their amenities, nothing outstanding is worth mentioning.  The hotel has a small swimming pool and I did not visit their fitness center. There is a small coffee stand at the ground floor. I could not connect to hotel Wifi and the front-desk loaned me a hot-spot to correct the issue.  Note that I have free Wifi due to Hilton Honor program.  If you…

title: Suite Room
review: I loved the walk in showers.  I ordered room service and it came in a timely manner.  The food was delicious. The check in cookie was worth the stay.  The staff was friendly and willing to help in any way.

title: Time for A Facelift!
review: The hotel corridors need painting and cleaning, and the room needed a deep cleaning and paint. Deteriorating after 10+ years. I started staying at this hotel >10 years ago. It's starting to look shopworn.

title: How was my stay
review: It was roaches in my room and they gave me a sorry excuse ( oh we stay by the water so it's common and even if it is we should be warned.! Then the shower was dirty and nothing was done about it and I don't think that's right .

title: Disappointing
review: We had a nice view, but it could not be enjoyed because of the noise! It's non-stop traffic going over the Intracoastal bridge.  Also, for those with small children, there is no bathtub in the 2 queen suite, just a shower.  The biggest disappointment was the pool.  It wasn't heated and the majority of the pavers around the pool were loose and/or cracked and/or uneven - very dangerous for the kids!  The hot tub also was blocked off and not working.  The first evening there were no pool towels and, although the front desk repeatedly promised to send some, none ever came - the bin was overflowing with dirty towels. We ended up checking out early and ultimately the Manager did refund the last night's stay so we didn't lose any money. BIG SHOUT OUT TO BEN THE BARTENDER AT THE POOL,…

title: Vacation from Hell!!  DON'T STAY HERE lazy housekeeping  staff!!
review: Front stay don't care about your needs They just take your money and run...They did not say what can we do to make it better at all. Then to top it off we paid $33.00 plus tax  for parking a day Valet had the nerve to say...oh you have a handicap tag you can park at yourself in one of the handicap spots. that's what you're there for to park it for $33.00 a day plus tax not us!!!  Ugh!!!!!!!

title: Great front desk staff
review: The first night we ran into issues with the shower being clogged, a hair dryer that broke while drying my hair but these issues were resolved quickly.  The hotel room is a bit dated but not like the pictures from the other guests (nothing ripped or falling apart) Overall the value for the room I would say is fair. Fair being walking distance to the beach, beside Galleria mall with a few nice restaurants, across the street is a publix and a burger joint which has decent burgers. All these are great when you are here with kids.  The parking is valet and mandatory at $33 a night, which is crappy but keep in mind, so is the Hilton Resort around the corner, and Lago Mar resort - which I have stayed before. Many of the hotels here force the mandatory valet. So this hotel is not the…

title: Buyer Beware: if it's a condo there's ZERO housekeeping (our room was filthy, the hallways stank of pot)
review: We stayed for 10 days (booked through this site) and deeply regret not booking elsewhere. Instead of a suite ran by Hilton, we were given a suite that's rented from a private owner but managed from an entity elsewhere. What that means? The disgusting stains on the toilet could not be cleaned by the hotel's housekeeping, we had to take out our own trash (??!!) and the carpet was so filthy it was sticky. Our poor crawling baby would end up with grosse balls of hair stuck to her hands and feet from the room. The valet parking (one upside, it's free if you book a private condo), lost our car and we had to wait 45 minutes for them to figure out where it was (people with small children will understand the pain of 45 bloody minutes killing time at the lobby, and worried about our…

title: Amazing front desk staff!
review: The front desk staff makes you feel comfortable from the moment you check in. Andrea at the front desk was particular great to me as she held my flowers after I had checked out since I went to the beach and I couldn't leave the flowers in the car. Property was beautiful, the breakfast buffet was complete with starches, fruit, protein, and the entire staff around the hotel was lovely. The only issue I had was with the only parking available was valet and it cost $33 a night. Other than that, two thumbs up!

title: Great location and Great service!
review: We were visiting Ft Lauderdale to attend a wedding and stayed at this hotel as it was the perfect location for the event.  Great location, walking distance to the mall with plenty of dining options!  The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us.  After the wedding we went to key west for a few days, only to return for one night to the DoubleTree to catch a early morning flight.  A special shout out to Andrea at the front desk for reserving our same room. Also the the valet service was fast and very helpful!

title: VIP Service!
review: I heard this hotel had great service but didn't know it would be this great! From the moment we pulled in, we were greeted with warmth and kindness from Guy at the front desk. We had a very clean room, the beds were comfortable and linens were crisp and clean. The balance was also clean, as was the kitchen. Pool was nice, never too packed. I was however disappointed with the Jacuzzi not in service. There is a taxi stop that is active here which is convenient. Also, the mall is a three minute walk, Starbucks and Publix is a 5 minute walk. The beach was a ten minute walk. Overall a wonderful experience and we will visit again!

title: BEST HOTEL FOR VACATION
review: this my second time staying at this hotel, the suites are clean and nice, I love the service provided by the employees. Its a beautiful place to be with family, the pool is clean and you can walk to the beach. I enjoy the view at night, it feels like I was in New York city.

title: vacation
review: I enjoy my six days that I stayed there to celebrates my birth day everyone was extremely great the big smile from the hotel employees face tells I should go to Gallery one, more often thanks Haitian mama she always clean up the room from may 18 I did not get her name a big Hug for because my son was with me I knew he added to her hard work  Mr. Ryan Kopp keep up with the good work your management skill is extraordinary

title: Great Location; Service Issues
review: There are wonderful things about this hotel, namely the location, the food and staff in the restaurant (Lissette especially) and the quick response of maintenance when there is an issue.  However, two things marred our experience.  The first is that valet parking is mandatory and extremely expensive, though for the most part there's not enough staff on hand to receive or retrieve your car in a timely manner.  On two evenings, no one even answered the phone for 15 minutes -- we gave up and went down to wait for the car for another 10 minutes.  The other issue is housekeeping (or actually the lack of it). Out of our 5 night stay our room was cleaned only 3 times. They forgot us and we had to call for towels, waste can emptying and coffee replenishment.  On another day,…

title: Poor value for money
review: Poor management has taken the hotel to a very low level. The phones don t work, The internet doesn't work, The extremely expensive forced Valet parking doesn't work - and all the manager can do is agree that they could do better. We have stayed many times at the hotel which was really one of the best in Ft Lauderdale in its day.

title: double tree ft lauderdale on sunrise blvd
review: extremely nice and clean  great value  EXCELLENT VALET SERVICE WITH MY BAGS AND CAR UNDER EXTREMLY BUSY CONDTIONS   The layout of the rooms was very convenient also all of the views were vary nice . my family and extended family were in for a wedding so we had many rooms booked all were very satisfied

title: Training April 23-28, 2017
review: The room was superb and having the great kitchen was awesome.  I can not say enough about the staff, the most courteous and friendly people I have ever met.  Every person that I encountered always said hi and asked him I needed anything.  I was treated like I was the most important  guest they had.   I personally wanted to say that Cindee at the front desk was amazing, from getting us into our room and then getting us into a better room.  She helped us when left, got me sugar when I didn't have any.  She always addressed us when she saw us and asked if we needed anything.    We had a problem with a man in a neighboring building looking at young women at the pool.  Cindee contacted the building manager next door and the problem was immediately taken care of,  Convient grocery…

title: Highly recommend this place.
review: This place is awesome, very clean & friendly staff. The cookie is mouth watering delicious. My only suggestion would be to offer free parking in addition to valet, everyone can't afford $33 or at least offer free parking to HHonors members.

title: Don't stay at this property at any price
review: Not up to Hilton/Doubletree standards.  This is convenient to the beach and  shopping but the hotel is not well kept and the service is terrible.  They charge $33 per night for valet parking and I had to wait almost an hour to retrieve my auto!  Room smelled like old cigarettes and shower gout was stained.

title: Good Hotel in Good Location
review: Pretty good hotel in good location, just like the reviews states. Close to Galleria Mall if you are into higher-end shopping. Publix (grocery store) is just across the road and has all the essentials. French Bakery is across the road as well. Also within a walking distance a plethora of restaurants (most reasonably priced) and 7/11. It sits close to Intracoastal Waterway, so, if you get a room with a view, you get to see some nice yachts passing by and, in general, the view is pretty cool. Beach is not too far away either, just across the Waterway if you don't mind walking a little bit. Otherwise, you can drive for 5-8 minutes and get to Ft. Lauderdale Beach parking ($1.75/hour). Service was fine. Suites are fine too. Two rooms, two TVs, kitchen with all the necessary…

title: Very accommodating
review: We had originally booked a 5 night stay at the Bahia Mar and we sent to a dirty room and then blamed for the mishap. We left and went Gallery One where Guy hooked us up! He was so pleasant and accommodating. The wait staff in the Vue is also fantastic.

title: OK Hotel. Great beach location.
review: Parking is $33 plus tax A DAY! $34.98 A DAY! We stayed seven days. We picked this hotel because of the one bedroom and kitchenette. It's a short walk to the beach. The air show was wonderful! The hotel could use some TLC. The carpets are old and need to be replaced. Driveway is in urgent need of repair. A fresh coat of paint would do wonders. Beds are ok, furniture needs to be replaced. What we thought was dirt/mold in the shower turned out to be different color caulking. My suggestion would be to remove all of it and do it right with one color. Internet is terrible. Staff was excellent! We didn't eat meals at the hotel, I cooked or we went out to eat. Galleria Mall is across the street as well as a Publix and Starbucks. We will probably pick a different hotel next time with…

title: Worst Meeting ever
review: From the air to the food to the attentiveness of the staff, this hotel was a fail. The majority of the staff members of this hotel were very rude and I would suggest not staying here for anyone in business or personal

title: Very disappointed, extra charges pile up fast!
review: I'm an avid traveler and because our main office is located in Fort Lauderdale I travel several times a year to South Florida.  Where to start!  Breakfast is not included and it's $23 per day.  There's no self parking option you are forced to use the hotel's valet which is $33 + tax per day.  The system really doesn't work ver well.  Even if the guys try their best (they did) there's always a line and cars take for ever to arrive.  One evening the parking lot was full and my car got parked just in front of the hotel (literally 100 ft from the entrance) and I paid $33 + tax! It's a rip off. (See pictures).  Carpets all throughout the hotel are old and dirty, rooms are rundown and in desperate need of maintenance (see pictures), furniture is dated and also need someone that take…

title: Not What It Use To Be
review: We arrived late. Went to check in Valet was backed up. We left to get dinner and food at the local publix. Came back not as busy however service lacking. Asked for help to check in and the gentleman told me check in first. Checked in and still no service available at valet for our bags. Someone eventually came over and helped however could not bring our bags right to the room. We took bags to our room on the cart ourselves. Got into the room, kitchen area was not at all what we expected. Also, very strong odor of chemical cleaner or something in room . We had asked for a hypoallergenic room , this was not at all what we received. Called the front desk he basically said that was all they had and would check with housekeeping and get back to me. After twenty minutes of waiting I…

title: always a great place to stay
review: Have stayed here many times and sent many family and friends here. No one is ever dissapppinted. Location is great, staff is great, facility is great, and price is great. I highly recommend to anyone.

title: Warmly Welcomed
review: It was a pleasure to arrive at the GalleryOne Doubletree yesterday.  The receptionists, Ryan and Anne Marie, we especially welcomed and really made us feel welcome and happy we were guests. That set the tone for a very comfortable stay. The all suite configuration of this hotel placed us in a spacious one bedroom suite on the ninth floor overlooking the Intercoastal Waterway. Fantastic view looking east towards the coast.

title: Great Hotel
review: Have stayed here several times, usually stay here a day or 2 before going on a cruise. Clean, well maintained hotel with friendly staff. Great rooms always clean.  Love the water taxi, you can ride up and down, get on and get off at several stops, go shopping or go to restaurants. Love this hotel. You can also walk across the bridge and be on Ft. Lauderdale beach, just a short walk.

title: Room with a view and kitchen 2
review: A very nice hotel as expected from a Hilton brand.  Nicely decorated and cordial, friendly, and helpful employees.  As a Gold member the free mini buffet breakfast is a Plus with made to order omelettes.  Room with view of the water is great.  Get one with a balcony if possible so u can lounge and relax.  King size bed was comfortable and bathroom had large towels. Fitness center had a few treadmills and recumbent bike. The pool was nice, but needed to be cleaned of debris. The spa was inoperable.  Food prices are expensive and the $33.00 mandatory valet seemed unnecessary.  Mall is 2 minute walk and the beach about 5.  Definitely a nice hotel I will stay at again when in Ft. Lauderdale.

title: Good location.  Billing issues
review: Our last bill included parking charges not incurred by us. ABOUT 100 dollars. Same thing happened to other friends on same stay. We were told that my name was similar to somebody who parked there. My name is 9 letters long and unique in the US.  Location is good for shopping snd beach access  beach very crowded there though. All in all value depends on the rate you get and whether you really need a kitchenetter.

title: staff treat guests like VIP
review: I called prior to our arrival to request adjoining rooms with our friends.  Instead of saying, "No, sorry," Alesa beginning clicking away to find a way to accommodate my request.  The adjoining rooms made our weekend very convenient and enjoyable. The hotel manage texted me before and after we checked in to check on our stay.  The front desk staff were very kind.  Our waitress was attentive even though the restaurant was very busy. The staff of the hotel make service to guests a top priority.

title: Great Location!!
review: This hotel is situated in a nice location that puts you within minutes to the beach, dining and shopping. The beach is a few minutes walk over the Intracoastal bridge, upscale mall in the opposite direction and numerous dining options nearby. There's also a grocery store across the street which is handy as these rooms have kitchenettes. Additionally there's a State Park across the street as well. A very unique bonus, this hotel is a water taxi pickup location.  A great way to see scenic downtown Ft. Lauderdale by river with stops at local hot spots along the way! Great hotel for first timers! The only drawback is the mandatory valet parking.  $33 plus tax per day!  But, considering the location of the property, you'd likely pay similar most anywhere. Also, wifi is a little…

title: Love this hotel's location
review: Great view of the Intracoastal and Ocean. I would recommend this hotel for people looking for a suite hotel with an excellent and caring staff.  Manager Ryan Kopp always caring about how our stay was going. Problems are quickly resolved.  Located in a prime area, 1 block walking distance to the Galleria Mall. Also a water taxi stop!...and Wow, to the new 55 inch TV's, nice addition.

title: Great Stay
review: This was the 2nd time staying and GALLERYone, and we enjoyed it even more than the first. The hotel seems to continue upgrading and keeping not only the suites up to date, even the lobby was getting an update of wonderful paintings. The suites have it all kitchen, dining, front room with TV, the a bedroom and bath. There is a balcony was perfect, two chairs and a table overlooking the pool and waterfront. The location was very walkable, beach, grocery store, mall, Starbucks, many restaurants as well as a spa and nail salon across the street. The employees are the nicest I've seen in the U.S. . My husband even noticed and commented he'd never stayed stayed anywhere with such friendly and helpful employees, they offered help without even asking. I couldn't ask for a better place…

title: excellent
review: The hotel has an excellent location about a 10 minute walk to the beach. The rooms are spacious and the view of the beach was lovely. The pool was large enough to enjoy a good swim. We liked how there was a golf cart service to take us to the closest bars and clubs along the beach and we had a blast (the cost was $5).

title: Amazing staff (Anisa) and great location!
review: My wife and I spent the night last Saturday at GalleryONE for the Fort Lauderdale Air Show with our 5 1/2 year old granddaughter.  It was a last minute decision and I called the GalleryONE and was pleasantly surprised that they still had open rooms.  We arrived at 10:00 AM and Anisa at the Front Desk really took care of us.  We were able to get early access, which allowed our granddaughter to get settled.  Then it was off on the short walk across the bridge to beach side for the airshow.  When our granddaughter tired, we came back, went to the pool and then watched the remainder of the show from our room.  The all suite hotel rooms comes with a fridge, range, and a pull out sleep sofa.  The staff was uniformly pleasant and the food at the complimentary break buffet was…

title: Hilton Hop (1 of 8) - GALLERYone Doubletree
review: We visited 8 Hilton Properties in 9 days.  This is the first of 8 reviews.  We are Hilton Honor members, not sure if you are not part of the program if your experience will be different.  One thing that will likely be the same for all guests regardless of your status or the property was the overwhelming Excellent Customer Service and Hospitality. This was constantly outstanding at each and every property that we stayed.  The date of our visit was April 12, 2017.  We paid for our stay with points (40K), otherwise the cost would have been $204,24.  We know this because they charged us for the room, but quickly credited my credit card when they realized the mistake.  Parking costs $30 + tax = $31.80.  Resort fee is $25 + tax, but this is waived if you pay with points.  This hotel…

title: A Great Place for Meetings
review: As one of the meeting coordinators for a small 3 day conference, I worked closely with the sales office and other staff members at Gallery one.  Every person I worked with was not only helpful and skilled, but willing to extend themselves to make our meeting and our stay a pleasant one.  The front desk staff were very competent and friendly; Guy and Joseph I remember especially.  The folks at the valet parking, especially Brian and Edriss, were also very helpful. The wait staff and banquet staff (Cleo!) did their very best to accommodate us. Most of all, I wish to thank Amy Luczak for her great work for our group. The entire sales office was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  All our guests enjoyed their stay very much. We would recommend this hotel for any meeting, small or…

title: Old and Outdated
review: Second time at this hotel, no working internet, only vale parking for 33dollars/day. Hotel have a nice location but is so outdated and the staff ... well maybe outdated as well. Will not say here a third time.

title: Similar to timeshares
review: Hotel had nice 2 bedroom/2 bathroom rooms with living and kitchen area. Similar to timeshares for a reasonable price. Very reasonable price for being Hilton in this area. Views of intercostal and Close to beaches.

title: Perfect for our needs
review: We have always used connecting doors in the past, but used a suite this time. It was wonderful. The kitchen was fully stocked and the two rooms have separate thermostats. Everything worked for our family.

title: Our stay
review: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay and the location was perfect! The water pressure in the shower could've been a little better along with the "city view" but overall, it was perfect. We're planning on making this our only option for a hotel every time we visit Fort Lauderdale.

title: My last stay has changed my opinion in a negative way!
review: My husband and I do an adults only getaway each year, and we love this Fort Lauderdale property for its proximity to both the beach and the Galleria.  Other stays have been great, as my prior review indicates.  Unfortunately, we will be picking a different location for next year's trip.    I honestly can't think of any PRO's for this particular visit.... maybe the weather or the fact that there were three treadmills in the fitness center and powerful air conditioning in our room?  CON's:  Inside bartender (Thursday night) was unfriendly/cold, it was difficult to get more than two bath towels at a time, whirlpool was drained.... The final straw was that my husband left his new (expensive) sunglasses in the room.  Luckily, he realized right away and called the front desk from the…

title: House keeping stole my credit card holder with 4 of my cards in it!!!
review: I had a very nice Burberry credit card holder that was stolen with 4 credit cards in it. The cards were not used but I'm I'm sure the thief just wanted the case and threw out the cards. For desk was very unfriendly and not helpful at all. Also a pair of dirty boxer underwear on the closet floor. Location is just average. About a half mile walk to some barely average restaurants. Will never stay here again. I'm in the area once a month and have stayed at way better hotels in better locations for less money.

title: Wonderful room, great staff, very pleasant
review: This was a wonderful hotel, situated in a nice area with a walking path along the waterway. Very clean and wonderful room, extremely gracious and welcoming desk staff. I was allowed to check in a little early which was very nice of them. All the staff I dealt with were extremely courteous. I am very glad I picked this hotel as it was a pleasant experience from beginning to end.

title: Bad!!!!
review: Parking and resort fee extra 80 a night.Bad! Staff was very friendly. Toliet kept running. The bathroom needed a paint, two or three different paint colors on wall. I had a 8 dollar 8 oz beer in a plastic cup. For 8 dollars you would think it would have came in a glass

title: Wondeful location with a staff that delivers the highest customer service
review: This is our second stay at the GalleryOne Doubletree and we enjoyed ourselves even more than the last time (and that was an excellent stay). The front desk staff led by Ryan and Anisa made sure that our week's stay was perfect. Our king-balcony-waterview room was lovely with an exceptional view of the Intercoastal.   The suites are equipped with a great galley kitchen with microwave, double burner stove, counter height fridge, dishwasher, coffee maker, and full service dishes, glassware, cutlery, pots & pans. There is a Publix grocery store only two blocks away and we regularly provisioned our kitchen. A couple of days, we ate our lunch on our balcony.... or had snacks on the balcony at night.....watching the boats float by.  The location is exceptional. Right outside your door…

title: Be careful not to get condo under private management
review: Same building as we stayed the 3 previous nights but we required a two bedroom suite for the last night.  The property is very nice and situated in a great location along the intracoastal waterways and one block from the Galleria Mall.  Rooms were well kept.  The best part of the property was the staff, very friendly, helpful and attentive to details.

title: Wish we could have stayed longer!
review: Great location near the beach and mall and right on the river with access to the Water Taxi.   The room was huge and the balcony was wonderful.  Very friendly staff.  We only stayed one night (after a cruise) before we had to fly home, but I wanted to stay longer.  Will definitely go back and stay at this hotel again.

title: From room 1205
review: I'm so happy with my stay here! I came with two friends, one of whom sits in a wheelchair. We hade so much help with everything from this wonderful staff!  I want to say a extra thank you to wonderful Lissette in the dining hall! Whom no matter how stressful it was, always have a smile on her face. She always talks in a calming voice and did everything to make our visit wonderful! So kind and loving. The breakfast was always my favorite part of the day, because I got to meet her! /room 1205

title: Great Hotel
review: Great hotel with very happy staff. its situation is perfect right beside Galleria shopping centre and a few minutes from the beach. i would go back no problem. Also its within walking distance to the Capital grille restaurant and the Blue Martini!

title: Gallery one - thank you!
review: We are a group of three people, and one person in a motorized wheelchair. We are so happy with our stay at this wonderful hotel with a great group of staff. They helped us when my friends wheelchair broke down because of heavy rain. And the guys at the valet-frontdesk, that have helped us with wheelchair-accessible cabs, thank you. A thousand times thank you for everything!  And a special thank you to Lissette, from the restaurant. She is the most helpful and loving of all the waitress's. you have patients of an angel! Great with people, and always with a big smile on her face.   Big thank you to everybody!

title: Rude / Skeleton Crew
review: lacks service, valet lost keys, rude staff.  Was in town for a funeral.   As a staunch Hilton Honors member - I was surprised by the poor quality.  We will not be saying at this hotel again unless there is a change in management / overall service

title: Not a good staff
review: The location is great and close to restaurants and shopping but I had two issues. Today I arrived early and called ahead to see if I could check in early was told not until 1:30. I arrived at that time and was told my room wasn't available to check back. I went to the mall shopped and had lunch. Returned at 2:40 and no room was still available at that time I just sat and waited in the lobby was told I would receive a text when it was read in 15 minutes. 30 minutes later I asked if a room was available and still no room after the 3pm check in but the young ladies at the front desk were very nice. Eventually I was told a room was ready. I unpacked and took a shower got into bed and a hour later I was awaken to hives. I called the front desk to make them aware that I only have this…

title: Breakfast waitstaff worst in Florida
review: Thin blonde older waitress is horrible and will drive you out of the hotel. She tries to get tips and push the Buffett breakfast on everyone and will ruin your vacation . I will never stay at this hotel again.

title: Convenient location. Great staff
review: Only issue we can think of is the pillows are horrible. This is true if all hiltons. Ask for firm pillows  Great location for water taxi. Not too far from beach. Recommend Uber for transportation. Parking is expensive everywhere in lauderdale. We spent less than 1 day rental on Uber's. Never had to wait more than 5 mins

title: Just OK for one night
review: The staff was WONDERFUL as always at a Hilton property.   I booked a king suite, water view balcony.   When I checked in I was informed i received an upgrade.   I was VERY excited, until we went to the room.  A 2 room suite, a parking lot view.   NO.  I immediately called the desk and told them I wanted a water view room like I booked.   They told me to come back down and get new keys.  We were then given a one bedroom king like I booked, with a water view.  The hallways of the hotel and very dark and dingy.   The room could have used a little pick up.   We asked if there was some place to grab lunch, they told us we could eat right there on the property, we walked around but none of the restaurants were serving food, it was about 3pm.  So we took the water taxi (the best…

title: Noisy location for the price
review: I stayed here for a work conference for three nights and overall had a decent stay. I opted for the "water view" room which barely overlooks the canal but has a pretty view of the yachts coming in and out.   Although, the noise level outside my window was pretty loud. I almost never ever complain about noise level anywhere I go, but the drawbridge that opens up outside the hotel requires a crazy lady to yell constantly at boats and pedestrians from her bridge station thingy during the whole drawbridge opening/closing experience.   If it weren't for clearly hearing her yell alongside very loud traffic outside my window, it would be a decent hotel experience.   Next time, I may opt for something closer to the actual beach (an easy 10-minute walk btw) so I can at least hear the…

title: Needs Some Refinement
review: This hotel has some good points: Friendly Staff Great Location Nice Pool Starbucks in the Lobby  This Hotel Hash Some Failings: Long checkin process Old and Outdated Technology Leaky Showers Lack of storage Old Beds  Loud A/C Slow/spotty internet SUPER expensive Room Service: Bowl of Oatmeal is $10? Valet Parking is $33+ tax a day

title: The Customer Service varies...
review: Lets start with Breakfast ***DISCLAIMER*** STAY AWAY FROM THE OVER BEARING, ANNOYING, BLONDE WAITRESS (looks like a smoker).  You will not be able to enjoy your breakfast with her around.  She will constantly ask you what room you are in and ask you nonstop if you are going to eat anything.  Not to mention she and a few other ones (Tall puertorican & long blondish brown hair waitress) will announce your business as far as costs are concerned to the entire dining area.  I have never felt so uncomfortable in my life and could not enjoy one meal while I was there.  Actually I take that back, i did enjoy one meal with the african american waitress, very friendly and kind, she let you eat your food without harassing you.  The cook there is great too.  The only 2 people I never minded…

title: Galleryone Fort Lauderdale - one night stay
review: Front desk was pretty slow and was not a huge fan of the valet only parking. Have a manual car and could see them stalling it several times when pulling up. Other than these two things my stay was great! Very clean and location was perfect, right by the beach and close to shops and restaurant. Was also positively surprised by the room size.

title: April 2017 poor
review: This hotel is old and over priced. The bathroom  had fecus on it when we checked in. There was hair and papers on the floor. There were stains on the carpet and chairs.Don't waste your money. This was our first vacation in two years!!! I was very disappointed!!!!

title: Perfectly acceptable stay
review: Stayed for four days prior to taking a cruise, mainly to get used to the time zone and to get a bit of shopping done.  Good sized rooms and everything worked but thought it looked just a little tired round the edges but still perfectly adequate.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Very handy for Galleria Mall, Public supermarket and is right on the intracoastal waterway with a stop in the grounds.  $30 cab fare from the airport and $10 shuttle to the cruise port.

title: Poor Operations, Showing its Age, Over priced
review: My family of 5 stayed here for one night before our cruise and one night following our cruise.  I agree with people that the location of the hotel is appealing, just a few min walk to the mall, water taxi pick-up just outside the rear door, and under a 10 min walk to the beach.  However, for the price of the hotel we were not overly impressed.  First, I will give positive feedback for the size of the rooms.  Our room had a small kitchen area, living room/family room with sofa bed, large bathroom and bedroom with 2 "queen" beds for both of the nights we stayed.  We also had a small balcony of the first night overlooking the road and a larger balcony on the 2nd stay overlooking the water.  We could hear a lot of outside noise in our rooms.  For some reason the road is popular for…

title: Great staycation
review: The service was outstanding! The kids really did enjoy the warm cookies served at checkin. Pool area was undergoing maintenance which we were not aware of. The location and suites were so good that it did help outweigh that con.

title: Great Stay- BIG SUITE
review: Just finished a 5 nite stay with my family- I highly recommend getting the 2 bed/ 2 bath suite if traveling with a family - lots of room for everyone and a kitchen. Overall we had a great stay - only drawback was the hot tub was out all week for repairs and the elevators were a little slow. Valet staff was on point- thanks to them for fast car retrieval- make sure you scan your ticket on your smart phone QR reader for fast service about 15 mins before you need your car- we did and it was always ready when we came down. Rooms were always cleaned nicely- after a slight billing error when we checked in- Ryan the mngr took care of it quickly. Good location to food and the galleria mall and beach are walking distance. Water taxi pickup right outside the back door was great- it's an…

title: Best place before a cruise
review: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel every time that we sail,from Ft. Lauderdale and we are never disappointed. The staff is friendly, helpful, and go,our of their way to make your stay a memorable one. It's close to restaurants and now provides a shuttle to the ship which is a plus.

title: Tortuga Festival
review: Great place to stay.  This is our second visit to this hotel.  Quick walk to the beach.  Water taxi pick up right outside the hotel which was a huge plus for us as we were headed to the Tortuga Festival each day. Only downside is the wifi does not work well at all.  Clean rooms. Staff super nice and accommodating. And the cookies, are fabulous!

title: Average
review: Nothing special about this hotel, could smell cleaner, food in restaurant was over priced for the quality. If you do get a room here go for the city view. Parking is expensive and probably just better to take an Uber or Lyft.

title: Bartender pocket profits
review: I came down to bar with my friend we ordered 2 drafts I paid cash he gave me change out of his pocket.I was shocked no liquor tax for Ft Lauderdale and no profit for the share holder of hilton.Breakfast buffet was nice with water view.Lady's service was excellent.The pool was nice but small there was 1 lady there everyday sharing her hate against Donald Trump so I left negative atmosphere and enjoyed the delightful water taxi.

title: Gets my vote for the worst hotel on earth.
review: Incredibly disappointing experience. Called this hotel on the Friday before my stay and inquired about the hot tub. When I arrived on Monday I found the hot tub roped off with no water in it. I noticed immediately the loud strange music poolside that the hotel was imposing on their guest. I walked back to the front desk and asked to speak to a supervisor. A few minutes later the operations manager Dee emerged and introduced himself. He offered to find me a room at one of the beach properties at a minimal expense.  When I told him that I used honors points for the stay he said that should make the transition easier. I waited for him for what seemed to be an eternity. Finally a lady from the desk Ann Marie walked over and told me that they would not be able to transfer the points…

title: Great Service at an Outstanding Location
review: This was my first time staying at the gallery one but it will not be my last.   The location of this hotel is perfect.  You do not need to rent a car as they have almost everything within walking distance.  Even a water taxi stop in the back of the hotel.  I had a small issue but the manager Ryan was there to help me and made sure that I enjoyed the rest of my stay.  Overall I had a wonderful weekend with my girlfriend and look forward to coming back in the future!

title: Perfect location
review: We lucked into getting this place for 10 days considering it was March break. I wasn't sure of the location but was really pleased to find it was located in a prefect spot. Literally 5 minutes from the beach, 2 minutes to the mall, groceries and restaurants. A great sheltered pool with a dock for the water taxi and some of the best staff anywhere. Thank you Ryan for the hospitality and of course my daily "cookie" we look forward to coming back.

title: Short but pleasent stay
review: Spent one night at hotel for an early flight.  Rooms are very comfortable one bedroom suite, we chose a water view.  If you get a chance take the water taxi to get a look at the estates that line the waterway as well as the impressive yachts.

title: Nice location and Water taxi Great view of inlet
review: We stayed her mid march and had a good stay.  We had stayed before here 4 years ago.  room was nice and clean but below what I thought a Hilton property should be. and for the price of the room.  We had a great view of water canal inlet and ships going by.  We had a room on the street side along the 4 lane and was very noisy.   It didn't bother us as we can sleep thru anything, but if noise is not for you, you don,t want to be on this side of hotel, ask for other tower. Room was very nice separate bedroom from other lliving room and kitchen with dishwasher and small cookto[ and refr.  The elevator service was good and main desk offered great service.  We needed a transfer to cruise port and they took care of it with a new service they offer $10 apiece.  We was there for 2 days…

title: Great location and outstanding staff
review: Beach is only 5 minutes away from the hotel, and the Ft. Lauderdale water way is right in front with access to the water taxi (hop on/hop off). Spacious and clean rooms. The receptionists provided an outstanding service throughout my entire stay, and had always a smile left even in busy times. Would definitely come again! Very recommendable! Regards from Munich

title: Very spacious with a great view!
review: We stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago, so we already knew to expect a spacious room with a great view.  My husband and I traveled to this hotel with our two teen aged daughters.  We love that we had a living room and separate bedroom.  We really enjoyed the balcony and the view of the canal and ocean from it.  Our beds were comfortable.  We enjoyed evenings winding down on the comfortable coach with the family.  This is a great choice for anyone needed extra space.

title: Hilton does it again for us!!
review: We've been Hilton Gold for a few years now and every now and then you stay at a Hilton property that reinstates your faith in the brand. Exceptional service, great location,  wonderful stay, and a happy family summarizes our experience at this property. The staff is incredible especially Allison and Ryan (the manager).
