review: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before a cruise that left from Fort Lauderdale. Check in was speedy, and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The lobby was large and airy, with a beautiful view. Our room was large and spacious, we were surprised just how big the room actually was. The room had a separate kitchen area, main space with dining table and living area, and a separate bedroom and bathroom. The room was finished to a very high standard, and the bed was super comfortable. With the Galleria across the road, there is also good shopping and restaurants close by. We have had problems at other hotels where there were no dining options except the hotel restaurant, but that is not an issue here.  If we were ever in Fort Lauderdale again, we would definitely…

title: One Word - Housekeeping!
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the first week in April.  I unfortunately got sick one night and a quick call to housekeeping was answered promptly and professionally.  Kudos to Marjorie and Anna for taking such good care of me!  The next morning, Kanesha and Nadine were kind enough to check in on me...now that's customer service!  Many thanks to the exceptional housekeeping team!  The hotel itself is very nice.  Breakfast was delicious, the cookies were divine and the  location  was perfect for spending the day on the water taxi and/or at the beach.

title: We enjoyed very much
review: We wanted to get away for a week.  From Boston.  Our room was very comfortable.  Got the Master Suite with kitchen, living room, water view and balcony.  The staff all around very pleasant.  Location is great for beach and shopping.  The pool area was right on inter-coastal and towels were always available.  Water taxi available right at hotel.   Housekeeping was great and the bed was very comfortable.  The only negative is the parking.  Hotel should just add the $25 per day into the nightly room rate.  Valet personnel very friendly.  Also, if you do not want to hear the traffic on Sunrise Blvd. or Bridge for ships, then request a room on other side of hotel.  Didn't bother us, we enjoyed the view from the balcony.  Would return.

title: Nice rooms
review: Nice hotel, large rooms, we stayed with family in 2 connecting rooms very nice, well complete kitchen in room. nice to be near shopping mall and intercoastal waterway. Also 5 blocks to the beach the area is not the best but decent

title: Perfect place for business and pleasure
review: I must confess I do not like to write reviews but I really want to express my gratitude to Gallery One. First of all, I was able to check in as yearly as 1pm. Front desk person was very fast, friendly and was able to pronounce my extremely difficult last name. I was surprised to get a warm cookie at the reception as well. I did not know that Double Tree brand provide cookies! The best cookie I've ever tried! My room is very clean, spacious with a great view on the beautiful canal and inter coastal. There is a kitchen in the room, desk, very roomy living room area with pull out sofa. During the night I just turn off air conditional and open windows for a fresh air. There is a large mall right next to the hotel, Publix across the street, water taxi stop and ocean, it took me about…

title: Our Room was Filthy and Had Dirty Sheets! Won't be Back!
review: Gallery One by Hilton looked great from the exterior but was a huge disappoint in our room. We stayed from Thursday April 3 - April 6th and then boarded the Coral Princess for our trip. This hotel was definitely not up to the standards of a typical Hilton property and we only stay at Hilton properties for business and pleasure. The exterior and main lobby are actually in very good shape, but when we exitied the elevator to our room, we were so disappointed. The room is so beat up, old and our particular room was filthy. There was mold/mildew in the bathroom, dirty corners, baseboards are filthy and chipped, walls were dirty with scuff marks, all the stainless appliances had fingerprints and filth all over them, microwave was dirty inside, the sink and pipes below were dirty,in…

title: Avoid
review: Dear dkmercedes,   Thank you for your detailed review of your recent stay at GALLERYone DoubleTree by Hilton. We are very regretful that you were disappointed with the cleanliness of our rooms and property in general. We strive to provide personalized experiences for each of our guests, and apologize about the housekeeping and guestroom issues. We appreciate all of your reviews as it provides the feedback that we need to re-evaluate guest needs and make the necessary adjustments to our offerings. We hope that you will give us the opportunity to show our commitment to satisfaction in all areas of the guest experience especially in cleanliness. If I can be of any further assistance, certainly do not hesitate to contact me directly.  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Hilton galleria fort lauderdale
review: Very dirty, run-down hotel that smells of mildew. The hotel is located next to the drawbridge and a busy boulevard. The bar is a cramped little spot adjacent to the lobby. The night that I checked in, the bar was out of all beer except Bud Light. The restaurant and bar close by 11:00 pm. After that, it's room service. Much better hotels are available in the area.

title: Bad first impression
review: Dear GregStella,  Thank you for your feedback and for choosing GALLERYone DoubleTree by Hilton. We regret to hear that you were disappointed with our property. We’re sorry you encountered challenges with cleanliness. This is not typical for our hotel, and we appreciate that you brought this to our attention. I am actively working with my housekeeping team to make every effort that our rooms and common areas of the hotel meet the highest housekeeping standards. Also, thank you for suggestion regarding hotel service hours, it is important for us to deliver customer satisfaction. We would really love to have you back for a true Hilton experience next time. If you have any other concerns, please do not hesitate to contact me directly.  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Superb location, Amazing welcome cookies!
review: We spent 5 nights at the Gallery one, whilst meeting up locally with friends. The Gallery one is set in a beautiful location overlooking the waterways. We were presented with welcome cookies which were to die for!  (and on check out too!!) Great sized suites with full kitchen,  Perfect location, walking distance to beach, restaurants, shopping etc etc. Small Starbucks on site. Good sized gym, with sufficient equipment, all in good order. Restaurant on site, which looked good, but we just didn't get to eat in, as were out with friends each day/evening. Pool / hot tub ok, with sufficient beds/towels and views of the waterway.  Fab boat watching!  Only drawback, having to pay for valet parking, and wifi.  Shame it isn't incorporated into the room rate, then you would feel it was…

title: An Excellant Hotel in a great location
review: Thank you for your great and honest review, and for taking the time to write it. I appreciate your comments and look forward to your next visit.  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Over night isn't long enough
review: Located on the inner water causeway and the water taxi has a scheduled stop at the hotel. We had the standard one bedroom type suite with a separate living room, bedroom and kitchen. The room was clean and in great shape. Our room was near a corner that overlooked the causeway and was near a raised road bridge. The only problem was car noise when they went over the bridge which has a metal honeycomb road portion that is part of the bridge so it can be raised. The views from out room to the causeway were great and the whole hotel looked to be recently renovated. We able to check in early and spent most of the day riding the water taxi. We only stayed the one night and had to check out at 4:30 AM for an early flight.  The checkout and valet was available and very quick even at…

title: Outstanding Customer Service
review: My Daughter and I stayed overnight checking in late and having to checkout early, as I had to be operated on at 6:30am the next morning. The experience of my short stay was delightful. I only wished I could have stayed longer and enjoyed all the hotel had to offer.

title: Place is ok, not the greatest
review: We were surprised by how beautiful the lobby was with the view of the canal and all the boats sailing by as we checked in. Our suite was great with 2 bedrooms, living room and kitchen. The hotel staff was always attentive despite that fact that there were many events going on. The coffee bar in the lobby was great and a nice retreat. Great location near beach and shopping.

title: The very best inFt. Lauderdale
review: I have stayed here for many years and  it just gets better all the time. I choose a two bedroom suite, to give me extra room.The entire staff are highly motivated and each time I stay here they go to greater heights to ensure customer satisfaction.  From the valet to the receptionists to the maids and management, they are all dedicated to their job.  All of the rooms have recently been  renovated and are spotlessly clean. As I have said before Gallery One  gets better all the time and I am looking forward to my next stay.  Kevin Stabile´s presence in the lobby is a valuable addition to Gallery One.

title: Can't beat the location
review: This was at least our 6th stay at this hotel. We love the location because the Intercoastal Waterway is so interesting with lots of activity on it. It's very close to the beach and good shopping and restaurants.  The furniture has all been updated but to me the one negative was the walls were quite beat up and in need of paint. We did switch rooms and both were like that. The lampshades in the first room were completely stained and I'm surprised nobody has changed them. The staff there is definitely another big reason we go back. Kudos to Vanessa and Maria at the front desk for being so friendly every day.

title: Nice suite near the beach
review: I stayed here for a night after a cruise out of Fort Lauderdale.  Arrived there in the morning, too early to check in but we were able to check our luggage and head out for the day until our room was ready.  The hotel is very nice - new, clean and modern looking.  The rooms were perfect, more like a well appointed one bedroom apartment.  One of the nicer places I`ve stayed.  There was a small kitchen with fridge, stove and microwave plus dishes and other kitchen supplies.  The bedroom was seperate from the living room.  Bathroom was large and clean.  Overall a fairly large room with a beautiful view of the harbour below.  It is located next to a large shopping mall with lots of restaurants, and walking distance to the beach with more shops and restaurants. About an $18 taxi ride…

title: Awesome Time!
review: We visited Fort Lauderdale on March 20,2014 and stayed at the Double Tree on E. Sunrise Blvd.   we had an awesome time. The bartender Fernando really made our stay that much better. He is very personable and always greeted us with a smile.  The suites were very large and had amazing views of the intercostal and were very comfortable. If you are looking for a place to stay in Fort Lauderdale stop by the Double Tree and mAke it a point to find Fernando. You will be happy you did.   -Nick & Deanna, New York

title: Nice place to stay
review: This hotel has comfortable amenities and you can even have breakfast in your room. It is very close to many restaurants and stores around. Just two blocks from the Galeria Mall and other places around. Walking distance to the beach and nice places around. Take the water taxi tour it is very nice!

title: Am I staying at the same Hotel???
review: After a holiday break down the keys arrived in FT last week for a three night stay at Gallery One. On the plus side the rooms are 5 star, large lounge and bedrooms and well maintained.  On the minus side, I was advised my room had a balcony. This turned out be be a rail across the window. I could of course move the furniture, open the window and lean against the rail if I wanted to . Not a balcony though by any stretch of the imagination, particularly as I had telephoned to ensure the room did have a balcony.. After querying this with reception I was told no other rooms available and in their opinion, this was a balcony. Also and I had not booked directly with the hotel but with an agent. I acknowledged this but confirmed that I had included comments on the booking form sent to…

title: First Time, Overall Good Experience
review: Dear Les and Jan,  We appreciate your honest feedback and are glad you chose to stay with GalleryOne DoubleTree by Hilton for your special occasion. However, we regret that we did not meet your expectations. We apologize that we did not make the suggested accommodations and that you did not receive personalized service during your stay. We strive to ensure all guest needs are met and any special requests are granted as much as possible. Truluck’s restaurant is indeed a wonderful dining experience for special occasions and we were remiss in not suggesting this to you. We hope you will consider giving us another opportunity to serve you for your next special event allowing us to demonstrate the "Art of Hospitality". If I can be of any further assistance, certainly do not hesitate to contact me directly.  Kind regards, Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Great room
review: We chose this hotel to stay overnight before our cruise.   We all liked the location and the hotel was really nicely appointed, clean and comfortable.  Sitting out back watching small ships sail by also extremely nice.  I did find my room a bit noisy as I could hear highway traffic.  The only slight negative is that the front desk only seemed to have one person checking guests in and answering questions. Took a while to check in.  Front desk employees were nice and personable though and who can argue with fresh chocolate chip cookies.

title: Great stay!
review: Stayed here for 1 night pre cruise.   We had a large lounge/ kitchen as well as a lovely bedroom and a bathroom with a great shower. Superb views of the ocean and the waterway.  Thanks to previous contributors we knew about the Publix store close by.  Obviously a  guest staying in our room had known about it too as we found part of an apple tart in the fridge.      Is it still there???

title: great place
review: This hotel was wonderful.  Beautiful views of the canal and drawbridge. Very clean and comfortable rooms.  Everything about our stay was enjoyable.  The valets were very helpful with directions and places to see.  Eric was especially wonderful.   My dad is handicapped and Eric went above and beyond to assist my family with our car and bags.  I look forward to coming back to stay here.

title: Special Event
review: I was treating my brother to the Florida Derby and wanting to stay in a nice hotel. My overall experience was average not what I would expect from Hilton or any property where rooms are $200 + per night. We did have a beautiful view in our two room suite. The suite was roomy, but enough wear and tear not to be an upscale experience. The dining room food for Dinner was tasty but was way understaffed for the amount of people that were eating that night. Never saw a supervisor on the premises to converse with. Continental breakfast was below average. The fruit all tasted the same like they serve it day after day. The outside grounds were great was well as the valet parking which you have to take. No self parking. The cookies were delicious.

title: Family Cruise
review: Dear Koecker,  Thank you for the review of your recent experience at GALLERYOne DoubleTree by Hilton. We are very sorry for your overall experience at our hotel and that you found that our food variety and room quality did not meet your expectations. As a DoubleTree by Hilton we like to provide a personalized experience for each of our guests but also look for ways to keep costs low while providing comfort and convenience. We work continually to improve our menu offering and we are in the process of finishing the upgrading our suite decor. We appreciate your feedback as we use this for a learning tool to make our services better. We hope that you will stay with us the next time you are in Fort Lauderdale.  Kind regards,  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Excellent
review: We loved it  there, we had a 2 bedroom , 2 bathroom suite over looking the draw bridge, fun time at the pool , happy hour 3-7. We did the water taxi, loved it, food in the restaurant was good. We were there for 2 days before our cruise, there were 5 of us,  Public's across the street was ideal.

title: Daughters 19th BDAY
review: No Complaints at all. Congrats. to all at The Double Tree. Being in show biz. I always advise my clients to check in at the Hotel and mention my name. I have had so many of my friends and clients calling me and thanking me for my recommending them to The Double Tree. I think this says it all.

title: Almost 100%
review: The hotel is old, and they have tried to give a facelift. We stay in a 2 bedroom suite room 834 for 4 days, 3 nights.  On the very first day we seen a roach in the hallway on our way to the room.  We had to called call the front desk multiple times because TNT (CHANNEL 12) had no sound on either of the 3 TV's in our suite. Finally they got it fixed on the last night we were there.  On the last day there, Tried to call the desk to pull our car around. The front clerk had no clue of what she was doing, we gave her the information we had used the entire stay to retrieve the car. She continue to say that the # we provided her 248 was our room #, and it was not, because we were in room 834. Had enough of going back and forth with her (she barely understood English). Hung up and went…

title: Beautiful!
review: The property sits facing Sunrise Blvd, however, from your room you have the option to book for intracoastal view. City and intracoastal view are both nice, the staff is very nice and helpful and the rooms are clean and spacey. I love their DoubleTree cookies upon check-in! One of my favorite spots to book a stay-cation at when I just want to get away... Quiet and the breakfast buffet downstairs is worth the $$$! I booked for water view but checked in late and the front desk apologized and comped my valet parking, comped breakfast, and gave an additional set of fresh baked cookies! That was appreciative...

title: Nice hotel but more for the wealthy
review: A very nice hotel, very comfortable. The hick is they have no shuttles from and to the airport or to the port if you are going on a cruise. The cost of taxi ride is $25 from the airport and $20 to the cruise ship. Breakfast is not included the cost is between 14 and 21$. No free WIFI in rooms but available in lobby. Well located with outdoor pool and by the water. Mall/stripmall with grocery store within walking distance. Very clean rooms and common areas, great service, and overall a high end hotel where you get what you pay for but it is very expensive.

title: Excellent hotel
review: We stayed here on our way back north from the keys. The hotel is right on the canal and highway. We received a canal room, and the view was great. Watched the boats go by, and the bridge rise to let them under. The hotel is next to a huge mall, and across the street is a Publix grocery store. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.   I have one big issue with this hotel. It's s hilton brand.  I have also on this trip stayed in Hampton inns. They provide FREE wifi, the doubletree makes you PAY for wifi. This is nuts in today's world. We didn't pay. We just used our phones to get Internet.   Come on hilton, if your moderate hotels offer free wifi, so can your upper end hotels.

title: "Excellent Experience"
review: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night after her surgery.  When I walked in to book the room, the lady at the front desk was very helpful and patient, I forgot her name.  House keeping was great also and oh wow, I cannot help but to mention Karesha, I think she was the supervisor of housekeeping, she was quick in responding to all our request for extra wash clothes and towels.  Thank you guys for making our night a memorable one and so we plan on visiting again. Keisha

title: Excellent Experience!!
review: Attention at the counter was excellent, room attendants were the best, rooms very clean, and the best view to Ft. Lauderdale beach.  No Complaints at all.  The Galleria One Mall is at walking distance and very convenient as well as a Publix supermarket and a CVS Pharmacy open 24 hours.

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: We stayed for a day prior to a cruise.  Our room was nicely laid out and clean (I've seen others mention issues with cleanliness).  The kitchen was nicely stocked with dishes / fridge and having the two room suite with a TV in each location is a plus.  It's right across from the huge Gallery Mall.  We took the water taxi tour and enjoyed it very much - guides were wonderful and it's a nice way to get to some of the restaurants while gawking at the yachts and homes of the rich and famous.  Valet service was prompt and friendly.  The only complaint I have .. and it's VERY minor but is a pet peeve - no obvious instructions on where to find ice, which is only on the 4th floor.   Would it be terribly difficult to put a little sign next to or better yet on the ice bucket?   Fun tip..…

title: Great reception, weird location
review: very nice reception and friendly people. The hotel looks very nice on arrival although as you drive in it is a kinda weird location. The lobby is great and the room seems nice enough. I had a inner corner room with a good size balcony, a bit of a view over the city. The room layout is good and very comfortable bed with a nice TV. A couple of problems with the room one was the shower pressure was somewhat anemic and the drain very slow. I let them know and they said they would get it fixed. Also they forgot to put a laundry bag in the room. Normally not a great big problem until you have to throw your "stinky undies" in with the clean clothes then it becomes a deal...  The location of the hotel is a bit off the main path, there are a few places around as far as restaurants but…

title: Won't stay here again
review: We stayed here with another couple after our cruise - just for one night.  We rented their 2 beroom/2 bath suite.  Not impressed.  After requesting early check in both on line and at the front desk (and agreeing to pay extra, if available) we did not get into the room until past 3 pm.  Now it is not their fault if the room is occupied - but seriously, a time span of 4 hours to clean the room?  And when we got in, the room was pretty bad - serious stains on carpet, hairs on bed linen, an indescribable/sour odour in the kitchen and the toilet was extremely dirty - inside and out.  Also, not enough toilet paper - my husband went down to lobby and got more.  We did not complain at the time to the front desk as we were only staying 1 night and to find 2 more rooms late in the…

title: Ask for a room away from Sunset Blvd.
review: Dear BWandBW,  Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay with us at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We are very sorry that you were disappointed with the cleanliness of your guest suite.  We try to be very vigilant in this area because we know how important it is for our guests.  We are actively working with our housekeeping staff so this situation doesn’t happen again.  We always try to listen and resolve our guest’s concerns and we deeply apologize that we did not meet your expectations.  I have reached out to you through your Trip Advisor account.  I would like to speak with you regarding your stay.  Kind regards,  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Terrific Stay
review: The hotel has a good location, only a 1/4 mile from the beach, and a few hundred feet from Galleria Mall, and some terrific restaurants.  Our room #1028 was spacious, clean and the kitchenette was well equipped.  The side of the hotel which our room was on is directly opposite Sunset Blvd, and even 10 floors up is very noisy during the day.  As the location of the hotel next to the highway can't be helped, perhaps some additional soundproofing when the rooms are next freshened up, would be beneficial.  If you have a choice, ask for a room away from highway.  We had a small misunderstanding about the room rate we made on-line, and Vanessa at the front desk sorted things out and we were very pleased with her attentiveness and cheerfulness.

title: Good location and lots of space
review: We stayed here before and after our cruise with the kids.  It is approx a 25-35 dollar taxi ride from the FLL airport or cruise port. The hotel will arrange a private car/van to the port or airport. We paid $32 for 4 people and had a SUV to the port and Van to the airport.  Check in fas fast and friendly both times. We did have to wait for a room post cruise as the hotel was full the previous night. We were able to get into our room by 11:30.  We got a standard room (suite) which had 2 queen beds in the bedrrom and a queen pull out couch in the living room. Room was clean for the most part but one of the rooms had a filthy carpet.  The TV in the living room was a older HD flatscreen and did not have a HDMI connection. The TV in the bedroom did have a HDMI connection.  We paid…

title: Our Experience
review: Overall, the hotel and its location was very good but the carpet in the room was tired and ragged.  The set-up of the room was very good.  The restaurant was quiet and the food was fine.  The access to the intercoastal was great and the boats running on the canal were very good.

title: Great Location
review: We stayed for 10 days at the Gallery One Doubletree in Ft Lauderdale and over all the experience was very good, with just a few minor things that could be improved. First off the location is outstanding.  You are just across the street from the Galleria, one of the best shopping malls in Ft Lauderdale.  There are plenty of good restaurants in walking distance from the hotel.  The beach is also just a short walk away.  It's very easy to get around from here.  However the best feature is that the water taxi leaves from right out the back door - this is a fun and very convenient way of getting around Ft Lauderdale.  It's great that the hotel is one of the water taxi stops as it's easy to get around from here. The hotel sits on one of the rivers and the back rooms have a wonderful…

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: The hotel is a typical Doubletree- very clean- nice size rooms and friendly, helpful staff. The location was perfect- one block to the beach and one block to the Galleria Mall which had 5 restaurants. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the patio- beautiful- only downside was the noise of the traffic going over the bridge- bothersome at night.

title: Noisy
review: There was a great deal of traffic noise all day and all night.  The cost was very high considering what was offered. The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  The lobby was attractive and was very well located for the water taxi and the beach.

title: Very Nice
review: We liked everything about our stay.  The staff were all very friendly and courteous.  The suite was nice, very clean and comfortable.  The access to the water taxi, the proximity to Bonnet House, the state park, the beach, the shopping, and the excellent restaurants allowed us to need minimal transportation.  We will stay there again if we have the chance.

title: Nice Place
review: Dear James H,  Thank you for the great review!  It sounds like you had a fun time here in Fort Lauderdale.  We hope to welcome you back soon!  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Cookies contain nuts
review: We stayed here for 3 nights while vacationing in Ft. Lauderdale. The rooms are a nice size with a nice kitchen that you could cook in. It is furnished with what you would need for staying a while. The bed was quite comfortable and has a large walk in shower and bathroom area. About a 10 minute walk to the beach and some nice pub/restaurants. You can also catch the Water Taxi on the resort grounds.The hotel does need some maintenance though. We would stay here again if need to.

title: Fort Lauderdale - Great Value and Location
review: The hotel staff was not overly friendly and questions I had were answered with "I don't know" instead of "I'm sorry I am not sure but let me check into that". The room was very nice and the pool was clean. The fitness center was also very nice. I thought their prices were a little steep for not being located directly on the beach.  ALSO, the cookies they hand out at checkin contain tree nuts...nearly had an allergic reaction. Luckily, my fiance took a bite of cookie first. They should tell their guests the cookies contain tree nuts...Vastly negligent.

title: Living up to its Trip Advisor Reviews!
review: Dear Victoria M,  Thank you for taking the time to send us a review.  We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We’ve addressed the issue with our front desk staff.  I’m glad to hear you enjoyed the suite, pool, and fitness center.  The cookie wrapper does indicate that the cookies contain walnuts however it is best to verbally tell our guests as well.  Thank you for the suggestion and we’re glad you didn’t have an allergic reaction.  We hope the next time you travel to Fort Lauderdale you’ll consider staying with us again.    Kind regards,  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Big room, nice outdoor restaurant and bar, no parking
review: The room is large, with a separate kitchen, living room, and a large enough bedroom. The bathroom is also spacious but something wrong with our shower, the water spills out. We had to put towel to keep the floor dry. There is a dock at the back to the river cruise, the outdoor sitting area facing the river is nice. Within a walking distance there is a nice Mexican restaurant. There is no parking, you have to do valet parking. A short drive to basically everything in town but you have to wait for the car each time you want to go out. If you go out 3x a day this could be a bit annoying.

title: The Valet Team here is exceptional
review: Dear Ben P,  Thank you for your feedback about the shower leakage.  We apologize for the issue and we’re working with our maintenance team to ensure the situation doesn’t happen again.  We hope to welcome you back in the future!  Miguel Mendez Chief Engineer

title: Hotel=Great Restaurant service=Poor
review: My family, friends and I recently stayed at your hotel the weekend of Feb 7-9th for my wedding and I just wanted to take a moment to praise one of your employees, Kevin, who works at the valet.  Every time we came through the valet area, he asked us if we needed anything, can he help out, etc.  He has a fantastic personality and a "do whatever it takes" attitude.  We were not an easy group in terms of the amount of luggage and wedding decor that we unloaded and then loaded back up and he was more than willing to assist each time.  What is ever more remarkable is that we found out towards the end of our stay that Kevin's mom is battling breast cancer.  He had actually come straight to work from the hospital at least once.  You would never ever know what he was going through in…

title: Double Tree GalleryOne #1
review: The hotel and service from the hotel was just fine. I didn't need much from them other than quick check in and friendly faces. They hit there. The restaurant is a no go. Service takes forever and food is over priced. Wanted a quick breakfast and it took about 10min and a few visits to ask someone just to see a server. Food was ok.

title: what didn't go wrong?
review: I stay here at least 4-5 times a month for business. My stay is always beyond my expectations everytime and gets better each time. From getting out of my car at the Valet service they all know me by now and treat me as I am the Queen of England. When I enter the beautiful well kept and clean lobby, I am always greeted by Mrs.....and my last name. Vanesa Gaddis is the best customer service manager anyone could ask for at a Hilton Hotel. She is a Diamond in the Rough and its very hard to find a remarkable sweet person to assist me at the highest standard of customer service that anyone can offer. It is in a perfect location with a short walk to the beach to enjoy the beautiful Florida weather, or take a quick 2 minute walk the opposite direction to the mall and go on a shopping…

title: Gallery One Experience
review: My sister and I stayed at the hotel for three nights which two were pre-cruise and one was post cruise.  The room and food were great and the staff was excellent.  Breakfast was very good. Chris and other attendants were great at the valet station.  My sister left her wallet in the car at the airport.  Through a series of phone calls and Chris coordinating efforts with the taxi driver, my sister not only got her wallet back but made her flight as well.  We had a very difficult morning with my flight being cancelled and the temporary loss of the wallet.  The hotel let me check in again to the room we had stayed in the prior night so that I didn't have to sit at the airport for many hours.  I couldn't have asked the staff to have treated us any better.  Also, Jackie in the…

title: First and last time
review: This was a very standard fair hotel, valet parking in Mandatory 26.50. They should upcharge the room and omit this extra fee, along with having to tip everytime you want to use your vehicle. We were on the 9th floor in a "suite". It honestly felt like a dorm room. Some rooms had a balcony, ours did not. I felt like a caged animal. The different levels of flooring right within the suite was dangerous. If you werent paying attention, you could easily trip. Upon arrival, the elevator was extremely slow. Everyone was complaining about it. Also there was food on the floor of our hallway upon arrival and  still there when we left. The "drinking" water was yellow. All this being said, when we went to turn in for the night, our sheets had unidentifable hairs on the sheets. I will…

title: Pleasantly Suprised
review: Dear mustrelaxnow,  We sincerely appreciate your feedback and can assure you we take all guests' reviews very seriously. We're currently working with our team to address the cleanliness issues and apologize for any discomfort you experienced.  The elevators are now working and we deeply apologize for the inconvenience.  This is certainly not typical nor acceptable. Your comments will certainly help us improve our processes moving forward and we hope we'll have another opportunity to serve you.  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Comfortable, good location
review: We stayed at this hotel as part of our pre cruise. There were four of us and the space we shared was excellent. I had chosen this location because we had stayed at a Double Tree on our cruise to cabo. a few years ago. The suite was large, clean and was excellent for our party. The only improvement would be to add another two chairs & cocktail to the balcony. There was plenty of room & we could all have sat outside to enjoy our coffee. This location has an excellent grocery near, we ate at the Mexican restaurant  just across the bridge, it was excellent I would eat there again. Thank the staff for the great experience. We were there Feb 22.2014

title: Almost Perfect
review: Spent 1 week with my family at this hotel and it was ok. The cleaning of the room was poor but on the other side housekeeping supervisor Kanesha was great and took care of it! The location is also great, close to the beach and lovely morning jogging! Would stay at this hotel again, but I think it was too expensive, especially the parking 25 dollars/night! Feels more like a business hotel than a familyhotel. Also, considering the price of this hotel, free wifi in the rooms should be included.

title: Great Stay for Business or Family
review: Just attended a conference at the hotel and the meeting rooms were very nice and the lunch buffets were creative and tasty. This hotel has a nice outdoor layout with the pool, bars and function area.  I like the proximity to restaurants, bars (Blue Martini) and the beach.  The beds were comfortable and I enjoyed having a living area and kitchen.  Our room was #432 and I did not like all the noise from the street.  I would ask for a room facing the pool/waterway.  They do have a water taxi pick up in back of the hotel if you need to get around.  The cons of this hotel:  I don't like paying for parking if I am not staying in NYC or a major city.  It seemed steep to charge guests $25 to park.  The valets were personable and accommodating.  The hot tub was not functioning and my…

title: HORRIBLE SERVICE
review: We had a conference with over 100 members attending.  The outside bar was CLOSED on Friday and on Thursday the bartender went on "break" around 4 and said the bar was only open until 6pm.  The insider bartender hated the fact that she had to serve ( by herself ) 40-50 people waiting at the bar for a drink.  This was gone over BEFORE the event and the management cared less about adding people to work that weekend.

title: Great for wedding on caprice
review: Dear Mike C,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We’re very sorry that you encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay.  Thank you for alerting us to this issue, and we hope you’ll give us another chance if you return to our area.    Tiffany Davis Director of F&B/Operations

title: great rooms
review: While I thought the prices were high, the room service not good, and parking fee high, the location and atmosphere were great for my daughters wedding on the Caprice which docks behind the hotel. Great location within  walking distance of beach, restaurants,  shopping.  Kevin -in valet ,did a super job helping with all of our extra wedding decorations, had a great attitude and a charming personality.

title: We could have stayed longer...
review: Diane S,  Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I will share your comments regarding the room service with our Food & Beverage team.  Parking prices in the area can be high, so we try to offer the lowest price possible for parking.  I’m happy to hear that Kevin was helpful and I will share your nice comments with him.  We hope to welcome you back in the future.  Phillip Smoak Director of Parking Operations

title: Just ok with a big price tag
review: I regret we paid extra for a water view, and actually requested a higher floor.  The water from our balcony was only visible when standing, making the price difference NOT worth it.  The hotel definitely had some 'wear'.  We did the 'pre-cruise' package which included the same breakfast our friends got for free, however we did upgrade which WAS worth the cost.  The restaurant was quite good and the overall service in the hotel was GREAT.  The front desk clerk however, was definitely lacking in the friendliness of the rest of the staff (even the 2 maids we encountered were more welcoming).  I give high compliments to the maids, the bartender outside, and the breakfast staff.  The rest of the place left little to be desired.  Also, we regret staying on the side of the drawbridge…

title: This is a condo owner hotel
review: The property has a very good location and is very comfortable.  Guests should know that this DoubleTree is a condo owner property in which each guest room has an owner, and therefore there is a locked closet with the owner's property.  During my visit, I was forced to change rooms because the owner of my initial room was arriving during my stay.

title: Excellent suite hotel
review: I stayed here 6 times during January and February between cruises and enjoyed each stay. My thanks to Receptionist Ann Marie for remembering my name and doing such a great job. Hotel is close to the beach and Publix and the Mall. Take the water taxi Andrew

title: well located hotel
review: Nice hotel, simple, located close to a shopping mall, super market, convenience store and to the beach. Diner and breakfast are good. Reception very helpful and efficient. They have a full kitchen that can lower the cost of your stay. Internet is ok.

title: Wonderful staff but not a great stay
review: My husband and I stayed one night post cruise at the Gallery One on Feb. 16th.  Our stay at this hotel was a pretty mixed bag, some good some bad.  The good:   The hotel is in a great location, right on the water, perfect for watching the beautiful boats go by.  There is also a water taxi stop right on the grounds which was so convenient.  The hotel is not huge but the lobby and grounds are beautiful and kept up very well. There is a nice little pool and a small sandy “beach” where you can lay out.  The outdoor patio is very nice as well.    We enjoyed a delicious buffet breakfast in the restaurant although it was very expensive.  The front desk was nice enough to let us access the free wifi while we waited since it would still be a couple hours before we could check in.    When…

title: Amazing
review: Just spent the weekend their. Beautiful hotel, amazing staff. The staff there was so understanding of my needs. I went to the hotel with my friends and our special needs camper. The staff was so helpful and amazing. I would stay there again. With the service and location I recieved im wondering why this hotel doesnt cost $1000 a night. Best hotel I have stayed at in a long long time.

title: Perfect location
review: We have stayed at this hotel before when in Fort Lauderdale pre cruise , and will definitely stay again. Great location, walking distance to beach, shopping, restaurants...short cab ride, or hotel shuttle to the cruise pier. Water taxi stop at the hotel...there is also a very nice pool. Rooms have had a much needed refresh, new furnishings.... Kitchen was very well equipped, beds excellent. We always book a water view with balcony, and enjoy our morning coffee or a pre dinner cocktail there, while watching the passing yachts. Staff were all great......can't wait to return, we love it there!

title: Noisy and smoke and mirrors
review: This place was so noisy I was jumping up in bed all night. The shower leaked all over the bathroom. Rug was tattered all over. No Wi-Fi unless you pay, really, wi-fi is even at Denny's. The only good thing about it was Cesar the valet, he was a bright spot. The 2 girls at front desk were very snippy when asking about wi-fi.

title: No room at the Inn
review: Dear 101walterh,  We’re very sorry for the noise disruptions and service issues you encountered during your stay at our hotel.  I have shared your comments with our management team.  Complimentary internet is available in all public areas of the hotel.  We've also personally thanked Cesar for his dedication to hospitality. We hope that the next time you’re in the area, you’ll consider staying with us again.   Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: GREAT  customer service  ! ! !
review: I booked a room for 2 nights before leaving on a cruise.  Much to my surprise I received a call from the hotel at ~5pm when we were in baggage claim at the airport.  They called to say that there was an "incident with our room" and that there was no other rooms available for our first night, but that there would be space on the second night.  REALLY, I booked this room 6 months in advance!  They paid for a room at the Hyatt...which was old, dirty, and not in near as good of location.  We also wasted one whole morning as we had to check out of the Hyatt and into the DoubleTree...so much for my stroll on the beach.  The only good part of this mishap is that the concierge man, Kevin, was very nice.  He picked us up at the Hyatt, paid for our lunch while we waited for our room to be…

title: Pre Cruise Stay - Good Choice
review: This was a great location!  Beach, water taxi, mall, grocery store, drug store, and restaurants were all within walking distance.  The staff at the front desk needed to be a little more efficient, but overall the experience was very good.  If they do not offer their cookies, be sure to ask.  Transfers to the cruise ship was convenient and close.  Rooms were very comfortable.

title: Always room for improvement
review: The room was a good size for the price but smelled musty and old.  The ac system was loud and there seemed to be alot of outside noise in the room.  Room service was quick but forgot my dressing which seems minor except that for salad, fries and a sandwich I paid $60 which is a little pricey for mediocre food.  I would probably stay again, but not my first choice of beach hotels.

title: Great staff, shabby shoddy property
review: $450 a night plus tax for a suite with stained carpet, chipped and scarred paint, broken hot tub and only two working elevators for 13 floors. So disappointed. Only pluses are a kind helpful staff and good location. Avoid this ripoff'

title: Great location; rooms could use some renovation
review: Dear wannabeislander1232,  Thank you for your candid feedback of your stay at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We are very sorry that we did not meet your expectations and we’re actively working with our housekeeping and engineering departments to ensure the condition of the rooms are outstanding.  We hope you’ll stay with us the next time your travels bring you to Fort Lauderdale.  Best regards,  Merle Martinez Executive Housekeeper

title: Not My Best Hotel Experience
review: We stayed here for 2 nights post cruise. The location was great as the beach was a 5 minutes walk to the east and the Galleria Mall was 5 minutes to the west. For the quality of the room we had, we found it to be very expensive. A can of paint can go a long way to helping out the look of the room. Rusty shower fixtures, dented light shade also contributed to our impressions. $25 for valet parking per night. For the price we paid, internet was not included - a major disappointment and a cash grab on the part of the hotel. I wouldn't return here.

title: Excellent Location, Dated Rooms
review: My husband and I enjoyed a weekend here pre-cruise.  The property is right on the waterway and serves as a stop for the water taxi.  The grounds and lobby are lovely.  Our room, a waterview suite, was spacious with a bedroom, bath, living/dining area, and apartment style kitchen.  The appliances were Kitchenaid stainless steel and in good working order.  The bed was comfortable and the linens soft.  The room itself was beginning to show wear and tear - knicked paint, frayed carpeting, shoddy patch repairs.  The cooling vent is located in the living/dining area.  If you close the bedroom door, expect temperature extremes.   For the $162 per night price on Hotwire, it was well worth the cost.  For the normal $300 - $400 per night rate, I believe there are nicer properties to be…

title: The day before a cruise
review: Having literally missed the boat when traveling to Florida to board a cruise ship during the winter., our travel agent suggested we arrive the day before the ship sails and suggested the Gallery one  Double Tree Hotel on Sunrise Boulevard. The location is perfect and right across the street from a mall in case shopping is on your agenda. There is a restaurant on the property and many more in the area. The hotel is all suites and very comfortable.

title: Best ever one night stay
review: A friend of mine was hosting a party this weekend and I got to stay here for one night. The staff is friendly and professional..the rooms are clean and decorated nicely...with a fully equipped kitchen...the breakfast service was great and reminiscent of hotel stays in the caribbean...great place to vacation

title: pre and post cruise stay
review: very good experience,would come back without any question.Entire staff was very pleasant and helpful.Food was a little pricey with so many high end resturants near bye.If you wanted to spend that kind of money,they were a better option

title: Nice, but expensive
review: We stayed one night prior to our Royal Caribbean cruise. The hotel in general is nice, clean, but very pricey. The best part of the hotel was the location. It’s about two blocks away from the Galleria Mall on the right side, and to the left about two blocks to the beach. There is a water taxi available at the rear of hotel for $22 per / day for each passenger, you could ride all day. We found it to be a lot quicker to take a taxi. From Fort Lauderdale’s airport it costs approx. $26.00 for a taxi and $13.00 from hotel to East Las Olas Boulevard shopping & dining district. Then just off the corner of East Olas Blvd & South East 5th Street is North New River Drive East, near the beginning of The Riverwalk. The Riverwalk walkways are lined with brick pavers, plants, restaurants and…

title: pre cruise stay
review: It is an older hotel with a very nice refurbishment. The kitchen was great.We had a nice view of the water. There weren't a lot of chaise lounges by the pool and some had holes. The bathroom was very nice and clean. We enjoyed the lack of a tub. The location was great. There were many restaurants at the mall around the corner. Though it was longer to the cruise dock than I thought.

title: Pre cruise stay
review: Pre cruise stay on 2/1/14. Arrived a bit early (2pm)  and tried to check in and we were told the room was not ready and check in was not until 3 pm. We were ok with that and decided to eat lunch at the restaurant at the hotel.  We waited approximately 20 minutes to be seated ( plenty of tables) but only one waitress and one waiter who was also the bartender. We then waited approximately another 20 minutes to order our food. The food was ok but nothing that great.  We then tried to check in at 3:30 and were told our room is still not ready. While others around us and some who,arrived at the same time as us were being checked in. I advised the guest service gentlemen of this and his reply was the suites are not ready I can place you in a one bedroom. I advised him that their is 5…

title: Gallery One by Hilton
review: Dear Harley27,  Thank you for your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  Due to the recent high popularity of the hotel and high occupancy we are in the process of hiring more servers in the restaurant.  I deeply apologize that this was a concern during your stay and I wish I would have known while you were here.  I’m happy that you enjoyed your guest suite and that the valet attendant was nice and helpful.  We hope to welcome you back to the GALLERYone in the near future.  Warm regards,  Tiffany Davis Director of Food & Beverage/Operations

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: Wonderful location of Hotel and remarkable staff..... simply do not have enough staff at Breakfast room or at the snack counter...staff are asked to look after too many stations at once...and they do it all with a smile on their face. Hallway on one of the floors wasn't cleaned for over 24 hrs.

title: Great Seminar and really good customer service
review: Was very pleasantly surprised.  Seems to be all suites hotel, with two and 1/2 rooms.  Full kitchen with all amenities ie dishes pots and pans coffee pot.  Living room with sm. dining room area, and terraces.  Service was very good, as I initically had a problem with the A/C, but it was fixed right away.

title: Great service! Poor Value
review: I thought staff was very nice and friendly. Having traveled around a bit, I would say that I've stayed at similar hotels with far better amenities included. This hotel has a very pricey continental breakfast, charges a lot for mandatory valet and doesn't even include wifi in the price of a suite.  I would say this hotel is very nice, but not luxurious.

title: horrible and old
review: Chris the valet cares, sadly no one else does. Stayed here after a cruise, had to wait hours for a room. Am in a wheelchair and the hotel is not ADA appropriate. The place is old, no shuttle. Smelled. The bathroom was ok. For this price, I expect more. They could not even get a wake up call right

title: Okay
review: Janine511,  Thank you for your feedback and we apologize for the unfortunate experience you had. We can assure you that guests' reviews are very important to us and we're taking your comments very seriously. Please contact us directly so we can speak with you directly.  Nelson Chacon Front Office Manager 954-335-4503 nelson.chacon@hilton.com

title: Pre cruise stay
review: The amenities and valet people were great.  But the atmosphere was dry and stuffy, this includes the person who checked us in.  This may be a So FL thing, not sure.  Probably wouldn't stay there again.  Friendliness is very important to me!

title: Great Place
review: Dear TripAdvisor Member,  We’re sorry we didn’t provide the high quality of services you deserve.  This is not typical of our hotel and staff.  We try to make each guest experience a great one at the GALLERYone and your satisfaction is important to us.  Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope you’ll give us another opportunity soon to make your stay the best it can be.  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Where's the value for the money??
review: When one pays over $300 per night (including taxes), one would expect some value??!! Well, not here!  Not included was parking $25 per day, no breakfast, wifi $9.95 per day, and white glove service!  I really wonder if housekeeping cleaned my floors the 5 nights I was there??!! Also, I had to keep the toilet seat and ring up so they would clean and/or remove the long hair.  Oh, I have hardly any hair!  For my money all I got was a balcony with a nice view of the intracoastal waterway.  I would rather stay at an EMBASSY SUITES by Hilton!  At least there you get value for the money and normally cheaper room rates.  The hotel is very nice and has a Starbucks, pool area (free towels. LOL), and there is a Water Taxi stop there also.  Oh, the business center is free ;) I did get 2…

title: needs repair
review: Dear Gringo66,  We appreciate your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We see that you were unhappy with some of the charges, and we apologize if the charges weren’t clear when you booked the room.  We work hard to personalize each guest’s  experience and try to keep costs affordable.  Your review helps us maintain a focus on both of those areas.  I will share your comments in regards to the housekeeping service with our management team.  Thank you again for your review.  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: This hotel needs to be renovated
review: Our shower handle was ready to fall off, you would think housekeeping would have caught it. Literally!! We had to find valet when we left in the early am.  Location great and suite set up good although individually owned units had variations.

title: Another great stay at Galleryone
review: Dear Diane M,  Thank you for your feedback and I apologize for the broken shower handle that you experienced.  I have discussed this with our housekeeping and engineering teams.  Thank you for bringing it to our attention.  I’m glad that you enjoyed our location and guest suites.  We hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Merle Martinez Executive Housekeeper

title: Overall a very good property with a couple of issues
review: The shower drain was clogged, my room temperature could not be controlled making it either cold or hot always, fruit received from room service was not good. The hotel rooms are in need of a renovation.  The location and proximity to the beach is very good for the price.

title: * A Wonderful Place to stay in Fort Lauderdale *
review: We recently returned from a two-week stay at the DoubleTree Gallery One Suite Hotel in Fort Lauderdale and what a pleasant experience it turned out to be.  We had a one-bedroom suite with a balcony on the side of the building facing the swimming pool and Intracoastal Waterway.  The suite was extremely quiet and also features a small kitchenette where you can prepare breakfast or heat up any food that was leftover from a meal enjoyed at any one of the local restaurants.  You can walk across the street to the Publix, a well-stocked supermarket, to purchase any groceries that you might need during your stay.  Most of all, I would like to commend the entire hotel staff for a level of service that is rarely found in most hotels nowadays.  From the valet parking attendants to the…

title: Excellent
review: Dear musiquedonaldo,  We can’t thank you enough for your lovely review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  It was our pleasure to have been able to provide you with a high level of service and great location to help make your stay special.  We’re delighted you enjoyed your visit and hope that you will return soon.  Kindest regards,  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Fantastic
review: We selected this for our pre-cruise overnight stay. The guys out front were fantastic - Andrew, Edriss, Cesar, and Paul greeted us, took care of our bags, brought the bags up to our room as soon as we got there, came up the next morning as soon as we called Sandy, and made sure that our bags were watched and put on the correct bus with us. They could not have been more friendly and efficient. The room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. We weren't disturbed by noise from other rooms. The check-in and check-out were handled very quickly and by a very caring and friendly staff. We recommend this hotel to anyone going to Ft. Lauderdale.

title: great
review: Linda22373,  Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience at the GALLERYone.  I’m happy to hear that Andrew, Edriss, Cesar, and Paul made your stay even better.  I will share your nice comments with them.  We hope to welcome you back on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale.  Phillip Smoak Director of Valet Operations

title: Great experience
review: We stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon before and after we went on our cruise.  The location is fantastic, five minute walk to the gorgeous beach and a stones throw away from the Galleria Mall which has a great selection of shops and restaurants.  There is a water taxi stop right outside the hotel which makes it easy to hop on and off for sightseeing.  The staff were wonderful and every one of our requests were dealt with in a timely and professional manner. Rooms are huge and extremely comfortable and there is a gorgeous pool/spa area right on the waterfront.  We would highly recommend this hotel.  Free wifi in the lobby is also a bonus!

title: Excelente, no problem, near the beach
review: The hotel was excelente, the staff is great and it is very near the beach. All you need to relax and work. We had a conference and it is perfect. Also to take the family. The food is not high cuisine but it is good. The rooms are comfortabler and have good space and working places.

title: The staff at the front desk were all great ! Amanda , was the very first employee that my family did get to know during our stay
review: Dear Rodrigo M,   We’re happy you had an excellent stay at the GALLERYone,  Thank you for the great review!  Come see us again soon.   Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Great place to stay
review: The location is perfect and my family and I were happy with our stay and would consider returning again in  The nearest future for a family vacation! The staff from the front desk and dinning staff  and house keeping Marie,in house keeping floor 11 were just pleasant and helped made the stay at one gallery more enjoyable!

title: Awesome
review: Dear Nikki2626,   Thank you for staying here at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We’re glad you had a taste of our warm, caring service.  I will share your nice comments with Amanda and Marie.  We hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Solid hotel but nothing spectacular
review: I am spending 4 weeks in Fort Lauderdale and have come to stay at this suites /Condo hotel. The suite we have  is fantastic with tremendous views of both the Inter coastal waterway and the Atlantic Ocean.  The accommodation consists of a kitchen and dining area, lounge with balcony and a very large bedroom with en-suite facilities. Ideal for us as we can bring any groceries we require and cook in the apartment, which makes a good saving.  As we are here for a rather long stay we were also able to make some savings on the normal cost of the room, which again led to further savings.  The only downside about the Hotel is that the bar is a little dull and their happy hour is limited to house wines and beers with Cocktails excluded. Fortunately the Blue Martini is 2 minutes up…

title: Good hotel close to beach and shopping
review: We stayed 4 nights pre-cruise to recover from jet-lag after a long flight from Europe. The rooms are comfortable and include a well equipped kitchen with coffee maker + coffee, micro wave and refrigerator. We had a room facing the strip mall across and a busy street. The noise from the street was not that disturbing and we could sleep well. Wonderful staff and service.   This hotel is a great location before or after a cruise. You can walk to the beach, the galleria mall and supermarket. There are a few restaurants towards the beach and a 7-eleven. In the galleria mall there are some nice restaurants and bars as well as a food court.   A taxi to the hotel from Miami airport (rush hour) cost us $110 and to the cruise port $35.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Cruise Package
review: Dear Anders52,  Thank you for sharing your experience at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed our location, guest suites, and our service.  We hope to see you on your next cruise out of Fort Lauderdale!  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Great experience
review: Celebrity cruise lines recommended this hotel prior to boarding our vacation.  We arrived and was upgraded into a King Suite, which wasn't really necessary, but was very nice.  Our package was "Park and Stay".  We were told we would be transported to the ship in the morning, our car would be garaged at the hotel and then we would be picked up at the pier upon return.  What we were not told was that the ride to the ship was included but that we would have to pay the VIP driver $30 plus a $6 tip to return to the hotel to pick up the car upon our return.  The fee for storing the car was $25 a day, something else that was not explained.  Wow, until we paid for everything it was a costly recommendation by Celebrity and caught us by surprise.  Obviously I didn't ask enough questions.…

title: Exceeded expectations
review: Dear Nancy K,  Thank you for your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  The “Park and Stay” package includes valet parking each night during your stay at the hotel for one vehicle. Special pricing of additional $15 per night available for vehicles left on property during cruise.  Transportation to Port not included. Standard parking fees are $25 per night.  I apologize that this wasn’t clear when booking the reservation.  We hope the next time you’re traveling to Fort Lauderdale you’ll stay with us!  Kindest regards,  Lianette Aqui Director of Revenue Management

title: Thanking the staff of the GALLERYone for an incredible experience!
review: We were met by very friendly staff, from valet / bell hops to front desk to housekeeping. Upon learning we were celebrating our 25th, the hotel sent a special gift to our room.  The suites were very roomy, great location.  We had some problems with the heat (cold spell in January) but it was fixed when we brought it to their attention.

title: Great location!
review: My husband and I had a fantastic stay! The room was quiet and comfortable. We enjoyed watching the yachts from our balcony. The location is superb. On our second night we walked to Seasons 52 for a fantastic dinner and then danced at The Blue Martini right next door. Perfect!

title: Very Expensive for an average hotel
review: Dear Lisa N,  We’re happy you had a fantastic stay at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton!  Come see us again soon!  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Excellent family stay, wonderful staff
review: Be prepared to spend for every amenity normally supplied by the Hilton Chain.  This Doubletree is not very clean, and charges for everything.  It is in a good location and the staff is excellent, but the hotel is dated and needs some renovation.

title: Great stay and friendly staff
review: Dear Sheldon C,  Thank you for your candid feedback.  We see that you were unhappy with some of the charges, and we apologize if the charges weren’t clear when you booked the room.  Valet and internet charges are listed on our website.  We work hard to personalize each guest’s experience and try to keep costs affordable.  Our rooms were recently renovated and we have replaced all products in the guest suites.  I’m glad you enjoyed our location and staff and hope that you’ll stay with us the next time you’re in Fort Lauderdale.  Kind regards,  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Great intracoastal location
review: Stayed there for 5 days in December 2013, we were walk-ins with no reservation after we left the previous dump of a hotel.  They gave us a very good rate, we had a 2 queen suite.  Great location - next to the mall, the water-taxi and the beaches.  Clean and the staff were great.  Loved the mini beach area they had.  Negatives are the parking as other reviewers have noted and also there were some loose tiles at the pool area.

title: Wonderful hotel and staff.
review: Understated but very comfortable. Location is unbeatable and staff is exceptional. We have stayed at the Double Tree Galleria many times over many years and will continue to return and recommend to our family and friends.

title: restful and beautiful
review: Dear Nelson G,  Your comments about your stay here at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton made me smile.  Thank you so much for the great review!  We’re thrilled that over the years our service and location has continued to impress you.  We look forward to welcoming you back!  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Very good value and location
review: Gallery One, Double Tree on Sunrise Blvd in Fort Lauderdale, Florida is esthetically alluring and loaded with amenities that include a beautiful pool and patio area on the intercoastal and a water taxi stop. The guest suite hotel is located in walking distance to the Galleria Mall that hosts a Capital Grill, Blue Martini and Seasons 52. I highly recommend this Hilton property.

title: Good stay.
review: Janiceg70,  Thanks for recommending us to our fellow Trip Advisor users!  What a nice review you’re written.  Thanks for taking the time to send us the great review!  We hope to see you again soon at the GALLERYone!  Martin Hoellrigl General Manager

title: Second Visit
review: The location was great, nice pool and jacuzzi by the river, really nice good value rooms. We had a family suite for barely the price of a room. Beautiful lobby. On the minus side, beds are very soft and aircon is a bit noisy,

title: The best of both
review: I had a wonderful experience at the hotel and would stay again. I stayed here for five. Great for pre-cruises who want to get some shopping or R&R time in before or after their cruise. I was greeted at reception with the best warm chocolate chip and walnut cookie. Staff at reception were very friendly. Starbucks located in the lobby area and water taxi on the doorstep. It costs approximately $22 including tips from Fort Lauderdale airport to the hotel in a taxi. Room with balcony was extremely spacious. Great little kitchenette with, sink, fridge, dishwasher, hot plate and microwave. Shower was great and there was a lot of space in bathroom. The mall  is located across the road from the hotel and the beach is an easy eight minute stroll. There is a Publix supermarket nearby,…

title: Stay at DoubleTree Fort Lauderdale-Galleria
review: Dear SilverD11,  Thank you for staying here at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We’re glad you had a taste of our warm, caring service (along with our delicious cookie at check in).  We look forward to welcoming you back.  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Fun in the sun
review: My family and I were treated as if we were their family.  The staff was knowledgable and helpful.  The parking valet gave us a great suggestion for dinner.  The desk staff really seemed to care if we were happy and did everything to do so.  Of course the warm cookie is GREAT comfort food.  We visited at Christmas time, and they even had a real Christmas tree in the lobby, it smelled so good.

title: Upgraded property helps overall effect
review: Dear Amanda W,  Thank you for the great review!  We truly appreciate your comments and we’re so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We hope to see you again soon.  Kindest regards,  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Nice Stay & Good Location
review: Stayed at the Gallery One in July 2013 as my daughter's volleyball team selected this hotel as its home base.    The hotel was beautifully located.     Three blocks from the beach, access to the area's water taxi's and restaurants located next door in the shopping center/mall.   The room was what I expected from a Doubletree/Hilton property.   The lobby was beautiful.     Loved that the hotel was an "all suite" property which made it spacious for a family of four.   Add a full kitchen and it made this an a great family space.     I had been upgraded to a "water view" and had access to two balconies (one of the living space and one off the bedroom).     The room was clean and spacious.  Some cosmetic fixes needed to be made (broken door frame, loose fixtures).    But for the rate…

title: Great location lacks polish
review: Location is great-minutes on foot to galleria mall, public grocery store, Starbucks and beaches.  Rooms are decent, although many items in disrepair.  Has a kitchenette which is great with kids.  Valet only parking is annoying and expensive.  Bar in lobby is not open in the evening.  Pool is ok, fitness room is decent.

title: ok accomodation, but see details below ...
review: Dear CFR1967,  Thank you for review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed your guest suite and our location.  We’re sorry that you thought our valet service was annoying and expensive.  We work hard to personalize each guest’s experience and try to keep costs affordable.  Our bar in the lobby is open until 10 pm every day however I apologize that you perceived it to be closed.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to welcome you back in the near future!  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Great customer service
review: I know the hotel for some 15 years and stayed again for a few days during Xmas / New Year.  The hotel has good points: location close to the beach large suites acceptable breakfast buffet (even if the only toaster takes 10 minutes...) small business center on second floor including a printer some staff at breakfast is great (east european waitresses), some is just plain useless (a guy yawning at our table and cleaning his eyes while asking us what we wanted...)  and some weak points: mandatory valet parking at $ 25 / night plus taxes old rooms (even the renovated ones) with TV channels only working occasionally small fitness with no Windows a pool (but too small for lap swimming) heavily overpriced in comparison to similar hotels (Hilton on the Beach for example) some staff is…

title: Truly my home away from home!
review: Dear Geneva2009,  Thank you for your candid review.  I’m glad to hear that you enjoyed our guest suites, location, and breakfast buffet.  Parking prices in the area can be high but we offer the lowest price possible for parking at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We are working with our engineering department on the television and air conditioning issues that you mentioned above.  We see that you were unhappy with some of the charges, and we apologize if the charges weren’t clear when you booked the room.  We work hard to personalize each guest’s experience and try to keep costs affordable.  Thank you for your review.  Kevin Stabile Guest/Owner Relations Manager

title: Good room but a lot of noise coming from the bridge next to the hotel
review: Just got in from a long drive and received great valet service, as well as a quick and kind check-in topped with warm chocolate chip cookies.  Vanesa G and Amanda B made sure our kids were well taken care of and that we had the perfect room.  It's clean, spacious, with a great view!  Everything is within walking distance.  I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE!!!

title: very nice hotel
review: we stayed here prior to cruise departure and altho somewhat a distance from the port, it was very close to the beach - walking distance - and to the Galleria Mall. The staff impressed us the most as did the mini beach on the canal and outdoor setting. The suites are very well maintained and have locked closets for owners. Plenty of room for large family.

title: DCP - Favorite Winter Getaway
review: Let me start by saying that I travel often for professional training seminars, and I have stayed in great hotels across the U.S.  and Canada. But this hotel and location is my favorite. I had a rental car but really did not need one because the ocean, bars, and shops was three blocks east of the hotel front door, and a mall (with Macy's and Nordstrom), and top restaurants was three blocks West. There was even a 7 eleven two blocks away.   All that being said, great customer service is why I have made this my favorite winter getaway. The staff from valet, to front desk, to on-site restaurant was very friendly, respectful, and helpful. And you will understand why when you meet the Front Desk Supervisor, Ryan Love. He is the epitome of customer service.   Upon check-in, our suite…

title: Nice but aged
review: This was a quaint hotel that desperately needs to be updated.  For the price, I was disappointed they did not offer free WiFi service.  The hotel restaurant offered a fairly decent breakfast buffet but this too seemed to be a little pricey at $21 per person.  For the $250+ we paid for our room, there must be a better deal in the area than what we experienced.

title: Nice suite, Excellent View and Great Service
review: Spent a great week here with our children.  The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and for the most part attentive (the small things they missed aren't worth a mention). Very family friendly for children of all ages (including surprise children's opportunities slid under the door).  For the parents, happy hour specials daily throughout the week at the hotel restaurant.  Only a 7 minute-walk to the beach (over a draw bridge, which gets kids really excited:).  The hotel is also a destination stop for the water taxi which is a MUST DO for all visitors.  The rooms are spacious with balconies (I think on each), a small but spacious refrigerator, dishwasher, etc., provided comforts of home.  So we'd loved to have given this spot a 5 but our minor concerns were...  the first day…

title: Day stay
review: We arrrived at this hotel for a day stay after a cruise. It was very convenient located close to grocery shop and mall. The flight was delayed by 10 hours - and the reception was extremely helpful to extend the stay and make everything as comfortable as possible. Will definitively stay here again on a later occasion when I am in the same area. The only bad thing is that they charge for wifi.

title: Very happy
review: Overall very happy...we checked in on Christmas Eve. Larissa at the front desk was very helpful, all of our reservations and accommodations were as we had requested. The room was clean and spacious with plenty of counter space in the bathroom. Ryann of the front desk was also very welcoming and accommodating.

title: Nice hotel near the beach
review: This is a pretty nice suite hotel.  The front desk is friendly and courteous and the valet is great.  The only issue I had with it is that it is right on well traveled street and can sometimes be loud at night with all the traffic.  Other than that the hotel is very nice and I would highly recommend it.

title: nickel and dime
review: The website says "free wifi" but the only free wifi is in the lobby.  Wesite says "self parking available" but they closed that lot and charge $25 a day for mandatory valet service.  I paid extra for the waterview balcony room and they do have a nice view of the intracoastal but no beach view.  Having the water taxi stop is nice but long waits between boats.  I just feel they should be more honest in their promotional descriptions - after all, Hilton used to be a primo hotel.

title: 10 minute walk to the beach
review: Excellent location, choice of double Queen or King bedding.Friendly staff and close to stores.We ended up finding good restaurants from Yelp,Trip adviser,Zagat on US1 North, a few miles away.Used LA Fitness on the same road.The hotel fitness center is not for dedicated workouts.No bathtub.Pool did not feel heated.I highly recommend this property,no hassles,great staff.

title: A wonderful stay for the family
review: Our extended family stayed at  Gallery One  before our  cruise out of Fort  Lauderdale.  The hotel is in a perfect location.  There  are excellent restaurants within walking distance, and it's an easy walk to the beach and to the mall.  The rooms were large,  comfortable,  and well equipped. Vanessa,  the front office supervisor,  was especially helpful. She's terrific at her job,  helped us find everything we needed,  and addressing all of our needs.  We  highly recommend this hotel if you're in  the area!

title: Very nice hotel in great location
review: Large and clean suites with full kitchen. Shower in the suite was delightful. Our family saved tons of money utilizing the kitchen to make our meals or heat leftovers. Nice fitness room and pool, though pool was on the small side compared to other hotels (but who cares with the beach so close). Used their balcony extensively every night to unwind and gaze at the city view.  Best aspect of hotel was its location. It was minutes away from a mall, supermarket, beach, state park and public transportation. Water taxi stops right behind the hotel and the bus stop (route 40, 36 and 11 are especially useful) is right across the bridge or in front of the mall.  The only downsides are the ones already mentioned earlier by other users. Valet parking is expensive and obviously a scam since…

title: Design, Service, Style--a perfect family vacay!
review: We recently stayed at the Gallery One as a family getaway from the hustle and bustle of New York.  I could not have asked for a more attentive staff, superb location and and all around unforgettable experience.  It's one we won't soon forget.  Vanesa at the Front Desk checked us in and it felt like we had a personal concierge and butler our entire visit. You must ask for her when you stay.
