review: We stayed here in transit to the MV Allure of the Seas for one night. After a long journey from the UK we were delighted with the welcome (including cookie!) and the suite.  Eating in the hotel, the service was slow and the food average, but we were too tired to bother. We took a drink outside and were amazed with the man made secure beach at the rear of the hotel.  Did not have breakfast there, but took advantage of the Seven Eleven nearby!  Recommended.

title: Great Room, Great Location
review: Thank you for your review and for recommending the GALLERYone.  I’m thrilled to hear you enjoyed your guest suite and our signature DoubleTree Cookie.  I will share your comments about the restaurant service with the Food & Beverage team.  Thank you for making us aware of it.  We hope to see you on your next cruise out of Fort Lauderdale.  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Not quite a 4-star property but definitely better than a 3
review: We stayed at this hotel because we were going to a wedding. This must be a popular thing to do, because we ran into the bridal parties of two other weddings on the same day, plus a family reunion.  The hotel is in a good location. It's west of the Intracoastal Waterway with its own pier on a canal that connects directly to the Intracoastal. The pier can and does handle good size cruise ships. In fact, the reception was on a cruise ship which gave us a nice tour up and the waterway. The hotel had a good space for an outdoor wedding.  Going to the beach means walking over a bridge over the Intracoastal, though you could drive if you wanted to. It's also a quick walk to a grocery store, which is nice since all the rooms have a kitchenette. Also within walking distance is a huge…

title: Overbooking seems to be the norm!
review: Thank you for your nice review of the GALLERYone Fort Lauderdale - a DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed our great location and spacious suites.  Please visit us again soon as it would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Dissapointed in Fort Lauderdale
review: The majority of past reviews have, for the most part, been on point.  The hotel fell a little shore of being 4-star in my opinion, but was better than other 3-stars that I have stayed in.  The pluses: 1) walking distance to beach (about 5 minutes); 2) great price on Hotwire (was able to get 2 rooms for the price of one at other comparable properties); 3) suites are great for extended stay (mini kitchens and dining room tables allow you to save $$ on eating out by eating small meals in - probably would not try to cook a full dinner, although it could be done); 4) valet parking, although $25 per day, was very fast and convenient - most other quality hotels in area also charge for valet; 5) decent pool and hot tub with complimentary towels (although towels cannot be taken to…

title: Double Tree
review: Never stay at this hotel. They lure you with a cheap room rate but then charge extra for everything. Internet access is advertised as complimentary but its only available in the lobby. They charge you for internet access in the room per day per device!

title: Family Vacation with a special needs family member.
review: I am deeply concerned of your rating of a “1” for the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites Fort Lauderdale.  Thank you for making us aware of the issue you experienced.  Please contact me at your earliest convenience at 954-335-4632.   Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Great Experience
review: The hotel is nice, clean and comfortable.  The staff can be lazy, esp. on weekends and evening shifts.  They often gave us misinformation in regards to accessability.  There were a lot of careless mistakes being made during our stay; giving us the wrong hotel room with occupants still in it, hotel keys stopped working the day before our departure, housekeeping on weekends mad because we chose to stay in room while she cleaned/we requested fresh sheets after 3 days, wrong billing statement given to me on the day of departure.  All these issues can be fixed if all staff on all shifts were trained better in customer service!

title: Not the best experience from a Hilton
review: Thank you for your review of your recent experience at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites Fort Lauderdale.  We’re very sorry that you  encountered an unacceptable level of service.  We do our best to make sure all our guests have a rewarding stay.  We’ve addressed these issues with our staff and hope that the next time you’re in Fort Lauderdale, you’ll visit us again and experience a higher level of customer service.  Please contact me at 954-335-4632 so that we can make this right.  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Nice Hotel but the Valet Parking is $25 plux tax on top of the Room Charge
review: My husband and I spent our honeymoon there it was great. The room was clean staff was friendly and great location. We didn't drive so we didn't have to worry about parking and there is always a cab outside. Overall great experience would stay again.

title: Nothing Special but Expensive
review: A nice hotel but with overpriced restaurant, pay parking $25 daily with nothing complimentary except a warm cookie at check in. When extra charges added in the hotel is not a value or worth the cost.  If you have to stay close to the location of the hotel it is the only good choice for the area.

title: Used to be better, now it's on a slow decline on quality
review: We appreciate your review of your recent stay at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Fort Lauderdale.  We see that you were unhappy with some of the charges, and we apologize if the charges weren’t clear at the time of booking.  We work hard to personalize each guest’s experience and try to keep costs affordable.  Your review helps us maintain a focus on both of those areas.  Thank you again for your review.  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: A good experience
review: for almost two years, i would stay here for work because our company has a corporate account, but after my last two stays here, i'm sad to say that i will not be returning. there were furniture that need to be replaced and some pieces were loose and found in the room. the refrigerator froze my food. the room was very noisy because it faced Sunrise Blvd and the water. granted it was a nice view, but who wants a view if you can't have peace and quiet. because of our corporate status, billing has always been a pain, which makes checking out unpleasant.   i'm speaking on a business-stay perspective, not personal. if you stay here for vacation, you'll probably find this place to your liking.

title: Shortage of Towels
review: Thank you for your feedback.  Your rating of a “2” deeply concerns me and I would truly like to discuss your experience over the phone.  Please contact me at 954.335.4632 at your earliest convenience.   Sincerely,  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Perfect Location
review: Friendly helpful staff; for a hotel well priced restaurant, good sized rooms.  If leaving car here, prior to a cruise, note that the parking will add to your cost.  We have stayed at hotels where we could leave the car and incur no charges while on cruise.

title: Overpriced   Not worth it
review: My family spent four nights in a 2 bedroom suite this week. The condition of the suite was deplorable. The suite was musty, dirty and sheets were worn out. There were cockroaches scurrying across the stained carpet. The bathroom tiles were cracked and the fixtures were moldy and filthy. For about $250 a night this room was not worth half of its price. The facilities are worn out and filthy. The hotel has no parking and valet is the only option which is totally unnecessary and only adds to the expense of this hotel. The kitchen lacked basic utensils such as a knife, can opener etc and the number of utensils was inadequate. What did they expect us to do with only one spoon? Wifi cost $10 per day per device! It was a horrible experience and we couldn't wait to get home. However I…

title: Nice hotel
review: We are very sorry for the unfortunate experience you had at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites Fort Lauderdale and appreciate your feedback.  Please contact me directly so that we may speak about your recent stay with us.  Andreas A. Ioannou, General Manager 954-335-4632

title: Beautiful Location, but in need of updates
review: The double tree was very nice.  A can of soda at the bar was $450-a little outrageous.  Internet costs $9.95 per day.  Don't know why Super 8 can do it for free and Doubletree can't.  They also charge $25 per hour for an extra hour at checkout and $25 for parking.

title: Positive suprise
review: Thank you for taking time to write a review.  Whenever you’re in Fort Lauderdale, stop by the GALLERYone Fort Lauderdale – a DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We’ll take good care of you.  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Great for the price, but has some flaws
review: I love Doubletree hotels, but this one is older and needs to be remodeled. The best part, it's only 2 blocks away from the beach, and its on the Inter-coastal Waterway. It's an all-suite hotel. My suite had a dishwasher, a microwave, a small refrigerator along with several kitchen utensils, but only one teaspoon! The staff was friendly, and very helpful. I did my homework and found out about the charge for valet parking before booking my trip. I received such a good deal on my stay through SWA, the $25 per day fee didn't really bother that much. It was kind of nice to have someone park and retrieve the car for me. I did, however, have a serious problem with the Water taxi service! I am in the process of seeking a refund of the $20 I spent, only to be stranded several miles away…

title: Family Fun
review: The prices are a tad bit too much for the location in my opinion.  All of the rooms are suites which are nice.  I had the opportunity of viewing different rooms on different floors since my family was pretty spread out through the hotel and it was pretty nice.  Cons: $25/ night for valet parking. I think the guest should have the option for valet parking and not subjected to it. The traffic near the hotel is a little congested as well due to the drawbridge but the hotel can't control that. Pros: Quick walk to the beach, water taxi access and friendly staff

title: Valet Attendants Steal
review: Thank you for your review!  I’m glad you enjoyed your guest suite, our location, and the water taxi access.  We hope to see you again in the future!    Kimberly Miller Director of Sales & Marketing

title: Business / pleasure
review: The head board to the bed appeared to be fake leather that was cleaned by Edward Scissorhands because it was distroyed. I wasn't at all happy about being forced to do valet parking and certainly not happy with being forced to pay $25 per night for it. They seemed nice to our face however upon leaving after our stay, we noticed they had stolen a small but important item from my fiance's car. Dealt with a number of managers over a few WEEKS who were 100% unwilling to admit that this ever could have happened. Never got the item back and there is no possible way it was lost as it's something that my fiance notices every hour of everyday- was my fault for not noticing until we got home because I was the one who picked up the car on our departure day and she slept the ride home. We…

title: Recommended
review: Thank you for your candid feedback about your recent stay with us at the GALLERYone Fort Lauderdale – a DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  We are very sorry for the inconveniences that you experienced. We are just finishing up on our suite renovation and our headboards are one of the final touches to be completed.  Unfortunately, parking is limited in the area so we provide valet at a competitively set price.  Our focus on safety and security at GALLERYone is of top priority and as one of the managers involved in investigation into the regrettable loss of your fiancée’s handmade leather keychain, it is my understanding that we resolved this at the property level.  Please contact the hotel directly if you would like to further discuss this matter.  Ryann Love Front Office Manager

title: Great Hotel
review: Not satisfied with forced parking $25 per day - Internet charged $10 per day - no beach towels - continually ran out of cups / plates / cutlery - just found daily rates are kind of pricey and then everything else is charged - I'm surprised they don't charge for the air you breath while in the hotel

title: Nice Location
review: Loved the 1 bedroom suite, with kitchen, which is what attracted us to this hotel.  Walking distance to the Galleria Mall and grocery shops nearby.  The Beach is walking distance, but walking in the hot sun back to the hotel made me wish I had booked at a beachfront hotel.  Ft. Lauderdale beach appeared to be very family (kid) friendly and was not crowded.  Be aware that there is no self-parking, only valet parking for $25 (+tax) per night, which caused my hotel bill to be much higher than anticipated.

title: Can't be beat!
review: Thank you for taking time to write a review of the GALLERYone Fort Lauderdale, a DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I’m glad to hear that you enjoyed the one bedroom suite and the close shopping nearby.  The Beach is a short three block walk but the sun in July is HOT!  Be sure to have sunblock on.  We hope to have you again in the future!  Kimberly Miller Director of Sales & Marketing

title: Some inconveniences
review: Everything was so clean, the cookies were wonderful, the parking staff was so friendly, never had to wait on the car, it was  like they were sitting around just waiting on us to get there. Not in this area much but will used this chain again.  The two bedroom suite worked very well for our family situation.

title: Great hotel near the beach.  Expensive valet parking
review: Thank you so much for the high rating of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites Fort Lauderdale!  I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed the cleanliness of our hotel, the cookies, and our valet team.  We look forward to having you again on your next trip to Fort Lauderdale!   Kimberly Miller Director of Sales & Marketing

title: Very nice hotel
review: Great location near galleria shopping mall, and restaurants at Galleria.  The room was big, one bedroom suite, a complete kitchen.... But the back of the bed was all tear out.  At first it looked like someone has been killed on that bed.  Looking closer, the plastic of the bed rest was all tear out but look horrible!!! The toilet flush was so noisy that I even awake my husband last night. Tv remote did not work, apparently batteries were low, we called front desk they promised to fix it but we went dinner and control was the same way.... This morning i was trying to use the complimentar wifi at hotel lobby but neither i was able to connect.  At room wifi is expensive 9.99 per day.  There is a small bar at the lobby, yesterday we had a nice happy hour drinks, but after dinner we…

title: Fort LAUDERDALE Stay
review: Beautiful hotel on the water near the water taxi. Eat in house though, the restaraunt staff and cooks make this place the most enjoyable with their exemplary service, smile, and caring!  Make sure to note there is NO self parking, the hotel site shows there is, but it is not true.

title: Hotel experience
review: Thank you for your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Fort Lauderdale.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed our restaurant.  I will be sure to let the Food & Beverage team know of your nice comments.  We hope to see you the next time you’re in Fort Lauderdale.  Andreas A. Ioannou General Manager

title: Love the warm cookies, friendly staff and room, not so much the parking situation
review: Family function was centrally located and close to amenities such as restuarants, malls, shopping and beach. Valet attendents were the best!!! Speedy and efficient very welcoming to the hotel. night shift very pleasant and breathe of fresh air. Always fresh towels by the pool!

title: Great night stay before Celebrity Cruise
review: Thank you for your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton!  I am happy to hear that our team members made your stay more comfortable.  We hope to see you again soon!   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great Views, Location and Price
review: The warm cookies are a nice treat when you check in.  Our room was very nice and the staff was very friendly.  I was disappointed that upon arrival, (it was pouring rain), we could hardly get under cover to unload our car.  Also the parking is by valet only and for a hefty fee.

title: convenient location
review: This hotel is very convenient for shopping as well as beach going. It is affordable compared to the beach front hotels. Perect for a quick shopping break as it is right next door to a great mall and many restaurants.  Because of the layout of the rooms, it is comfortable and feels like a small apartment on the waterway.  All rooms do not look on to the waterway so be sure to book a room facing the water as, in my oponion, it gives a sense of relaxation.

title: Double Tree in Ft. Lauderdale
review: Thank you for the nice review of the GALLERYone.  I must agree that our location is perfect by being within walking distance of the mall, restaurants, grocery store, the water taxi, and the beach!  We are an all-suite hotel and offer one and two bedroom suites for all guests.  We hope to see you again soon!     John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great location and price
review: There was an excellent view over the intercoastal waterway from room.  the room was very clean and comfortable room. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and knew my name when I walked in after a long day. I had to pay extra for internet and parking.

title: mold in bathroom and Valet does not get it
review: Thank you for rating the GALLERYone a “5”!  The views are spectacular and we’re happy that you got to experience it.   We know it’s the little things, like remembering your name, that make your stay more comfortable.  We hope to see you again soon!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: enjoyable stay
review: What a great hotel. Large rooms and water taxi right off the pool area. I highly recommend this hotel!  Highly recommended for family as we had a suite with two bedrooms, kitcjhen and living area. Good value for the price.

title: Gallery Number One
review: This is one of my favorite properties in Ft. Lauderdale I come here at least once a year and never am disappointed. Everyone from the valet to the housekeepers are great! Lauren the supervisor checked us in and was superb :) I had a great view overlooking the inter coastal and I could see the ocean just over the horizon. I wish internet was free but this does not change my opinion about this property. Love it.

title: High-priced, but worth it
review: I love the title “Gallery Number One”!  Thank you so much for the great review and for being loyal to our hotel.  We always love welcoming back repeat guests.  I’ll be sure to mention your nice comments to our team members.  We look forward to having you back next year!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Poor representation for Hilton
review: Although the a/c could not raise the temperature and the telephone in the guest room did not work, the room, kitchen and bathroom were all very clean, the view was great and the service was great. Will recommend to anyone needing a stay in this area

title: Great location for start of cruise
review: Thank you for recommending us to anyone traveling to Fort Lauderdale.  We greatly appreciate your feedback and we're very happy you enjoyed your guest suite and the hotel service.  I do apologize that the air conditioning and telephone were not working properly.  I will address this with our maintenance staff.  Thanks again and we hope to see you soon!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Love the Gallery One Doubletree FLL
review: Stayed here for one night for a local night out and not too thrilled about the hotel itself, but the service was great. The valet that greeted me was super nice and the manager, Lauren, that ended up helping us after our issues was also very sincere and friendly. Other than that, had to switch rooms 2 times on account of a heat and cleanliness issue in one room and then a roach issue in another. They offered to come and spray and/or move us and we obviously chose to switch rooms. Didn't have any issues in the next room but ironically heard the next day that some people refer to the hotel as the Roach Motel. This hotel is on the water and the rooms have kitchens- bug maintenence should be the number one priority. I've stayed there twice before and never had an issue so not too…

title: The hotel is great,fantastic suite,great viewm and location.Very good Manager Ryann.
review: Great hotel,good location,view,great suites on the 3 different times I've stayed there. Very good manager Ryann Love. I had a check-in at 11 am,it was very nice of the Hotel, not to wait until 3pm, the three times I came to the hotel, they had always this very good welcome hospitality. I gonna come back next year for sure. Good restaurants with music beside the Hotel, the beach just 5 minutes walking. The swimming pool with sand just in front on the Canal, great place for any time.

title: Old and Tired
review: Thank you for the great review!!  I will be sure to pass on the nice comment about our Front Office Manager, Ryann Love.  We look forward to welcoming you back next year.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: What a location surprise!
review: The hotel is old and outdated.  Even the sign out front on the building was not working.  All furnishing had visible wear and tear.  Paint pealing and water damage in several areas.  Window sills were covered in black goo.  Not worth the price.

title: Another Great Stay at the Doubletree
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We have renovated all guest suites and the rooms now have all new furnishings including dining room chairs, headboards, sofa, lamps, artwork, carpet, etc.  We hope that you will visit us again so we may change your opinion of our hotel.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: What a view - what a location  !!!
review: To start off I wasn't sure that I would like staying at a hotel not on the beach. I was surprised when I got there, the outside is nothing like the inside. The suites are great, with so much room and a kitchen with everything even a dishwasher. The staff was great, from the front desk to the cleaning people, even the man who cleans the pool. Rooms were very clean, and there were 5 other rooms/suites being rented by family.  There was shopping, grocery store, places to eat and the beach in walking distance. The family loved the place, except for the parking fees. Views were also wonderful, especially if you get the water view instead of city view. My only other complaint was ice, there are 13 floors and ice only on the 4th floor. Since they are renovating I hope they add more…

title: Very good
review: Everything is good; good rooms, nice people, nice service. Poor housekeeping. Too heavy valet parking guys.(always changing all your preset car info !) An overall rating; excellent. You'll always have a bad point !

title: Great location...but dated hotel
review: Thank you so much for rating the GALLERYone a “5”.  I’m glad you had an excellent stay.  I do apologize that you encountered housekeeping problems and have shared your comments with our Executive Housekeeper.  We hope to see you again in the future!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Nickel and Dime
review: Stayed here for a week for a corporate event. The hotel is right on the Intercoastal and Galleria Mall with plenty of fine dining options. Walking distance to the beach, great views, service was ok, but hotel is quite dated, and room was dusty. Room was facing the E Sunrise ave so very noisy from cars passing by.

title: CAN'T BE BEAT!
review: Thank you for your review.  I’m glad you enjoyed our location and the views from your suite.  We try to be very vigilant in our housekeeping efforts, but there is no excuse on our behalf for anything less than a perfectly clean room.    John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Ft. Lauderdale family trip.
review: This place was spotless probably the most I have ever felt at home. The only problem is you have to pay extra (like a lot extra) for everything- parking (+$26 for overnight , wifi (+&10 a day), breakfast (+ at least $30).  But the pros do outweigh the cons.  The place is clean and easy waking distance to food, bars and the beach.

title: FAMILY GETAWAY
review: This was a great place to go for a two day lay over. My husband and I stay for two days on our way to a 50 year class reunion in Fort Pierce Fla. Everything at this Hotel was great and the staff made you feel at home and it is located next to a large Mall.

title: GO HERE
review: Thank you so much for the great rating of a “5”!  I’m very happy to hear that the team made you feel at home.  We hope you and your husband visit us again soon!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Location location location
review: This hotel is amazing!!!!  The staff was wonderful.  Free giant warm cookies everytime you pass the front desk, just ask.  Perfect location for the sea trolly and shopping...right by the mall!!!  Amazing!!!

title: Phenomenal Stay!
review: Thank you for the great review!  We hope to see you again in the future.  We will have a cookie waiting for you!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great location, helpfull staff, great view!
review: Stayed here for two nights pre cruise, 5 mins walk to beach, 2 mins to publix 2 mins to mall. Nice suite with river view and the big bonus a water taxi stop at the hotel. Only 2 dislikes, the young brazilian lady on reception who was doing me a favour by checking me in and the 39 dollars for 2,burgers 2 fries and 2 buds. Apart from that I would stay here again.

title: Used to be better
review: Extremely poor service with the valet parking, 6 years ago I stay here and the valet was terrible. Bugs in the bathroom, broken, damaged furniture.  Pool patio furniture is broken and falling apart. My wife and loved this place, we celebrated our 25 wedding anniversary 6 years ago , the place was great except for the vallet, my car was badly scratched.

title: A nice hotel in a pleasant location
review: I do apologize for the experience you had with our valet team for this is not what they are known for, we will address this with our valet manager.  Also, the rooms are currently undergoing a renovation and we have replaced all carpeting, dining chairs and we are finishing the installation of new sofa beds.   I do wish you will visit us again so that we can give you that same experience you had with us six years ago.   John Allan  Hotel Manager

title: Gallery One- A Galorific Surprise!!
review: Having stayed here before it seemed only right to come back again. What I love about this hotel is the location....Its great for shopping and eating. The thing I dislike now, is they have taken away selfpark options, so no matter what its going to cost you $25 to park the car with the Valet. The other draw back is the ridiculous charges for the WIFI access, they want to charge $9.95 per item used (THAT'S JUST GREEDY). On a different not, rooms are very spacious, especially if you get a corner suite, however the furniture is tired...Dining room chairs were ripped, wall paper peeling and it desperately needs a new lick of paint. Staff are always wonderful and the views of the waterway are lovely. Breakfast was nice but not as good as other Hilton buffets.

title: Phenomenal Hospitality
review: Thank you for your feedback and continued loyalty to our hotel.  All of our dining chairs have been replaced along with new carpeting and sofa beds.   Please note that we feature free wifi in all public areas of the hotel if you would like to take advantage of that.  Thanks again for your feedback and we hope to have you again soon!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Nice room size
review: Galley One is a gem in the rough. This property is a Hilton property, so you can earn, and use your points. I found great rate compared to other hotels in area. Was given an "upgrade" due to my Gold Hilton member status.   The room was really a one bedroom apartment!!! With water, and street views. The space in my one bedroom suite was enormous. I could see families staying here. The kitchen was like an apartment kitchen with stainless steel appliances and full size refrigerator.   The Suite came with a very small balcony. Flat screens in bedroom and separate living room. Hotel has a water taxis stop on property. After eating in the affordable and tasty restaurant, we hopped on the water taxi (after 4pm rates DROP). Nice size outdoor pool and the bar area had ample space for…

title: Lots of space
review: This hotel offers a suite instead of just a hotel room. Upon check in we were greeted with warm chocolate chip cookies!  Opening the door to the suite you feel as if you are stepping into a one bedroom apartment. There is a foyer and a kitchen, then a dinning area and a living room area with balcony. The bedroom had two queen beds and a seating area with a wide window. The bathroom was large with a big shower.  There were two plasma tvs.  All kitchen supplies were included to cook a meal.  There is a $25 valet parking charge nightly, but we had Florida resident's special price with complimentary parking. This is a great suite for a family to spread out, or anyone who likes to enjoy a hotel without feeling claustrophobic.

title: Not Typical of the Brand...I hope
review: Thank you for your great review of our hotel!  Our chocolate chip cookies are a way of us saying “welcome and thank you for staying with us”.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your one-bedroom suite and all the amenities in it.  I am also happy that you got to take advantage of the Florida Resident rate which includes valet parking and a cocktail per registered adult.  We hope to see you again in the future!   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Exceeded Expectations - Great Staff, Location, Quality, and Value
review: Beware of the $25 Valet fee with no self parking option. Rooms and furnishings worn or not installed properly. Not the value or the ambience that I was expecting. The rating on line was not justified. The Valet people were great however, very freindly and helpful.

title: Great Stay
review: I apologize for the experience you had which is not what we are known for.  Our rooms now feature new carpeting and dining chairs, and we have already started on the installation of new sofa beds – we’re certain you’ll love our newly renovated suites.  Unfortunately, we are limited in parking options therefore we offer valet for a competitively set price.  We hope that you may give us another chance to change your view of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Fort Lauderdale.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Can't get better than this!
review: We booked this hotel through Hotwire.  The staff were friendly, helpful, and accessible.  The location, access to nearby amenities, view, beds, pillows, ensuite, view, pool area, and price were great.  We had heard that the rooms were a little "tired".  Other than some VERY slight/minor signs, our room was well-appointed, clean, and comfortable.  The bathroom appeared to be new.  Our only advice to the hotel would be to include a few more basic items in the kitchenette (dish liquid and cloths, cork screw, and pot/pan).  I would highly recommend this hotel for groups, families, friends, couples travelling together.

title: Nice hotel
review: The Double Tree was a decent hotel to stay in for the price. We had a nice clean room, the pool was nice right on the intercoastal waterway, it had a bar with overpriced drinks until later in the day they were half price. The room we stayed in on the 12th floor overlooked the road. It was very noisy and we also heard what sounded like lots of moving of heavy objects above us. I don't know if they were doing renovations there or what. The buffet breakfast in the morning was VERY expensive for what was served and unless you have a room that comes with tickets to comp your breakfast don't eat here.  Expenses and noise aside the staff was SUPER friendly and helpful all around! We got to know Chris, the valet, quite well. He's knowledgeable, attentive, quick to serve, genuinely…

title: Perfect for a girls trip
review: Thank you for your review.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed your guest suite, our friendly and helpful staff, and the location of our hotel.  I will let Chris and the valet team know of the nice comments you mentioned.  We have happy hour every day from 3pm – 7pm where drinks are half-priced.  We have installed new carpet in all of our guest rooms, and apologize for the noise you may have experienced.  We hope to see you again soon.    John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Love this spot
review: Small kitchen with fridge and microwave, great inter coastal and ocean view- large bathroom for 3 girls to share.  We didn't need any more than that!!  We didn't eat anything at the hotel, but it was in walking distance to SO many great restaurants!  We even walked to Starbucks each morning and could also walk to the grocery and drug store.  We didn't need a car!

title: Beware of mandatory $25/day valet parking
review: Thank you for the nice review!  I’m happy to hear that our hotel was perfect for your “girls trip”.  The rooms are very specious and great for large and small groups.  Our location is one of the best in Fort Lauderdale simply because you have everything you need to enjoy a great vacation without the need for a car.  We hope to see you and your friends again soon!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Fix this!
review: Now every time I make a trip to Lauderdale I stay at Gallery One.  Traveling is hard enough, but with a nice suite you can at least be comfortable.  Full kitchen in every room with a grocery across the street makes life easier.  Very friendly staff...just a great location.

title: Wedding Trip Nightmare
review: Our suite room was fraught with problems - hot water valve would not shut off in bathroom, dishwasher leaked, room ceiling leaked water.  Wedding party had to suffer with no a/c during the after wedding dance.

title: Friendly welcome, great location, slightly tired rooms
review: Thank you for your candid feedback.  We are concerned that you ranked us a “2”.  I have shared your room concerns with our respective teams as it certainly does not reflect the level of amenities that we are known to offer.  We encountered an issue with our air conditioning and it was quickly addressed, but I apologize that it wasn’t resolved sooner.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Location great - hire new bartenders
review: The hotel was very easy to find on the main Sunrise Boulevard, next to a modern Mall with some great shops and restaurants which we used to have dinner on our first night. The valet parking was hassle free and the check in swift and friendly. The views from our room were lovely over the waterfront and even had our own balcony. The decor of the room was really the only small let down, it felt tired and dated and could do with modernisation. However, this didnt spoil our stay and we were made to feel very welcome, even at breakfast where the staff couldnt do enough for us. A short walk to the beachfront, but not right at the heart of all the city action in Fort Lauderdale, so as long as you have a car or are happy to walk this is a great option. Probably not as "boutique" as we…

title: Pre-cruise hotel
review: Thank you for your nice review.  I’m happy to hear your experiences with valet, check-in, and breakfast were pleasant.  We hope to have you visit us again in the future so you can enjoy our newly renovated suites!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Wow
review: I recently stayed at this hotel for an extended business trip.  The hotel is very nice, clean and the full kitchen in the room is a great addition.  It is close to a mall and grocery store and right on the water taxi route.  Unfortunately I was unable to take the taxi anywhere due to a huge music festival that had contracted with the service for the weekend.   The problem I had was with the service - the customer service from the bartenders was nonexistent.  They definitely had their favorites and if you hadn't been there all day you were overlooked.  And due to the walk through traffic from the festival, they were definitely concentrating on that crowd. The pool is small and was extremely warm on an 85 degree day (not refreshing at all)

title: Friendly staff but hotel needs updating
review: Stayed here in April 2013 for four nights. The hotel is conveniently situated on the intercoastal waterway on a water taxi stop and is a few blocks from the beach. There is also a large mall next door as well as a grocery and drug store across the street. While the staff was very friendly, the guest rooms are in need of updating. The suite we stayed in was very spacious, however the chairs in the dining area were all peeling and looked shabby and the couch was extremely worn down. The patio had some sad furniture and our patio also had several old cigarette butts scattered throughout. Aside from the space given in the room, I did not feel that it was worth the $169/night rate. Additionally, if you are bringing a car, they charge a mandatory $25/day valet fee (there is no lot…

title: The only place to stay in Ft. Lauderdale
review: Thank you for your feedback.  Guest room renovations are in full swing, with dining chairs already installed, we’re almost finished with new carpet and the sofa beds are being installed as we speak. I will mention the condition of the balcony to our housekeeping team.  Parking is very limited in the area so we offer valet parking at a competitive rate.  I’m glad you enjoyed the location, our lobby & patio area, and also the pool bar.  We hope that next time you’re in the area you will give us another chance to exceed your expectations of our hotel.    John Allan Hotel Manager

title: leaking ceiling=daughter falling down
review: Every time I stay at Gallery One Hotel in Ft. Lauderdale there is always something that catches my attention. The staff are always friendly, and the valet attendants make me feel like a VIP. They are so courteous and I never have to wait for my car as a call from my room is all that is required. Service like this is hard to find.   The Hotel is having a make over and the new room furnishings are going to make Gallery One the Number One Hotel in Ft. Lauderdale.  I am already looking forward to my next stay at this excellently situated hotel. Everything is within a few minutes walk, beaches, restaurants, mall, shops - even Publix. I can think of no better location in Ft. Lauderdale.  It was good to see that the excellent services of Ryann Love have been recognised with his…

title: GREAT HOTEL WILL RETURN
review: Wow!  I couldn’t help but smile when I read your review.  Thank you so much for rating the GALLERYone a “5”!  Thank you for recognizing our valet attendants and Ryann Love.  I will share all of your wonderful comments with our team.  We look forward to seeing you again.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: I didn't think it was worth the money they were asking
review: I arrived on a  Friday, with my confirmation #, only to be told my room was cancelled. I never cancelled the room but was told there was none available. Checked back in Saturday night. After walking to my water view  room, my daughter went into the bathroom and screamed. My 7 year old daughter was petrified. After calming her down I looked up to see the sprinkler system leaking. After telling the front desk,there was no incident report filed, and they moved my family to a new room. This room had no water view. It seems to me that no one was real concerned for my daughter. I will not be back.

title: Loved it
review: We stayed 4 nights per-cruise it was great  : shopping close by a short walk to the beach  Our suite was beautiful ,really very friendly staff   Great breakfast : best oatmeal ever , fruit ,smoked salmon fruit etc all very high quality produce  I would definitely stay here again if we cruise from Fort Lauderdale

title: nice stay
review: Thank you for the great review!  We’re happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at the GALLERYone.  We definitely look forward to having you back.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Needs updating
review: Due to the concert going on the weekend we needed to be in Ft Lauderdale, we had concerns on where to stay, when we were able to secure this hotel we were greatly pleased.  It was away from all the activity of the concert, but close to shopping and restaurants.  Reading previous reviews, I was quite frankly concerned about conditions of these rooms, and getting a room facing the road with the drawbridge.  Arriving early morning, we were assigned a ready room on the, uh-- third floor, of course facing the road and the drawbridge.  It was early and only staying one night, I wear earplugs anyway, bit the bullet.  I had called the property a few weeks earlier requesting a room on a higher floor in a nice quiet area, but I guess I had to adjust due to the early hour of our arrival. …

title: Wonder event services for a group stay.
review: Thank you for your review.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed your stay.   Our delicious chocolate chip cookie is our signature trademark.  VIP Limo is an excellent car service that we like to offer to our guests, I am glad you agree. We look forward to welcoming you back!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Three Years in a Row
review: Furnishing need some help.  Great location.  Desk staff friendly.  The guys parking cars, arranging transportation...jerks.  We stay here because of proximity to water taxis...which gets more and more expensive everytime we're here.  (Our 4th stay here.)  Over the 4 or 5 years we've come and stayed here the quality and value have declined.

title: Glad that we booked it
review: This was a great pre- cruise hotel stay. Everyone that we encountered was nice and professional. We arrived at the hotel around at 10:00 am, there were Saturday cruisers checking out and they honored our request for an early check in. They got one room ready for us in about 30 mins as we  went to the store for a few cruise items. The 6 of us hung out in one room until they called us about 15 mins later when the second room down the hall was ready. We were upgraded to sea view rooms on the 14th floor. We had a wonderful view of the inter-coastal and the Atlantic ocean. We could also see the cruise ships in Port Everglades. The rooms were clean with modern furnishings, and yes, I noticed the worn spots on the chairs and headboard. It wasn't a deal breaker. I was told that they…

title: Okay Hotel.
review: Thanks for staying here at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Fort Lauderdale and taking the time to write a review.  We’re glad you had a taste of our warm, caring service.  It sounds like the valet service exceeded your expectations and I’ll be sure to pass it on to the valet team.  We truly look forward to welcoming you back next year.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Decent Hotel in a Great Location
review: My husband, young son and I stayed at this hotel for five nights in early April.  Although the hotel isn't located on the beach, the beach is within walking distance as are many other stores / restaurants etc. The $25/day mandatory valet fee is a complete cash grab and completely inconvenient.   Our room was a good size. Kitchen wasn't well stocked.  I, at the very least, expected a complete set of everything (4 plates, 4 bowls, 4 forks, 4 spoons etc.) but that wasn't so.  Also, at any other suites hotel we have stayed at we have always been provided with dish detergent, sponge / dish cloth etc.  There were none to be seen here.   Pool was okay.  Minimal chairs that were always taken.  No clean pool towels to be seen for a couple of hours at a time on several days.   Furniture…

title: Gallery One Ft. Lauderdale
review: Thank you for your candid feedback.  We do apologize for the issues you experienced.  I will address your concerns about the kitchen and bath items to our housekeeping team.  Our guest room renovation will be completed this summer and the headboards and furniture are among those items that will be replaced in the suite.  We’re happy to hear you enjoyed the location of our hotel.  We look forward to welcoming you back to share all that we have done.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great hotel for cruise vacations
review: My wife and I stayed here for one night.  The hotel is located a few steps away from Galleria Mall, and close to other stores and businesses, such as CVS, Wells Fargo, etc.  This hotel is also a short walk to the Boardwalk.  The Water Taxi also stops here to pick-up and drop off passengers.  The hotel has a mandatory valet of $25.  They also don't have free shuttle service.  Breakfast buffet will cost you $21 per person.  The room that we were put in was on the 11th floor.  The room furniture (i.e., headboard, chair) were damaged and not in good condition, and the coffee maker was also broken/not working.  Staff were okay, but not consistent.  I called to ask for assistance about transfer from airport to the hotel and the person who answered was not helpful at all.  The only…

title: Hotel review
review: Excellent hotel, with ideal location right on the Intra-Coastal waterway. Staff was extremely helpful, courteous and professional. Only complaint is that they charge $25 per night for guest parking. I thought that was excessive, especially for guests who are already paying quite a bit to stay at the hotel.

title: Excellent
review: Thank you for rating the GALLERYone DoubleTree Fort Lauderdale a “5”!  I’m happy to hear that our staff was helpful, courteous and professional!  Being so close to the Atlantic Ocean, parking is very limited with all of the hotels in the immediate area so  we make sure our rate is competitively priced.  We hope to have you again in the future!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Happy with my stay
review: Extremely clean Nicely Decorated Good Food Very Friendly Service Excellent Price~ Very reasonable Everyone was helpful and more than willing to help with a smile on their face.   Great location, with a beautiful view.   Accessible to water taxi and regular taxi

title: Nice everyday kind of place to stay!
review: Thank you for your review and rating us a “5”!  I’m happy to hear that our service and our great amenities made your stay excellent!  We hope to see you again soon.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: So much potential
review: furnishings dated but the room was well appointed.  The beds were unbelievably comfortable and welcomed on arrival. I can't say enough about the staff.  They were very helpful and pleasant from the front desk to the valets.

title: Nice Stay for business
review: I stayed April 7-11 while on a business trip.  The location is nice and close to shopping and the beach.  The suites are very nice and well appointed with small kitchen, living and separate bedroom / bath.  The balcony with the city view was very large.  The room and hotel were clean and up to date.   The valet drivers were very curteous and helpful with dining recommendations on the beach.    The water taxi stop right at the hotel is very convenient and taking the water taxi is recommended for sight seeing and entertainment.

title: Had a wonderful stay!
review: Thank you for your rating of a “5” for the GALLERYone DoubleTree Fort Lauderdale!  We are thrilled that you enjoyed the location, guest suites, valet, and water taxi.  Please visit us again soon as it would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: This place is great, although showing signs of aging...
review: Had some extra time and a couple of free airline tickets so my wife and I decided to go to the beach for the weekend.  Have traveled through Ft. Lauderdale several times, but never really spent any time here.  Decided on the Doubletree, because of its location.  We were extremely pleased on check-in with our 1 bedroom suite, very spacious and clean. We had a fantastic view off of the 9th floor. The restaurant was very good each morning for breakfast.  Found the exercise suite to be very well stocked and had a lot of the equipment that I usually use for my workouts.  Found the staff to be extremely helpful and accommodating.  Location was very convenient to the beach and restaurants.   I did find the daily valet parking fee of $25.00/day to be a little steep, and there are signs…

title: WONDERFUL HOTEL
review: Thank you for your review!  We’re so happy you decided to visit our wonderful city and hotel.  Your many kind comments about our service and hotel are greatly appreciated and we’re so glad you enjoyed the view from your room.  I will mention your comments to our team members.  We look forward to seeing you in the future!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great stay
review: This hotel has a great location, very friendly staff, clean, comfortable suites, a laundry room, a bar and restaurant. but the leather furniture is aging. and showing a "patina", as is the pool area. I love that the Water Taxi stopped here. There is a daily valet parking fee of $25 plus tax, that is not mentioned on travel sites. It is near everything you could possibly need or want. We would definitely stay here again!

title: A Comfortable, Pleasant Week
review: Our family of five spent an entire week over spring break here.  We chose this hotel because it had an available 2 BR 2 Bath suite, with a pull-out sofa.  Finding a place to accommodate a family of 5, especially one with big teenage boys, is difficult.  We weren't sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised and were comfortable despite our togetherness for the entire week.  It is centrally located, within walking distance of shops, Starbucks, a grocery store, and the beach.  Watch your wallet though, there's a Nieman Marcus a stone's throw away - I did some damage in their handbags department.  Our unit had a small kitchen, so we stocked up on some basics the first day from the grocery store.  The kitchenette was convenient, but cookware was very limited.  I had to…

title: An absolute dump
review: What a nice review of your experience at our hotel.  I’m happy to hear that our team members made your stay enjoyable and comfortable.  I will be sure to share your comments to Margaret, the maintenance staff, valet, housekeeping, and the front desk.  This month is one of the best times to see manatees in Florida and I’m glad you saw a few right in our backyard!  We do offer complimentary internet in all public areas of the hotel.  Parking is very limited in the area so we make sure our valet service is at a competitive rate.  Our valet attendants truly appreciate your generosity.  Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you in the future!     John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great location!
review: The hotel has a serious mold problem and the rooms are dated.  Mandatory $25 valet parking fee for parking and the hotel is right next to a major highway so all you hear is the traffic all night.  One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in.

title: Work to be done
review: Thank you for your feedback.  The overwhelming majority of our guests share a different viewpoint but we value everyone’s opinion.  Our goal is to ultimately ensure a comfortable stay despite any challenges that may arise.  I have contacted you through your Tripadvisor account to discuss your experience further.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: "EVERYTHING YOU WANT IN WALKING DISTANCE"
review: We have stayed here every spring for the last five years.  We really love the location and staff is friendly and helpful.  We travel as a five member family and the two-bedroom rooms are great!  We always have end room so we can sit on balcony and view the innercoastal (kids love watching bridge go up and down) and ocean view.  We enjoyed our stays here so much we are actually looking into purchasing a condo in the hotel!  Teenagers love the mall next door and being with in walking distance of pretty much everything is a plus.    Looking forward to staying again soon!

title: could use a little updating
review: We  stayed here for one night before going on a cruise, and then one night at the end of the cruise.  The first night we had a beautiful view room of the intracoastal and out to the ocean.  We had a good dinner in the restaurant when we arrived, and breakfast outside in the morning.  On our return visit we were given a room where all the dining room chairs had the finish peeling off of them and at the side over the building.  The pool was great and the outside areas were wonderful.  It is one block from a HUGE shopping center, and the pick up point for the water taxi. It was so easy to grab a cab and go to the cruise ship terminal.  Enjoyed the stay.  Great location!

title: Wonderful location and very family friendly hotel!
review: Thank you for your review.  I’m happy to hear you enjoyed our restaurant, pool, location, and guest rooms.  We hope to see you again in the future!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Short but excellent
review: Let me start by saying this hotel is GREAT and we will return next year!!! My entire family was pleased and that isn't easy to do! My only complaints are 1- the valet parking fee of $25 is a little over priced for the area. Although the service was timely and great, I still think it could be cheaper for that area. I expect to pay this in Miami on the beachfront. 2- the maids kept taking our towels and not replacing them with enough towels for the whole family. Then we had to keep calling for more towels. Other than these two minor issues, this place is a great place to stay. Location is the best. Beach is a quick walk over the bridge to the right and the mall, grocery store, and restaurants are out the door and to the left! You don't have to drive for much of anything. The water…

title: Don't stay here
review: Thank you for review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree by Hilton Fort Lauderdale!  I’m so happy to hear that your entire family was happy here with us. Our valet is competitively priced and I will address your concerns with the towels to our housekeeping team.  Our location is perfect with the beach, shopping, dining, and the water taxi all within walking distance.  Thank you for your recommendation and we hope to see you again soon.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great place to stay
review: Our stay was only 2 days ( 1 prior to cruise and 1 after ) however,we enjoyed a great dinner at the restaurant and great service from the front desk and valet staff. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly to others.

title: Great for a Family Get A Way
review: My wife, teenage daughter and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for a quick get a way.   The spacious suite offered enough room for all of us to be comfortable and the view of the intercoastal waterway from our balcony was beautiful.  We found the room very clean, the service attentive and the location perfectly situated between the beach and shopping.  We also enjoyed the pool and comfortable outdoor seating along the water way.

title: Pre Cruise Stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your stay with us!  I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed our location and spacious suites along with all the amenities the hotel has to offer.  Let us know when you would like to return.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Pre Cruise stay
review: We chose this hotel because its a suite hotel.  We have two teens so we need a fold out couch.   The room was nice and clean.  We had a partial view of the water way.  This hotel is in a great location.   There's nice restaurants a mall grocery stores and drug stores all within walking distance.  I only have one complaint.   Both  times I stayed at this hotel there was a long wait for a taxi.   The first time was really bad.   This time we still had to wait but not quite as long.  Im not sure why getting a taxi at this hotel takes so long.

title: Old & tired rooms. Dirty carpet
review: Thank you for your candid feedback.  I’m happy that your family enjoyed the comfort of our spacious suites.  The taxi service is licensed by the City of Fort Lauderdale and it can be difficult to find an available cab on busy cruise port days, but we would be happy to assist in arranging transportation with our preferred shuttle service, who happens to be one of the best in the area, to take you where you need to go.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Excellent experience times two
review: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 2013.  I can't say enough.  We used my Hilton Honors points and assumed that we would have a lower rated room.  Not so.  We were on the 11th floor with views of the city and the Intercostal.  Our room had a full kitchen, large bedroom, living room, and balcony.  The front desk staff were very personable and were quick to accommodate.  When I approached the cleaning lady for towels, she immediately knew my room # without even seeing me exit my room.  The outside has a wonderful area to sit and relax, even has a gas powered fire pit table with high chairs.  The maintenance man was very helpful when we asked to replace the propane tank.  He went out of his way to immediately get us a new tank.   There is a nice pool, hot…

title: Good Location, Good Room, Good Cookie
review: Unique property because it consists of condos that are managed under the DoubleTree banner. Like most of the units, we had a 2 room suite (bedroom with 2 queen beds; living room). Also had a small kitchen area. We used Hilton Points. If I paid $200/nt, I may be more critical. This was a 1 night pre-cruise stay. We had a rental car.   Here are the reasons I did not give it an excellent (you decide if this matters to you; we still enjoyed our stay): 1. Carpet was in ok shape, but had some areas that had small stains and wear marks. 2. Shower head's gasket leaked. 3. Corrider leading to unit had signs of wear on baseboard trim and we saw some entry door trim that needed repair.  Reasons you should stay here: 1. Very friendly staff from valet parking to reception and the morning…

title: A nice stay at this hotel.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  You hit all aspects of why our hotel is the place to stay in Fort Lauderdale.  I will be sure to notify the staff of the friendly service they provided you.  Our suites are quite spacious allowing all guests to be comfortable.  We hope to see you again in the near future!   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Vue on the Water restaurant at Gallery One
review: Firstly, the Hotel is rather uniquely located along the west side of the intracoastal which means if you get a high enough room (floor 10 and above with waterviews) then you'll have a great view of not only the intracoastal but also the ocean.   As many have also mentioned its very conveniently situated next to Galleria but also only a short walk over the bridge to the beach.  In the beach direction there a few good and reasonably priced restaurants (a Mexican and an Italian?).  Also, a few laid back cheaper bars where you can kick back and have a few drinks without breaking the bank.   In the other direction is Galleria where you can pay a fortune for a meal or eat on a tight budget.  Theres a mini Starbucks in the lobby and a full blown Starbucks across the street where you…

title: Nice rooms - friendly service.
review: Thank you for your review.  I’m sure many will find this helpful.  As you have mentioned our location is unique and convenient because the hotel is within walking distance of restaurants, shops, bars, water taxi, and the beach.  Thanks for choosing the GALLERYone DoubleTree Fort Lauderdale and we look forward to welcoming you back next time you’re in town!   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Valet only, but you won't need your car.
review: Stopped in for a break while taking a water taxi ride and had THE BEST EVER key lime pie.  Huge slice with strawberries and whipped cream garnish.  What more can I say--you have to try it!!    We had super service from Daniel, who actually went to seek out the pie as it wasn't even a standard menu item. Daniel  told us he was interning while studying hotel management at college; he has a bright future ahead and we hope that the hotel knows what gem they have in him.  Anyway, back to memories of that pie . . . . . .

title: Worst hotel we've ever stayed in
review: My girlfriend and I stayed here a for 2 days after a week long cruise and wanted a few days more to relax before we headed back to the cold north east. The only thing that was nice about this hotel was leaving. The first thing we noticed was the sticky carpet....not nice but not something to cry over, we can just wear our shoes. Then we started to notice just how horrendous this room was. The furniture was peeling and falling apart and there was dust/dirt everywhere. The shower over flowed as soon as you turned it on and the closet handle fell off as soon as I touched it. I thought Ashton kutcher was going to jump out of the bathroom and totally punk us. Fortunately/Unfortunately we used Hotwire to get the hotel so we were told we didn't have any recourse to get any money back.…

title: Bad Experience
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We are very concerned of your ranking of a “1”.  We have discussed this with our staff and will make every effort to be sure our rooms meet the highest housekeeping standards.  We’ll address the issues with the shower and closet handle to our maintenance team as well.  I have reached out to you through your Trip Advisor account and would like the opportunity to discuss your experience about your stay with us.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Tired Rooms
review: Wonderful location but not worth the money. Toilet leaked, shower leaked, coffee pot was broken, no parking and a $25 per day valet, and poor service staff. Concierge thought Ft Worth, Texas was on the West Coast (that should have been a sign of things to come).

title: Too much road noise!
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We are obviously concerned that you ranked us a “2”.  Being so close to the Atlantic Ocean, parking is very limited with all of the hotels in the immediate area so we make sure our prices remain competitive.  I have also shared your housekeeping and engineering concerns with our respective teams as it certainly does not reflect the level of service and amenities that we are known to deliver.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Very bad - Hilton:(
review: We only spent the one night here after a cruise.  The rooms are huge, but old and tired.  There was party in the next door apartment that went onto the early hours. On the positive side it is rigth next to a water-taxi which is great.

title: You'll Tire of the Tired Rooms
review: This hotel has all the makings of being GREAT hotel!   When you first arrive you're great by the very hard working valet staff that greet you with enthusiasm but lower their voice a little when they mention the $25 per day valet fee. Something to consider if you plan on renting a car. I'm not sure if that is the going rate in the area but I think it's high nonetheless.  The lobby is large and very open and airy and again the staff are warm and friendly. The restaurant works just fine especially if you'd like to have breakfast inside or out. I didn't have lunch or dinner there.  The overall appearance of the hotel is clean and well maintained and so far, you're quite impressed. But this hotel is not without it's problems.  I'm not sure of the age of this hotel or when a…

title: Great location, problem with bill!
review: Thank you for your feedback about your recent stay with us.  With parking being very limited  in the area, we make sure our  prices remain competitive if not lower than the area hotels.  Our location is ideal as there is so much to do and all right at your fingertips. Most importantly, we hope that if you do visit Fort Lauderdale again, that you give us the opportunity to show off our suite improvements and allow us to deliver a memorable experience.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Very nice stay!
review: The hotel is at a great location next to the mall, Colony Grill, PF changs. Restaurant in hotel has poor service and below average food. Two weeks I settle the bill, I had a charge in my cc of 100 for a deposit. I had to make several call to the hotel to clarify the problem.

title: Couldn't ask for anything more
review: We’re sorry our restaurant didn’t meet your expectations, our guest reviews give us valuable information which we have shared with our team.  We also apologize for the inconvenience of the billing and we hope that it was settled to your satisfaction.  Thank you again for your feedback.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: loved the location
review: We stayed at the double tree Gallery in February over mid-winter break it was a great  stay. The breakfast was Phenominal and the hotel also had a Starbucks inside. The only thing I did not like was how cold the lobby was.

title: Beautiful view
review: I stayed just one night 3-4March2013 at Gallery One Fort Lauderdale and I do wish I had been able to stay longer (+that the weather had been nicer). We had booked a cityview one bedroom apartment/suite but were upgraded to a very nice suite with views from all windows towards canal. The suite/apartment was good 4star standard, nice and clean and with a small Ok equipped kitchen. The hotel has a pool, a whirlpool & a created "minibeach", hotelarea very pleasing overall. We had a continental breakfast in the Café/restaurant before we left , nothing to complain about there. The location is very good, Galleria Mall nearby, a Publix + some nice restaurants in walking distance. The beach is maybe 600-800 meters away. Overall I did really like it and would like to stay here if/when I…

title: Really liked this hotel - wouldn't hesitate to book here again
review: Thank you very much for your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Fort Lauderdale.  I am sure many will benefit from your positive experience.  It was our pleasure to have been able to provide you with a high level of service and great location to help make your stay special.  We hope to see you soon!     John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great way to ring in the new year!
review: We booked this hotel via Hotwire for a 3-night stay pre-cruise. The price was good (for an unseen hotel) and it was pretty obvious by the description which hotel we would get and since the reviews looked good we went ahead and hoped we'd get this one. Sure enough we did and I have to say the hotel exceeded expectations.  We really like the suite hotel concept. We were upgraded on arrival to a one bed suite with a separate dining/kitchen area with a large sofa and huge TV and a big balcony (facing the highway but still nice enough to sit out on). The patio windows are not double glazed so rooms facing the highway could be noisy, however after a transatlantic flight and since we always travel with earplugs, this didn't bother us. The kitchen area is pretty well equipped with…

title: Oh thank Heaven for this slice of heaven...
review: Thank you very much for your review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Fort Lauderdale.  Whether it is before or after your cruise this is a great place to relax and unwind.  We are excited that you enjoyed your stay and the convenience of our location in relation to the Galleria Mall, Publix and the beach.  We’re happy you were able to take advantage of the shuttle service to Port Everglades for $8 per person.  When you visit us again please enjoy the complimentary wifi offered in all public areas of the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: A great location with great service
review: Stayed for a week, using HHonors points.  Quiet, clean, short walk to the beach, and close to Miami (if you have a car).  Had a great time.  Not the most luxurious, but well maintained.  Pool was small, but didn't need it with the beach close by.  Breakfast buffet was decent.

title: Excellent suite hotel
review: Nice and spacious rooms, close to shopping, beach and short driving distance of all great things in Miami.   Upon arrival after a four hour drive luggage was quickly ofloaded by the valet parking team and check-in was quick and efficient.   Clean Bathroom, good breakfast buffet.   Kids loved the place!!!

title: March 2013
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the helpfulness of our team.  They do a wonderful job in making sure that all of our guests get a chance to experience all the wonderful things Fort Lauderdale has to offer!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: A very special branch of Doubletree
review: Great stay - couldn't have been better. Restaurant, Pool, Bar, In room amenities were top quality. The view of the intracoastal and the ocean from my room was a real treat. I will definitely be back to this hotel when I am back in south florida.

title: Rich & Jen GALLERYone Fort Lauderdale
review: Thank you for such a nice review and we’re glad to hear that you will be back to visit us!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great location
review: Arrived at the hotel off  cruise  At about 8.30 am went to checkin & although we had no member status lady Said get some breakfast & we shall have  A room as quick as possible . Had a lovely  Breakfast overlooking the intercoastal waterway . Staff lovely   Lady came over just as we'd finished Breakfast to say room ready for us gave my passport in & she said oh it's  Your birthday so her & colleague sang Happy birthday . we were shown to the Most fabulous suite living room kitchen Area balcony  & massive bathroom  & bedroom . we went out for the day when we returned  In the evening staff had left a birthdaycard & a plate of lovely mini cakes the hotel is spotless & all the staff were friendly & very helpful would have no Hesitation  about staying here again

title: Not a hotel more upscale Motel-so for the money go elsewhere
review: The "hotel" was clean enough.... but some things stuck out.... the bathroom only had 2 towels for a family of 5 in a suite... wifi cost $15 and was spotty.... business center... internet was spotty and no paper in printer, no pens, no nothing.... We stayed here one night before our cruise...For the cash we shelled out I would have spent the extra $50 and stayed at the Ritz.  Breakfast buffet they were not prepared for a Sunday morning for all the guests.... (Think cream cheese no bagels, bagels come out and no cream cheese)   I would call it an upscale motel... even the shampoo in the bathroom did not wash two heads... they offered the smallest shampoo bottles... each room has a kitchenette and our "ocean view" was across a highway...  Pool was tiny and they do have a…

title: Excellent Location for exploring the area
review: Thank you for your candid feedback. We are obviously concerned of your ranking of a “3”.  In order for us to deliver the exceptional guest experience we are known for, it is so imperative that our guests convey their concerns prior to departure to allow us the opportunity to correct any deficiencies and exceed your expectations.  I have reached out to you through your Trip Advisor account and would like the opportunity to discuss your experience about your stay with us.     John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Would defiantly recommend this hotel 5 stars all the way room cleanliness, location food, staff excellent
review: My extended Family of 7 spent 3 nights at the Gallery ONE in Feb using it as a base to explore the area.   The Hotel is perfectly placed on Sunrise Boulevard – a main route from the Turnpike, stop Nº 9 on the wonderful water-taxi, and two blocks from the beach.   The room with two queen beds in separate bedroom area was spacious and spotlessly clean with well appointed shower room and kitchen dining area. The staff were very friendly, very helpful and very courteous with excellent local knowledge.  We enjoyed eating at the Mexican Cantina and Franco and Vinnie’s Italian restaurants just over the drawbridge outside, which were recommended by the staff.  Also a great tip by the Parking Valet chap to park in the 7th street parking garage in SoBe Miami which cost us $7 all day, some…

title: Great pre cruise stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review and with such high ratings!  GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton  does have it all. Oversized suites,  Water taxi, Shopping, Dining and Outstanding guest service is what our guests can expect.  To address your comment on our valet parking, our price is indicated on all reservation confirmations so I do apologize that this was a surprise to you.  Thank you for staying with us.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Wow!
review: My husband and I stayed here before our cruise wanted to book after as well but hotel was full .I now see why!! They offer a ride to the port for eight dollars a person we took a cab it cost us 36.00 We didn't know about that service till we were out front waiting for our cab .

title: Great Location
review: We stayed here one night after our cruise.  It was about a 10 minute cab ride from cruise port.  The location is fantastic.  The views from our room were great.  We could even see the cruise ships leaving port.  The walk to the beach was only five minutes or so and the beach was beautiful.  There are plenty of places to walk to for food etc and a mall next door so no need for a car.  The hotel quickly got us a car service to the airport the next day that would accommodate the five of us and our luggage.  The staff at this hotel were all so kind and helpful.  We arrived at 10:00 am after our cruise and were told (without us asking or expecting) that they would put a rush on getting us our room.  They also held all our luggage for us.  We were in our suite by 11:30am, which was a…

title: IGOR WE MISS YOU
review: Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  Our location has it all;  Water Taxi, Shopping,   Numerous dining options, and close to the beach.   Your review has touched upon everything that makes our hotel an exceptional one.  I do hope that if you find yourself back in Fort Lauderdale, that you will be allow us to share with you all the suite improvements with regards to paint, carpet and furniture that we are in the process of completing.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Needs a Paint, Carpet and Soft Goods Renovation - Great Location
review: We stay 3 times at Gallery One and always enjoy our stay. This last time was a very sad stay because we found out that Igor is not there yet That was the big lost for the hotel. I ask for him and find out that he quit because he get in fight with the Food and Beverage manager that I also think that there is something wrong with her. You lost your number 1 employee ever. He always used to make our stay great with his sense of humor and his gorgeous  smile.

title: Good Family Suite Hotel
review: As stated in an email that I sent you this morning prior to your Trip Advisor posting, thanks for your note and feedback regarding Igor.    My apologies that one of our Food and Beverage Managers fell short of your expectations; it is certainly feedback that I am not accustomed to receiving so I’ll use it constructively to enhance our service delivery in the restaurant.    Perhaps on your next visit you will allow one of our many fabulous food and beverage team members to provide the exceptional service we are known for.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Gem in Ft. Lauderdale!
review: The Doubletree hotels in Fort Lauderdale both had some questionable review.  Being a meeting planner I actually called the Doubletree Bahia Mar because the poor reviews did not appear match the photo quality.  Not phone call to this day was returned from the sales office.  So I decided on the Gallery One.  Let start with the positives; walking distance to shopping, restaurants, beach and nightlife.  The hotel is on the inland waterway and is an all suite property like a one bedroom apartment.   I was using Hilton Honors points for my stay and after reading the reviews I decided to spend extra points to get a water view room because I saw some reviews mentioning the noise from the city view side and the drawbridge.  My reservation request stated a quite room far from elevator,…

title: Friendly staff but very disappointing experience.
review: The hotel is well located and has very friendly staff.  Unfortunately, the staff can't compensate for our disappointing experience.  First we were awakened at 3:00 AM by a humming smoke alarm with only few hours to sleep before we had to leave for our hotel pickup far a pre-planned event.  To add insult to injury, the hotel never collected the breakfast order form we had left on our door the night before. So we never received the breakfast we ordered and had no time to stay for breakfast at the restaurant.  The restaurant staff did offer us a free breakfast, but, because of the scheduled hotel pickup, we had no time to eat what we should have eaten and instead had to wolf down some cereal and high-calorie muffins.

title: Great Stay at Gallery One
review: Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay with us. I do apologize for the shortcomings you had experienced with the smoke alarm and our in suite dining. Your comments have been shared with both our culinary and engineering team as this is certainly not our standard. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope that you will give us another opportunity to make your stay a memorable one.  Joh Allan Hotel Manager

title: Love this hotel!
review: We stayed at this hotel the night before a cruise.  it's an excellent location - 1 block from the Galleria Mall, 2 blocks from a Publix, and 6 blocks from the beach.  Being right on the intracoastal waterway, the hotel gets you in the South Florida mood very quickly.  The rooms are really spacious and well-done.  Bathrooms were very nice with large walk-in showers and plenty of natural stone.  The service was outstanding!  Christopher, the night manager was present in the lobby all the time.  Everyone was extremely friendly, from the front desk to the dining room, to the parking staff.  Great choice for a visit to Ft. Lauderdale.

title: Great Fort Lauderdale location
review: I cannot thank you enough for your wonderful review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  You truly have covered everything that I believe makes our hotel and exceptional one.  I am sure your review will have a positive impact on our future guests that use Trip Advisor as their benchmark as to where they choose to stay.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Perfect Stay- Thank you Aasha!
review: Gallery One is our favorite place to stay in Ft. Lauderdale.  Perfect location, an easy, short walk to many restaurants, mall and the water taxi is right outside, love the water taxi. We stayed here during the boat parade a couple of years ago, loved it.  The rooms are nice and comfy and just a short taxi ride the next morning to the port!  We have stayed here many times and don't have any complaints.

title: Perfect pre cruise stay
review: We stayed here the night of Feb 8 before boarding a cruise ship the next day.
