We paid extra for a waterview room with balcony due to an early flight in we thought it best to spend a little extra and enjoy the view and room. Water taxi is an excellent asset here grab a map and take the tour it stops in many places to keep you entertained also walk over the bridge to the beach and take a right there are bars and shops not too far away . The staff is very helpful and the grounds with the pool and a sandy area right along the water add a nice touch. Once piece of advice if going on a cruise book a taxi or van the day before there is a massive clear out at all Motels aroun11:00 A.M. to get to the cruise port. Thanks Gallery one & see you next year

title: Gallery One has it all!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review of the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton. I am pleased to hear that our services and amenities may your stay an exceptional one. The water taxi is an excellent way to see why Fort Lauderdale is known as the “Venice of the America’s”  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Loved our stay
review: I would love to give this Hotel 5 points, but we had a couple things about our stay that took away from the overall experience.  First, let me say the location is excellent.  It's right on the Water Taxi line, so it made it VERY convenient.  The pool is wonderful, and the little sandy beach area was fun.  Now, the room, while a very nice suite, was located on the side where we heard horrible traffic noise until all hours of the morning, made it hard to enjoy the room.  Then, we had a bad experience at the restaurant.  I won't go into details because the Restaurant Manager was very apologetic, and made it right.  I am hoping the issues we had will not happen again. However.. this I will tell.... They don't have a blender at any of their bars!  That's right.. no pina colada, not…

title: Noisy, needs cosmetic repairs and painting
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your stay with us at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton. Our location is one of the best in Fort Lauderdale simply because you have everything you need to enjoy a great vacation. I am glad to hear that our Restaurant Manager was able to resolve your challenge quickly and efficiently.    John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great Location! Doubletree Gallery One is in a prime location for shopping, sightseeing, great restaurants & the beach.
review: This hotel seems to be former apartments converted to a condo hotel, taking advantage of a great location.  The renovation was well done and stylish, the condos are spacious with quality furnishings,  and it is a very pleasant, welcoming place to stay.  There's a cozy, family friendly  vibe to the place.  Kids, seniors, all ages.  The outdoor pool is nothing fancy, but it was kept warm enough to use very comfortably in a cool January.  The pool, the indoor restaurant and the outdoor cafe/bar all front the intercoastal waterway viewing lots of boats and the water taxi stop.  Inside the lobby, there's also a bar and a coffee stand.  It's a welcome thing to have all these services open in the hotel, considering it is not a huge complex.  It is true the condo furnishings and…

title: So So
review: Double Tree in Ft Launderdale was fair.  The staff was helpful.  However, our room needed some cosmetic maintenance.  The headboard of the bed appeared as if blood was on it.  It almost looked like a splatter pattern from a gun shot.  I was concerned.  However, upon closer inspection, the headboard fabric was peeling.  That made me feel somewhat better.  Still, it is just one example of some cosmetic maintenance that was needed in the room.  The food for breakfast was kind of spendy too.

title: Excellent place to stay!,,
review: I appreciate your feedback and I am so glad you enjoyed the helpfulness of our team. They do a wonderful job in making sure that our guests get to experience all the great things Fort Lauderdale has to offer, We do hope that if you find yourself back in our beautiful city, that you allow us to show you our “Suite Improvements” as we feel they will only enhance the wonderful product we already have.      John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great Hotel before our Cruise
review: The customer service you get at this hotel cannot be beat----Helping you with transportation is one of their best attributes. They use VIP limo services----And they are amazing!!!! I stayed at Doubletree the night before an Eastern Caribbean Cruise and the night after we got back----I brought my family of 15 with me...... Seven of them being my grandchildren who were all under the age of seven. We were a little concerned with transportation with such a large group. I was able to schedule pick up for all of our Transportation before we ever even got to Fort Lauderdale. They were amazing---- I would get a call from them if they were running a little behind schedule and also got calls from them to let me know we were on schedule for pick up. We use them four times-From the airport…

title: You call this a Hilton?
review: Thank you for the wonderful comments you have shared about the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I am sure many will benefit from your positive experience. We strive to provide exceptional guest experiences and that extends to who we partner with such as VIP Limo.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Best Hotel in Fort Lauderdale
review: This hotel exceeded every expectation.  The rooms were a great size, the location was perfect to the restaurants in the Galleria as well as only a few blocks to the beach.  If you are not in the mood to go anywhere, sitting by the nice pool that overlooks the waterway was very relaxing as well.  They were also wonderful in helping set up a transfer to the cruise port.  I can't say enough great things, we will definitely be back, looking forward to it.

title: Housekeeping
review: We vacation in central Florida during Winter months and have been coming to the Gallery One for a week every year for 7 or 8 years to enjoy the ocean.  As seniors, we also enjoy the hotel for its lovely suites, balcony, beautiful pool area and mainly and most importantly, its cleanliness.  We are so very pleased with the housekeeping.  Not only is everything nice and clean but the staff is so efficient and friendly.  Karesha, housekeeping supervisor, is great.  Thanks, Karesha  Orval & Constance Brown

title: Outstanding Ft. Lauderdale Hotel
review: Thank you for your wonderful comments about the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton. Our entire team is dedicated to delivering the best experience possible to each and every one of our guests. I will make sure that Karesha hears about what you had to say about her. It will only broaden the smile she wears proudly every day.   John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Expect more from a DoubleTree in this type of area
review: We just completed our second stay at this lovely hotel and again, we were very pleased.  After reading a few previous bad reviews, I was concerned.  How could this hotel have gone down so much in a year's time?  I decided to see for myself and honestly, I can't find anything to complain about.  The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful and the room was wonderful.  We did get a Hilton Honors upgrade to a suite with a view of the Intercoastal Waterway which was quite nice.  The water taxi stops here and it is an enjoyable ride.  The suites are quite spacious and include a living room, small kitchen area, large bathroom and a separate bedroom with a comfortable mattress.  Let's not forget this is a Doubletree so the chocolate chip cookies are always available and they are…

title: This hotel looks nice on the surface, but they have many problems.
review: I could not let your review go by without taking the time to thank you for the wonderful comments you made of the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites by Hilton. We strive to provide exceptional guest experiences and I am glad to hear that you wanted to “see for yourself”  Your review will have a positive effect on our guests who rely on Trip Advisor as their benchmark for hotel choice. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Suites with a kitchen
review: I am a Gold VIP of HHonors (Hilton's frequent traveler program) so I have stayed in many Hilton family hotels, which DoubleTree is a member.  Being in this location, I expected a beautiful location, top-notch hotel with typical DoubleTree amenities.    Front Desk Staff:   Good: Very friendly, helpful, efficient, and did their job well.  I was just coming off a red-eye and they were able to move me in a room earlier so I could catch a nap.  Rooms:    Good: Our first room was nice but the view was the parking lot.   So we got upgraded to a two room suite on the top floor.   Clean.  Nice balcony.  Beautiful views of inter coastal waterway, city of Fort Lauderdale at night, and could see the ocean as well.  Water flow would have been better in the showers.   Did come with a nice,…

title: Great Hotel, good location
review: Stayed here in January after a cruise from Port Everglades. Lovely suite hotel ideally located on the intercoastal waterway with a water taxi stop right outside the hotel. Suite was excellent and reasonably priced. Staff were very pleasant and attentive.

title: Fantastic Property Beautifully Set on the Intercostal Waterway
review: Thank you for sharing your experience at the GALLERYone DoubleTree Suites by Hilton.  I am pleased to hear that our service and amenities made your stay comfortable.  The water taxi is an excellent way to see why Fort Lauderdale is known as the “Venice of the America’s” and so convenient that it is right at our dock. We hope that when you take another cruise out of Fort Lauderdale, that you will stay with us again.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Beautiful Room
review: We travel all the time and I really fell for this property.  It has a lovely sense of arrival for being in the middle of a busy area of Fort Lauderdale.  The lobby is all granite and marble with sweeping windows to bring in the beauty of the Intercostal.  Lovely pool area right on the water.  It's not the beach but is a different way to experience the Fort Lauderdale waters.  They have two manmade beach areas on the intercostal.  So fun to lay there and watch the yachts come and go.  At night the place just sparkles with the lights of the condos and boats.    Suites are fantastic.  Just amazing.  Full kitchens and lux bathrooms.  Probably the best suite product we have seen.  Note - this is not on the beach for which Fort Lauderdale is so famous.  But it's on the intercostal…

title: Hilton "where the extras are WAY extra'!
review: I can’t thank you enough for your wonderful review of the GALLERYone- A DoubleTree Suites by Hilton. You truly have covered everything that I believe that makes our hotel and exceptional one. I am sure your review will have a positive impact on our future guests. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Worth the visit
review: Our family shared a 2 BR/2BA suite for 2 nights before our cruise.The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were quiet. The only disappointment was the water view balcony which overlooked the garbage area with the only waterview a very small portion off one end of the balcony. The breakfast which was included in our rate was delicious. It's very convenient to have the nice selection of restaurants next door at the Gallery.We didn't rent a car & didn't miss it at all. The pool is adaquate & there is a little beach area next to the canal where there was sun for part of the day.

title: A nice place to stay.
review: With the exception of the pricey valet service, there is really nothing too negative I can say about our stay at the Gallery One. The location is very close to the beach in fact its a short walk over the bridge. The room was nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. My only suggestion would be that if you plan to leave your room after 9 or 10am you might want to let the desk know you still want your room serviced. Although I did not think that we were leaving the room too late for service, we did not have our room serviced 3 out of the seven nights we stayed. The location is excellent for restaurants and shopping.

title: Lovely place for an overnight before the cruise
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites. Unfortunately parking is very limited being on a barrier island but we do keep our pricing on the lower end of the range in comparison to the other hotels in the area.  I have shared your experience with our housekeeping department at their pre-shift this morning.  This is certainly a good check and balance training opportunity for our team.  On your next visit to the area, we hope you will stay with us again so that we may provide you with the excellent service and hospitality we are known for.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: You pay for the location
review: We were lucky to have a pre-cruise night allocated here. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to a shopping mall and there is a pharmacy across the road as well as a supermarket. We had a lovely view of the river from our balcony and there is a shuttle boat/water taxi you can take from out back. We did not get enough time to explore that one. The rooms are suites with a separate lounge/kitchen area and en suite bedroom (ours had 2 double beds). Flat screen TV in both Lounge and bedroom. Kitchen was well equipped and clean, the whole environment was clean and felt safe. Large bed which was very comfortable.  We would love to go back and use this as a base for a week or 2.

title: Suite overlooking Inland waterway
review: Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience at the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites. I am happy to hear that our service and amenities made your stay so comfortable. Our entire team is dedicated to delivering the best experience possible that can be had by all.  I am sure your suggestions will be very helpful to our future guests.  When you do return, you must experience the water taxi. It is one of Fort Lauderdale’s “must do” activities as Fort Lauderdale is known as the “Venice of the Americas”      John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Would stay there again
review: I agree with all of the previous reviews regarding the location - it is close and within walking distance (if you don't mind playing 'Frogger' with the 'Fast and the Furious' of Ft. Lauderdale.) with all of the needed amenities and restaurants.    We stayed here for a wedding, and I would like to recognize however, that Andrew, the group reservations manager was wonderful at accommodating an extension of our wedding rate even though the primary hilton/hhonors service desk refused to extend our reservation at the same rate since the group rate was sold out.    Even so, once getting to the hotel, we were baffled by the lack of self-parking (even though there was an empty parking lot in front of the hotel) - you have to pay $24/day for valet.  We did not eat in the restaurant,…

title: Nice room, right on water taxi route
review: This is a good location, right on water taxi route with a stop right by the pool, easy walk to the mall and a nice food court, plus half a dozen restaurants, walk to Bonnet Gardens.  Room clean, liked the balcony, nice room.  We stayed here for three nights after a cruise, and maybe we were jaded from the cruise experience, but there is no concierge, the front desk people don't really know anything about the area, there is not a rack of brochures of things to do as there is in many hotels, (though they do have some brochures behind the front desk, you need to know what to ask for, and I really like to browse), and they can't answer even fairly simple questions, like can I walk to the mall, which it turns out is half a block away.  Our room did not get cleaned one day in the…

title: Service was amazing
review: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay with us a the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites. I would have to agree that our location is ideal to get to see the many of the wonderful things Fort Lauderdale is known for, one of them being the Bonnet House. Having a balcony is a wonderful way to enjoy "down time" and relax as you watch the yachts cruise by. I have personally shared your experience with our front office team about knowledge of the area.  This is certainly a training opportunity for some of the newest members of our team.  We hope that if you visit the area again, that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with the excellent service and hospitality that we are known for.  Hotel Manager John Allan

title: great pre cruise stay
review: Service was above and beyond by all of the staff!  However, a little pricey for the room we had - no view and the furniture was over-worn.  Good location close to the beach and the water taxi.  Shower was great!

title: Getting quite worn - needs update
review: I will make sure to share your kind remarks of excellent service with all of our departments. I do agree that our location is one of best. It was our pleasure to have been able to provide you with continued exceptional service. We look forward to welcoming you back.  Hotel Manager John Allan

title: Great location, average hotel..... expensive!
review: Stayed here for two nights before going on a cruise and we really enjoyed it.We were upgraded for free to a very spacious apartment style room with a large lounge/kitchen area , good size bedroom and lovely roomy bathroom with a brilliant power shower. We had a very big balcony with great views over the inter coastal waterway and even a glimpse of the sea.Our room was spotless and I thought all the public areas were clean and inviting and I personally did not see anything I would describe as shabby or poorly maintained. Myself and my husband enjoyed the buffet breakfast as there was plenty of choice and the staff were helpful and attentive.The hotel is located next to the shopping mall and the water taxi stop is right outside the hotel patio. It is also easy strolling distance…

title: nearest to the Galleria mall
review: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. We intentionally booked this hotel to be close to the mall next door, and walking distance from the restaurants. Rooms are nice, all are suites, the problem we had was with the noise of the bridge traffic going over the intercoastal all day and night long. We asked to be moved as we did not get any sleep. The front desk clerk was very obliging and apologized and we were moved right away. The staff are very friendly, from the front desk to valet etc. This hotel however does charge $24 a day for valet(cannot park your own car). We had breakfast the first morning at the hotel, and were disappointed! We ordered off the menu instead of taking the buffet($19) and it was like we were being penalized. I ordered pancakes and got 3 of the…

title: Great location & great price!
review: Thank you for sharing your feedback about your recent stay with us and I’m glad to hear that our front desk team was able to resolve your challenge quickly and efficiently. I have to agree that our all-suite location is perfect, literally everything you need right at your doorstep.  I have personally shared your breakfast experience with our culinary team at their pre-shift meeting this morning.   This is certainly a training opportunity for us.  On your next visit to the area, we hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with the excellent food, service and hospitality we are known for.  Hotel Manager John Allan

title: Stayed for many years. Now its gone down hill
review: My family of 5 (3 children) recently stayed here during a recent trip to visit family over the Christmas holiday. The staff is very helpful and greeted us with a warm smile every time we walked through the door. Our children got a big kick out of the warm chocolate chip cookies they received during their stay. We had a 2 room suite which was spacious with comfortable beds. The bathrooms were large and clean. The valet was fast and friendly. Inside was a Starbucks which was perfect for us who need our coffee in the mornings from there. The location was great with sights all within walking distance. The kids enjoyed the pool area and walking along the inter coastal with the beach being close as well. Management was helpful and answered any questions we hd and was very kind. We…

title: Very central and  friendly staff
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the GALLERYone Doubletree. A warm weather getaway to Fort Lauderdale is a wonderful way to spend time with the family and our great location makes it easy to see everything that makes Fort Lauderdale fantastic . More important, it was our pleasure to provide you with our high level of service and amenities to help make your stay special. We will look forward to welcoming you back with a smile and warm cookies.    Hotel Manager John Allan

title: Beautiful hotel with excellent service in a great location!
review: We have stayed here annually for 4 years. My wife has been here annually for about 8 years. Being frequent travelers I find it hard to believe many if these reviews. The property needs a makeover BADLY. It shows many signs of neglect and poor management.   When you stand under the outside atrium at the front door and look up, that will sum up the condition of this property. IT IS GROSS BEYOND ALL. Long time growing algea and mold not just a little but whole sections of glass!  The railings on our balcony had mold/mildew that was noticible. Some cousions on the lounge around furniture at the small sand area by the water had mold.   I saw light fixtures in the back courtyard broken. The landscaping had not been cleaned in a while and had small trash and cigarette butts all through…

title: A tired place, trying hard
review: This is my fourth visit to this property; every year in the first week of January I attend a conference here. Now that I have become a 'reviewer' I though I should offer my thoughts.  First off, the staff tries very hard. I was asked frequently how everything was. I was almost hovered over as I ate my breakfast. These people are nice!  But everything at the property is worn and tired. And little things are awry. I asked for eggs over easy and got eggs over hard. My room service french fries were cold, and the burger was way over cooked and dry. The coffee service in the room had cream but no sugar anywhere.   The carpets are worn, the furniture grungy, and the art dull. The property is in need of a serious makeover, and given the price ($185 a night) it was sort of alarmingly…

title: Great Pre-cruise hotel
review: We loved the location of the Gallery One. it is on the waterway with stop #nine.  Front desk helped us order a van to the port  after our one night stay. The hotel was bright and modern, loved the two room suite. We had a room on the 11th floor with balcony with a sea view. The front desk folks were friendly and answered all our questions about where to eat, had water taxi schedules etc. Friendly staff in the cafe, Starbuck coffee area. Enjoyed breakfast buffet  with wide variety of food. Loved the outdoor terrace. If all the doubletree suite hotels are like this I would stay in them whenever I can.

title: Beautiful Location
review: The Gallery ONE is in a wonderful location, overlooking the inter-coastal waterway.  Both the pool and outside patio area also overlook the waterway.  The staff was friendly, and accommodating.  The suites are spacious, and feature a separate kitchen, living, and sleeping area.  The shower is amazing.    The hotel is close to the Galleria, with nice restaurants and shopping two blocks inland.  We also enjoyed the close proximity to Publix (across the street from the Galleria.)  Breakfast in the restaurant is plentiful, and made to order.  There is also a breakfast buffet option.  We loved having breakfast overlooking the water, while watching the boats line up for the Holiday boat parade.  We got a great deal on this property through lastminutetravel dot com.  Our only…

title: Excellent Place to Stay
review: Close to the beach, reasonable price, friendly staff, great rooms.  Best thing about the hotel was the room size.  It felt more like an apartment than a hotel room.  Worst things: $24 per night for mandatory valet parking.  Valet parking got backed up and took a while to receive our car.  Hallways in hotel were a bit run down.  Scuff marks on doors and walls.  One door near our room on the 8th floor looked like it had been beaten down.  Overall, a great place to stay.

title: Excellent rooms, staff and location
review: Just returned from an excellent stay. So much to say... Location. It's 5 miles north from the FTL airport and directly next door to the popular Galleria Mall.  The hotel is positioned just by a drawbridge on the Intercoastal waterway, which means you have to walk over the bridge and 2 short blocks to technically dip your toes into the ocean. On the way to the beach there is a Mexican, Thai and two Italian restaurants as well as two lively pubs and an ice cream parlor. It's not South Beach but it's not dead either.The beach is pristine and family-friendly.   On the other side of the hotel is the mall and a Publix supermarket and CVS drugstore. That said, I don't know why previous posts were so concerned about the breakfast. It's an all-suite hotel so everyone has a kitchen and we…

title: Funny smell and kitchen utensils missing
review: The room size is okay but there was a funny smell, and simple kitchen utensils like forks and knives were missing (but lots of plates in different sizes... except that not enough utensils to use them with)... As a suite with kitchen, we were expecting a more better prepared kitchen.  We picked this location in a hurry, the beach is just around the corner and we would have picked a beachfront hotel, but the walk to the beach is 10min so that was nice; this hotel is close to a mall so for those who prefers shopping over the beach then this is not a bad choice location-wise.

title: 2nd Stay Thoughts
review: Thank you for alerting us to the missing utensils and undesirable smell.   All kitchens now have all utensils. It's nice to hear you enjoyed our convenient location to the beach and shops. We hope that you come back and visit us again if you're ever in the area again.  Kind regards,  Karesha Brissett Housekeeping Supervisor

title: Another great stay
review: We spent two nights at this property during the weekend of December 14th.  Overall we like the property, the staff, and the location.  Although, like our last stay the restaurant breakfast service on Saturday morning was a bit of a mess.  The impression we received is that they were short staffed.  Not sure if it's because of the number of guests leaving for cruises later that day or what.  But, it's exactly the same as thing that occurred during our last stay.  As well, the food offered at the breakfast buffet is also lacking.   The omelette bar was new and a nice change but the other items offered on the buffet were the same as last year and were not inviting.  The scrambled eggs were overcooked, the bacon was undercooked and the potatoes were not crispy, almost soggy.  Sunday…

title: Another Great DoubleTree
review: I just stayed two nights while in town on business. This is a nice "Hilton" location especially during cruise season when prices start to jump up. The suites are very nice and spacious. There is a kitchenette with a dinning table, a separate living room, and a bedroom. The room was clean and updated. I had room service which was ok. The breakfast buffet was very good though. If you are a light sleeper, take the city view which keeps you away from the draw bridge. It can be a bit noisy as cars drive over it. Overall, a nice stay. I will be staying there again.

title: Great property! Great location
review: I stayed here back in June for one night before catching a flight back to Virginia. I am just now getting around to writing a review, but still wanted to express my experience. As a Hilton Diamond member, I was upgraded at check in to a beautiful waterfront suite on a high floor. The room decor was up to date and comfortable. The room aslo had a HUGE balcony that faced the waterway. This was perfect for enjoying a drink in the evening while watching the boats pass. The room also had one of those really nice big sliding glass doors so that the balcony just felt like an extension to the room, rather then the normal plain sliding doors. I also had lunch at the restaurant, this was great as well. I will return if I were to visit the area again!

title: Great stay
review: Just returned from a 7 day stay in Gallery One.  Although the Hotel was full it never felt crazily overcrowed and I was always able to relax at the bar or by the pool etc.  The staff were all very friendly and cheerfull.  The higher floor waterview units offer great views of not only the intercoastal but also the the ocean.   The higher floor Units facing Sunrise Blvd actually have the best views of all the units and the roads noise is not a great factor.  I could imagine the lower floors would present a noise problem.  As I understand it, the Hotel is considering sound proof windows for the lower floor units.  I was told all the units will be outfitted with new furniture and carpeting in Q1 2013.     The Location is pretty unique as there aren't any other Hotel perched at the…

title: Great Spot
review: The rooms at this Hotel are larger than the norm. The staff is great and will go out of their way to make sure your visit is perfect. Ask for a room with a full balcony facing the Inter Coastal Waterway - sit out there with an adult beverage and watch the boats go by!! (or go and sit by the pool and / or the outdoor lunge and relax). The location is 1 block away for the Galleria Mall - so if you want to shop you have a great selection. Also, in the area are a number of restaurants with an endless variety of food types. The Hotel is also a Water Taxi stop so if you cant find enough to do in the immediate area take the taxi to downtown Fort Lauderdale for more options. Oh, and dont forget the beach - a short walk away.....

title: Great Facilities
review: We can’t thank you enough for your wonderful review of the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites. Our suites are anything but the “norm” as they include a dining area  separate kitchen, an oversized bathroom and balconies to enjoy the surroundings.  It’s like having your own private condo on the water.  Thank you for including the wonderful suggestions and advise for our future guests!  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: PreCruise stay November 15-16 2012
review: The rooms in this hotel are all large suites with well equipped kitchens. Nice river views & great location for Galleria Mall shopping, close to the beach & several good eateries close by. Staff were very helpful & attentive ......& of course the cookies on arrival.....& the next day if you ask at reception were extremely good. Look forward to staying here again!

title: We have stayed here many times
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us from your recent stay at the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites. Our suites are exceptionally large and provide all the comforts of home with the added benefit of a fantastic view and ideal location. You really don’t even need a car to get around when staying with us.  It’s all at your fingertips. We look forward to welcoming you back to Fort Lauderdale soon.    John Allan Hotel Manager

title: A week in Paradise!!!
review: Everything was enjoyable about this hotel. Valet took our vehicle with excellent service, room check-in was quick and friendly. Cookies a plus. Loved the room, luxurious, spacious, great balcony, nice view of waterway.Kitchen was a great help. Short walk to beach, mall , restaurants. Enjoyed sitting by pool and hot tub watching boats go by. Walked over bridge to State Park for nature walk. Everthing can be accessed by foot. All staff very friendly and helpful. Will be back. Thanks Gallery ONE

title: This is a very nice hotel, but the rate is misleading due to the high charge for Valet Parking
review: I could not let your review go by without thanking you for your awesome comments of the GALLERYone Doubletree Suites.  You truly have covered everything that I believe makes our hotel and exceptional one. We feel our hotel really is the best kept “Diamond” in Fort Lauderdale.  I have shared your comments with all of our departments as it looks like they all have contributed to you having a wonderful stay.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!      John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Nice hotel, good location (near Galleria) but ...
review: This is a very nice hotel, It has not taken a beating as the other hotels on the beach and is not used as much for over nighters preparing for a cruise.   It is about two blocks from the beach and next to a mall.  There is CVS across the street and a publix in the same area, so everything is within a block, as a hilton diamond member I have stayed at many of their family of hotels in the area and found this to be the nicest one. However the rates a a little deceptinve if you have a car, because valet is the only way to park there and it is $24 a night plus tax and time, so you have to figure this in the cost of the room - there are no options ......I would think the valet is the most important since these guys are the first and last to see as a guest - they are not the most…

title: Perfect rooms, great location!
review: Thank you for sharing your feedback and we appreciate your nice comments about the condition of our suites.  I can attribute that to our exceptional housekeeping and engineering team that work very hard  to ensure that our suites are in the best of conditions for our guests to enjoy.  Parking in the area is limited and our prices are on the lower end of the spectrum for the barrier island area.   You are correct in saying that Valet is the first and last impression our guest have of our hotel so we have addressed this with our team.  We hope to have another opportunity to make your stay “exciting” and memorable.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: I specifically stayed here to compare to the Hilton Ft. Lauderdale Resort
review: ...some staff there can very easily ruin the Hilton brand.   Stayed there for a late night arrival before heading out to Key West the next morning. The hotel is located ideally to the mall, is very comfortable and offers decent views of the Inter-coastal. The front desk staff and valet was very accommodating, but one of the workers from the kitchen (who obviously has no business interacting with guest) was very confrontational to us as we put items in our truck that was inappropriately parked (as stated by him) by the valet.  I would not discourage anyone from staying at this location but I would encourage management to be very careful with letting some of there staff that know the least amount about good customer service to interact with guest.  Other than that, it's a good…

title: Good pre cruise hotel in Fort Lauderdale
review: Very nice suite hotel close to beach, Galleria mall and intra coastal canal. No need for rental car. Five minute walk to beach and Galleria Mall. Nice area on beach with a couple of shops and bars. Not too many.  The mall is a bit upscale  but has a good varirty of stores including Macy's and Dillard's. Our room had a view of the draw bridge and we found it interesting. Noise from bridge and traffic was minimal. Hotel service was good. Restaurant service was good and food tasty. Breakfast buffet was good but monotonous and about 20.00 which is about norm for Hilton. Could easily walk to mall to eat. At night there was a "golf cart" giving rides in the area for 2 or 3 dollars if you did n't want to walk. The Sun trolley passed out side hotel as well. The water taxi was…

title: Great location
review: We stayed here for 5 days and had a great time. The staff was very friendly. This is a great hotel located right on the water. I would recommend you ask for a water view near the elevator, it really makes thing very convenient. The water taxi was a great way to get around. I would definitely stay here again.

title: pleasant stay
review: Everything was nice with a beautiful water view king suite. We walked to the beach and enjoyed our stay. It is right next to Galleria mall and there are many restaurants nearby. The only negative thing was the parking charge of $25 plus tax.

title: Perfect choice!
review: My sisters and I stayed here two days when we met to visit friends.  My sister invited a few of her friends to come to the hotel, rather than our trying to visit each separately in the area.  We met on the patio near the water and had drinks and ordered tapas.  The staff was wonderful, setting up a table for us and catering to us.  The tapas were delicious!  We also found the suite very comfortable as we're the beds!  We loved this hotel and will choose it the next time!

title: Good location, geat views.
review: A good place to relax. The hotel has its water taxi stop outside so a great way to get around. Ask for a high floor room with views of the waterfront. Has a nice but small pool area. The suites are very comfortable and give some affordable luxury. Check out The Hut which is friendly bar across from the hotel. There is also The Galleria Mall within 5 minutes walk for some great shopping.  The staff were very helpful. Be careful if you park a car here, it is $25 per day. Don't be tempted to park in the shopping centre opposite as after 22.00 the tow trucks arrive to remove all cars. Costs $250 to get the car back. Not worth it.

title: I could (very happily) live here
review: We had an end unit with three walls of windows in the living/dining area that overlooked the Intercoastal and (beyond) the ocean. Amazing views, loved watching the "beautiful people" yachting by below.   Immaculate, sumptuous, and an extremely friendly staff. Everything a hotel should be. So roomy, I feel like we could have lived in the unit.

title: Wedding / Vacation
review: The hotel was beautiful inside, nice bar and restaurant lay out.  The room that we stayed in was huge, with a small kitchen and living room area and balcony.  Most of the suites have a beautiful view of Ft. Lauderdale.  They have water taxis that you can take from this hotel to other areas or hotels. Even though we didn't lay out by the pool or sand area, I noticed that the outside area was dirty, and the white beach chairs and lounges looked dirty and really worned.  The pool was nice, nothing special.  We got a good price because were had a Wedding Group Rate, I would not have paid the full rate to stay there.  Not because the hotel wasn't nice, but because for the full price of $250 + you can get something closer to the beach area.  Maybe its just me, but when I go to Florida…

title: Good Location, Nice Amenities, Pleasant Staff
review: Stayed here one night pre-cruise.  Rooms are nice, with a kitchenette (for those needing one, maybe for longer stays).  Gallery Mall next door is good and has the nicest, swankiest food court I've ever seen (quick and reasonable place to grab lunch, something for everyone).  Publix and CVS across the street for various needs.  Nice little beach behind the hotel, on the canals, my kids enjoyed just pushing the sand around and watching the boats (and a gecko and iguana passed through as well).

title: Nice location - treated as an annoyance
review: Stayed here one night, and while not ever treated rudely I was often spoken to as if I was annoying them at every turn.  We tried to check in at 2:30 PM, 30 minutes early but were told we would have to wait until after the 3:00 PM check-in time.  Unusual but not unreasonable.  But this was communicated with an air of annoyance with me as a part of the problem.   The room was reserved for 3 adults but was set up for only 2 - 2 bath towels, 2 water glasses, 2 single serve coffee packs. The room was nice, but not up to the cleanliness of other Hilton properties. So this stay was just OK, not great.  We will look elsewhere next time we come to Ft. Lauderdale.

title: Double Tree Superb!
review: I spent five nights at the hotel. It was superb in every way. Firstly, the staff led by TJ went out of their way to be courteous, helpful and very efficient. The suites are really comfortable and well appointed. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels all over the world that are nowhere near as good. Excellent for business with fast internet connections. I could not find any fault at all with the hotel and would highly recommend it to any discerning traveller.

title: Nice hotel, but a bit of a walk to the beach
review: Stayed & enjoyed 2 nights here. Staff friendly, rooms big (Suites), but tired and need some parts  refurbished which the manager told me is happening in early 2013. Comfy beds, safe, no free wifi but a cookie on arrival to try and make up.  Hotel is by very noisy road bridge so try to get room away from this.  Shopping mall is 5 mins walk with many shops (incl Macy's) and some restaurants and food hall. 15 mins walk to the beach and non exciting restaurants. 30+ mins to main shops and more restaurants, but these can be reached by boat from back of hotel for $20 pp ($10 after 17:00). Boat seems expensive but takes 45 mins and includes commentary as you pass many huge and fantastic private houses and boats.  Otherwise catch the bus for a $ or less!

title: Good Deal Using Hilton Points A+++
review: While on a stopover to board the Oasis of the seas we enjoyed our 2 bedroom suite... great for traveling with the in-laws.. Very clean hotel and a very friendly staff. And, Loved the In-House Starbucks... Excellent location. Close to great shopping and the fabulous Ft. Lauderdale Water Taxi. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Class and comfort
review: This has been my choice for hotels when ever I am in Ft Laud. It is classy and swank and yet casually under toned.  The walk to the dock for the taxi (might want to grab one to go from the outdoor bar) is a trip worth taking. The staff are just super! and the food to die for. Remember to get your fresh chocolate cookie before you go to your room.

title: Service, friendly staff, great cookies and A+ location....
review: The first time we have stayed in this hotel we were surprised by the space we got for the price we paid. The room was big, sitting area, bathroom! The rooms and suites we have stayed in are clean, no old furniture, good beds. We love love love the suit spacious, own kitchen  no sharingof a bathroom with the children. Parking is paid parking 25USD per day.. The Galleria Mall - NM, Dillards, Macy's, Apple, Teavana, Cache, Brookstore and more- are within walking distance from the hotel. It took me tops 3 minutes to walk to the entrance.  PF Chang , Sea food , Burgerfie ,attached or near at the Mall as a publix, 7-11.   **Well I can go on but cutting down to the issue is.. The staff were very helpful with all the items I had send there. They had to find more and more boxes but…

title: Great rooms; great staff
review: I was a bit skeptical that the hotel would be that nice as I've always thought of Doubletree's as being less upscale, but I was pleasantly surprised.  Each of the members of our party had a large suite with a living room, balcony, kitchen, bedroom and large bathroom.  The staff really went above and beyond to be helpful and friendly-  the manager, Christopher, was especially good and dealt with some of our elderly relatives who can be persnickety with much grace and humor.  The hotel is not on the beach, but it's not far to the beach and the hotel has a nice pool.  It is also right next to a large shopping center with Neiman Marcus, Macy's, etc.  The gym was well taken care of, but could have used another elliptical and another bike during peak times. The bathroom toiletries…

title: Best DoubleTree At Which I've Stayed
review: Though the neighborhood is very middle class, this hotel is a proud benchmark by which other DoubleTree Hotels should be judged.  This is an all-suites hotel, and the accommodations are very roomy, IMHO.  The service we received was impeccable, just top notch; they make you feel like a VIP.  And the facility is very well kept inside the lobby and out on the grounds.  Be aware that parking is by valet only, with a $24 charge per night, but it is worth the extra money to have your car parked and your luggage delivered to your room.  This writer is used to self-service, but the way they treated us left my family smiling and nodding to each other with approval.

title: Great location
review: Very good location within five minutes walk to the beach. The staff are very welcoming upon arrival and with any problems you may have. All suite rooms that allow you to stay at home and cook if you grow tired of dining out. Restaurant is over priced for the quality of the food and plenty of local restaurants very nearby allows you a choice. The Galleria mall is right next door and a supermarket across the street has all you need for daily cooking.The water taxi stop is at the hotel and and will allow you to enjoy the entire city for twenty dollars all day or ten dollars from 5pm to 10pm. The bedding is comfortable and clean and the maids are at your service. Nice place to stay without the beach hotel prices. The only drawback is the parking which is valet style and around 25…

title: Nice Place to Stay
review: We stayed here for a night before our cruise in the 2 bedroom suite.  Very nice.  Staff at front desk very helpful.  The suite had a little kitchen which we always like and a living room area seperating the two bedrooms and a bathroom for each bedroom.  Mall within walking distance if you need anything.  Restaurant on site was nice, service was very slow for lunch and dinner though.  I would stay again.

title: Good hotel (eventually)
review: Stayed here for one night after a cruise, and had a good experience overall.  We reserved two rooms, but only one was available for early check-in.  As it turns out, the available room had not yet been cleaned so when we notified the front desk they were apologetic and immediately found us adjacent rooms elsewhere in the hotel.  Appreciate the prompt reply, as it is a little unsettling to walk into a dirty room.  The rooms we did get were clean and large, though some of the furniture is starting look tired (the dining chairs especially look like they need some upholstering?). Bathrooms were immaculate, though the shower heads are starting to rust.  Connecting rooms were a real plus if you're staying with a group / family.  Aside from the mishap with the unclean room, concierge…

title: A Great Place To Stay
review: I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean and spacious.  The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the beach so if you plan to spend all day there, you might want to choose another hotel.  The hotel also is right next to the Galleria mall with lots of shopping and dining available.

title: GALLERY ONE Ft. Lauderdale We love this place!
review: I guess the title of my review says it all!  Yes we do love it!  What is not to love?  A location on the intercoastal waterway.  Sipping coffee on your balcony watching sailboats and yachts pass by.  Sitting on your balacony (if you have a higher floor) and seeing the ocean. A short walk to the beach.  A shorter walk to some of the finest restaurants in Ft Lauderdale (you can walk to Captiol Grille, Blue Martini, Seasons 52, ect.)  This is important when you want to have a few drinks and not worry about DWI!  We have stayed here so many times, I have lost track. The staff is top notch.  The hotel is very comortable whether you are a couple traveling alone or have children.  The hotel is all suites, so if you are with another couple or with children there is plenty of room for…

title: What a waste of Property
review: I  would first like to say that the staff is excellent. frontdesk valet are  gems. however the hotel is such a great waste of potential. I am going  o give you free advice.  you need to  be more detailed  to the appearance. walking out the room the carpet is filthy  the dent in the walls. that   tile was ancient  I remember those tiles 25 years ago when my mom woudl take to this hotel .  the elvators looks morbid. I felt uneasy . For one you can turn the entrance into  something  welcoming acquire the land that you blocked off so you can collect the parking fees needs more space. the  alndscape is horrid  I felt  creepy walkign over to the restaurants across the street.  you can turn that lobby into a sheik place to want to hang out. welcoming scent great color scheme . this is…

title: Surreal two time visit
review: Thank you for staying with us at our hotel. We appreciate your candid review of our property.  New perspectives about our hotel and our guestroom appearance help us make improvements to our guest experience on an ongoing basis. There are many projects ongoing to enhance our property in the coming months, again thank you for your review.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Wonderful customer care
review: During our vacation in January 2012 we decided to stay at thís hotel before and after our Caribbean cruise. This turned out to be a surreal experience.  Arriving for our first stay coming back from a drive to Key West we got a really nice top floor room overlooking the canals and the coastline of Fort Lauderdale. Champagne bottle arrived within 10 minutes and when discovering that the safe was locked by the previous tenant a service guy came by quickly and solved it. This time we stayed for two nights and were locking forward to return for an additional night on January 29th.   Arriving for the second stay we wondered if it was the same hotel. Since we arrived early our room was not ready which was OK. They promised to call us when it was ready and we got ensured a room similar…

title: Nice hotel, very friendly staff
review: Thank you for your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We want our guests to enjoy their stay and so your review is important to us. We express our sincere apologies for your experience during your last stay and because we do not have all knowledge of your stay we cannot look further into the details with our staff. I ask that you contact us so that we can look further into the details, please ask for me. Again; we apologize for the inconveniences that you both experienced with us and hope that you contact us soon.  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Great hotel and great location!
review: Just 15 minutes from the FLL airport, just $25.00 the taxi ride.  Stayed three nights in a two beds, one bedroom suite for a weekend getaway. Upscale neighborhood. Very clean hotel.  Modern kitchen, nice living room and bathroom. Great shower!!!  Crossing the street there is a Publix, Starbucks, CVS, etc. Steps from the Galleria Mall, P.F. Changs.  As other reviews mentioned, the hotel is a water taxi stop.  That's why we chose this hotel. We didn't want to rent a car and the water taxi was great.  We really enjoy it.  We walked to the beach one night. Friendly staff, always with a smile and a yummy cookie at check-in.  Don't have any complaints!!!  I came back telling all my friends about my stay here.

title: Great Deal/Very Nice Hotel
review: I recently stayed for three nights at the Gallery ONE - Doubletree Hotel in Ft Lauderdale Florida. The hotel is in new condition and I had a comfortable/clean room.  I had read other good reviews about the hotel and that is why chose this place, I wasn’t disappointed. I was happy with the service – the staff was very friendly and helpful.    I heard some people complain about having to pay to park but I think it is a fair trade off considering the hotel is in a great location (right by the ocean and shopping mall/restaurants) and they offer very competitive room rates.     Finally, the hotel had all the nice amenities I was looking for (pool/hot tub/gym/business center/laundry machines) as well as a nice restaurant/bar/coffee shop.  I would recommend this location and plan on…

title: Great Stay at a Wonderful Hotel
review: My husband and I just spent a terrific week at the Gallery One.  The rooms are large and very comfortable.  We especially love the fabulous view of both the ocean and the intra-coastal.  The staff went above and beyond to make sure we had an excellent stay,  You cannot beat the location and value of this hotel.

title: Comfortable, attractive hotel steps from the beach
review: I stayed one night here on business and wish I had had more time.  I was upgraded from a double to a one bedroom without asking.  The rooms were imaculate, spacious and attractively decorated.  The terrace overlooking the Intercoastal water-way with its parade of yachts was too hot to sit on in early September but would be nice in late autumn through spring .  The water taxi stops right at the property.  I did not use the outdoor pool as you are  only 150 yards from the beach.  If you want to use the kitchen though, be warned that the cupboards were empty of spices, condiments and the like.  Room service delivered dinner promptly and warm. All in all, very nice.

title: Comfortable hotel in good location
review: I have just checked out after a 7 night stay in the hotel.  The hotel met my expectations completely.  My suite was clean & comfortable with a great view of the water and a balcony with a couple of chairs and a small table.  It was great to have a fridge although the kitchenette didn't have full supplies, e.g. There were 3 forks but no knives.  Gym was small but more than adequate. All the equipment looked new and the room was clean.  Location was great as next door to the Galleria mall and on the water taxi route. Also only a few minutes walk from the beach.  Overall a good hotel in a good location and I would definitely come back he if coming to Fort Lauderdale again.

title: Can't beat the Customer Service!
review: I booked a 2 bedroom suite for 2 nights this past weekend to accomodate 5 people. We were greeted by Christopher at the check in desk, he offered big smiles, excellent customer service, a room upgrade, and warm cookies. We faced a minor issue on Saturday and situation was quickly remedied. Margaret at the pool bar was amazing, Rosie, a waitress in the restaurant was so friendly and affable. Each staff member we came across during our 2 night and 3 day staycation was warm, friendly, willing to help, and genuinly seemed happy to be there. I have stayed in plenty of hotels and will maintain I have never received such quick and hospitable service as I have during our stay at the Gallery One.

title: Good choice
review: Stayed here one night before cruising on Oasis Of The Seas the following day. Was greeted at the taxi by the bag handler who promptly took our bags from us. We arrived at 10am and our room was ready! We were greeted warmly at the front desk and given some really good chocolate chip cookies.  Booked a two bedroom suite as there was four of us traveling. Lobby and hallways are nice and clean and the room was neat with plenty of space for four including a bathroom in each bedroom,kitchen with fridge,microwave and dining area. Area is super convenient as there is a publix supermarket,cvs  lot's of restaurants in the area and the galleria mall which has an excellent food court. .Only minor issue is that I felt that the balcony chairs and decor were not as nice as the room but not a…

title: goodd time
review: hotel and staff very nice under the circumstances that we were there in the first place.we were going on a cruise but the weather made it impossable the leave ,royal caribbean put us up in your hotel for two days .we were welcomed with warm cookies and big smiles. i do plan to come back he very soon your hotel not far from some of my family members that live in ft lauderdale ..

title: Good hotel but chaotic check-in
review: This is a good hotel with a great location and friendly staff. We were there for two nights and just before tropical storm Isaac arrived.  The hotel has a lot of good points. The valet parking and housekeeping teams were both excellent, very helpful, friendly and more than willing to help.  The suites are large, clean and well equipped and the location is excellent. The pool is a good size, the gym is small but well equipped and you are in walking distance of a really good choice of restaurants.   The check-in though was pretty chaotic. I understand that tropical storm Isaac had caused a lot of changes but it took a couple of hours to sort out check-in and get the room long after the official ready time. That sort of wait was not ideal sitting in the reception with tired small…

title: "Next door to a Mall"
review: My sister and I stayed here for one night August 25. We had reserved a queen room with a water view.  Because of the inpending storm Issac I guess the hotel wasn't as busy, so we got upgraded to a larger suite.  The suite had a kitchen, eating area, living room, king bedroom, 2 queen bedroom and two bathrooms, with a walk out balcony water view.  The room was nice, the beds comforter and bathrooms clean.  We also got two warm chocolate chip cookies when we checked in. My only complaints were the walls had marks all over them, water marks (I guess) and scuff marks.  And the silk flowers and plants needed a dusting bad. The door to the bacony had finger prints all over it and the couch sank when we sat on it.  Little things that made it not seem as clean as it could be.   Our room…

title: Doubletree Gallery One; our home away from home!
review: Melanise and I have been making the trip to Ft. Lauderdale for about 3 years now and each new visit is better than the previous one. This time we did the 3 day cruise to the Bahamas and as usual we stayed at the Doubletree before and after our cruise. The Hotel staff; especially Zeynep, the Front Desk Supervisor always treats us like royalty. We will be booking our next reservation for the upcoming Holiday Boat Show in December; and, of course; we will be staying at the Doubletree.

title: Large Suites and Good Views but with a few problems.
review: The good:  Nice staff at front desk and valet desk.  The rooms were large and the kitchenette had a dishwasher and microwave and two burner stove.  Hotel is very close to beach, shopping and is directly on the Interocoastal with a water Taxi stop.  The Galleria, CVS, Publix and a number of restaurants are within walking distance as is the beach.  Bed was comfortable and there was a nice balcony with two chairs and a table.  The room shuts off from the main area and there are flat screen TV's in both.  The bad:  When I got there most of the dishes were in the dishwasher and had to be unloaded.  There were very few utensils, no can opener, bottle opener, or sharp knives.  Coffee maker appeared to be dirty and counters were sticky.  Microwave turntable was in dishwasher and was…

title: Experience Galllery One
review: Thank you for your candid feedback of your stay at our hotel. We are very sorry that we did not meet expectations and we’re actively working with our housekeeping team to focus on cleanliness and comfort throughout our property.  We have noted the lack of supplies was an area of concern and we will work with our team in regards to this area of focus. We’ll keep your concerns in mind as we evaluate refresh options at our property. Thank you again, and we hope you’ll stay with us the next time your travels bring you back to the area.  Thank you  John Allan Hotel Manager

title: Very nice hotel
review: You haven't had a hotel experience until you have stayed in Gallery One. I'm not a cookie person but even though it was a short trip from the Bahamas the warm cookie was a relaxing treat at the check-in and of course my 11year-old son couldn't be satisfied with one.  The guys at the Front Desk and the valets were very friendly and were always willing to give directions and show you how to get around.  The rooms are neat and beautifully set up with all the amenities to make you feel comfortable.  One of the TV"s in the room wasn't working on the day we checked in but before I could have time to complain, it was replaced with a new one. We were told about the water taxi and I was sorry we waited until our last night to use it.  That was an experience - enjoying a ride on Fort…

title: Could not have been better!
review: The rooms are very spacious with fantastic views all around.  All of the staff were very kind & concerned about the stay.  I was even thanked by the housekeeping staff for staying!  Great visit overall.  The only downside were the 'valet only' parking & the fridge wasn't adjustable and didn't seem to get very cool.  Overall very good stay!

title: Would not hesitate to recommend to friends & fam...
review: Great staff... valet service was fast, friendly, & very helpful.  Got a nice dinner recommendation from them for this great place down the street across the waterway.  Amazing food & drinks at a great value.  Make sure to grab the large margarita... and the home made green (jalapeno & lemon/lime i think) hot sauce is a keeper.  Wanted to take that home with me.  The rooms at the hotel were very clean, spacious, and accommodating.  Bathroom was nice... spacious shower.  View from balcony was lovely.  Breakfast staff was great too.  Very accommodating.  This hotel was definitely a lovely addition to our trip.  Great location - short walk to beach, supermarket, cvs, good restaurants, & view.

title: The room was magnificent and the service excellent.
review: When I am in Ft' Lauderdale there is no other place I will stay! The kocation is excellent. Close to the ocean, close to shopping, and fine dining. The waterway taxi is an added bonus.The little "beach" is cute and adequate and a wonderful pool. This property is perfectlt situated.

title: Perfect
review: Its close to the beach, galleria mall, publix, cvs, and starbucks.  Hotel is affordable.  You can catch the water taxi from the pool or the galt ocean mile hop on hop off from galleria.  Hotel is very clean. Sigh, how i miss FLL

title: Great Hotel!
review: I stay in many hotels in Ft Lauderdale.  This is the best value I recieved in terms of the quality of the Hotel..I didnt even mind paying the Valet fee!

title: Great Family Vaca!
review: My wife and three children stayed at this hotel for a week in March- what a wonderful hotel.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The location is great- a Publix Supermarket and a pharmacy are right across the street along wiith a Starbucks (though a small location is located in the hotel).  A very nice mall with a food court are near by.  The walk to the beach is short- 5 to 10 minutes.  A few restaurants along the way.  A state park is about three blocks away- great place to see nature and get away from the city.  the hotel has a nice restaurant, bar, and pool area.  Even better, it is a water taxi location.  I cannot promote this hotel enough!

title: Gallery one
review: We decided to stay at this hotel because it's 10minutes from the airport, a nice walk you are at the beach, and Galleria Mall is like next door.We did see several well known restaurants also in the area.The staff starting with the valet were friendly and available.We had the good fortune to be hosted by Ryan Love who went out of his way (we think) to make our stay special.We were upgraded to a king suite with extra chocolate chip cookies. The suite overall was nice, there was that chair, and a Lilttle wear on the couch, but it was still nice, and the view no matter what time was fantastic. There are quite a few Hilton properties in the Fort Lauderdale area but location,location is everything .....along with staff...be prepared parking is 25.00

title: Nice but Noisy
review: We stayed here last week for three nights. The hotel is very nice, the intercoastal view king suite was very cozy and comfortable. We did not like that it is not clear when we booked that ONLY valet parking is available for $25/day. The hotel is noisy, you can hear music and or loud guests down by the bar area outside and you hear the traffic as it crosses the bridge. I also did not like that housekeeping does not empty the dishwasher. I thought previus guests were stealing things only to find the dishwasher full. The issue I have is you do not know how long the items have been in there. Now that we know what to expect, we would stay there again. It is vey convenient to the Galleria mall, lots a resturants and and our favorite french bakery on Federal Highway.

title: Excellent find in FLL
review: We recently stayed at this property. Found it updated. Rooms with kitchenettes, nice breakfast layout with separate living and bedroom areas. Staff was helpful. Parking was valet only, but was reasonably priced. Huge balcony with nice view of waterway.  Breakfast experience at the restaurant was above average and the service exceptional. Wil defintely stay here again when visiting the area.

title: I truly enjoyed this hotel!
review: Me and my husband spent three days @ this hotel. The room was clean and a decent size.  We spent most of the stay in the room and I must say it was like a home away from home! We spent $400 including valet parking, very cheap for such a nice suite. The pool area was also clean and lovely. Plenty of food choices and the beach in walking dustance.

title: Nice Suite for Five.
review: Booked a two bedroom suite for 5 people travelling.   Hotel is in a good location convenient to the beach, the port, and the airport. Located next to the mall and near a supermarket, it's a good choice for the area.   Suite had a total for 4 beds with a small kitchen that included a mini-fridge, plates, flatware, and glasses. Made for a convenient place to eat when ordering takeout pizza and salad.   Staff is extremely friendly, always smiling, and eager to help! The chocolate chip cookies are always warm and tasty as well.   If I were in the area, I would stay there again.

title: Gallery One
review: I visited with my family, the room was clean. The people were friendly! We  had so much fun! We went to the pool everyday, the kids enjoyed it and they were very happy! The whole family had a lot of fun,we played,we went in the pool/spa and just enjoyed it!We hope to go back there again!!

title: Annual Visit
review: My daughter and I stay in the Ft. Lauderdale Beach area every June to participate in an international swim meet.  This hotel has been a great choice the past few years.  My review is based on the actual room and the personnel at the check-in desk.  The hotel is perfect for an extended stay.  The room is clean, comfortable, and well maintained.  The kitchen and eating area are ideal for storing snacks & beverages.  The beds are comfortable and provide for a great night of rest.    I really appreciate that the bedroom is seperate from the main room.  It allows family members to sleep undisturbed while other members watch television.  I have had rooms on different levels and have not had any issues with noise disturbances.  The check-in is efficient and without challenges.  We…

title: Great Location.
review: Stayed here for 2 nights.  Booked this hotel because rooms have a kitchen.  The room was very comfortable with a separate bedroom from living room and kitchen.  Everything worked and was clean.  The kitchen was quite well equipped - we had breakfast and left overs and drinks.  The bathroom was very nice and spacious.  The beds very comfortable and all was clean.  Both the bedroom and the living area had a balcony with chairs that overlooked the canal. The hotel is literally just up from a large fabulous mall called the Galleria.  If you are there for the beach it is just a couple of blocks down. Lobby entrance is really nice - did not eat in the hotel. Staff were all pleasant and helpful, especially the doormen. As usual they charge an arm and a leg to keep your car parked and…

title: Cookies save the day
review: I had a great suite on 3rd floor. River view balcony. (try to get a higher floor). My suite was spotlessly clean, lavishly appointed and comfortable.   When I arrived, it was late and so I headed to the lobby bar for a beer and a menu. I ordered simple. Mahi sandwich. It oame 45 minutes later, and when it arrived it was I inedible. A fried greasy mess still delicately frozen in the center!   I was hungry but the DoubleTree cookies saw me through to breakfast. Strawberries and smoked salmon breakfast more than made up for the hellish night time repast.   I never normally eat in hotel restaurants, so this wouldn't scare me off from staying again. Super location, great rooms, nice staff. My only other comments would be        $25 for valet parking in Ft. Lauderdale is a little too…

title: very good surprise
review: We stayed several nights ,aug 2012 , in a " waterview suite with balcony" . and this is definitely what you should book . The hotel is located next to a mall, and on the intercoastal waterway .You're a few minutes away from the busy and touristic ocean bvd , which is nice . Melanie at the front desk is very helpful,  and gives you a welcome cookie :-) the decoration is simple but modern and subtle .there is a nice pool and a "beach" along the canal . The suite was big, king size bed, with two TV sets , a nice kitchen area fully equipped . large bathroom with shower . all in the beige tones . The only thing ... carpet ( 6th floor) in the hallway do need to be changed . really :-(  We din't try the restaurant for breakfast , as it's so convenient to stay in your room ..  This is…

title: Wonderful staff!
review: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May of 2012 for a family wedding.  A large group of us!  The staff was really terrific, very attentive and pleasant.  Rarely have I stayed in a hotel where even the custodial staff smiled and said good morning or good afternoon when passing you in the halls!  On our last day, check-out time was long before our flight home, but the staff graciously held our luggage for us, and after some time down by the beach and at the Hugh Taylor Birch State Park (where we rented a canoe and spent an idyllic hour on the lagoon), we hung out on the hotel's back patio and had drinks and enjoyed the view until departure time.  I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Ft. Lauderdale.  The hotel's outdoor pool was lovely and we used it…

title: Could be better
review: Spacious suites with all the amenities. Room, however, was a little worn with stains on carpet etc. Despite being on the 11th floor, traffic noise was loud--almost as if the windows don't have double-glazing. This is our second visit this week. The first night we stayed were made to feel like second-class citizen because we hadn't booked through Hilton. I was actually using up some United Airlines mileage points. Even though I'm a HHonors member I was told emphatically that I would earn no points at all--even from purchasing breakfast. After all, the man at the desk told me, this is a loyalty program. OK.   The forced valet parking is beyond a joke. On top of the daily $25 parking plus tax, you have the cost of tipping each time you get the car during the day. The $10 plus tax…

title: Excellent location on the intercoastal
review: We stayed for 3 nights at The Gallery One hotel, the front desk staff were very nive and helpful, they received us with delicious chocolate chip cookies and put us in a very nice room on the top floor directly over the intercoastal and seeing the oceal from a distance. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable (a suite really) with a reception, dining table and a kitchen. The hotel has its own water taxi stop which is extremely convenient, we did not use the car for the whole of our stay. Breakfast is ok but a little poor. The mall is just nextdoor. We will definitely return to Gallery One hotel.

title: Awesome Stay @ the Gallery ONE
review: Our ONE night stay at the Gallery One was great.  Not everything went perfect but we aren't ones to complain about every little thing.  We booked this hotel because we were scheduled to see the yacht out back for a wedding reception we are thinking about booking so it just made sense.  After booking the reservation, I called the hotel and asked for their best room as it was going to be a surprise for my fiance.  When I called they said they couldn't promise anything but that they would make a note.  To my surprise when we arrived, they were not only friendly and courteous but had gotten us a top floor room with a view of the inter-coastal.  PERFECT!  We got our complimentary chocolate chip cookie and headed to our rooms.  The suite we had was nicely appointed, updated and…

title: Good Value, Excellent Location
review: Arrived early for check in and found the front the desk busy since a large number of guests from the previous night decided to stay in their rooms and not check out.  This created a log jam for the in coming guests, us.  The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Since we were trying to check in early, only by an hour or so, they triads their best to find us a room.  We were up graded to an ocean view room with a large balcony.  The room was large, clean and well laid out.  The location of this hotel is on the intra coastal water way, and we rode the water taxi to nearby restaurants.  One draw back of this hotel I did not care for was the mandatory valet parking.  Some people love it, us not so much.  There is a parking garage, but it is reserved for valet only.…

title: Ok, but need some work done
review: Spent two nights here second year in a row. Short walk to the beach (5 min) and close to Galleria Mall. Suites ok, but we found them a bit "worn out", and this year we saw that they really needed some work done and that sofas and chairs really needed a replacement. Beds were really nice. Staff was friendly and helpful, especially the valet-guys/luggage help. Breakfastbuffet is pricy and ok, but could have had more choices. Ex no cheese or ham there. Also miss veggies, ex cucumbers and tomatoes. I give it a 3 because of the "worn out" furniture, besides that it's a 4,5 and I wouldn't mind stay there again.

title: Bed bugs included in the price
review: We recently experienced this hotel on our way for a cruise.  The pool was ok but not kept up during the day thus at the end of the day cans of Coke were your pool mates.  Then in the morning, we noticed bed bugs on our pillows....I noticed 3 bites on my right forearm!  When the front desk was informed they told that they would look into it......this is not a fake review unfortunetly. Jean-Claude Landa

title: Summer Vacation 2012
review: Hotel was chosen as the hotel for the family reunion. Staff was very helpful and nice facilities. Very spacious rooms, all suite style which include a kitchenette. The galleria mall was located in the next block, publix grocery store and cvs was across the street thus shopping for food, clothing or just about anything was pretty convienent. Pool was opened all the time. The hotel sat on the intercoastal canal like waters so the hotel had a mini each sand area of its own, in additon to be only a few blocks from Ft. Lauderdale Beach. There was plenty to do in the area for all ages. We drove to Sawgrass Outlets 20mins away, Hard Rock, the Jungle Queen Dinner Cruise. The only downside was that the hotel charged for parking.

title: Good spot for business
review: A business associate from the area recommended the hotel. Clean and very comfortable. My only regrets is the parking facility. You have no choice but to use valet parking at 25 dollars a day. This translates into long wait to get your vehicle and constant tipping. The gym is a bit small. Staff very helpful and welcoming.

title: Nice Hotel
review: We recently stayed here for two nights before embarking on a cruise. Upon arrival we were booked in a room on the top floor. We were satisfied with that until we got to the room and in the bedroom area of this two room suite was a skylight that could not be covered. So that meant the sun would be shining in early in the morning. Something that was not convenient for a family who likes to sleep later than 6am. A call down to the front desk and we were immediately taken care of. Another room was quickly found and we were now given the same type of room but with a great view of the water. Very pleased with how easily this was handled with no questions. The service overall was excellent. The front desk staff and the guys at valet were very helpful with any questions we had. Valet…

title: Great Service!
review: I have no complaints about the hotel itself. Staff was great, our room was HUGE. Booked a regular two bed room not sure if we were upgraded or all rooms were the size we had but we had a bedroom area- 2 queen beds with a HUGE bathroom. Double doors with dived the living room and full kitchen area not mention a balcony. Hot tub, decent sized pool, sandy area along where the boats dock with sunbeds you can lay on and nice outdoor area.   The only downfall of this hotel is it's not on beach, however it is definitely walkable (as we walked to and from the beach multiple times throughout our stay eta 12-15 minute walk) if you have a rental car or dont mind cabbing it I would deff recommend. Had such a great stay! Will return again.

title: Very nice hotel
review: I stayed here just one night for a business trip. This hotel is extremely clean and modern. I had a suite, which included a kitchen, dining, and living area. Although I did not need the extras, they would be great for a longer stay. My view from the 3rd floor was nice, but I think the higher floors get an ocean view. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. If I have to come back to FLL, I would definitely stay here again.

title: THE PLACE TO STAY!
review: My husband and I love this place! super spacious, super clean, staff is awesome, the location couldn't be better, the views are beautiful... I can only say good things about this place I didn't find anything wrong what so ever!! I recommend this place to everyone, 5 stars in our book :) we looking forward to a stay at this hotel again

title: 5 star service for a small price
review: Everything about this hotel was great even before we arrived.  We booked on hot-wire and will book here again without using hot-wire.  My husband called a few days before our trip and requested a king room which was no problem.  I called the day before we were to arrive to ask for an upgrade to a top floor with a view of the ocean.  It was my husbands birthday and I told them that I wanted it to be special for him.  We arrived about 9:30 am and a room was already available.  Our room was beautiful, spacious, clean with a fabulous view of the ocean and the intracoastal.  There was a decent size kitchen that if you wanted to cook a meal or two you would be able to. The living room was modern and comfortable, there was a dining table, large bathroom with a rainfall shower and a…

title: Great location, lovely suites but unfortunately average staff
review: Gorgeous hotel with amazing suite! We were lucky enough to have a room with an amazing view.  However, felt rushed with staff - not the most helpful.  Only stayed for 2 nights and had a chambermaid walk directly into our room in the morning while we were still in bed TWICE! Complained to reception who weren't phased by this.
