Would be a great hotel if a few of the staff were a litle bit more interested in their guests.  Hotel in excellent location - 10 min walk to beach and 10 min walk to the Galleria shopping mall - lots of lovely shops and restaurants.  Would love to go back to Fort Lauderdale but not this hotel.

title: Favorite Fort Lauderdale Hotel!
review: LOVE the location & feel of this property! Stayed at many Fort Lauderdale hotels & this is our favorite for sure! A 5 min. walk to the beach for us means a walk to the beach for a swim to start & finish the day! Water taxi stops right in front of the property, which is an excellent way to get around & be entertained. Seriously, make this your choice if you're thinking Fort Lauderdale. The only reason it's not listed as a 4-5 star is because the hotel doesn't have an onsite spa. Honestly, in my books it's a 5 star!

title: If only I knew.
review: Positives - very clean, and spacious rooms, we had a great view of the intracostal and ocean  - kitchenette was handy- big bathroom perfect for a family of 4 - nice balcony - exceptional service at front desk and housekeeping - nice patio area overlooking the waterway - water taxi right there- note it is a long taxi ride to stops 8 and 9 at least 1 hour - mall right beside hotel - Starbucks in the hotel  Negatives - just that 1 block to far from the beach, especially if it is hot. My kids are older but I cannot imagine walking that far with little kids and lugging all the stuff for the beach, also note it is a long walk for individuals with a physical disability or the elderly- - note parking is very hard to find if you drive to the beach - hotel pool is way to small for the…

title: Good Location 3 blocks from Beach and right next to Mall
review: Stayed here for two nights. Staff is so friendly. Had a great view of the canal and boats. You do have to pay for parking. Loved that the Mall was next door and you can walk to the beach and shops. Would stay here again. Did not know there was a water taxi until our stay was almost over. Will try it next visit.

title: Free parking in the garage next by the hotel?
review: I've stayed here twice before (2007 and 2008) and both times we parked our rental for free in the garage right next to the hotel. You had to do "everything" by your self, but at least it was free. Is that not an option any more? Also, just looking at google maps streetview I can see ALOT of parkings in the street in the neighbourhood. Are you not allowed to park there?

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Experience
review: Thank you for asking that question. Unfortunately there is no free parking in the Fort Lauderdale area for hotel guests.  The city operates metered parking that averages about $2.00 per hour.  The parking lot immediately in front of the hotel belongs to the Galleria Mall and we are not permitted to park there.  Parking on the streets around the hotel is also not permitted as the parking is reserved for residents.   The hotel offers very competitively priced valet parking for all guests at a cost of $24 per day and does not offer free parking in the garage next to the hotel.   Most hotels in the area charge between $25 and $35 dollars per day so we are the most economical option available. I hope that I answered your question.    John Allan  Hotel Manager

title: Super Suites....
review: We stayed here for 2 nights.  We drove up from Key West and was due to fly on to Harbour Island.    The hotel suites are great.  Large bedrooms offering wonderful panoramic views of the waterways.  There is a really reasonable water taxi service ($20 per person for a 1 day pass) offering 12 (could be 14) different stop 'n' drop locations.  The best bit is one is at the back of the hotel making it nice for late night drop off's.  Just a 1 minute walk away is large new Mall with plenty of dining options including a great bar with live music called Blue Martini (happy hour 1/2 price drinks from 5-8 every day).  Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a few days in Fort Lauderdale who doesn't want to drive anywhere.

title: LOVED it! Short walk to the ocean.
review: The slight upcharge for a room with a balcony was worth it. We sat out on the balcony which overlooked the pool and the waterway. We could see the Atlantic and the sklyine of Fort Lauderdale.   Our room was well appointed and perfectly clean. The bedroom was very quiet and we could not hear any noise from the hallway.  We were surpised by the fact that the room had a kitchen. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large with ample counter space and a walk-in shower.   The decor of the hotel was beautiful. Loved the pool area with a small beach that you could relax on, have a drink brought to you and watch the boats go by. Next time I will stay longer! The website does not do this hotel justice. I was surpised what a short walk it was to the beach.

title: Comfortable stay
review: 3 of us stayed for ten days in one of the 2 bedroom suites. Was very pleased with the room in general, although the kitchen was very small as was the fridge. Not a problem for us, we ate out every night but if you were staying in and entertaining it could be a struggle. The staff were very pleasant, especially the maids who were exceptionally nice and friendly. We spent a lot of time driving around on this trip, house hunting, so did not really spend too much time actually in the room. It was always very clean and tidy. If you are a hotel bar or pool fan you may be a little disappointed as there is little to no scene here and the pool is small and relatively unappealing. The only thing which bugged me was having to pay every day for the wifi ($9.95). Just a personal thing that…

title: Good Choice!
review: The Gallery One was a great choice for our family’s weekend in Ft Lauderdale.  The room was clean and well-appointed.  The hotel was conveniently located near shopping and restaurants, with a water taxi stop in front of it for easy transportation elsewhere.  The restaurant inside the hotel was good.  We had lunch outside and spent the afternoon at the pool.    For breakfast, the hotel offered a buffet as well as a full menu.  We chose the buffet the first morning, but were disappointed.  There were few selections to choose from and none were not replenished the entire hour we were there.  We found it overpriced and not worth it.  Our server was inattentive, despite few guests dining with us.    If our schedule would have permitted, we probably wouldn’t have gone back on the…

title: Florida family trip 2012
review: Front desk manager christoper GREAT!  He sells the location.  This hotel is best option for picky hotel folks like myself.  However, you will not feel like you are in paradise but you will be good.  They will fix and clean the small details they miss like window seals, balcony stuff. Great view,great customer service.  Great area.  Breakfast buffet terrible and over priced.  Better option order off menu if you must eat.   Advise to hotel get staff that focus on small details that mean lot.  The best cookies in the world! Starbucks on site.

title: The ONLY place I will stay at in Ft Lauderdale
review: My wife and I travel alot. Once a month we are somewhere. We love Ft Lauderdale for the beaches, the restaurants and the nightlife. And when we come to Ft Lauderdale the only hotel we consider is Gallery One Doubletree Suites.  I agree with another reviewer who specifically mentioned Christopher Byrne (front desk manager) as an exceptional employee.  I have seen him standing in the lobby on many of our trips but we never knew who this young man was. On our last visit he approached us and said he recognized us from a previous visit and he introduced himself and apolgized for the line at check in. He then disappeared for a moment and then returned with our key cards and said to stop at the desk later to complete the check in procedure.  What an impression that left us with!  As…

title: Very Good Hotel
review: This truly is an excellent hotel and I agree with all positive reviews . Reasonably priced.Well located: on intracostal waterway ( water taxi stops in front of the hotel), Galleria Shopping Mall is just around  corner ( very nice shopping place and a few fine restaurants). Publix (one of US supermarket/ grocery chains) is across the street. Beach is about 8-10 minutes walk across the bridge. Beautiful Bonnet House is also around the corner ( about 5 minutes walk). I was solo traveller and I did not need a car. If you want to go to Sawgrass Mills Outlet Shopping Centre and do not want to pay taxi you may take public transit (Bus No. 36 stops across the street, just 2 minutes walk from the hotel, the fee is $1.75 one way.It takes you directly to Sawgrass Mills. The trip is about 1…

title: The Best Hilton brand in Ft. Lauderdale
review: As travel agent and a Hilton Diamond member my expectations are flexible but high. Chris Byrne, the front office Manager of The Double Tree Gallery One and his entire staff are some of the most courteous and best trained customer service people that I have experienced at any hotel. In Ft. Lauderdale there are many choices and several Hiltons to choose from, I have stayed at the other 3 Hiltons which FYI none are directly on the beach but 2 are across from beach, so if on the beach is a must then Gallery One is not for you. But beware everything you want when you’re done with the beach is truly within walking distance to Gallery One and my prediction is that you will end up in a car or a cab from the beach over the bridge to this area at some point and if its Las Olas Blvd you’re…

title: Didn't want to leave!
review: This place was so nice and well equipped that I didn't want to leave! Our suite had everything that you would need....comfy bed, lovely bathroom, nice sitting area, generous kitchen and an amazing view. Staff and parking attendants were helpful and very accommodating. Our room was also very quiet! Negatives: Yes...I agree parking charges were almost a deal breaker, but given the value of our room and the fact that my brother-in-law agreed to split those charges with us-I overlooked this minor inconvenience, also free wifi isn't provided in the rooms and some of the furnishings showed the usual hotel wear. Positives: Great location with easy access to the beach, adjacent to the Galleria Mall which makes it convenient to restaurants and shopping as well. I didn't take the water…

title: Beds are Heaven
review: Came all the way from Colorado for a family get together.  Rooms are very clean and roomy. The beds are beyond comfy. The only complaint would be the cost of parking per night.

title: Great Service
review: I got an early check in and the hotel is clean service was incredible. Close to the galleria with many nice restaurants.

title: Still A Nice Place!
review: We stayed here on June 8th only for a few hours. Got a reasonable day rate since we were returning from a cruise in Miami and had to fly out of Fort Lauderdale later that evening. I have stayed here before and it was nice then and we found it to still be a nice hotel this visit. Our room was clean. I love the area! The cookies are delicious. The only negative thing...upon check out, I felt the desk clerk could have been a bit more hospitable. I would stay here again!

title: Great Holiday
review: This hotel is really amazing and I got an AWESOME deal on hotels.com.  The only thing is that you have to pay for parking.  $21 for self park and $25 for valet.  If you can, go for the valet it's worth the extra $4.  The water view is amazing.  The king had a full kitchen, dining area, living room, balcony and separate bedroom.  Will definitely stay here again!

title: Best hotel for $ value
review: Gallery one is located in the heart of fort lauderdale, next to a shopping center and a short walk from the beach. The accommodations r wonderful! Staff is great, 5 star amenities, cannot get better! Definitely recommend it be it for business or leisure! Great location for families...you won't go wrong

title: A wonderful full service hotel near the beach
review: I have many choices when I travel to Ft. Lauderdale, FL and decided during the week of Memorial Day to stay for 4 nights. I was not disappointed! I was able to cehck-in early and started my vacation at the pool bar.  Adriana Bolivar was working this area and was a great representative for the Hilton brand. She remembered my name later in the day when I came back down for some Starbucks coffee.  I looked forward to seeing her everyday either by the pool or inside bar.  I was thrillled to be able to see the intercoastal outside with the boats and bridges in my view by the pool. If you are thinking about staying in the Ft. Lauderdale area, please give this hotel a try. You will not be disappointed.. Also, whenever I re-entered the hotel from the beach or whatever...I always…

title: Rating could be better if not for my first room (bugs, but not in the bed)
review: My first room had a number of bugs on the walls and ceiling (none in the bed that I saw). I killed 9-12 before going down to the font desk to let them know.  The desk person was very apologetic and  helpful and moved me to a different room immediately no questions asked.  The way this was handled is the reason I may consider giving the hotel a second chance on my next visit to the area in a couple of weeks.  Also, neither of the other two rooms my party occupied had bugs or other issues.   Pros: Nice area. Convenient access to the water taxi.  Beautiful views from the right rooms, comfortable beds, good service.  Cons: Expensive valet only parking but their service was friendly.  If your room is on the 6 lane road (3 each way) side of the hotel it can be noisy.  Buffett…

title: A very good hotel, excellent service, excellent location.
review: We stayed 9 days and everything was very good since we arrived until we left. I studied all the comentaries (starting with the worst) and I was worrying of having made a bad selection, but it was a good experience. We had a room in front of the bridge and the noise was not as commented, but of course is better to the south. The price we paid was reasonable comparing with the other hotels in the area, but the restaurant (room service) is kind of expensive. Take into account they have a special fare including valet parking. Great service of all the personnel.

title: great rooms
review: had a room with ocean view which paid extra for but worth it. clean well equipped room with small kitchen area  staff ok if nothing special 5 mins from the beach and a water taxi stop at the hotel which was useful and we bought the day ticket that we got full value from

title: Look elsewhere...
review: We stayed in the two bedroom suite over the spring break this year and we were very disappointed. The rooms were nicely laid out, but house keeping was very poor. The kitchen had dirty dishes in the dishwasher on our arrival. The bathrooms had stains and the carpets were sticky.   They only valet parking, and i found this to be extremely inconvenient. The location was nice, but access was difficult because you had to go east and do a uturn if you were headed to the west.   We booked here because the price was right, but it wasn't worth the savings. You get what you pay for.

title: Beautiful rooms made up for disinterested service....
review: Stayed at this hotel for one night while visiting FLL. We were in love with the large beautiful suites. I have to say, we felt like somebody very important. The rooms are huge and very new feeling. We also had a nice balacony overlooking their small pool.  In all the staff we encountered, everyone just went through the motions, but I wouldnt call anyone extraordinary. We didnt mind very much because we were able to spend a lot of time in our room, given the size.  This hotel is in an excellent location for getting around on the water taxi. It picks up right in their "backyard" as it is on the intercoastal. We were able to get around FLL without using our rental car.  Lastly, another poor breakfast experience. They seemed to be very short staffed.... All in all, would return.…

title: Beautiful, contemporary, modern but with 1 major problem
review: The Gallery One Double Tree runs to my taste in hotels – modern and contemporary.  The suite setup is nice, though the rooms are smaller than a typical Embassy Suites suite setup.  The water views from the fairly large balconies are exceptional – especially on higher floors (I was on the 10th floor) – though the balconies are not very private.  The furniture and bed are very comfortable and the mini-kitchen is handy if you want to cook something on the stove, in the toaster, or the microwave.  There is a full selection of dinnerware silverware and glassware (tumblers, rocks and wine glasses) in addition to the glasses in the bathroom.  The glass walk-in shower is large with a nice rainwater showerhead and the bath amenities are top-shelf.  Room service menu is broad, though…

title: Spacious suites and very helpful staff
review: We had a very pleasant 3-night stay at the Gallery One.  The location is great -- on the intracoastal waterway, a short walk from the beach, and across the street from the shopping mall.  The suites are spacious, and the beds are very comfortable.  (We didn't pull out the sofa bed, so I can't rate that.)  The pool is very nice, overlooking the intracoastal waterway, so you can lounge next to the pool and watch all the yachts go by!  For the price that we paid, it was a very good value.  The staff are extremely nice, helpful, and competent, from the front-desk staff to the people in the restaurant and the cleaning staff.  One example:  There was a problem with our room when we first checked in.  I called the desk to report it, and within 15 minutes we had been moved to a…

title: Best Hotel in Fort Lauderdale
review: This place is as good as it gets in this area.  If you're looking for a great hotel near everything this is the one.  Great rooms, views, and service.  Highly recommend.

title: Good Location, nice rooms for the price
review: We stayed at the Gallery ONE, Doubletree Guest Suites Hotel for one night prior to a cruise.  The hotel is easily located and in a nice area.  It is on one of the intercoastal waterways and water taxis are available.  The room was a small suite with kitchen, small living room with TV and bedroom with TV and a lovely bath with shower, no tub.  Our room faced the parking lot but we were not there for the view.  This could be why we got a good rate.  The hotel itself is very nice with a lovely patio and sunbathing area as well as pool.  There is a restaurant in the hotel but we did not use it.  The desk service was very friendly and helpful.  They only have valet parking but they are very efficient.  Just a short drive to the beach.  Free Internet on the first and second floor…

title: The best place and location
review: We have been visiting Fort Lauderdale from time to time and we beleive that we have found the perfect place. Close to everything (beach, restaurant, shopping and bars). This hotel is lovely, well decorated, and the service is excellent. The water taxi is at the dock right in front of the hotel. It is fun to swim in the heated pool while boats pass by on the intercostal. You wont be dissapointed !

title: Great Hotel for Girls Trips
review: I stayed here with my two best friends before a cruise in March. From the time I entered the hotel, we were treated wonderfully. Not to mention the fabulous, warm, chocolate chip cookies you get when you arrive. Oooh, they were delicious! We received a complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite, which had one room with two Queen Beds, and another with a King Bed. Each room had its own bathroom. Perfect for three women! Everything was clean, and our balcony (just one, off the room with two beds) overlooked the Intracoastal Waterway. We had a view of the Atlantic Ocean in the distance.   The location was great for us. We rented a car, and were able to have lunch at Coconuts (yum), dinner at Truluck's (fabulous!), and go dancing at the Blue Martini (a block away). A Publix…

title: One of the best hotels around!!
review: This was a fantastic hotel. The valet service was A++++. The front desk staff on check in were fast and warm. Made us feel welcome!! The room was clean, great sitting room and kitchen. The bathroom was easily accessed for my Mom with mobility issues. The beds were very comfortable. The housekeeping staff were great! The breakfast was amazing in the dining room. Again customer service all the way!! Nothing was too much trouble for these folks. If I were the manager of this hotel I would be very proud of my staff. I will stay here again.  Great location. Walk across the street to drug store, Publix, huge shopping mall. Most hotels in the area do Valet parking only. I do not love valet parking but it is part of the deal in Ft Lauderdale so just accept it folks.

title: I would stay here again
review: Hotel management was very accommodating. If you stay in a room by the drawbridge be prepared for announcements into the night and early morning. There is a Starbucks on site. Water taxi. Nice pool. When leaving the property by car you need to g around the side of the hotel if you are not headed to the beach due to the median. There's lots to do on close proximity to his hotel such as the galleria mall, the beach, and nightly local events

title: I would come again
review: This was my 3rd stay in this hotel. For our purposes it's great. Room price was a bit higher for us but still acceptable. Next time we would come again here. Only internet needs improvement. And pool area should be cleaner. In grnetal it is nice and very convenient hotel.

title: Great post - cruise stay
review: We stayed at Gallery One at the beginning of April 2012, after a cruise from Fort Lauderdale.   It was a perfect place for our needs.  There were 4 of us and the room was large with 2 seperate bedrooms, a kitchen area with full fridge and dishwasher, tea and coffee and hob and microwave.  Both bedrooms had en suite bathrooms and it was very clean and well maintained. Right next door to the Galleria shopping Mall, we were able to do our last minute shopping and there were restaurants right on our doorstep (although very pricey)   The hotel restaurant had a good selection of dishes and also a special offer of 2 courses for 2 people at a low price ($40 I believe).  Breakfast was a la carte or buffet, which we opted for and it was fine - although not as extensive as other hotels…

title: great hotel
review: normally i would have given this hotel 5 stars, but the parking issue reduced it to 4 stars. the hotel is very nice and the beds are very comfortable, a great place to stay, but the valet parking only can get expensive.

title: Run down, future pricing former glory.
review: This is my third time at this hotel, you keep paying more for less. The beds are very comfortable and the staff is super friendly, don't forget the warm cookie at check-in. Now add $25 everyday to park the rental car that you only paid $15 a day for and $9.95 each day for wifi and things really add up. We stayed in one of the suites on the 14th floor, the views are spectacular. Unfortunately, the furniture is very run down, the decor is tired and the giant red square logo only lights on one side. Next year I'll spend my $4800 somewhere else.

title: Take the water taxi for tour of the stars
review: We stayed at the Gallery One Doubletree the day before our cruise left.  This is a well maintained property in a great location.  Only two blocks from the Ocean and restaurants.  A jog on the sidewalk along the beach revealed the younger crowd and happy hour at full blast about a mile south.  Back to reality at the suite-very good size-pull out couch in the living room with small kitchenette, balcony and large two bed bedroom.  It had to be one of the most comfortable beds I every slept in.  The water taxi stops at the hotel and takes you downtown.  It was about a 30 - 40 minute ride with several stops.  Our Captain was very funny and had obviously been doing this for a while.  He gave us the tour of the rich and famous of houses as he worked the waterways.  We were starving as…

title: Excellent hotel, we liked it
review: Our family vacation in Florida started with 3 nights at Gallery One and we liked this hotel.  + : Location is close to the lovely beach (short walking distance, max 10 min) + : The 2-bedroom appartment we got were located at the 8th floor, overlooking both the canals, the Ocean and the city (see the pictures) + : Comfortable beds +: Pool and jacuzzi were warm and clean + Water taxi stop right at the hotel back area +: Good breakfast buffet and service in the restaurant  -: tiny balcony with simple chairs -: Rather simple kitchen  - : Front desk staff was not really willing to help us with where to buy groceries when we arrived late evening  We would stay there again

title: convenient
review: This hotel was recommended by Celebrity Cruises.  It was clean, pleasant, well appointed.  OUr only negative was that it was advertised as "waterfront everywhere" and our room faced the registration parking lot.  But we were only there for the night before a cruise.  The restaurant was fine for our purposes (right there!) and has a nice view of the water.  We would stay again.

title: not much attention to detail
review: Stayed here with my wife last week.  This hotel is nothing special, don't be fooled by the "suites" name.  It was ok, pretty standard accommodations; there was a burned out lightbulb on the counter in the bathroom and nobody swept the balcony off because the previous guest clipped their toenails and I was fortunate enough to step on them, pretty gross.  All in all a decent place I suppose, but I'm gonna try my luck somewhere else next time.

title: Good for pre-cruise, not vacation!
review: Okay overall, this is not a bad hotel.  However, your level of satisfaction will depend on what you're doing in Fort Lauderdale.  Staying a night or two before a cruise?  Great!  This hotel will totally suit your needs.  Visiting multiple nights for vacation?  Go elsewhere.  Don't get me wrong, I have no major complaints about Gallery One's service or amenities.  The rooms are great size and very convenient, and free breakfast is great!  However, the "short walk" to the beach is not as short as implied.  It's quite a walk, especially during the HOT summer months.  Being so far from the beach itself takes away from the "beach vibe" of your vacation.  The hotel just doesn't feel like a vacation spot, it feels like it could be anywhere, USA.  Basically my husband and I felt a…

title: The Vue Restaurant - poor
review: The restaurant service was horrible.   The bar staff are expected to wait on the tables, serve the customers at the bar and serve poolside.  We waited for over half hour before we were waited on and then totally ignored the rest of the meal.  We had to keep getting up and walking over to the bar to get drinks refilled, ask for condiments, etc.  We also had to go to the bar to get the bill and pay.  We were not acknowledged upon leaving.    Prices were high and food quality was also poor.

title: Perfect in every way!
review: We visit our daughter and her family near Fort Lauderdale many times a year.  We've been looking for the perfect hotel to be "where we stay" when visiting.  This is it!!  The hotel is impecably maintained.  The staff is extremely accomodating.  We spent an afternoon at the Red Door Spa which is walking distance from the hotel.  Galleria Mall is also walking distance and has several great restaurants.  The hotel has a cozy bar area that is great for an evening cocktail.  We had a lovely balcony with a view of the city and waterway. The valet parking is great. The all suite and nonsmoking feature of the hotel is fabulous!! This hotel has it all, great location, great service, great room amenities, etc.

title: Great Hotel in Many Ways
review: We recently stayed here for 3 nights, and had a great experience. The staff was very attentive and helpful, and we really enjoyed the Valet people, they were a lot of fun to visit with and gave good advice on eating places and directions. The rooms were very clean, and the location was great, right on the waterway. We loved watching the drawbridge from our balcony!! The restaurant on location seemed expensive, but we were able to walk a short distance to get some really good food, thanks again to the Valet guys!! It was a great value, very clean, great staff, and would stay there again!!

title: Loved this hotel
review: Fantastic hotel, brilliant location. lovely clean modern comfortable bedroom and bathroom. valet parking. pool deck next to water taxi. kictchen/lounge area was comfortbale.less than 5 minutes walk to Macys/mall.would stay here again.

title: Very Nice Property in a Great Location
review: I had read the mostly positive reviews, but was so pleasantly surprised when I got there.  Check in was a breeze, and the clerk was extremely helpful in giving us information on the water taxi, which stops right out the back door of the hotel.  I was amazed at the room...two room suite with a kitchen that overlooked the waterway.  It was clean and very comfortable.  We took advantage of the water taxi, the Galleria Mall next door, and the numerous restaurants nearby.  The hotel has a lovely back patio that overlooks the waterway, and even though the bar out there was closed, you could get a drink from the inside bar and take it outdoors.  I was too busy sightseeing to try the pool, but there was a nice sand "beach" area out back behind the patio, near the pool, and it looked…

title: Perfect Location and Wonderful Amentities
review: I loved the Gallery One Doubletree.  It was a huge hotel room with plenty of space to hang out in.  They had a nicely heated pool that was clean.  You are very close walking distance to the beautiful beach, and within walking distance of some really nice restruaunts and a cute Martini bar.  It was about a $15 cab ride downtown where all the big bars and awesome clubs are. The service could have been nicer at the restruaunt/ starbucks area, but over all, me an my two friends had a fantastic time.  I would definitly go back.

title: Hotel okay - SERVICE AWFUL
review: Hi all i recently stopped here booked by royal Caribbean cruises  - the hotel was average, rooms a bit tatty. and wasn't VERY clean - i wouldn't stay here again  however the bad service came when i had 3 authorisations to my card all for around 50 to 60 dollars - i called the hotel from the uk, to be told accounts will call you back, still 1 week later no call.  i phoned them again and again accounts will call me back  i finally got this escalated through my bank and the funds returned - however if you have any dealings with this hotel KEEP ALL CARD DOCUMENTS/RECEIPTS AS YOU WILL NEED THEM AGAIN - BEWARNED

title: Loved This Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed her for two nights before our cruise. We loved the room, the location. The only issue we had was no free wifi in the room.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel, Close to all!!!
review: I read some of the great reviews before I booked, so I thought I would return the favor.   We stayed in room 402, which is a handicap accessible room. I I like to be near the elevator, since I have some trouble with my knee. The room has a nice open layout with a separate King size bedroom. It has a nice water view of the intracostal. The kitchen was nicely outfitted with a mini-fridge, stove top, and microwave, which was perfect for breakfast and snacks (this saves a bundle if you have kids).  The hotel is ideally situated and close the Beach and there is a Publix, CVS and a nice mall all right there. We used the water taxi right outside to take us to the beach, which was great.  The hotel is only about a 10 minute taxi ride to the cruise port. The staff was friendly, the hotel…

title: Pre Cruise Stay
review: We stayed at this hotel on March 29th and 30th before our cruise out of Port Everglades.  I was traveling with my husband, 2 daughters (ages 10 and 8) and my parents.  We had a 2 bedroom suite which worked out perfectly for us.    We arrived around midnight the first night and check in was uneventful since it was so late.  Even though it was late, we still received their homemade cookies!  The room was the perfect set up for our family.  We basically went right to sleep that night since we were exhausted after a full day of travel to get there.  The next morning I got up early to shower.  Our shower had a drainage issue and was filling up fast!  I had to take a quick shower or water would have overflowed into the bathroom.  I called the front desk and a maintenance guy was up…

title: Comfortable pre-cruise stay - great beach location!
review: We stayed at the GalleryOne hotel for one night while in Ft. Lauderdale before leaving on a cruise. We arrived to check in just after 4pm and were able to go straight to our room, which had been upgraded from a double to a king sized suite. The room was fresh, clean, and really quite large. The kitchen was nicely outfitted with a mini-fridge, stove top, and microwave, which was perfect for making breakfast in the morning. There is a Publix and a CVS across the street from the hotel, which was great for picking up last minute items. In addition, there is a French bakery across the street, which was great for breakfast.  We had drinks at the lobby bar before heading to dinner with some friends – the bar staff was very friendly and the drinks were good.  The hotel is ideally…

title: Pre cruise stay
review: We stayed at this hotel for four nights before a cruise, it has a very nice location, at the side of a shopping mall, close to beach and on a water taxi stop. The rooms are very spacious with a kitchen area, dining table, living area and a separate bedroom and bathroom, the balcony had good chairs and table on it and in our case we had a good view of the waterways and of Fort Lauderdale city centre. In relation to the room the only bad point was that it also looked out over the rear yard for the hotel and at times this was noise (a simple canopy near to the loading bay and compactor would have reduced the noise level and also made the area look better. The bar area was very nice and the prices where reasonable We only used the restaurant twice on an evening, the food was first…

title: HOTEL IS NICE. BUT IS NOT WHAT YOU WOULD EXPECT. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.
review: I stayed here for one night. I arrived at the Hotel around 11:00am. There is no self parking. So I parked by the enterence while I went to check in. The front Desk guy Ryan was not very nice I was paying cash and I was told no it had to be a credit card. So I began to leave and go somewhere else. Until the discovered that I was a Hilton Diamond member then there attitudes changed. I had to wait cause no room was ready. So I went outside and asked a valet if I could get them to store my bags. He was a young little punk who said next time leave your damn keys cause it's blocking traffic. Got to my room around 1:30pm. I called for a taxi and I told them I would be ready in about 30 min. I went to the lobby a few min later I walked outside and told the valet that I was the one that…

title: Business trip - Clean hotel with a good location
review: Company selected this hotel for meeting. The rooms were nice suites with comfortable bed and very clean. Good location near plenty of dining. Right on the intracoastal, outdoor bar and water taxi are right from patio.  See attached photos of guest room.

title: Very nice rooms in a great location
review: Very nice rooms in a great location!  The staff was very curtious and the warm cookies are a nice touch.  Has a small refridgerator but no freezer in the kitchen.  Balcony was nice.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: One block from the beach, beautiful spot on the waterway - not bad at all.
review: We were here for a business conference. Brought the family along. They enjoyed the short walk to the beach and the nice spot on the canal.  Of course the cookies are always a major highlight at the Doubletree!  The $24 per day parking is a ripoff but the valets were friendly.  Great staff all the way around - even the housekeeping staff were exceptionally friendly!

title: Reasonably priced and in a great location!
review: I stayed here for a work function and brought my family along.  The area offers something for everyone and the hotel rooms were spacious and clean. I would stay here again.

title: Weekend Wedding
review: We received a special rate as part of a wedding.  The service was excellent and staff all very friendly and willing to go the extra mile.  I would have rated this lower had I not had a water view suite as there is no other view. It is located on the river with a Water Taxi stop right in front of the hotel - worth taking.  The food was very good and a Starbuck's in the lobby. Pool was average and Bar/food service was slow. I would go back when it is updated - carpeting is worn and paint needs attention, but it was clean.

title: Great location!
review: Enjoyed sitting out on our balcony in the early evening watching the boat traffic. The water taxi stops right at the hotel.  One stop away is great dining. Unit provided small refrigerator, microwave & dishwasher.  Also had in-room safe.  Very small outdoor pool.  Good pre-cruise location.  Good shopping across the street for last minute items.  Staff is very friendly to its guests.  However, they were severely understaffed during our stay and promised rooms were not available until very late...5:00 or later.  We were upgraded to a waterfront suite because our room was not ready on time.  It was a great room. Our traveling companions got their room by 4:00 but no towels were available until 6:00!  We were told by staff that college-aged guests had caused damage to some rooms…

title: Gallery ONE - Management ZERO
review: Our visit started with being given a room key to an occupied room.  I entered the room to see three startled young children looking at me.  I apologized and as I was returning to the elevator, a concerned father came out to question me.. I couldn't blame him.  Back down to the lobby to wait 45 minutes for a room after arguing with the manager for 15 minutes as to what constituted a water view room.  This place has been in decline ever since they started selling the rooms as condos.  The front-desk and management are clueless.  The housekeeping is useless .. you may as well clean the room yourself.  Our second last day there, we were out of the room from 11 am to 4 pm.  We returned to an unclean room.  Went out again from 5pm to 11pm and told the front desk on the way out that…

title: Nice hotel in great location
review: Very nice hotel in a great location just steps away from the Galleria Mall and all of the restaurants and the beach and all that goes with that. The rooms are pretty nice equipped with a up to date kitchenette with granite countertops, refrigerator and dishwasher. Flat screen HDTV's with plenty of channels to choose from and there is a good restaurant for breakfast. The pool area is nice as well and there's a good bar and menu for lunch. You can walk to everything - highly recommend.

title: Upon entry through departure
review: the staff was welcoming & professional. My one bedroom suite was fully appointed w/ kit.,liv., dining and beautiful large bath. The Inlet/Ocean view was accessible by 2 balconies. The hotel felt quite modern & freshly cared for in every regard. Location is a water taxi stop/ within walking distance of Galleria Mall and many restaurant choices. As a frequent traveler, I will highly recommend and hopefully return! Janet Barber

title: Perhaps needs slight modernization
review: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel - the last time was post cruise and it seemed nice .  This time I felt that some of the decor in the rooms was begining to become a little jaded and worn . However this was more than made up for by the enthusiasm of the staff to help guests, particularly Ryan on the front desk  . On the night of our arrival , we were upgraded to a river view suite , however as it didnt have a balcony , we declined . He tried very hard to get us one but as the hotel was full we were given a city view , with the promise that he would see what became available , True to his word we were moved on the Sunday into a Riverview/part ocean view, with balcony . There was a bit of noise from the adjacent tilt bridge but nothing that kept us awake . During…

title: Very nice, centralized location
review: Stayed at the Gallery One for 3 nights and overall this was a good hotel. I am a firm believer in ' you get what you pay for' and you really do. Even though we arrived after 3 our room was not ready. The actual suite was very nice, roomy and the bathroom was very nice. The bed was super comfy. I did not want to leave the bed. Our balcony was large and even though we had the city view it (the noise) did not bother me. The lobby can be busy because the water taxi traffic but unless you sit in the lobby your whole stay its not that bad. The Vue (which is the restauraunt inside the hotel) was very good. They have a really good breakfast buffet for $20..but again you get what you pay for. The mall is very close and so is Publix and CVS. You can take a ten minute walk to the beach or…

title: Great Location
review: Very nice hotel, within short walking distance of many restaurant, shoppings and the beach.

title: Prime location, high class service & accommodation
review: We were able to book the Doubletree Guest Suites Hotel in Ft. Lauderdale directly from our Doubletree Hotel Resort in Key West. We found the location excellent on Sunrise Blvd. and so easy to find once arriving in Ft. Lauderdale. It was an excellent choice of accommodation for us as it was only minutes away from the Ft.Lauderdale airport. Our suite was sumptuous, large and clean - a two-double bed room with living room, kitchenette with balcony overlooking part of the inland waters. Our one-night stay permitted us to dine at the suite hotel dining room where the food was excellent. We highly recommend the Doubletree Guest Suites Hotel (Ft. Lauderdale) with prices that reflect the high-quality of its service and first class accommodation. We will certainly return given another…

title: Nice location and wonderful view
review: We stayed only on night. He hotel is really close to Galleria Mall, Publix, etc. The rooms are big, bed could be bigger. The view was wonderful. The only thing is that we had a false fire alarm at 4 AM, but this wasn't a hotel's fault.

title: Good family hotel
review: The hotel is a good choice for families; the kitchen was equipped with a refrigerator, stove and microwave, which was very convenient, located across the street was a CVS and just a little bit further was a Publix grocery store so we could purchase snacks and milk for our toddler.  There is a small pool that never got crowded so we were able to take our daughter to the pool, even at peak periods of the day, and even get lounge chairs.  There were a couple nicer restaurants within walking distance and the location was fine since we had a rental car with us if we wanted less pricier dining options.  However if we were to come back to Fort Lauderdale without our daugther, we probably would not stay here.  While it was a short walk to the beach, it was still not where all of the…

title: Nice hotel. Had everything we needed
review: We stayed here for a night during our vacation and stayed in their two bedroom suite. The price was very good for this room. It was a very nice setup and all 6 of us were very comfortable. The suite even had a balcony. Hotel was very clean with a modern decor. Hotel staff was very accomodating even allowing us to stay a bit past the typical 11:00am checkout. This gave us some additional morning time to spend at the beach which was just a 5 min walk away. The Galleria mall was a short walk away as well. They are also right on the water taxi route which although we didnt use, was a very convenient feature. It also has a starbucks as well as an inside bar and an outside bar. We will definitely stay here again when in Fort Lauderdale.

title: Solid Hotel - Business or Pleasure
review: Thank you for your review and we are delighted that you enjoyed our hotel during your stay.   Our spacious suites and convenient location and amenities make a great destination for families like yours.  We hope that you return with your family and take advantage of the scenic intercoastal views the water taxi provides.

title: Good location close to the beach and Galleria Mall
review: I spent 3 days at this hotel for a business meeting.  The meeting room was spacious and the banquet staff was fantastic.  The food for banquets was above average. I do a lot of meetings around the country and having a good meeting room with attentive banquet staff and solid food goes a long way.  As far as the hotel is concerned, the location is great.  If you are a boat lover, you can sit and relax and watch all the different kinds of boats go by on the intercoastal.  The water taxi spot is convenient.  The rooms are modern and spacious.  I had a water view room with a balcony (ask for that room) as this is the best view.  The cons of the hotel are that the bridge is NOISY if you are facing it. So make sure you ask for a room not facing it.  Also this seems like a transit hotel…

title: Great Hotel
review: We appreciate you taking time to share your experience and I’m delighted to hear your enjoyed your meeting.  We are fortunate to have one of the best meeting facilities in the area and I’ll make sure to share your feedback with our Banquet team. I thought it would be beneficial to let you know that our Fitness Center is being completely renovated to provide our guests with a great new facility.  Again thank you for your feedback we hope that you come back soon.

title: Excellent Stay
review: This hotel is a good hotel for a short stay-over in Fort Lauderdale. It is close to the inter coastal waterway and the water taxi stops at the hotel. The pool bar is average, the indoor restaurant does not make it to the top. THen better to go to the restaurants at the Galleria Mall. Room standards are very good with nice bath room. The room was very clean and the service excellent.

title: this is fabulous or icky - it depends
review: The hotel has a great location.  You can walk to the beach, and later in the day you can walk to the mall to shop or have dinner.    There's even a drug store (CVS) a block away.  You can stock your fridge, and benefit from the fully equipped kitchen.  It's kind of weird (as others have mentioned) that the dishes are in the dishwasher and you get to put them away.  On the other hand, there are dishes and a functioning kitchen.  So that makes it OK.  Icky?  The cockroach that walked across the kitchen counter.  I caught and released him!  Also, the mirrors are streaked.  Why is that?  The front desk staff are great.  The food is good.  The water taxi stops at the edge of the property.  There is plenty to recommend this place.  If they'd up the cleanliness, it would be a 5 star.

title: Exceptionally Average
review: The hotel looks good and is in a great location. And that's where it ends. The staff were laconic and seemed to have no knowledge of the area. There is no concierge, so we asked the desk staff if we could walk to Bonnet House. He didn't think so.  Bonnet House is listed as one of the top attractions in Ft. Lauderdale and he didn't even know it was about two blocks away!! They wouldn't call us a cab for the airport - they would only book us their "limo"  which was more expensive than a taxi ride. We had a two-bedroom suite. It was fine - nothing special, but okay - could have been a little cleaner, could have had a few more basics in the kitchenette. We went to the coffee bar to get our coffee, as the coffee maker didn't work well and produced a very weak cup of coffee. We came…

title: Great value
review: My wife and I stayed here while on a weekend away.  The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful.  It was a short walk to the beach, but a long walk to downtown Ft. Lauderdale.

title: More than we would usually pay - but worth it!
review: First of all, the location is GREAT.  We had a water view suite overlooking the intercoastal and it was lovely.  First night walked over the bridge to a wonderful local Italian restaurant where we had wine, salad and pizza for less than $30!  Bed was soooo comfy and with two flat screens - easy for the two of us if we had different choices.  We walked 2 blocks to the beach and strolled for an hour - then took a $.50 trolley ride (I believe it only operates on weekends) back to the Galleria Mall - just 1 block from our hotel.  Second evening we took the Water Taxi from the hotel dock.........and toured for over 3 hours for only $10.00 each.  Would do it AGAIN!

title: not a quality hotel
review: We spent two nights here - one night before our cruise and one night after.  We were travelling with 4 kids and were assured that our room would be ready at the end of the cruise when we got there around 11 am.  The room was not ready and we had to sit outside the hotel for over two hours waiting.  They also had us leave our luggage with their valet service who later delivered it to our room.  When I opened my laptop, I realized that the valet had dropped the bag the laptop was in and completely destroyed the screen on it.  The valet manager came to take a claim on it but we had a flight out early the next morning so nothing else was done about it.  Now trying to get their claim people to answer the phone or return a message is a nightmare and I'm left with a useless laptop that…

title: I expected better
review: Like so many hotels, the public areas are pretty good but my room was tired. I stayed in room 1002 and there were various flaws:  1) Windows were draughty - I could hear the wind coming in and blowing the curtains. 2) One of the main bulbs in the kitchen area had blown (wasn't replaced all week). 3) There's clearly been some sort of water leak in the bathroom since the door frame was rotten in the corner and the carpet had been lifted and showed signs of water damage. The carpet should have been replaced and the door frame repaired. 4) Perhaps worst, the toilet didn't flush properly. An odd fault, but water only flowed in at the bottom of the pan and not down the sides. Was like it all week so the cleaning staff obviously couldn't be bothered to report it.  So while I tolerated…

title: Spacious, Clean and excellent!
review: I wish that I could have  booked this hotel for more than one night in Ft. Lauderdale because the hotel was just perfect for my standards.  Check in was very quick, followed by being given a warm chocolate chip cookie!  Our suite was on the 8th floor, overlooking the  water and draw bridge . We had huge windows on three of the 4 walls.  It was very clean and spacious.  The bed was extremely comfortable, with the freshest, crispy linens.  The pillows were fluffy and welcoming.  The bathroom was very clean and bright with the fluffy, soft towels.    The location is so close to the beautiful beach and ocean, a mall and lots of shops.  Everyone on the staff was helpful, happy and friendly.

title: Honeymoon Hotel
review: We started our honeymoon at this hotel and what a great start it was. fab room with lovely views of the water. bed was very comfortable and room service was quick and food was tasty and warm. the room had a fridge which was very handing for storing drinks as most hotels don't allow you to put drinks in the fridge if its a mini bar etc. Turn right when you come out of the hotel and you will find a fab italian restaurant called Franco & Vinnys over the bridge where you will get great pizza and Itallian food for a very reasonable price. The food in the hotel is reasonably priced also. we had wings one night and they were super tasty with extra blue cheese sause ! Both reception & vallet were very helpful with answering any questions. Galleria Mall is right on the door step also…

title: Solid choice, if not phenomenal
review: I spent three days at the Gallery One - Doubletree Hotel. The hotel is nice, but there's nothing especially outstanding about it. I had a "city view" room, so I might have felt differently if I'd had an ocean view room.   The rooms are all suites with small kitchenettes, which is great if you want to save money or cook your own food. There's a Publix grocery store one block away. The Galleria Fort Lauderdale shopping mall offers upscale dining and stores, only a block away. The ocean is a short walk from the hotel.   Service was good and the room was cleaned thoroughly every night. The noise from the highway was a problem until I turned on the air conditioning fan. The rooms were large and solid double doors separated the main living and dining area from the bedroom and bathroom.

title: Living in a birdcage - Extras
review: Smallest suite I've ever been in. Everything in this hotel is extra & expensive...No more Doubletrees...who cares about the 360 calorie cookies....It is clean, but I stayed in better hotels in Ft. Lauderdale. Parking $25.00 a day..Internet 10.00 a day...I've stayed in rooms 1/2 the price and got it all included..

title: Gallery One Revisited
review: I last stayed here in May for a week and enjoyed my visit. The location is fantastic as it is within walking distance from Galleria Mall with its shops and restaurants, and just five minutes walk to the beach; I hardly used my rental car. There is now a Publix as well as a CVS across the road, and as the Hotel is right on the river, you can watch the yachts go by from the heated pool. There is also a water taxi service at the Hotel dock. The valet service has vastly improved and now you can call from your suite, a few minutes in advance, and your car is waiting at the Hotel door for you. Now that’s service! The restaurant is good value for money and the inside and outside bars were both well stocked. I ate at the bar one evening at 10.30 pm and it was an enjoyable meal. The…

title: Off the beach and convenient to town
review: This was our 2nd stay at the Gallery One.  It is convenient to town and especially to shopping and restaurants.  For those who don't need to be on the beach, this hotel is well situated.  If the beach beckons, it is a long walk or a short drive away. The hotel has a pool, bar and restaurant.  It is on the Inland Waterway, making for scenic views of boaters.  The suites include kitchens, so that breakfast or other meals or snacks can be had easily.  Rooms were modern and clean.  Staff friendly.  We will stay here again.

title: Cruise package is misleading for Florida Residents
review: Beware if you have a car and are driving to the hotel and then going on a cruise!  My review is in direct response to a recent stay and situation that took place at this resort. By booking their 'cruise package' one would assume that this Doubletree Guest Suites would be offering the same thing as any other Doubletree around the state of Florida for their "cruise package".  For instance, in Port Canaveral the Doubletree cruise package includes the free breakfast, transportation to the cruise port and free parking at the resort. This way the resort not the cruise port makes the money. Understandable and I don't blame the hotels a bit for trying to make some extra money.   However, the Doubletree Gallery one while their website says they offer a "cruise package" it actually does…

title: poor service
review: Toilet was blocked, had to have plumber in twice, second time he snaked it, not pretty sight at bed time. TV kept turning off and on, hotel staff could not sort out problem, had to use mute button. Dishwasher full of clean dishes left for us to unload-I could have stayed home to do that. Needed shuttle to Miami Int'l airport, shuttle service used by hotel quoted $100 for trip, which is very pricey-they had no other suggestions for more economical trip, had to do leg work myself to find alternatives. Property has an excellent location, rooms are large but all the housekeeping issues put me off this property.

title: Great location,good value, but.....
review: you can tell everything in the room was cleaned with the same dirty rag.EVERYTHING had wipe marks: from the kitchen sink,counter tops, outside of refrigerator and dishwasher. VERY obvious that housekeeping flies through these rooms when they clean. Nothing was noticeable until we opened the blinds and the sun lit up the room. The rooms must be cleaned in  the dark! Other than that the hotel is in a great location within walking distance to beach and fine dining at the very close Galleria Mall.If you get a room on the south or east  side of the hotel, the view is great but the hotel is directly next to the bridge for the intracoastal waterway and opens LOUDLY with bells ringing every half hour during the day but quiets down at night.  Overall a nice hotel.Just need a housekeeping…

title: Nice suites
review: We liked the size of the rooms, bathroom, kitchen amenities and living room.  The location is great.  3 blocks to beach (easy to walk to).  Next to Galleria mall.  Walking distance to publix.  I would stay here again if I had to.  Queen size plush beds were quite comfy.  Heated pool, thankfully because the sun disappears from the pool in the p.m.

title: Gallery One - Doubletree is my new home in FLL!
review: Stayed for 3 nights and didn't want to leave for my cruise...  :)  Everything was perfect from check-in to check-out!  The customer service at this hotel is A+, and my compliments to the management and staff!  They really went over and beyond to make us feel welcome and appreciated.    Our king 2 room suite was facing the intercoastal waterway and it doesn't get any better than sitting on the balcony, glass of wine in hand, and watching the yachts cruise the waterway right before your eyes.  The water taxi stop is directly beside the hotel and the Mall is right next door.  With CVS and Publix right across the street, it made for great convenience for goodies for the room and cruise.    Have two cruises this year out of FLL and will definitely be staying with the Gallery…

title: great hotel/suite
review: stayed in a one bedroom - wonderful reception. great staff, great service.  the one bedroom was about 650 sq feet, dinette and kitchen, well done and nice bath and balcony.  the first nite there was a water outtage in the whole broward county area and the management was really on top of the unexpected problem. would def stay again

title: o.k.
review: Stayed here with my mother. We were given a suite that unfortunately overlooked the glass covering for the parking lot, so we had a close up view of the parking lot & a debris covering the glass. The flags they have hanging (were nice & bright a few years ago) now look dingy & worn out. Staff is a little snooty, so if you need anything, just ask for a supervisor. Pool is very nice & which is adjacent to a  marina, which has a water taxi & a mini beach! Our room was comfortable, although the shower leaked all over the floor. The t.v didn't work, so maintenance tried to fix it, couldn't, gave me a chocolate tool (cute) & changed my room ( a hassle). Nice computer room, star bucks & breakfast. shops & beach near by. I stayed recently at the B Ocean & would pick this hotel a MILLION…

title: Going Over and Above the Call of Duty
review: This property blew us away. The suite was fabulous: well-decorated, clean, functional, and with a great view of the intracoastal and ocean. We had dinner several times on our balcony overlooking the star-lit waters and elegant yachts, cruising below us.  The pool, couches by the water, and gym were all beautiful and functional. The best part of course was the service. From the hotel manager to the cook, to the waiters, housekeepers, and valets-everyone was engaged with customers and doing their very best to go the extra mile in delivering exceptional service. For these reasons, I would rate this property with 5 stars, it blew away hotels I have stayed at in South Florida like the Loews in South Beach, The Victor (Hyatt-SoBe), and Hilton on Fort Lauderdale Beach. Alll these…

title: Perfect location . . . shopping, restaurants, beach, nightclubs
review: We have stayed at the Gallery One Doubletree Guest Suites on several of our short trip to Ft Lauderdale.  We love the location where we can walk to the Galleria Mall, several great restaurants such as Capital Grille, Seasons 52, Blue Martini ect. Also a short walk to the beach.  The location on the intercoastal waterway is perfect for watching the yachts pass by.  There is also a water taxi stop at the hotel which is very convienent.  We  had an issue with a valet parker during our stay and was directed to a manager names Maureen.  She was great and handle what was upsetting to us in a professional and satisfyiing manner.  All of the hotel employees greet you by your names once they learn it.  The suites are first rate and spacious.  It is only my wife and I but we appreciate…

title: Good Choice
review: This hotel is beautifully appointed and in a good location.  The staff provides great service.  The room we stayed in was a suite with a bedroom and livingroom/diningroom with a kitchen.  The bathroom was large and was the very nicest bathroom we have ever seen in a hotel - large shower with a clear glass wall.  The room had a balcony which overlooked the pool area and with views of downtown Ft. Lauderdale, the Intercoastal Waterway and the Ocean.  The hotel had ample amenities including pool, exercise room, and business center.  An excellent continental breakfast was provided) this may have been becuase we are Hilton Honors members or because it was a holiday period.  The hotel is walking distance to many restaurants and the beach, but is fairly far away from the airport and…

title: ONE hotel you have to try.
review: I like this hotel because it is close to the beach and the Galleria Malll. You can walk to both within a few minutes and it's an enjoyable walk. You can take a water taxi to Los Olas Boulevard or a larger speed boat water taxi to South Beach. Parking for this hotel is extremely over priced and there is no street parking. The parking fee is a "we've gotcha".  During my last stay I didn't get a rental car and used the water taxi and cabs. I got around just fine and could enjoy a few more drinks at night.  The hotel lobby and guest rooms are very nice with a unique style. The rooms are very modern and upscale.  The pool and hot tub is clean. The service is awesome. Make sure you enjoy a drink and meal outside facing the intracoastal waterway. Make sure your room isn't facing the…

title: Very comfortable
review: They need better service more warmly also can be more clean especial in the kitchen

title: Location=Great Guest Services=Not So Great
review: I loved everything about this hotel EXCEPT for the fact that you are FORCED to valet park your car.  I had to have my car pulled up, even if I just needed to get a bag out of my car (sometimes waiting up to 20 minutes).  There is a huge, empty parking lot right next to the hotel, that must have been used for guest parking before valet became mandatory.  It is extremely inconvenient and  expensive if you are planning on staying for more than a day or two.  If friends or family come to visit, they too must valet park, pay a daily fee and tip.  Not good if you are on a budget.

title: Loved it!
review: Stayed at the Gallery one for a few nights pre-cruise and got good value for our money. It's location is a bit off but near the beach and next to the Galleria shoppingmall with shops and a nice foodcouart. It's also on a busroute to Sawgrass Mills. The watertaxi stops at the hotel and it's a nice way to move around the area. Across the street is a CVS and a Starbucks.  The suites are huge and have a small kitchen with everything you need. We had a nice view of the intercostal waterway. The poolarea is a bit small but if your early it's no problem. By the afternoon it can get a bit crowded. It's a 5-10 minutes walk to the beach and the shops and restaurants on the boardwalk. Don't miss Blue Martini in the Galleria. It's happyhour every evening and the coctails are great.

title: Great staff and exceptional customer service
review: For the price you can't go wrong. Staff go out of their way to help. A delight

title: Loved this hotel
review: I'm a frequent guest at Hilton properties and this is one of the nicest Doubletrees I've ever stayed at. The location is fantastic. It's within walking distance to the beach and right on the intercoastal waterway. In fact there is a water taxi stop right outside the lobby which is a quick, fun and inexpensive way to get around to local attractions. The room I had had a great water view. Aside from the location and the view, the rooms themselves are spacious, comfortable and well-furnished. We had a suite with a kitchen, living room and a balcony. The bathrooms are large and had great rainwater showers with a separate jacuzzi tub. Highly recommended!

title: Enjoyed Hotel For Boat Parade, Attention to Detail Missing
review: This is our second year staying at the hotel for the Holiday boat parade. The hotel is quite large so I was very surprised to find there is only one ice machine in the whole hotel and it is on the 4th floor. Apparantly there is a second one located in the same place but one was broken. This was very inadequate and the ice machine was always empty from people filling their coolers. This are extremely small ice makers of the type you would find a couple of on most floors of a big hotel.  We enjoyed our room which had a water view and not advertised as having a balcony. It did have a very small balcony about 1' wide and a sliding glass door. We were happy to have this for the boat parade and stayed in our room.  We did notice several light bulbs out in the room and cigarette butts…

title: Great Location!
review: We recently traveled to Ft. Lauderdale for a very quick (24 hour) visit.  When we arrived on Saturday evening we realized that one of the most anticipated Christmas Events was that night... The Christmas Boat Parade.  As this hotel is right on the water, it is a prime location for parade watching.  We needed a wristband to enter the hotel - guests only.  Needless to say, our first impression upon arrival was not great as employees were scattered and they seemed a bit frazzled.  Once we went up to our room - which was lovely... a suite with balconies in both the living room area and bedroom - things got better.  There is a kitcheonette in the room, which is a necessity for us traveling with a 4 year old.  After we settled in, we took a very short walk to the Galleria Mall for…

title: day staff good - evening staff bad
review: there was a valet problem in the evening that needed to be addressed as well me and my wife did our check-in practically at midnight.  i found the desk clerk to be absolutely useless and uninterested in attending to our problem and took about 15min of 'pleading' our case to him and to top it off, we were starving at that point and simply just wanted something to eat.  He didn't have a single clue about anywhere we could eat nearby and his best suggestion was "just order a pizza".  oh yeah, I forgot to mention that we informed him that this was our HONEYMOON.  i was just really annoyed, me and my wife stormed off and found a great bar nearby within just a 5min walk.  i decided to take up the valet problem again in the morning with the day staff and it literally took 10 seconds.

title: Location can't be beat - love the views
review: My second stay here was as satisfying as the first. I had a 14th floor suite with a balcony that overlooked the Atlantic Ocean and the Intercoastal Waterway. The rooms are beautifully decorated, though some of the furniture was getting to the stage of needing to be replaced. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The staff were all very professional and friendly. The water taxi stops right at the property. The Galleria Mall is right  next door. The valet parking was very fast and I had absolutely no problems during my 3-night stay.

title: Our favorite place in Florida
review: We had a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for us and our daughter and husband.  Living room and kitchen made it easy for us not to have to eat all of our meals out.  The location is fabulous!  Better to get a room overlooking the canal but we had one on the busy street and still had a wonderful time.  Be aware that it is near a fire station so sirens will wake you up but we still loved this place.  Grocery store right down the street.  Things to do:  take the canal boats and get on and off at different stops plus just the boat ride was great.  Loved driving the streets to Miami.  Great park at the end of the drive at South Beach.    First night we arrived, we walked in our travel clothes to the mall next door and had the best meal of our week trip.  Can't remember the name but…

title: Good Hotel
review: Stayed in the Doubletree for four nights.  We had a king room with balcony.  Balcony is tiny.  Pool area is nice.  Room was excellent, very clean.  Breakfast was excellent and was included in the price we paid.  Valet parking is the only down side in this hotel.  Location is good, however, we did end up taking a taxi to Las Olas Boulevard for some nightlife.  Next time i am visiting Fort Lauderdale i would consider staying closer to the action on Las Olas, thats more my kind of thing.   Its very close to the Galleria Mall.  Overall i got a good rate so i was happy with the hotel.

title: Not tooo bad....
review: If you like quiet hotels, I would suggest that you pick another location.  Besides the noise levels, this hotel was ok....though I can't say that I would stay again.  Maybe if it were a little less expensive I would reconsider. It is an ok hotel.  Yes the rooms are nice and the views are nice however, it tended to be a bit crowded and just didn't feel like a "luxury" hotel.  It is in a nice location near the mall and some other shopping areas but not a lot of food choices if you check in late at night.  Most of the restaurants around are upscale.  The service was ok but nothing stellar and if you're coming in for a cruise, the port is about 15 minutes away.  Overall I had an ok stay but would probably not return.

title: Nice Location-all suite hotel
review: This was my first trip to Florida and this hotel was recommended to us by a friend who stays here many times..I love the idea of having a kitchenette in one room with a living area and separate bedroom.  We got a AAA discount for the waterview room with a balony where you can see all the yachts in the marina.  My only complaint is that they have only one coffee type restaurant and the breakfast was just OK so I won't eat there again..too many other choices in town. You can buy groceries at the Publik Market (their grocery store) and bring it back to your room.They do have a cappucino bar also in the lobby area which is a nice touch and a newspaper is delivered to you each AM. Would I stay here again? Maybe..maybe not.  I would like to try the Westin next time since we are…

title: Best Service
review: This place was awesome! The customer service was the best. From the time we arrived until we left. The hotel is in a perfect location. We plan to stay there every time we visit.

title: Perfect Location
review: This hotel is walking distance to the ocean. The location is beautiful on the intercoastal waterway. You can sit by the pool and watch the yachts pass by.  The rooms are clean and gorgeous.  The restaurant does not have a lot of choices but there are so many places to eat in walking proximity. Grocery store right across the street. Mall is next door.  We never rented a vehicle because it was not needed. Cabs are available by asking desk clerk and sometimes are waiting right there anyway. We will be returning here next year. Happy hour each day at the outside bar.  Other close hotels tried selling us their services but we were not interested. We liked it here!  The bed is soooooo comfortable too! Lisa - Geneva, NY

title: A perfect girls getaway experience
review: We loved this hotel - clean, spacious, good kitchenette, beautful view of the canal, with lots of room to sit by the pool or on the little beach as you watch the boats go by. And the water taxi stops right there. This is on one side of the hotel. If you walk out the other side of the hotel, there is fabulous shopping, a Publix, and great restaurants. From here, you can also walk across the bridge to the beach and boardwalk for some livier action.  The art filled Bonnet House is a must see - beautiful, peaceful grounds along with an interesting tour of the historic home.

title: fantastic holiday in fort lauderdale
review: great stay at gallery, suites great with family. balcony+kitchenette great bonus. views from water view a must if you staying here. staff very good and efficent. well done to ryan at pool bar for tips on things to do. above all. after travelling a good bit of the world with family + friends, at the second week of our holiday coming from miami and key west a 5* welcome from receptionist maurico,. from entering the hotel with this welcome, and if available offer of an upgrade to which i recommend at 20 dollars a night.he went out of his way during our stay to make sure we were comfortable. well done to housekeeping on great job every day. home from home wit a touch class

title: The place to stay in fort lauderdale
review: This hotel is not only beautiful but is close to the airport, mall, restaurant, and the beach. We stayed here with another couple for the boat show. The water taxi stopped at the hotel which made the boat show a breeze to get to. We will definitely be staying here the next time we visit fort lauderdale

title: Average rooms
review: Decided to stay here because of proximity to galleria mall and beach also I needed some type of kitchen and for the price was the best deal. Room was quite small loveseat size sofa table for two queen size bed small bathroom city view was of mall but on 3rd floor parking lot was the view definitely b ocean hotel down the street way better but no kitchen views and rooms nicer at b ocean with view of ocean for same price . While service was good unfortunately better rooms with view for same price B ocean wins I'll be at Hilton beach resort 1 bedroom suite on the weekend soothe to come .I'll still recommend because of kitchen and proximity to mall a positive feature if u need a kitchen. Oh btw there is no w/d in room but coin laundry on 3rd flr didn't know this till after I booked .

title: loved the suite
review: This was a very enjoyable place to stay.  The rooms come with kitchenettes (i didn't use) and a bedroom and bathroom with large shower.  The bed were very comfortable and rooms were very big.  I stayed here on business with a coworker and we felt very comfortable  When you check in the attendant give you a package of very yummy cookies.  Totally worth the stay for just those cookies.    I didn't use restaurant or pool area.  The hotel is in walking distance of Ft Lauderdales local mall and Publix grocery store.  It's a great location but not near Las Olas

title: Can recommend
review: Very nice hotel, lovely suites, pleasant helpful staff, would certainly stay here again.

title: Great hotel from the bvi
review: I stayed here for a week for the boat show everything in the hotel is marvelous but one issue is that I have to pay for parking this makes no sense thumbs up the the staff those ladies and gentlemen are so friendly and reliable but the charging for parking has to stop

title: Gallery One Restaurant
review: I do not rate Hotel restaurants as they always sdeem to be a bit of an after thought, OK for breakfast but not for an evening meal. Last night I decided to try the Restaurant at Gallery One and I was pleasantly surprised. The Clam Chowder was superb and the chicken was served on a bed of asparagus.. Delightful. The service was excellent and I accidentally left my jacket behind when I left. Minutes later my server delivered it to my room. How about that for service.!

title: Comfy spot in an excellent location
review: My husband and I recently stayed for a friend’s wedding aboard the Caprice.  We live locally in Fort Lauderdale.  Check in was smooth and we thought the room was pretty close to fantastic for the price.  The bed was comfy, the shower and towels were nice and I enjoyed the full kitchen as well.    The service I experienced was very good for the most part.  I think the bartender in the lobby could use an extra hand on weekends while functions are going on.  The $24 mandatory valet is a lot in my opinion especially when we were forced to wait a good 30 minutes each time we requested our car.    Depending on what you plan to do during your stay in Fort Lauderdale, you may just find it beneficial to cab it from the airport and make use of the water taxi or rent some bicycles just…

title: Bill & Joyce Scott Experience
review: From the moment we entered this hotel we were treated with great courtesy, and we were processed at reception efficiently. We were well pleased with our 5 day stay at Gallery One and we will be passing on our recommendation to our family and friends, should they wish to spend some time in Fort Lauderdale.

title: Was a good stay.
review: Just returned from a four night stay at the Doubletree. We had a one bedroom suite and loved the space and having a kitchen, dining table, etc. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. Every member of the staff we came in contact with was pleasant and helpful. I was also there for the 1 am fire alarm evacuation. As annoying as it was, I expect that is a rare occurrence and hopefully the night staff has had some training since in how to do it better if it ever happens again. The pool is small, and the area where you can sit by the canal is nice. We didn't need the pool, and the beach is near enough. We had breakfast every morning and it was adequate. The restaurant staff was great. We had free wifi and it worked well and was fast…

title: Great business hotel....
review: Great hotel for business.  Free Wi-Fi, nice meeting rooms,very comfortable hotel rooms, and great Ft. Lauderdale location. My only complaint was that my room was facing the entrance of the hotel and was pretty noisy at night.

title: Large rooms
review: Nice hotel in a good location. Full kitchen, good beds, and spacious living area. Everything was fine until the fire alarm went off at 1am and everyone had to evacuate the hotel. Apparently the staff didn't know how to work the fire control panel because I overheard the fire department lecturing them. Also, staff never made an announcement that it was all clear to go back to the rooms or what triggered the alarm to begin with.

title: Be aware this is a condo hotel
review: Thank you for your review.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel’s amenities, however, we apologize for the fire alarm disrupting your stay. We take the procedures related to fire alarms, even false alarms, very seriously and will ensure that the proper announcements are made accordingly.
