Please accept our apology for the inconvenience related to the alarm but the safety of all of our guests is paramount. John Allan, Hotel Manager

title: Have stayed here for years..
review: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and found it very convenient to Ft. Lauderdale attractions with superior suite accommodations offering a view of the inland waterways. We were visiting on this trip with my parents who had travelled from the UK. While our suite did have an ocean view and a partial inland waterway view it also had a view of a very busy and noisey road. The lift bridge was right outside our balcony and was very, very noisey all day and night. It was a "condo suite" - not mentioned on the web site!! and both closets in the bedrooms were unavailable for use so this coupled with the noise left me feeling very disappointed with my choice of accommodations. We spoke to the front desk who offered to bring up a clothes rack - should that not have been there to…

title: Nicest Doubletree in America
review: Thank you for your review of our hotel. The fact that we are a condominium hotel affords our guests some of the largest suites in Fort Lauderdale and should not affect the condition of the room or service that our guests receive, in fact it shoud enhance it. All of our guest rooms are full suites with a kitchen, living room, dining room table for 4, and a sleeper sofa in addition to the oversized bedrooms. Each suite on property has a standard hotel closet for the guest’s use, however should the closet space not be large enough for your stay, we can certainly provide you with opportunities for additional storage.  We do offer valet parking at the price of $24 per night which is very much in line with area hotels within our immediate proximity, affording our guests courteous and convenient service with prompt delivery of their vehicles.  I have replied to you to personally discuss and obtain more insight as to how we can exceed your expectations in the future. -John Allan, Hotel Manager

title: A+!
review: I have been staying at this hotel for years at least one week a month because I travel down to the area for work. I also had my company add this hotel to our travel site which has brought them A LOT of business! As the years have gone by, I have notices the quality of the service and rooms go down hill. The rooms are beginning to look old and worn. I have noticed many rooms are dirty(Especially bathrooms, walls, etc) They also force you to use their valet service that never has your car ready on time. Besides the time wasted with their valet service, it is 25 dollars a day to valet!! I live in manhattan and the Hilton near me is 20 dollars! I had a huge customer service issue at this hotel a few years ago and was taken care of by the manager to the highest level but…

title: Excellent Stay!
review: I stayed at this property with a group of colleagues, all attending a seminar in the hotel.  It was a wonderful stay.  The service was flawless - very friendly from the front desk staff to the patio bar staff.  The food in the restaurant was delicious and reasonably priced for a hotel.  The only drawback was the charge for internet service in the rooms, but free access was available in the lobby and on the 2nd floor conference level.  The pool was nice - big, well-kept and relaxing.  We were within walking distance from whatever we wanted to do and the valet staff quickly got us a taxi when we wanted to go farther from the hotel.  I'd stay again!

title: Beautiful Rooms!
review: I recently spent 4 nights at the Doubletree Guest Suites Hotel.  The location is great; within a few minutes walking distance to the beach, a nice mall, and several restaurants.  The rooms were beautifully appointed with a full kitchen, glass dining table that seats 4, nice flat screen TV on the wall, beautiful balcony, gorgeous bathroom with tile shower and a granite countertop.  I did, however, miss having a bath tub. I would definitely stay here again when I come to Ft. Lauderdale.  One word of caution; there was a charge on my bill for a phone call that I did not make.  So be sure to check your bill closely.  The good outweighed this, so I would stay here again!   Also I requested no feathers in the room, and they mentioned my request when I checked in and let me know that…

title: Good business stay
review: Thank you for your thoughtful review! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your recent stay with us and all of the amenities our hotel has to offer. It is a tremendous compliment that you mentioned that you would consider staying at the GALLERYone again. However, we strive to make each of our guest's stays perfect and hassle free. I have sent you a message to allow us the opportunity to correct any erroneous telephone charges that may have been placed on your bill. -John Allan, Hotel Manager

title: Fabulous Property!
review: I recently spent 4 days at this Doubletree property. Let me state some positives. The room was fantastic; plenty of space with all of the necessary amenities. Very clean. Nice large HDTVs in the living room and bedroom. Kitchen area was nice with a small refrigerator, stovetop, microwave and dishwasher. Very nice comfortable balcony. Speaking of comfort, the bed was great. There is a small safe in the closet which is always a nice bonus.   The location of the hotel is very good. Within walking distance is the beach and ocean which was great. But you can also easily walk to a number of restaurants/bars along with a Publix, Starbucks and CVS.  Wifi was above average, especially for a Hilton family hotel.   The staff I encountered were all friendly and courteous.    By far my…

title: We loved it and we'll be back
review: This hotel was very beautiful and in an excellent location.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  It's close to the beach, restaurants and bars and there's a really nice mall right down the street!  Also a good location for weddings or family gatherings since yachts can pull right up behind the hotel to cruise along the coastway :-)

title: Great Stay!
review: We were extremely happy with our week long stay over Labor Day. The king room suite was perfect with an awesome view of the fireworks and water. Service was perfect! Will definitely return soon!

title: Great Location Great Service !
review: The hotel is on the intracoastal with easy access to the Water Taxi, Galleria Mall and the beach (all of which are withing walking distance).  We booked the room last minute due to construction issues at our house.  Joe at the front desk checked us in quickly.  When the work wasn't done on our house and we needed to extend our stay, Paris was extremely helpful and understanding.  Everyone, in every department was extremely nice and helpful.  We couldn't have asked for more.

title: Location. Location. Location
review: This hotel has a fantastic location. It's within walking distance to Ft Lauderdale Beach/A1A, the Galleria Mall, and other convenient stores you may need if traveling with a family for a prolonged amount of time (publix, walgreens,etc). If interested in the water taxi it also stops hourly at this hotel site so that's a plus as well. Pool is quaint but not overly intimidating and the view of the intracoastal is tough to beat.  The rooms are of adequate size if you book the double queen rooms. Bathroom is fairly large. Grout work in showers could be done better and the interior could use a fresh coat of paint. That being said it's a nice place for people with teenagers or a young family as it has a kitchenette with stove/fridge etc, dining room table, and living room that's…

title: Second vist -  improved customer service
review: This was our second trip to this hotel.  As with our last trip, the room is spacious, clean and well-appointed.  On our first trip,however, we found customer service to be lacking and I preferred to stay at the Hilton beach hotel but it was booked.  I reluctantly booked the Double Tree again but was pleasantly surprised.  This visit, the customer service was much improved - valet staff were excellent and front desk staff much more on point.  Good value choice for families on travel with children that require space as well as nice amenitites.

title: Hotel was ok but not what you expect from Doubletree
review: Most of what I read on previous reviews of this hotel was accurate.  It is definitely run down and not what you would expect from a Doubletree.  In our suite, the carpet was fraying and coming up where it met the tile.  Our room was the last on the hall and outside our door, it looked like no one had vacummed in quite some time.  The carpeting was very dirty with scraps of paper and dirt.  When I went to get in the shower for the first time, there was a big clump of hair just laying in the shower floor.  The walls definitely needed to be painted in our suite and in the halls.  The fake flowers in the bathroom were just covered in dirt and looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a very long time.  The pillow on the couch had a big rip in it.  Just little things that made you…

title: Good Value
review: We stayed here over Labor Day weekend after the Hilton Beach Resort was sold out of all balcony rooms.  The room they had was tiny and they were great about moving us to the Doubletree and a great room (I'm a Diamond Member).  The Doubletree is nice.  It's just across the bridge from the beach (maybe 10 minute easy walk) and next to the Mall.  It's also across the street from a supermarket and drugstore.  So all in all it's a great location.  It is on the river and has views of the ocean that are really nice.  The staff was great.  The pool is on the small side but well maintained.  I think this is more of a family destination.  The only complaint (and not the hotel's fault) is that there were large famiilies with many children who were continually in the pool.  It did not make…

title: Great Room, Friendly Staff, VERY Loud
review: I loved the King Suite, and the water view was nice. However, the noise from the traffic going over the drawbridge beside the hotel was loud and quite annoying. Luckily, the traffic dies down before bedtime, but until then...

title: Felt Expensive
review: The only thing I wasn't fond of was the mandatory valet parking. The room was spotless and huge. It was a quick walk to the beach. Great location. Very impressive.

title: Nice Rooms... but pricey services
review: I stayed at Gallery One for 3 nights the rooms were nice and came with a full kitchen.  It's also within walking distance to the beach which is nice when staying in Fort Lauderdale.    I didn't like how guests are forced to valet park their cars for $24/night.  We parked our car in the huge lot beside the hotel and avoided that charge.  Internet is also $9.95/day which in my opinion is unreasonable.    The front desk staff were nice but house cleaning didn't replace our towels one day.  Overall, I was somewhat disappointed with this choice and will likely stay somewhere else next time I'm in the area.

title: Not too bad.
review: As a loyal Hilton customer, I always expect more from this chain of hotels. The check-in process at this hotel was fine, the valet service was fine (but expensive and no self service alternative), the rooms were fine, the pool was fine, the location was fine. The housekeeping was average( never cleaned the sand off my bathroom floor nor fully made our beds). Positives about this hotel was it was nice to be able to print our boading passes in the business center, the room to spread out (two tvs and a door between the livingroom and the bedroom) and a good breakfast buffet that was included in our package. The location was nice because it was with-in walking distance to the beach, mall shopping and a new grocery store. The walls are painted with flat paint and retains all dirt and…

title: Great Hotel and great staff-definitely going back
review: We were very pleased with the Gallery One Hotel.  The staff was great and the room was clean and comfortable.  The location is perfect with restaurants, groceries and the beach close by.  There is a water taxi stop right outside the back of the hotel.  And, you get warm chocolate chip cookies upon check-in.  Yummy!  The only downside is they do not offer a free breakfast, nor do they have a shuttle to the airport.  We did not have a car, but I noticed the rate per day is $24.00 plus tips, which is expensive in my opinion.  The restaurant on site is very expensive so I would suggest walking down to the beach and eating at one of the hotels along the ocean or go to Publix for groceries and fix breakfast in your room.   The pictures on their website depict the rooms perfectly. …

title: Great location but.....
review: We stayed at the Gallery One Doubletree for two nights......The suite was nice, clean and the beds were comfortable,  the staff was friendly.  However, we found the hotel was very noisy, our suite was facing Sunrise Blvd and the inter coastal.....the draw bridge and its attendant ( he speaks on a load speaker to pedestrians and cars )could be heard easily inside the room. The traffic was loud during the night, a fire-station is located less than a block away which made it noisy with sirens in the middle of the night.  The air conditioning was not cooling the suite efficiently, you  would think that it would be a priority in Florida.  Although it has a thermostat, which apparently you can program, it programs itself and the 69 degrees it displays is not at all the real…

title: Fair-Some problems
review: Upon arrival to hotel, I was very pleased by the appearance of the hotel. I was greeted by one of the valet staff, but apparently he had problem with grooming; He was soaked with perspiration, unshaven, and his English was very poor. I had a very hard time communicating with him due to the language barrier. Once he realized I was checking in, he directed me to the front desk; however, he didn't offer me assistance with luggage. Once I told him I needed a bellman, he did not provide assistance. He let me unload all of my bags before he retrieved the cart and began loading them onto it. He walked us into the front desk and then us and the cart unattended. After checking in, there was no bellman in sight, so we grabbed the cart and began walking ourselves upstairs. Before we…

title: Good space but pricy amenities
review: I like that the room is well stocked with things for the kitchen. The staff was polite, but it always took about 15 minutes to get your car. I tried to call down several times (question about check out, to have my car pulled around, wake up call request...), and only once did someone answer. I have a handicap tag and chose to park myself the last day, because I was tired of waiting for my car. When I was checking out, I was asked if I informed the hotel that I parkway in the handicapped spot. Since when do I need permission?

title: Great property, Greatly deceiving
review: I recommended this hotel to my sister, brother-in-law with their 11-month baby, and stayed with them after comparing several properties, locations and ratings.  The place was nice, the rates seemed acceptable yet as soon as we arrived we realized that there was a lot of 'fine print'. They may be more explicit now, but it was not clear when we booked the room that: 1) Self parking is not available, and $24+ tax is charged for valet ('only $13 for visitors'). 2) If you want to have late dinner, supposedly offered, you might have grumpy Ryan or someone else moving slow that will let you know that it is not their job and they have a busy bar and might get you dinner in a while (never happened), unless the room service staff (or a lovely colombian lady that was the exception to the…

title: good location but
review: The hotel is located next to a large enclosed mall that provides for your needs. The hotel is located on the inter coastal waterway. We stayed there in December and was able to see the Christmas Parade of Boats. The hotel rooms where OK. Food service pricey. Concern for hotel guest poor. The hotel had sold tickets for a party to watch boat show. Paying guest herded into a out of the way area. My wife is in wheel chair and tough to navigate hotel. A bar was set up hindering use of ramp to go out to waterway. Was asked to move a few times so as paying party guest could have our space.

title: Great! except
review: The hotel was very nice The staff great  Except, the valet parking was very expensive and there was plenty of space available for free parking. The hotel also charged for wifi. In this day and age wifi should be free especially at a hotel of this calibar.

title: Nice place, good location, a little rough around the edges
review: We had an extra day to spend in south Florida so we picked Ft. Lauderdale. This hotel is in a nice location and close to the beach and popular sites in the area. Our suite was nice but has seen better days. A renovation in the near future is in order. Besides that it was clean, the staff were great and the included breakfast was great. There is also a water taxi spot right there near the pool so it was very convenient.  For the price, location and amenities it was great. New coat of paint, new sofa and regrouted shower would make the place even nicer.  free wifi would be great too but not that big a deal  finally, I needed a place to park my car for a few hours and they wanted to charge me $13. This is a suburban location and there is a lot of space, I thought that charge was…

title: Very nice Hotel, but a bit expensive for not being on the beach
review: Stayed at this hotel in February for the AUSA show. Most of the hotels around that time are quite pricey, but at over 300 per night with taxes it was a bit to high. On the bright side the rooms are huge and the hotel was very clean. The lobby is a bit plain and the check in seemed small for such a big hotel. Other than that they charge you for everything like any good beach resort does. Overall the hotel was nice, but did not set my world on fire.

title: All that and a bag of chips
review: Located on sunrise Blvd. right nest to the Galleria Mall, Gallery One has a great central location with water taxi service that will squire you around the Intercoastal and drop you off downtown in no time flat.  Formerly a Doubletree property, this completely refurbished condo hotel is all that and a bag of chips.  Our designer one bedroom suite was oh-so-glam with two 42" Plasmas in the bedroom and living room, a luxurious marble bath, a sleek granite countered kitchen and hip espresso- finished furnishings throughout.

title: Great Pre-cruise hotel!!!
review: We stayed here for two days before our cruise on Royal Caribbean's "Allure of the Seas"  It was wonderful.  The room was very large and the staff was excellent!  It had a large bathroom with a huge walk-in shower.  The location was wonderful. It was was across the street from a spa, bakery, drugstore, nail salon, Starbucks, and a beautiful Mall with loads of great places to eat!  We never ate in the hotel's restaurant!  We walked to the beach and to the mall.  It had a great view of the river, too. The staff was very helpful when we asked questions.  We will go there again.  The only negative was the size of the pool which was small, but other than that...perfect!

title: pre cruise stay
review: we only stayed here for 24 hours as this was before our Cruise. As far as i know this is a "royal Caribbean" hotel. we stayed in a suit (honeymeen couple) booked a normal room. our suite  was a large 1 bedroom apartment large kitchen and sitting room. For 2 people we had so  much space. we had or breakfast nxt morning and the staff  were great all knew or remembered we were on honeymoon ( we did nt  say anything at this stage as we had been on honeymoon a week by now). looked after us as if we were stars... the pool was small but perfect no 1 else around when i was there. pool towels availalble, Myabe because we did nt releaise how close the beach was.. the beach went on for miles only relaised how big when r ship was departing.... anyway if u did nt make it 2 beach like .(us)…

title: Watch out for the Parking
review: I booked this hotel through Priceline and was given the hotel for $70.00    Great deal for the location.  When i arrived at the hotel i was shocked to see that VALET is mandatory and it costs $24.00 a day plus tax.  No place on the priceline confirmation or the hotels information did it state that Valet was mandatory for all guests.    That is a very high rate to have my car sitting in the driveway 15 feet from the front door of the hotel, but had to use valet.     Hotel is aged,  rooms are a bit shabby and starting to show wear.  Staff not very hospitable, but not horrible.  I did contact the GM about this parking deal and we set it up for $30.00 for the two nights instead of $48.00

title: Does the job
review: A bit narked that the parking was only valet at $24 a night when there was a huge car park right at the front of the hotel! Rooms are fine but there were no towels in our room which was clean but not spotless. Balconies are not particularly safe if you have small children (easily climbed). Pool area was nice and the location is real handy for the beach. Our stay was perfectly fine but it wasn't as good as I expected.

title: I had an amazing time here!
review: I absolutely LOVED this hotel.  The staff was friendly and welcoming, and went above and beyond to be helpful.  For example, one of the front desk clerks spent about 15 minutes doing research to try to find out what kind of horrific arachnid scared the bejeezus out of me while I was in a park (turned out to be a banana spider.  Or, more accurately, LOTS of banana spiders.  But that's a different story).  The hotel was clean, the amenities were great (business center, lovely pool, fitness area) and you can't beat being right on the water taxi route.  I stayed for nearly a week, and about four or five nights into my visit I got a call from the front desk informing me that noisy construction was going to be started on a nearby bridge, and offering me a different room.  I didn't end…

title: Hated to leave!
review: Staying on the beach was cost prohibitive for us; because we have an 18 year daughter and 15 year old son, we needed a minimum of 3 beds and it was tough rooms to find in Ft. Lauderdale or Miami Beach that would accommodate us all.  We would have needed 2 rooms.  Thanks to Tripadvisor, I read about Gallery ONE--when we arrived, I was amazed at how nice it was inside.  Then, at check in,  we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite!  2 Q's and a bathroom for the kids, a living/dining area and a King plus gorgeous bathroom for us. Only a peekaboo view of the waterway/drawbridge but  having the space to spread out was amazing.  We had 3 tv's, a full frig, a balcony, etc... Perfect!   Parking is $24/day and there is no free breakfast, but we ate at a great local spot one day (the…

title: Attentive and friendly staff
review: My family and I enjoyed our 3 day stay at Gallery One. The mall next door is very nice with many high end stores and a nice food court. The only negative is that the hotel location is about a 5 minute walk from the beach. However, we were able to make the walk with our 8 year old without any problems. Will definitely revisit this hotel in the future.

title: 2nd time and hope to stay again
review: Great hotel, the staff was very friendly, pool was great, rooms are big with living room and kitchen. The location is great, 0.3 miles from the beach, next to the Galleria Mall. The breakfast was really good. Really good hotel. I highly recommend.

title: Beautiful hotel!!
review: We stayed at this hotel from June 24th - 27th with two sons aged 15 and 17.  Overall, it was a great stay.  They do charge $24 for valet parking but we were aware of that before we arrived.  The also charge for internet which I feel should be included.  Most other places that we have staying have free internet.  The hotel is very nice with spacious suites.  Service was great and the people working there were always friendly and helpful.  The grounds are beautiful with the back of the hotel facing the waterway.  It's very relaxing to sit by the pool and watch the boats go by.  The water taxi also stops at the hotel.  Locations is great - within walking distances of shopping and restaurants.  Next door is the Gallery One and across the street is a European bakery and just down the…

title: Great hotel and staff!
review: Stayed here last week and was upgraded to a spacious suites. The valet staff, especially Nick, really knows how to take care of customers. This has become my favorite hotel in Fort Lauderdale area.

title: Great stay at the Gallery One DoubleTree
review: Had a great stay from 7/1/11 - 7/4.  The property is valet only and the charge was $24 + tax a day.  The valets were all very polite and curtious.  Check-in was a breeze and the cookies were awesome!.  We stayed in a one bedroom king suite complete with kitchen (including plates & utensils), dining area, living area (included pull out sofa), bedroom and bathroom.  The room also incuded a balcony.  The view was great and overlooked the intercoastal along with the beach area in the distance.  During the stay we had only a few issues that were minor for us.  On two occassions we had to request extra towels.  I attempted to phone the front desk mutiple times within a 10 minute span before I received an answer.  The phone just continued to ring.  However, once requested, the towels…

title: Worse stayed EVER
review: Worse stayed ever. Don't wast your money. Service was very bad. I called 2-3 times to fix my a/c unit and they never showed up. During check out Ryan (front desk) denied in my face that they did no receive any phone call requesting to check the system. Bad service... They don't have any respect for the guest. I will never NEVER come back here.

title: Great One night stay
review: Our room was great!  Living room, Kitchen, Bedroom, and Full Bathroom.  We stayed in the King City view suite which had a large balcony.  Sadly, our city view was more of a view of a large building blocking the way to everything else...but it was fine.  The room was clean and was a perfect little place for a family.  Just know that this hotel is Valet only.  When we checked in they had warm cookies for us before we went up to our room.  The beach is also right down the road.  Nothing to really complain about here.  The staff was incredible and if ever in Fort Lauderdale again, this place is on the top of my list.

title: Convienient and Beautiful
review: The Gallery One is right next to the downtown mall and just a 2 block walk from the beach. Rooms are modern and spotless! Staff is awesome, view is spectacular! Only valet parking is offered and that is a bit pricey but I still highly recommend this wonderful hotel!

title: Good location, my own little apartment in FLL
review: The best part is that these are suites, so you have a full kitchen.  For me this is great, I save on meals.  It has good views, is clean, not loud, good crowd. Unfortunately parking is overpriced. And they should stop charging for Internet .... is like charging for having water in the toilet, come on !!! is 2011 not 1996 !!

title: Perfect location
review: Love this place! I've stayed here 5 times for a week at a time. Just beware that none of the rooms have bathtubs.  Also ask for a room with a full balcony.

title: Hold onto your Car Keys.........
review: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel in March and could not believe the Valet parking situation.  I have written to the Doubletree, but to date, no one has answered me. In addition, I also requested the address for Corporate Headquarters and that was also ignored.  Normally we park our own car, but this time we thought we'd live it up..... ohh...what a mistake.  Due to the incompetence of the staff we almost missed the wedding that we had driven to attend.  The first night we called 1/2 hr ahead of time to get our car and still waited an additional 1/2 hr outside.  We overheard a conversation between the valet staff that one of the cars was dead.  When my husband inquired it was our car, and it was not dead. No one had said a word after we had asked about it twice. …

title: Very Accomodating
review: My husband and I stayed at the Gallery ONE this past weekend and cannot say enough about the staff. They were very friendly at all times, accomodating and welcoming. Every time we called down for our car, they had it ready before we made it downin  the elevator. The front desk staff was always willing to help with what ever we needed. The room was very nice and we enjoyed our balcony overlooking the intercoastal waterway. The only negative I would say was that there was a loud party directly above our heads Saturday night. Since we had an early flight the next morning, we called down to the front desk. He told me he would send the manager up. It took a little while but they finally quieted down so we could get back to sleep. For the price we paid, it was worth every penny. I…

title: Very nice property
review: The hotel was very clean and everyone friendly.  We upgraded to a balcony which was nice although our view mostly consisted of a drawbridge.  Close to your standard chain restaurants and a mall.  The beach is only a few blocks away.  Overall, it was a great place to stay before a cruise.  They also offer a shuttle to Port Everglades for a flat fee.  I believe it was $25.  There was no wait and we got to the Port in about 15 minutes.

title: AN UPGRADE
review: I stayed at the Double Tree last year for labor day and decided to give them another try. I should say it was a completely different aura than my last stay. The staff was excellent! Marissa checked us in. She was extremely cheerful, approachable and intuitive to our every need.  We ordered room service. The meal arrived hot, in a timely manner and of course delicious.  I would definitely recommend Double Tree to friends and family!  PS- Love the cookies!

title: Awesome Hotel
review: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel during our vacation. We weren't entirely sure what to expect, but the hotel was a pleasant surprise.   When we checked in, the manager overheard us talking about celebrating our anniversary and upgraded our room to a corner king suite with beach views. She then sent up a bottle of wine compliments of the hotel, and gave us a late checkout. Overall, the entire staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.   Hotel was really close to beach (8 minute walk), restaurants, and AMAZING sandwich shop: Monster Subs. Monster Subs is the bees, you should eat about it. Owner is an old school Italian guy and he won't let you pay until after you eat in case you don't like it. It's about a 10 minute walk the opposite direction from the beach.   Pool…

title: No value for money
review: This hotel did not live up to the expected Hilton standard at all. The room was badly cleaned. The bathroom did not have enough towels, or toiletpaper. The kitchen did not have the equipment needed to make a meal. What you did ask for in the reception you did not get.

title: Fantastic Hotel and Staff
review: From the moment I stepped out of my car I was met by one friendly face after another. All the staff are just fantastic and they make you feel as though you have been there before. There are well appointed comfortable one and two bedroom suites with a dining table and a kitchen at prices that you would pay for a room elsewhere. It's like having your own five star Condo. Breakfast is lovely and there is a bar outside by the pool where you can take lunch.   Gallery One is right on the intracoastal and you get to see all of the yachts from the pool. and dock. It is only 100 yards from Galleria Mall and there are some lovely restaurants there. The water taxi stops right at the Hotel and can take you to Shooters to dine or to the Boat Show and the beach is only a few minutes walk…

title: Massive air-conditioning failure
review: The air conditioning was non-functional throughout the hotel, leaving us sweltering in the south Florida heat and humidity.  Management repeated told us that it had been fixed, was being fixed, or was about to be fixed, but nothing changed.  The problem lasted through our two day stay, and who knows how much longer before and after.  Rumor among the guests was that it would be out at least the rest of the week.  Persistent complaining won us a portable fan, which was dust-encrusted and filthy, but provided a little desperately needed relief.  And a substantial cash credit on the bill.  This may have been a one-time problem, and the hotel was otherwise quite nice.  But given our experience, I wouldn't take another chance on them.

title: Hotel was Average - but with a great location
review: Thank you for your recent stay with us! We did unfortunately encounter an unforeseen AC outage. Given the magnitude of the situation, it made it difficult for our management team to accurately establish a time estimate of how long it would take to get back to 100%.  We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences that you faced. With the installment of a brand new cooling system, we can assure you that we have permanently resolved the issue. John Allan, Hotel Manager

title: Extremely happy with our stay
review: The service we received was exceptional. When we arrived my daughter was extremely sick and the front desk staff found me the closest hospital and directions along with Doctors in the vicinity. The next day I received a call from the hotel manager asking how my daughter was feeling and if there was anything they could do to make her stay more comfortable to just call. The room(suite) was very nice, spacious and clean. It was nice that it was located right on the Intracoastal by the bridge. My kids really enjoyed watching the yachts and fishing boats go by. Very close to the beach, just a short walk. Close to restaraunts and the water taxi (which picks up right at the hotel). The only complaint I have is that the outdoor furniture on the little man made beach by the Intracoastal…

title: Aspires to be upscale--and fails
review: This hotel aspires to be recognized as an upscale Doubletree property but fails at the basics. Service was very poor. At breakfast one morning, there were about six of us in the restaurant and three wait staff. After ten minutes of trying to get coffee and an order started, I gave up and went to IHOP. Since they don't have self-park, I had to wait another ten minutes to get my car from the valet. Tried calling ahead for my car the next morning, but they didn't go get it until I got down there, so it was a wasted effort. There really isn't a decent restaurant attached to the hotel, so  you have to walk up to the Galleria area, drive, or get a cab to eat. Outside bar was seldom manned, so not a lot of help there either. Rooms were OK, but nothing to write home about. Could be a…

title: Location, Rooms are great.  Front Desk Service is terrible!
review: Thank you for sharing your comments; the service that you received in our restaurant is certainly unacceptable and I have personally reviewed this with our team. It appears as though your visit to our Patio Bar occurred outside of the operating hours of 11am to 6pm,  for our guest’s convenience we also have our Gallery Bar in the lobby available from 5:30 pm to midnight daily. We have recently installed a Valet Parking booth that is attended twenty four hours a day to allow our guests to call ahead at any time to have their vehicle in a timely manner. Please accept my apologies for your experience and know that your comments are appreciated.   John Allan, Hotel Manager

title: Nice Hotel to be close to the beach, "please read review"
review: I came in for a three day business trip and had stayed at this hotel once before.  I do like the location near the beach and can easily get on the main highways or leisurely drive along the water.  The air conditioning was out when I arrived, but was not told about it before I had checked in and signed all the documents.  The front desk man then told me the air was out, but would be fixed "shortly".  It was terrible! My room never got below 78 degrees during my stay.  Then the drain in my shower wasn't working and it took me 3 trips to the front desk to report the problem after my bathroom flooded to finally get the drain fixed.  When I checked out, I told the same man who had checked me in that I refused to pay for the first night.  Between the flooded bathroom not being fixed…

title: Service very poor. Would not recommend.
review: Thank you for your recent stay with us at the GALLERYone. Our central location to numerous restaurants, world class shopping, the intracoastal waterway and the beach, certainly does serve as a major asset to our property. We do apologize, however, for the warm temperatures and faulty drain that you encountered during your stay and certainly how are front desk handled the situation. The response time to assist you with your engineering issues is  unacceptable and we will work with our entire front desk team to make sure that we follow-up with our guests after a call has been placed. Even with all of the challenges you faced, I am glad that our Housekeeping and Valet team were helpful and efficient.  It is our hope that you will return in the future so that we can make up for the difficulties you experience in your recent stay with us. John Allan, Hotel Manager

title: excellent hotel in very good location
review: We arrived quite late after travelling from London to be greeted by very welcoming friendly staff who were very helpful.We got upgraded to a room with an intercoastal and drawbridge view which had everything we needed for our 2 night stay. It was nice to be able to walk to the shopping mall and restaurants which we did. We would certainly  come again.

title: Great room, friendly helpful staff,  very good value!
review: We were lucky enough to get an extra day of vacation in Fort Lauderdale and got a decent  price for a Friday night stay last minute on the Hilton website. We were greeted by a very friendly guest services employee. We are Hilton Gold members and We were upgraded to a 7th floor balcony suite overlooking the intercoastal.  We were warned the bridge traffic could be noisy but we wanted the view. The room was very clean and spacious.  Mini kitchen with everything we would need if we wanted to cook.  The bedroom was spacious and the bed comfy.  As Gold members we got free breakfast and internet service.  We enjoyed the breakfast and the waiter,  Bob, was very friendly and helpful.   The location was close enough to walk to the beach and right at the water taxi stop.  We did not have…

title: A pleasant surprise off the beach.  A great pre-cruise hotel.
review: The hotel is a couple of blocks off the beach but it is located on the inland waterway and has a water taxi stop right at the hotel.  This is really nice because once at the hotel you can take a tour of the "Venice of America" and never have to drive or walk any real distance to do so.   We were greeted immediately by valet and bellman upon our arrival.  They were very eager to help, very courteous, and very patient during the check-in process.    Check-in was speedy, courteous, informative, and the cookies were fresh and delicious.  (If you are not familiar with this hotel chain, they provide cookies to guest at check-in)  Our accommodations were everything advertised.  We had a two room King, with kitchen, and waterfront with a French balcony.  The living area had a sleeper…

title: Nice location, extremely-well kept. Not sure if I would pay full rack rate though.
review: Booked this for a couple nights' stay before a cruise. Had chosen this because I had a party of 7, and liked the availability of a two-bedroom suite. Had also booked a regular suite for my in-laws.  We got a deal through Hilton which made this reservation possible.  We arrived around 6:30. The bellman were courteous and efficient. Check in was a breeze, and like many others we enjoyed the complimentary and warm cookies they gave us.  Our bellman took us up to our suite, and showed us all its features. Had some trouble figuring out how to turn on some lights but otherwise no issues. We had a suite that overlooked the canal, but was next to the road/bridge next to the hotel so heard a fair amount of traffic.  The two-bedroom suite was huge. It had a kitchen with a small fridge,…

title: Great hotel!!
review: Doubletree Gallery One is a great hotel.  The rooms are spacious and clean, and include a fully stocked kitchen.  The hotel is in virtually new condition and the staff are all very helpful and friendly.  The warm cookies at check in are greatly appreciated after a long day of travelling.  The hotel is located within walking distance of a great mall, many shops and restaurants as well as the beach.  There is a nice pool and lounge area, as well as a business centre, gym and restaurant.  I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area!

title: Excellent location
review: Stayed here for one night before embarking on our first cruise on Navigator of the Seas.  On booking in found that bed in suite was only queen size and as husband tall they readily exchanged our booking for a bigger suite at extra cost which my husband negotiated.  Got a lovely big suite overlooking waterway instead of city - view of city in other was bit of a jungle.  Nice location on waterway and took water taxi to explore Fort Lauderdale.  Only discovered on return to hotel - excellent eating places at Mall of Millenia - both restaurants and mall restaurants.  Did not eat in hotel!  But would recommend...

title: A Wonderful Experience
review: I stayed 4 nights last week and can't say enough about this hotel.  Stayed in a one bedroom suite with very large rooms, a fully equipped kitchen and a very large and modern bath.  The hotel staff was pleasant, helpful and very accomodating-including allowing me to check in several hours before normal check-in time (request in advance).  The hotel pool was beautiful with plenty of comfortable lounge chairs.  The location was across from the street from a CVS where I stocked up on water, soda and food thereby enabling me to eat in when I chose.  Also next to the Galleria Mall, a nice way to spend the afternoon when it rained.  I would definately stay here again and highly recommend it.

title: perfect location for the money
review: we stayed for 7 days and were very happy with our choice. We were on the 8th floor looking toward the downtown and intercoastal.  I can see the bridge side being very loud from just walking around.  So I would stay away from that unless you like noise. The room was great with a balcony that was big enough to hang out on and enjoy the view. Pool was decent and warm.  The beach is a 5 min walk and 30 minutes to the main area.  The taxi on the intercoastal is great for 20.00 right outside the hotel.  Parking is pricey, so be prepared.  We had a 4 month old and we found it to be a very safe place to walk and the seperate bedroom allowed us to stay up after the baby was put to sleep in the bedroom. The kitchen has no oven and mini fridge. there is free internet on the second floor…

title: wish we could have stayed longer
review: Stayed one night pre-cruise.  Wanted a suite with 2 bedrooms and we got exactly what we wished for.  2 bedrooms (one with King and second with 2 queens).  Room was immaculate, updated, beds were very comfortable.  We were on the 10th floor overlooking the intercoastal and the drawbridge.  Didn't notice any noise from either.  Could see beach.  Didn't use the kitchen except for the coffee maker.  no freezer.  no sharp knives (?!).  Great big shower in the master.  Bathroom was very clean, but no towel racks which I thought wa strange. Right next door to the Galleria mall, but didn't have time to go there. Walked to a CVS right across the street and a Starbucks. The one big negative:  We had dinner in the hotel restaurant.  Food was okay but service was slow and slower.  The one…

title: Best pre-cruise stay yet!
review: My DH and I arrived at about 3:30pm in Ft. Lauderdale and took a cab to the Doubletree. It was $22 from the airport and we tipped $3. Check-in was quick and friendly. We asked the front desk clerk about transportation to the port and she arranged a private shuttle for $25.  The room was really great. It was clean, spacious and had a nice view. We were upgraded to a water view even though we used Hilton Hhonors points to pay for the stay, and we received vouchers for free continental breakfast as we are Hilton Hhonors members. (You could pay $5 more and upgrade to a full hot breakfast buffet, but we didn't do this because the continental breakfast included hot oatmeal and grits which we love.) That night we walked to the mall and ate at PF Changs (good as always). We loved the…

title: Great hotel on great location
review: My girlfriend and I stayd a week at this hotel in feburary. We got a "corner" suite with a huge balcony. The suite was very nice.  The hotel did not have free wireless internet, 9,99$ per day per device. The parking is also quite expensive. Stay out of the hotel restaurant. We waited for 50 minutes for our food when the restaurant was nearly empty. When the food arrived, it was not what we order. A great restaurant nearby is Seasons 52.

title: Close to everything...
review: Thanks for taking time to share your experience and we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our beautiful all-suite hotel.  The service that you received in our restaurant is clearly not the level of service that we strive for and we are addressing the deficiencies with our team.   We look forward to your return visit to the Gallery One and again appreciate you sharing your feedback.  John Allan, Hotel Manager.

title: Some Good Some Bad
review: We recently visited this hotel for a reward stay with HiltonHonors points but they didn't upgrade our room. So, we decided to upgrade for a room with waterview and balcony and they charged us $25/night. Breakfast was $45.28 for 2 ppl. Valet parking was $23 .Self parking $21 (good luck with that) and  internet $9.95. We end up paying extra... The staff was  very nice, my room was very clean,bed was soft and nice.  Waking distance to The  Gallery Mall,and restaurants....P.F.Changs, Seasons 52 So the next time,for breakfast I will go to Starbucks (across the street) I would no recommend this hotel is you have a budget, but if you dont care go ahead !

title: Almost On The Beach
review: I stayed here post-cruise for 1 night with wife and friends. The room wasn't ready so we had to wait several hours. I think they called us around 2 PM to say the room was finally ready. The city view suite had a kitchen, which was not that nice I might add, and a separate living room off the bedroom. We didn't use the kitchen, so we didn't care it wasn't that nice. We did, however, like the oversized balcony and living room. It made having four people in the room much more enjoyable. We also liked the walk-in shower. The location wasn't bad either. The hotel is next to a mall with some nice restaurants, including Capital Grill, Truluck's, and Martini Blue. We ate at Truluck's and everything was great except the stone crabs, which were terrible. Martini Blue is a fun spot to hang…

title: Wonderfully comfortable hotel
review: And if the 10 minute walk to the shops and restaurants is too much, this hotel is on the Water Taxi route. There's also a very good shopping mall within a 5 minute walk (Galleria).  Turning my attention to the hotel facilities, there's a heated outdoor pool and whirlpool with views of the waterway. The restaurant (which I didn't use) has outdoor seating as well as indoor. There's also a bar.  The rooms (sorry, suites!) are superb. Separate seating area, TWO flat-screen TVs, balcony, and kitchenette and dining table in all rooms.  This hotel was chosen for me as a pre-cruise stop-over. I'm hoping to stay here next time I book a cruise.

title: great location
review: spent 3 nights there. beautiful place, amazing patio. a bit pricey, but well worth it. lot's near by.

title: Watching the manatees -in luxery!
review: Although not advertised as a hotel amenity, watching the manetees, in the Ft Lauderdale inter-coastal waters, from our seventh-floor balcony was the highlight of our US visit. The hotel is very-well appointed (unless your desperate to be 'on the beach') being, as it is, a water-taxi stop and walking distance from the Galleria Mall and restaurants such as the Blue Martini and the superb P F Chang's China Bistro. Our suite was excellent , clean and roomy with all amenities needed by 'post cruisers' and the staff helpful and efficient. There is a small swimming pool and fitness facilities, too.  We'll go again!

title: Never Again
review: Stayed here one night 1-22-11 prior to cruise. Bathroom floor literally covered in hair. I wiped up a grapefruit size wad with a towel. Front desk sent maid to clean again but by that time I was completely disgusted with the place. To cap things off the next morning a big, burly valet actually SMOKED in my never before smoked in Acura TL. I would never again set foot in this dump.

title: Excellent Hotel perfect location !!!
review: I was staying at this hotel for almost two weeks - simply couldn't go elsewhere - it is a great hotel at a perfect location (intracoastal waterway and few minute from the beach), The rooms are beautiful. Staff was really friendly and helpful. I want to go back now ...

title: wouldn't recommend it, dirty and unwelcoming
review: I stayed at the hotel on January 2011 and the experience wasn't pleasant. To start with, the staff at the reception desk is the most unwelcoming staff I have encountered after years of traveling, not even saying hello when you walk into the hotel. Regarding the cleanliness, the rooms where not vacuumed during my entire stay, I mean I would see the same crumbs left by me the day before! The carpets were worn out, even with a yellow stain, the appliances and paint seemed very used and what was once a nice decor is now worn out. (Btw good luck even getting the room done!) There were even strange (and disgusting!) smells in the corridors. If you are bothered by noises, do not even think of this hotel. There is a fire station just 2 blocks away and trucks constantly go through.  The…

title: Great Location and Awesome views.
review: Try to get a room with a view of the intracoastal waterway and watch the boats go by. The higher up you are the better your distant ocean views are. This location offers a little bit for everyyone. My wife enjoyed being across the street from the upscale mall and I enjoyed being just a couple hundred yards from the state park entrance for a morning walk. The water taxi (they have a depot at the Hotel) is the easiest way to get down to Los Olas or any of the other "go to" spots in the area. It's also alot more fun to hop on the boat and see the area from the water. This is a nice Hotel in a great spot and I would certainly return. The parking fee is complete BS and unfortunately very common at all of the hotels in Lauderdale and Miami. They should do a better job of disclosing it…

title: Excellent Hotel, but expensive parking
review: Really liked this hotel.  We were upgraded to a room on top floor with  great view of the intercoastal waterway.  The rooms and the public spaces are beautiful.  Breakfast was excellent.   Fitness room was very good.  Staff was really friendly and helpful.  Valet staff had trouble explaining the parking options, though they tried and they did not push the valet option.  I still do not understand it fully, but even self parking is $20 a night.  Overall a top hotel, with great cookies.

title: Precruise stay for toddler and 4 adults, loved it.
review: We stayed coincidentally during the Christmas boat parade. What fun! Our room was stylish and comfortable. A family of 5, sharing the bathroom got a little tight. Only critique, was no bathtub. We brought an inflatable baby tub for our 2 year old. Lovely bathroom, but wished the door swang out, not in.   We walked across the street to cvs or down the street to 7-11 on route to home from the beach to get supplies for kitchen.   Beach only a 5 minute walk and totally under rated. Quiet sparkling, despite being a city beach.   Pool was beautiful, the "beach" area of the hotel had chic lawn furniture, and water taxi at your door.   Be warned if you have small kids. Do not plan to spend time at their beach area, as it's open un-fenced boat dock. Pool also more adult friendly. But…

title: Good Location and Nice Place to Stay
review: This hotel is in a nice location - walking distance to the Galleria and very close to the beach. I thought the service was very good and we had a really nice suite overlooking the water. It was quiet at night. We had continental breakfast every morning, which was decent. There was ample parking. The only problem we had was that there was only one business center computer working out of three.

title: Very Frugal with Hilton Honors Guests, Hotel OK
review: We stayed here for the Ft. Lauderdale Boat Parade and live in the area. We stayed in a suite for Hilton Points which was nice however there were no other Hilton Honors benefits. They do not allow people to get a room with a view of the water with points during the boat parade, no free breakfast, concierge level, etc.  Hotel was a bit rude during the boat parade. People were securing spots with good viewing all day and then about an hour before the parade they vacated everyone due to a private party and crammed the remaining people who paid dearly for their rooms into a very small area by the pool. They should have warned people much earlier then they did and put signs out. They also had very bright lights on throughout the parade which was annoying. The boat parade was enjoyable…

title: Worst hotel stay ever
review: I have stayed in hotels all over the world and this was probably the worst stay of my life. I would not and could not ever recommend this hotel to anyone. In spite of renovation three  years ago, it is ready for another. The carpets are tired, the furniture is scored, the cupboards are barely hanging on their hinges, there is a leak in the roof, the refrigerator freezes your food, the toaster did not work, the TV worked only in black and white (I could go on if time allowed). The pool resides in the shade about half the day and is very dirty. Many of the  pool chairs are broken and dangerous. The staff are probably the most ornery and non  hospitable that I have ever met. This Hilton Hotel is certainly lacking the qualities of a top rate hotel chain. There are a thousand other…

title: Excellent Hotel - Except for the Business Center
review: We stayed twice at this hotel for a total of four nights before and after our cruise.  Both times our room was upgraded from city view to water view.  Both suites were very nice and spacious.  Our second stay included the breakfast buffet, which was very nice.  We ate one dinner at the hotel - very mediocre.  The hotel is located at a Water Taxi stop, which was very convenient.  The staff was friendly, but made promises that they didn't keep in regards to the business center.  On our first stay, one of the three computers in the business center was out of order.  On our second stay - 11 days later - that computer was still not repaired and a second one was out of order.  In addition, the one printer in the business center was not working on our second stay.  I talked with the…

title: I want to go back
review: Great hotel, friendly excellent service, bed-view-room was great. Water taxi right at the back door and those warm chocolate chip cookies, ummmm great

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: We stayed one night pre-cruise and will not hesitate to stay again on future trips.  We got a great rate & were very pleased with the hotel, staff, & location.  I had booked a city view room but we were upgraded to a water view.  The hotel is on the Inter-coastal Waterway & has a Water Taxi stop.    Our "room" was actually a kitchen/living area with a separate bedroom & full bath.  It had a dishwasher, stove top, microwave, refrigerator, safe, iron, ironing board & 2 flat screen tv's.  We could easily have stayed for a week or so & been very comfortable,  They gave us warm chocolate chip cookies with our room key & they hit the spot.  We didn't have dinner on-site but did enjoy drinks in the lobby bar & breakfast in the morning.  The buffet was plentiful & included made to order…

title: Perfect place!
review: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights post cruise. The suite was so spacious and well laid out with lots of places to put things away. Full kitchen, dining area, living area with flat screen and seperate bedroom with another tv and a big beautiful bathroom. Huge balcony running the length of the bedroom and living area with a city view. Beds were very comfortable with very nice linens and pillows. The hotel is across the street from a very nice mall, and a couple blocks to the beach. It was a $20 cab ride from the port and a $25 ride to the airport. We also discovered it is on the bus route to Sawgrass Mills Outlet stores! Bus 36 stops in front of the mall on Sunrise - about an hour ride and $1.75 will get you to amazing shopping.

title: Great suite for the price
review: My husband and I travel regularly to South Florida and usually prefer smaller boutique type hotels but for this trip were had our 10 year old with us so were looking for something different.  The main reason that I chose the Gallery One was the fact that they offered a one bedroom suite at a reasonable rate. We arrived on a Saturday and the car lobby was mobbed.  My family waited in the car while I went to check in.  I was able to make my check-in with out any problem but I did feal that the Eastern European woman was rather cold but that may not be a reflection on the hotel at all. I reserved a one bedroom suite with a city view.  The suite had a kitchen, which seemed functional even though we didn't use it.  The living area was well appointed and my son was pleased with his…

title: Nice hotel
review: Stayed in loads of Doubletree hotels over the US and this was very similar to the others. Suite was very big with balcony and all was very modern and clean.   Hotel it's self is a bit life less imo and has no where to buy coffee or other little bits and bobs. Breakfast was expensive and having just come from a cheaper Hampton Inn with free breakfast (and in room WIFI) felt it was a bit of a come down. Parking at £20 a night is taking the pi$$ !  Nothing wrong with the hotel but would probably stay nearer Hollywood beach next time as there is much more going on.

title: Great hotel, service, and location
review: Perfect hotel if youre okay not staying right downtown. Great way to save a little $$. Water Taxi stop is right outside which I highly recommend. The water taxi will take you downtown along the intercoastal  waterway. It has 11 stops. Try to get a balcony with a view of the intercoastal waterway. Breakfast was great. 5 minute walk to beach or again just  use water taxi to get to different area of beach.

title: Fantastic....Excellent
review: Stayed at the Galleria One Fort Lauderdale for a week in June and it is a marvelous hotel. Staff was very friendly, very courteous and always available to give tips on what to see , where to shop,and thing to do in Fort Lauderdale.Very friendly and professional staff starting from the reception desk  to the housemaid.What a clean hotel,Could not find any negative points during my stay .

title: It was just okay
review: I wasn't overly impressed. Sure, it was clean, it was well enough located. And our suite was lovely. But the atmosphere felt cold and impersonal. The front desk staff were polite but not what you would call friendly. The guy who stored our luggage for the day even less so. And the bell hop when we were leaving, I don't think he smiled once. We appreciated that the water taxi stop was right outside the door, and we definitely took advantage of that. Though for some unknown reason somebody decided to have a wedding ceremony right in front of the water taxi stop and all of us paying guests and water taxi patrons were shushed out of the way (as if we were in the wrong for being in a public place). They even held up the arrival of the water taxi, so the wedding pictures would be…

title: Great hotel
review: I stayed for three days/two nights at Doubletree hotel for conference. It was a little farther than I would have initially planned but turned out to be great. Room was clean, no bed bugs. Hotel was clean and service was great. They were helpful with taxi service and any other questions I had. Area was safe. It was several blocks from beach but not a bad walk. Beach was beautiful. The hotel is near the Gallery One mall but I never got to go there.

title: Lovely hotel, great location
review: Stayed here for 3 nights in September this year. The rooms are lovely, spacious, and very clean. Our room had a full kitchen, which in all honesty, we didnt make much use of, spacious sitting area, large bedroom and bathroom.  A few things though, the water pressure on the shower in our room was terrible, and seemed to just trickle, and there is a really annoying green flashing fire alarm in the bedroom, which is quite distracting when you are trying to get to sleep. Parking is $20 a night (valet $23 per night). I just dont understand why parking in Fort Lauderdale hotels is so expensive, its free almost anywhere else! We stayed at the Hilton Beach Resort last year, and they charge $30 per night!, The Gallery One is $10 cheaper, but I still think its a rip off.  Other than these…

title: Excellent Property!!! will definetely stay here again
review: We had a great time at this hotel, the rooms are very nice and spacious as all of them are suites with kitchen, they are very well appointed with marble floors in the kitchen and bathroom, stainless steel appliances and marble countertops. the bed is very comfortable and the location is ver convenient to restaurants and bars next door at the Galleria mall. The staff was very friendly, I checked in around 2p and my room was ready with the special requests I had made (The additional mirror I requested wasn't there but that is ok). the valet staff was very friendly and always had our car ready when we needed it. The hotel itself is very nice there is an area for sunbathing overlooking the intracostal close to the pool and a full service pool bar. Overall I really enjoyed stayin at…

title: Exceeded out expectations
review: We chose this hotel after much research for a night before cruise place to stay.  Hubby spent hours looking at different sites trying to get as much info as possible on hotels.  We had originally booked the Embassy Suites as it is highly recommended by cruisers.  We then found out that the hotel was completely booked that night, we didnt want any complications that might come with a full hotel, so we looked at some Hilton properties as we can get or use points.  We booked two rooms, one for us and one for Bro-in-law and his wife.  We used out points so only had to pay for one room.  We went to the hotel before 10am to see when we could check-in, first the valet was super nice and kept the car up front cuz we were leaving as soon as we talked to the check-in desk.  Not only did…

title: Only One Night Thank GOD
review: Lets start out by saying when I arrived at the hotel I thought the lobby was quite beautiful and I was extremely excited to see the rooms. When I went to check in I had my sister with me because I was planning a surprise romantic night for my husband. Kate was the front desk clerk. She checked me in without a problem and off to the 7th floor we went. When we arrive in the room it smelled like wet carpet/mold in the living room and the bed room smelled the same. When I called down to the front desk and stated the problem she just said "OK". I'm on the other end line thinking to myself ok.....after an extended amount of silence I said OK??? She says she’s trying to locate another room on the same floor for me and will have the bell man bring it up. After waiting 20 minutes in the…

title: Great Experience
review: My husband and I stay at this hotel for our eight year anniversary and we had a great time for two nights. We checked in on Aug 27 until Aug 29.The room kept clean daily and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoy the beach which was walking distance from the hotel. Also the Galleria Mall is right next to the hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone who want a quick gateaway and want to relax.  CONS: Restaurant near hotel get crowded fast and need early reservation especially on Saturday. Parking lot overprice

title: Pleasant stay
review: Great value for money for the room. Large, good maintenance condition, very clean. We stayed 6 nights and found parking very expensive (we didn't park the car in the hotel because of that reason, in fact). Pool area is very nice, good views from the pool, which is placed away from main avenue and parking lot. In general the staff was very friendly. Housekeeping (Maria E.) was very good. Bartenders were extremelly friendly, and still discrete, which was a great combination, sometimes not easy to find. We had late check out and our room access cards were not properly set/programmed for this condition. When we wanted to access the room, we were asked questions like if it was the first time we were seen (after 6 days of every-morning greetings). We were not offered a new card, which…

title: Tired-looking hotel with great staff
review: We recently stayed here for the 2nd time and had an ok experience - we were in King Suite on the 11th floor. There was a functional, clean kitchen but stained carpets and scratched furniture. Our first stay here was about 6 and it definately didn't look like that then. Apart from the shabbyness of the rooms the staff were super friendly and helpful, apart from a disappointing final impression when after waiting 30 minutes for a porter to take our suitcases downstairs we gave up and did it ourselves!

title: Great Staff
review: We used points for this trip - sometimes you do that to save a few dollars and end up in something less than what you wanted.  Not this time.  The hotel was nice and the staff was excellent.   As other people mentioned, the location is great.  Be sure to use the water taxi.  It was a great addition to the whole experience.  We only needed one night prior to a cruise.   From the very begining, the bellmen were 5 star.  Everyone we encountered was exceptional.    Downside?   The room itself was a little old.   The couch had fabric that was split, but the bed was fantastic.   (reminded me of a Westin style of bed!)

title: Great Location - Great Rooms
review: Great hotel location and rooms are very well appointed.  We loved having the kitchenette, allowed for light breakfast to be made.  The entire property is excellent - pool area nice, water taxi pulls right up for some exploring; front desk service and bell men all excellent.  The rooms are up to date, lovely canal views.  Close to loads of shopping, walk to the Galleria.  Close to the beach, easy walking distance.  Would highly recommend anytime.

title: Don't Miss Out On This Great Experience
review: The best property choice for a group's 'pre-cruise' outing.  Excellent for a large group, or just a couple.  WoW!  Service was exceptional.  The group events department was awesome!  All you need to do is make the call and they'll make you look really, really good!  Prime location - right next door to the Galleria Mall.  The best part of the property - the outside area - great for gatherings, or if you chose to take the water taxi.  Walking distance to CVS, Manis & Pedis, Barber, Beverage, Dining, Shopping, Adult night-life, etc...Superior rooms...beds were so comfy, you felt like you were at home.  On-site food was rather pricey, but given the area, the quality was great.  Can't wait to go back.

title: Nice comfortable hotel
review: We went there for a conference trip. I booked a double bedroom suite. The room was very spacey. You can fit in 4 people as it has 2 double bed in one room. Of course, we were selfish and have one double bed for ourselves. We had a dining table and sofas in the living room. It great to do work if you are going on a business trip. There is a kitchenette and a mini-coffee machine to brew your coffee every morning. In level 2, there is a room where you can surf the internet and printing facilities to print your boarding pass etc. Next to the hotel, there is the galleria and food court. Its just 3 minutes walk to go shopping! If you walk 10-15 mins east of the hotel, you can find your way to the beach! The hotel location is fantastic! service is awesome too..you get hot soft cookie…

title: Excellent, would stay again!
review: I absolutely loved this hotel. I stayed on the 11th floor and our suite was very spacious. I have never slept in such a comfy lovely bed. Kitchen was modern, spotless and had all we needed. Living room was cosy and balcony huge with 2 pairs of sliding doors from bedroom and living room. Marie E. who took care of 11th floor really did excellent job. We had every day enough coffee, clean towels, soaps and toilet tissues. It was a pleasure to stay there and I miss my huge bed - I slept so well. We used internet room, pool and restaurant too. It was nice to get news of the days every morning waiting to be read with a cup of coffee. Staff was friendly and helpful everywhere at this hotel.

title: Great w/some Customer Service Tweaking
review: My first introduction to Gallery One-Doubletree was rocky and I am easily pleased no high maintenance here. Yet, I waited over 20 minutes to be checked in as the 2 people at the desk worked with one customer( seemed like someone they wanted to impress). I don't have a problem with this but we were guests too. Finally, the whatever it was suck up session eneded. The young woman Zeynaib was very apologetic and it soothed my stressed nerves. She everfound us a room we could check into early and was understanding with my CC having issue( didn't notify my bank of travel). We were handed two of the warmest best cookies.  We get to our two room suite. Very nice kitchenette area very clean, nice living room area w/big screen TV. Nice double queen room, comfortable beds and nice linen.…

title: I might stay here again...
review: I always like to finish on a positive note so I'll do cons first and then pros :).  Cons:  Noisy/thin walls.  Tried to do some work in the mid afternoon, and even though I was on the 14th floor, I could hear traffic below and children playing in the room next door.  It was distracting.  Some mild housekeeping upgrades would be good.  Windows a bit dirty/smudgy, fingerprints on faucets.  Bed and carpet was nice and clean, though.  Pool was just ok.  FILLED with kids so if you need peace and tranquility, not the place to go.  They also blast 50's type beach pop music at the pool and it's a bit loud.  Fees of $23 a night for valet parking and $20 fee for parking in general kind of bothersome.    Pro's:  Location is nice.  Right on the intercoastal and right over the bridge from the…

title: Excellent Value for the price, couldn't ask for more.
review: I stayed at the Doubletree Galleria with my girlfriend and had a wonderful time.  I went out for a night of celebrating, and ended the night with a great hotel!  I was greeted with a smile and a warm cookie, which was a rare and pleasant touch.  My room was ready when I arrived and it was much nicer than I expected for the price.  One block from the beach, full kitchen, living room, two flat screens, and a large shower all for the same price of a sub par hotel...love it.  I requested a very late check out and I was accomidated with no complicatications at all.  I have paid twice as much for a lesser hotel.  I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, and I will definately stay there again.

title: Quality, comfort & style at a very affordable price
review: This was my second stay at Gallery One & it was just as nice as the first time when I was here for pleasure.  The resort is close to everything, has beautiful vues, great outdoor space and the rooms are clean & have a modern chic appeal to them.  And the beds...can you say comfy?!?  The front desk was so helpful, I was in need of a sewing kit & aspirin & they were able to accommodate me immediately. I feel this venue is a great value for anyone who wants quality for an affordable price.

title: The Most Comfy hotel Ever...Like a Little Apartment!
review: Our stay at doubletree was very pleasant.  The bedding was fresh, crisp, and clean.  It was very plush and "dreamy".  Our suite was well equipped with anything I needed and made the stay very pleasurable.  The Water taxi being right there also was very enjoyable and very informational.

title: Fun and relaxation  in the sun!
review: I stayed at this hotel from June 12- 19- when i got there i was greeted by the from desk staff who were all very nice and helpful. I upgraded to the King Suite with the water-view which was a beautiful! The bedding was comfy the nice furniture to make your stay feel like the comforts of home.  The parking was a little pricy but then again so are all all the prices on the beach hotels so there is no getting around that but the location was great and convenient (though there is some construction by the draw bridge right now for the next few months but nothing that you cannot get around).   See attached my pics and you will see what i mean- there is little i could find during my stay that was not good- the breakfast i did included in my price which i would recommend b/c otherwise…

title: Really clean with friendly staff and close to everything.
review: This hotel gets a 5 star rating from me.  I always try to stay in a Hilton Hotel when traveling with my Grandchildren becasue you know what to expect.  This time we stayed at the Doubletree in Fort lauderdale which is next to the Galleria Mall.  We shopped to we dropped at the mall because of all the sales going on there.  The food court was outstanding!  When we checked in at the Doubletree we were handed warm cookies that the children loved.  The pool was clean, plenty of towels and again a courteous staff.  Our suite was on the 8th floor with a beautiful view of the city.  The beds were really comfortable and CLEAN!  Next month we are traveling to North Carolina and will be looking to book at another Doubletree Hotel.

title: Wonderful
review: Anyone will love this hotel and their staff. Great location, upscale comfortable and plenty of things to see and do. Loved it and everytime I am in Fort Lauderdale, FL I always stay at this hotel. Beautiful views and short walk to beach (5 minutes tops)

title: Great Location for Families with Older Teens & Young Adult Kids
review: We stayed two nights prior to a cruise and it was perfect. The water taxi stops right at the hotel, near the outdoor, waterfront bar so it's a pleasant area to wait for the next water taxi which takes you everywhere any vacationer would want to visit in Ft. Lauderdale. We loved that this hotel wasn't on the strip (A1A) and was less "touristy", adjacent to the wonderful Galleria mall (which by the way has the best food court ever with super healthy choices ... better deal and food than the high priced local restaurants!), and right near a CVS and a Starbucks. Close enough to the beach to cross the bridge and run along the Atlantic Ocean, and a $10 cab ride later, you're down a mile or two to the midst of the main drag of the beach/restaurant/bar area. A great hotel for the price…

title: A very clean, efficient average stay in the city.
review: Stopped here for 1 night on our way down to the Keys - wasn't keen on driving through Miami - and Homestead was a bit too remote for us  - having said that, the weather was so bad, and amenities so thin on the ground we endeed up doing very little here. The hotel seems very well placed, next to a very upscale mall - but compared to places like Tampa or Orlando there seemed very little to occupy us. Dining choices locally were limited and expensive - and the hotel is next to a few very busy roads so foot travel is not that pleasant. The rooms and service were what you'd expect - very clean, nice and modern. It's a  big corporate hotel - smart, and charmless. Parking isn't free though, and the restaurant a bit too chic for my tastes - i'd say it's perfect for business travellers,…

title: Heaven on earth!
review: This hotel was outstanding.  Pristine, clean, immaculate ... the beds were so comfortable, the marble floors and walls in the bathroom made me never want to leave.  We had a full balcony overlooking the waterway - so beautiful to wake up to each day.  Staff were very accommodating.  Loved the stainless steel appliances in kitchen - could have stayed here for a very long time and we will definitely be back.

title: Great Hotel
review: This is a great Hotel to stay at. It is modern, very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Not too far from the beach and Las Olas. Would definitely go back and recommend it to everyone I know.

title: exceeded expectations for relaxing getaway
review: efficent checkin after long ride from no. carolina.....suite loaded with ammenities that met my every need.....great balcony view of the city for quiet evenings with a cocktail.....water taxi at the "back door".....pool with view of the waterway.....fast, quality room service....world class shopping next door....highly recommend the property for buiness or pleasure trips.....i can verify "hilton Cares" about their clients

title: Awesome experience
review: The hotel and staff were exceptional. Upon arrival I was greated and helped out immediately. The complimentary cookie was delicious. The view of the canal was perfect. The only negative was they charge additionally for high speed internet. Not that big a deal.   I would definietly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: My family and I stayed at the Gallery One Hotel for one week after a family tragedy in May 2010. Immediately upon arrival we greeted with a warm welcome from both the valets and the front desk.  We were also upgraded to a wonderful suite that was quite large and clean. The pool area was fantastic for kids and family and there was even two weddings while we were visiting.  Room service, Careline and Housekeeping were always available and approachable. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and hope to return in the near future.

title: I stayed at this hotel this weekend...
review: I stayed at this hotel this weekend. ...first and last time! First thing I noticed is that the suites aren't as large as pictured on hotel site. Next thing was the prices for parking ..$20 daily for self parking!!! First morning we found that someone had decided to turn one of the elevators into a bathroom...feces on the floor!!! We were awakened at 3:00 am by a loud crowd in the hallway...calls to the front desk meant nothing as this ruckus continue until about 4:30!!! Definitely will not ever stay here again as front desk didn't really seem concerned...even about the feces!

title: Nice place for stay, great location, great service
review: I stayed last year in a leisure trip with my extended family.
