At arrival they received us very well, gave all of us a warn cholocate cookie and they assigned us the room really quick which I really appreciate as I was traveling with my grand mother and my little baby.    The room was very nice, with a great view of the water courses and the city.   I was in the 14th floor.     The service was very good, specially at the restaurant and the lobby.    Our trip was mosthly dedicated for christmas shopping and we used the valet parking all the time and the valet guys were very kind helping us with all the bags...  parking at this hotel is at extra cost,  but is a very good option specially if you use the valet.     The pool was warm all the time as well as the jacuzzy and they had…

title: I would stay here again~
review: Our family Cristmas reunion in Florida was a great success in large part because of the facilities at this hotel.  We had a large suite with a walk-in stall shower, well-equipped with 2 TV's and kitchen facilities, a view of the Intracoastal Waterway, free internet access, a fitness center, access to the water taxi right outside, a very short walk to the Gallery One mall with innumerable stores and a huge food court, a very short walk to upscale restaurants, a few blocks walk to the Ft. Lauderdale beach.  All in all, this hotel is extremely well-located.  My only criticism would be the buffet breakfast--not enough fresh fruit, not enough variety; pastries and bread were mediocre.  However, one could eschew the buffet breakfast and take the short walk to the food court at the…

title: Had my wedding here, Gallery ONE was good fit
review: After doing some research, I chose Gallery ONE Doubletree Suites to host my wedding and reception.  Overall, I am pleased I did.  The catering manager I dealt with, Tom, was excellent with communicating with me from long distance and went over all details to my event with me.  He always answered me promptly.  When we checked in to the hotel, we were hours early (check in time 3pm, we came at 7am and they still let us in).  The computer was down, so the check in desk gave us extra coupons for free cookies and a few few vouchers for breakfasts.  Very nice!  I have nothing but good things to say about the room, it was big and clean and the bathroom was nice.  The restaurant there (Vue) doesn't have a very big menu, but it gets the job done.  My reception was near flawless, I was…

title: Best Hotel Experience
review: I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody.  The rate they gave us was a little higher than I originally wanted to pay, but what we got was above and beyond what we would have got anyplace else.  2 rooms with a kitchen, very clean and awsome service from the front desk and housekeeping staff - SO friendly.    Location was terrific - right on the waterway which was beautiful day and night.  And beside the Galleria mall where the Piaza offered fantastic food selections at very reasonable prices, perfect for meeting up with everybody for breakfast and at the end of the day.

title: Comfortable Hotel with the comforts of home.
review: We really enjoyed the Gallery One.  The rooms were spacious and had everything you need to be comfortable, including a functioning kitchen, living area, and separate bedroom.  The bed was large and comfortable.  Bathroom was very nice and modern with a large shower and great water pressure.  Room service was good, but a bit pricey.   The valet staff, bellboys, and event staff were AMAZING!  The front desk staff were adequate, but not particularly helpful or friendly.  We were at the Gallery One for a wedding and I've got to say that the servers for the wedding were AMAZING!  They did a wonderful job and really went out of their way to make things perfect for the bride and groom.      My only complaint about the hotel is that the sliding doors to the patios are very loud.  It…

title: Great Hotel, Poor Staff
review: We stayed in a very large suite at this beautiful hotel.  It was really more room than we needed, but added to the luxury feel of our stay.  The room had a full kitchen, living room, bedroom and huge bathroom.  The bathroom was gorgeous!  Bed linens and bath towels were nice.  Our room, with balcony, overlooked the intercoastal water way with the ocean off in the distance.  There is some noise from traffic going over the nearby bridge that made leaving the sliding door open undesirable, but tolerable when closed.  The location is great, within easy walk to the beach and to the mall.    While the hotel itself was positive, I thought the staff was lacking in hospitality.  Every time we walked by the front desk to the room, we expected to be greated with a welcome or at least a…

title: A place we continue to return to.
review: We have stayed at the Gallery One several times now before taking cruises out of Ft. Lauderdale.  We find it to be a wonderful place to stay.  It is right on the water taxi stop and you can easily get around via the water taxi and that is also a wonderful way to spend a fun day just exploring Ft. Lauderdale.  It is also close, like within walking distance to a wonderful mall for shopping.  There are also wonderful restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.  We also enjoyed the bar and ate dinner there on several occasions.

title: needs updating
review: Nice location. Can walk to beach. Nice size rooms (we had a suite).   Cons -- tired furniture -- big stain on the carpet (although it looked like they had tried to clean it) -- stain on the tile in the bathroom -- they charged a fair amt for self parking, $24? -- they charged for internet.  We stayed at the Il Lugano the previous 3 vacations to Ft. Lauderdale but decided to try something new as the Il Lugano was a bit pricey. We'll probably go back to the Il Lugano or try something else next time.  The DoubleTree does have a better pool than the smaller pool of the Il Lugano.

title: I knew this was where we wanted to stay.
review: After being placed here by Priceline in December a few years back, I hoped to be placed again by 'Bookit' this year in advance of our cruise for a one night stay.  Well, 'Bookit' chose another hotel for us.  I paid the $20.00 penalty and cancelled that reservation and booked Gallery One on my own.  I got a great rate as there was a sale and we stayed one night in this lovely gem a couple blocks from the ocean and right on the intracoastal.  The suites are spacious and clean.  My lovely lady who is very germaphobic was very pleased with our accomodations.  The only things wrong that we noticed were: a) we couldn't get into or use the safe in the room; b) there was a small leak spot in the ceiling above the otherwise spotless and beautiful shower; and c) some idiot spring break…

title: Great location, Great hotel
review: We stayed here for one night after our cruise.  Hotel rooms are very spacious (especially after ac ruise cabin) and hotel very clean and well maintained.  Location was also good, within walking distance to the beach with local shops and restaurants as well as a mall with chain shops and restaurants.  Staff was very helpful and would not hesitate to stay here again, either for business or for a longer beach trip.

title: It's a good place to stay.
review: this place was good, clean, the transportation was good, the meal was breakfast , not so good, it was cold. The front end staff  VERY SLOW!! We stayed 2 different nights, it would be great to stay for a week, as the kitchenette would be great. Area was great, so handi to the water taxi. Overall GOOD

title: Perfect place for families
review: Stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite with 2 teens and 2 adults in March for 3 nights prior to leaving for our cruise from Miami. In the master bedroom, it had a king bed, and full bath.  The second room had 2 queens and a full bath as well. There was a TV in each bedroom.  The living room had a pull out couch and a chair and flat screen TV.  There was also a glass topped table with 4 chairs for eating. The small kitchen facility was perfect for our needs for breakfast.  There is a 2 burner stove, microwave, dishwasher, toaster and coffee maker.  The coffee maker is small and supplies from the hotel are there.  We were also short of plates but just a call to the desk and there they were!!  There is a drug store within a short walking distance that we were able to go for…

title: Good Value for the Money
review: We had a nice stay at Doubletree - all the rooms are suites with kitchenettes, living rooms, flat screen tvs, and nicely appointed bathrooms.  We got free wi-fi with our Hilton HHonors membership.   Location isn't bad - next to Galleria Mall, if you want shopping.  Water taxi stop is right there.   Vue restaurant on site was good - our food didn't look great when we got it, but it tasted really good.  The outdoor bar on the water is a nice touch too.  For the price point, Doubletree was a nice place.   We were very comfortable - the only real downside was the front desk staff was pretty inefficient and the parking is expensive at $21.00 valet per night ($18 self park).  The internet is $9.95 per day normally.

title: Great Hotel, Staff and amenities
review: This is our second year at this hotel. We are international travelers and look for comfort,cleanliness, hospitality and a relaxing place to stay.  The staff is wonderful, the suites are pleasant,clean and the staff in the restaurant (we  have breakfast every day) are great. It is comfortable because we have  the same waiters/waitresses for the past two years. We choose to self park our car but when we need a cab to go to dinner the valet guys are very accomadating.  We like that there are a few upscale restaurants that we can walk to but there is also a great food court at the Galleria Mall with very reasonable restaurants. The Hotel is on the intercoastal and the water taxi stops in front and gives folks the option to go to several waterside attractions. We also like the…

title: Is it we are so unlucky ?
review: I book this hotel on 7/3 for 2 nights in Chengdu on 15-17/3, When I arrived and check in to the counter, the counter said they have no record of our booking, but we already have the reconfirm email from Airasia and paid by credit card. On the same time,  another family happened to be same situation just like us that they book for 3 rooms; we dont know what to do, luckily that the counter suggest that we paid for another RMB2500 for 2 nights deposit that they will let us stay in (We book from AirAsia is RM153 per night, now is RM500 per night, we will see how tomorrow that we can contact with Airasia to settle this smoothly.

title: great stay,nice room on intercostal
review: stayed here in feb,nice clean room on intercostal,hotel pool warm,really nothing to complain about only the length of time it took for our sons crib to be delivered,would stay here again on next trip,

title: Perfect place to stay.
review: We stayed at the Doubletree after our cruise in February.  It was very clean and the staff were very helpful.  The rooms were large and had lots of space.  We used the Careline several times and they responded immediately.  The pool was warm and we had a great time swimming.  There was a little beach with sand for the kids to play in.  It keep them amused for hours.  The location is perfect as you are next to the Gallery Mall.  The water taxi is right outside the door.  Ryan at the front desk was very helpful with our rooms and booking the shuttle.  The cookies are the best that you have ever tasted.  It was the perfect place to stay with a family.

title: Nice appartments
review: Stayed with my family, 2 adults and 2 kids (3 and 6) during a 9-days vacation in Frt Lauderdale. We liked the One as it had large rooms, nice kitchen and large bathroom with shower/bath. Nice flat screen TV. The kitchen was good even though we missed the freezer.  We cooked a lot of meals in the apartment and there were plenty of stores close to the hotel. We had some complaints when we arrived - and got a dinner-on-the-house as compensation! Pool area was nice. We used the hotel gym a lot and that was nice. Parking was expansive. Walking distance to the beach it took about 10 minutes. Very close the shopping mall. The hotel is a bit "off" but we took the car when we wanted to go somewhere - and this is US - you don't walk.    All in all we had a great stay and we will comeback.…

title: Very nice Hotel
review: We stayed in the Gallery One - Doubletree Guest Suites on Feb. 8 to the 12th...We had a wonderful stay..Very clean..Rooms were spacious...This hotel is located on a busy street and on the intercoastal waterway...There is a watertaxi in the back of the Hotel..We had a nice time on the tour of the intercoastal waterway...It was a bit cold to swim in the pool...The pool was very small..  We would stay there again if we go back to Ft. Lauderdale..

title: Amazing Rooms, Amazing Views, Amazing Price
review: My girlfriend and I stayed here over Valentine's weekend.  After searching weeks for an affordable hotel in the Fort Lauderdale area that was within walking distance of the beach, bars, restaurants, etc, I landed on this hotel.  The pictures on the website don't do the hotel justice.  We stayed in a king suite with private City View balcony.  The rooms I believe, are all suites.  The room was incredible: full kitchen, full living room, large wall mounted plasma, spacious shower, ridiculously comfy bed. I had been worried booking the city view instead of the water view (to save about $70 total for 2 nights) but the view was beautiful nonetheless and we ended up with partial water views anyway.  Our stay came with free breakfast buffet for both mornings, and service in the cafe…

title: good new year's getaway
review: Stayed here 3 nights for new years getaway.  Hotel is older but  well maintained. Clean and roomy suites.  Good sized bathroom too.  Fairly quiet except for new year's eve celebrations which was to be expected. Front desk service was pleasant.  Only issue during stay is that we arrived earlier than check-in time and room was not ready.  We left our # with the front desk agent who was supposed to call us as soon as room was ready.  We never received a call so we waited until check-in time and went back to hotel.  Hotel is within walking distance to pharmacy, liquor store, & beach. Overall enjoyable stay.  Would stay here again.

title: Great rooms, great price
review: I just stayed two nights while in town on business. The hotel is very nice, especially for a Doubletree. The hotel lobby was updated. My room was a large two room suite which also included a small kitchen (fridge, sink, and even a two burner stove top). They had a nice gym, offering most everything you could need. Their business center was struggling while I was there, only having one computer working. So, the front desk staff was kind enough to print off my airline tickets for me. They offer vallet as well as self parking options. I didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant so I'm not sure how it was. Overall, a nice hotel in a good location. I would stay here again.

title: Wonderful place, excellent rooms
review: This is a very fine hotel, quiet, well placed and with the type of services you could expect at this level (also pricelevel). We had a suite on 14th floor, water wiew and enjoyed every moment.  The small nuisances, such as the breathtaking valetservice, with stupid explanations of the rooms functions as we had never been in a hotel before only to get the tips and the lack of the last level of control of cleaning (plastic icebag in kitchen sink, used coffee bag in coffee machine) do not change the quality image.  The breakfast buffet is at the level you can expect in this level hotel, but it lacks real quality products. It was 100% the same cereals, dairy products, jam and yoghurt's as in the cheap motels. However the fresh orangejuice is nice and the coffe is good. If you ask…

title: Very comfortable, modern and friendly for us and our visiting grandchildren.
review: We would definitely stay again next time we are in Ft. Lauderdale.  Our Son and Daughter in Law rented another suite and although they were quite happy with their accomodations, their kids, our grandchildren constantly visited us. Our accomodations were such that we had lots of room, two television sets, a kitchen and sitting room to entertain in great style. The restaurant served delicious onion soup for a late snack and also served a great breakfast for the eight people in our party.

title: The Best Stay Florida has to offer
review: My husbands 70th Birthday party was a super success thanks to the staff at the Doubletree.  The rooms offered the most fantastic ocean and intracoastal water view. One block from  the Galleria mall and excellent restaurants/bars.  The staff was friendly, professional, caring and very attentive.   No cars was needed everthing is a water taxi away.

title: large suites at a good price in a friendly neighborhood
review: Very congenial and helpful staff. Extremely well situated with a neighborhood feel as opposed to a resort ambience. Rooms are spacious and immaculate. Intend to return in a year.

title: Would stay here again in a heartbeat
review: My stay here was wonderful. I was here with my family for a pre-cruise stay....needless to say, we were sad we were leaving to go on our cruise. We wanted to stay longer here. We had arrived early due to our flight  time, and we were given a room immediately. Not only that, we were upgraded to a fantastic waterview. This hotel has excellent service, from coming through the front door, to arriving to our room. Everyone was very professional and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The kitchenette was perfect for our needs.The water taxi stops right outside for a perfet way to get around to the fantastic restaurants and shopping. I would rdefinitely return with my family again.

title: Great Hotel & Location
review: This hotel is excellent. Spent 7 nites last week. Staff was very friendly & helpful, a short walk to the galleria shopping center and some great restaurants, (especially Seasons 52) The rooms are large, very nicely decorated, with very good breakfasts. The warm chocolates at check in are a nice touch. I would caution guests to avoid a room too close to Sunrise Hwy. It's very noisy.

title: Wedding Weekend in Ft. Laud
review: I stayed at the Gallery One for one night in the suite... it was a great experience. Although they didn't have freshly baked cookies on arrival (they were baking ... and redeemable) ... the rest of the experience was enjoyable. Room was clean ... tip/top shape. Comfortable beds, pillows, nice bathrooms. Showers = amazing. It's located right on the water and since our wedding was on a yacht ... it picked us up straight off the dock on the back of the hotel. There are water taxis if you don't feel like driving. Only downside of this hotel is the parking fees: $21/valet, $18/self-park. Bar was small but relaxing and fun. Decently priced drinks....I guess compared to South Beach. $10 - scotch/soda, $6 - beer. Blue Martini is at the Galleria mall only a few blocks from the hotel…

title: Excellent Hotel, Great Location
review: Spent six days at this hotel and could not have been more pleased. It is a fantastic location. Just a block from the Gallery Mall with three excellent upscale restaurants (Truluck, PF Chang and Capital Grill), Red Door Spa next door, a short walt to the beach and to Bonnet House. Best of all, the Water Taxi stops right at the hotel. The hotel is out of the main tourist area and thus nice and quite. Room was large and very clean. Staff very helpful.

title: Not bad.. but not amazing.
review: My husband and I stayed here the week of New Year's Eve with our two toddlers and found the hotel to be just.. okay. The room was decently sized and the hotel was in a really good location, however I didn't see the "amazing" service that other reviewers commented on. The main problem we had with this hotel was the fact that our room didn't have a bathtub. Anyone with two small toddlers will understand how this can easily become a problem. However, we made due with the large walk-in shower and had only one "beach day" (because washing a two year-old's hair in a walk-in shower is nearly impossible), much to our chagrin. Overall I'd say that I'd stay here again- it's in a good location, away from the craziness of Beach Place and A1A, but close enough that you can still feel like…

title: Excellent location & accommodations.
review: Stayed here for the 2nd time as an overnight before a cruise.  The location is great because it is a very short walk to the Galleria Mall which offers many alternative dining options as well as good shopping.  The other plus is this hotel is a scheduled stop on the water taxi route which is one of the neatest ways to get around and see Ft. Lauderdale!

title: Great hotel, service left a lot to be desired
review: My wife and I stayed here on New Years Eve 2009-2010. I stay at a lot of Hilton properties (I'm a Diamond) and we really liked the rooms here. Great beds and all the furnishings appeared to be in good shape. We had a balcony overlooking the intercoastal and could see the ocean in the distance and that was a nice bonus. Very convenient to the airport, beach, & tons of restaurants. The grounds are very well kept too. However, several other reviews rave of the fantastic service and I did not experience any of that during our stay. No smile or friendly greeting from the front desk guy who checked me in. Plus, we didn't receive the standard complimentary cookies-I had to call the front desk and ask for them once I realized they missed that. Not a major deal-breaker or anything, but…

title: This hotel is Paradise !!!!
review: This is the second time this year we spent our vacation at The Doubletree.  We just love it here.  The suites are beautiful, very nicely appointed and spotlessly clean!!!!  We love the fact that we have a kitchen and a living/dining room.  The beds are sooooo comfortable you do not want to get out of  it  in the morning.  The bathroom is beautiful and very large with a fantastic rain shower.  Wonderful amenities in the bathroom.  The cookies you receive at check in are delicious and warm!!!  There is not one negative about this hotel.  You are close to everything.  You are within walking distance to shopping, beach, restaurants!!!!  The staff are terrific, always greeting you and smiling and extremely friendly!!!!  We love it here and can't wait to return!!!  They truly aim to…

title: one small problem but will definitely stay again
review: I was very impressed with this hotel..being that it was my first trip here.  The room was excellent..it was nice to have a living room, balcony, and full kitchen in the suite.  Everything was clean and the staff was friendly.  The only problem I had was that it was a little chilly in our room. We could not get the heat to warm the room at all....we called maintenance and they came and looked at it...but it still was not fixed.  We spent two nights in a cold room.  But we had blankets... Outside of that...we loved it..and will be back next year to see the Steelers dominate the Dolphins again.....

title: Watch Your Belongings
review: We file a theft report with the Ft. Lauderdale Police Department because the thief was by the housekeeper or by the next occupants because the housekeeper did not do her job.

title: Fantastic Coddling at the Doubletree
review: All the other reviewers are right ... this is a most perfect place to stay.  Absolutely nothing negative at all.  We were there on points but were treated like royalty.  My husband had a problem with the location of our suite, and Chris the Manager made him feel really good about the suite .... since the hotel was sold out that was very much appreciated.  I liked Fort Lauderdale much more than I thought I would .... the beach really is 3 easy blocks away.

title: very attentive and excellent service
review: the room I stayed in was in the romance suite. Upon arrival I received great parking accomadations and felt welcomed. At check in there were two hot and fresh cookies given to me. The room was promtly ready and very efficiant. I received my bottle of wine that was included ice cold and it was well placed on the table. I was on the water view room so the view was beautiful. Also included was a complementry breakfast. All food was served fresh and in good time. I would look forward to staying here again.

title: Location, location, location plus excellent service equals vacation heaven
review: This is my third time to the Doubletree Gallery One in two years and it has always been a smooth relaxing experience.  First, it is convenent to the airport, the beach and the water taxi which can make even that gorgeous mall an afterthought.  The staff is excellant, start ing at the front desk, to housekeeping to the restaurant everyone wants to know what they can do to make your day better.  Maybe it is because I travel with my 82 year old Mum but after three extended stays and seeing the same staff each time so eager to please I think it is plain and simple - the treatmenI t I receive at the Doubletree One is the on par with the way they treat their employees.  At least I hope so - because they always make  us feel like royalty.

title: What a treat!
review: My husband and I booked this hotel the day prior to embarking on a cruise.  I had seen the hotel on a prior trip to Ft. Lauderdale from the water taxi.  It surpassed my expectations!   I had asked for an early check in as my husband and I had flown in from California on a red-eye.  We arrived around 9:30am, fully expecting to just be able to drop our luggage off and drag our bleary eyes somewhere to kill time.  The staff at the Gallery One said that our room was ready, apologized for not having hot cookies yet and gave us rain checks for cookies.  The room was spacious, luxurious and the bed was very comfortable.  We were so grateful to be able to get some sleep and take a shower, it started out our vacation really nicely.  The staff was very nice and the facility is gorgeous!  …

title: I couldn't have picked a better hotel!
review: My wife and I decided to stay an extra day in Fort Lauderdale after a cruise and thought that this hotel looked like a good choice based on internet reviews.  I didn't realize just how good though.  When I booked, I forgot that we'd be leaving the ship around 10am and that most hotels have a 3pm check in.  We took a cab ($15 from Port Everglades with tip) and thought that we may be able to have the front desk hold our luggage until our room was ready.  To my surprise they had my room ready AND gave me a complimentary room upgrade!  Wow!  Our room was very classy in style with a balcony overlooking the water.  No complaints whatsoever.  But as wonderful as our room and the hotel was (5 out of 5), the staff here are amazing.  Everyone here seemed to honestly enjoy their jobs,…

title: Amazing service and location
review: Everyroom at the doubletree is a suite. The rooms are very spacious and include a living room and dining room. They also have large balconies. The pool, restaurant and gym  are all very modern. The best part of the hotel though is it's freindly staff. You can take a water taxi to 12 other bar/hotel/restaurant/shopping areas and it includes a tour of the some of the nicest areas in Florida.

title: Gorgeous hotel with amazing views
review: The greatness started with that warm, delicous cookie they give you when you check in.  Got up to my room.  Room was huge, with lcd tv in the living room and nice tv and big bed in the bedroom.  Living room had a small balcony.  Bathroom was huge and very comfortable.  Hotel is right on the beach by a river, and has the beds and lounge chairs there 24/7 so you can walk out there at 2am and relax under the starlight.  The hotel is also a 10 min walk from the ocean, and night life there doesn't shut down at 8pm.  Neighborhood is great.  I was walking around at 1am on a weekday by myself, lying on the beach, and eating the best pork chop ever (at H2O Cafe).  AND THEN, they gave me free hot tea and cookies at night when i got back at 1am and was hungry and thirsty again.

title: Good for the Price
review: This isn't my favorite place to stay in FLL, mostly because I like being directly on the beach. This hotel, however, had some very nice features, and I would definitely stay again if I were looking for a cheaper accommodation. The rooms are great. There is a kitchenette with a full sized dishwasher, microwave, 2 burner stove, and small frig. There is a dining table which could seat 6. It was nice having the living room, and the bed was super comfy.  The food is expensive. I think breakfast was buffet only, for about $18. There is a really good French cafe across the street, with great pastries and coffee. You are also right next to the Galleria Mall which has a few nice dining choices. We loved Seasons 52.  The pool is just OK, and in late November, seemed shady too much of the…

title: Great Value for $$$
review: Have stayed at Gallery 1 for 4 months...the layout of the rooms, the views of the intercoastal waterway, proximity to the beach, views of the city, friendliness of staff is A1.  Any problems/concerns presented are handled immediately...great customer service from the front desk....not to mention the great cookies!!!!!

title: An Oasis from the mad rush of Fort Lauderdale
review: It begins when you exit your car. The friendlly Valets to the housekeeping staff are genuine and a pleasure to meet. The front desk greets you with a smile and a fresh warm cookie. Extremely bright and clean property. Location is perfect. Short walk to a not so crowded stretch of beach combined with intercoastal waterway gives you the best of both worlds. The Water Taxi stops at the property dock providing great access without the hassles of driving. Easy access from Sunrise Blvd gives options to beach or city with many choices for shopping or dining within easy walk.  With over thirty years of South Florida travel I enjoy the friendly, honest and relaxing time spent at Gallery One and recommend it as a favorite destination.

title: A Great Place to Stay
review: When in the Fort Lauderdale one shoould really look at staying at the Doubletree Gallery.  Great rooms updated amenites.  The the staff is great and welcome you wiith open arms.  You will feel right at home in the updated rooms.  The views are awesome and only a short walk to beaches and dinning.

title: Everything advertised and more
review: We selected this hotel based on this website and travel reviews. It was excellent, from the quick check-in and cookies to the excellent "in room" dining. Travel delays caused us to order lunch at 4 PM after arriving. The staff was friendly and efficient, the upgraded room was perfect, and the food delicious. Our only suggestion: make the electrical outlets easy to access for computer laptops, cell phone chargers, and camera batteries. We had to move furniture and unplug a lamp. Hotel designers and renovators please take note. Bill and Debra B.D.Anderson, Caribbean writers

title: Great location, nice property
review: I stayed at this property while working at the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show. The location is ideal. Close enough to take the water taxi, with a stop right out back but removed enough from the noise. It's in walking distance to nice shops and restaurants.  The service was friendly and the hotel property was very nice.

title: cookies and milk
review: What a wonderful way to be greeted at check-in but with a great warm gooey chocolate chip cookie.   "Where's the milk?" I asked and in a moment an icy cold glass of milk with compliments were mine to enjoy.  Treated like a visiting ambasssador, the red carpet rolled out for my entire stay.  The suite was so well appointed, we were tempted to stay in for the entire weekend.  Doubletree's central location in Fort Lauderdale, steps to the beach and shopping and a short drive to all attractions makes it impossible to stay home but certainly at home when you are there.

title: First Visit to Gallery One in Lauderdale - Wow
review: Capt. Ted Lund and myself sat down with Kimberly (director of sales) at the Gallery One this past week.  We got the full tour of their waterfront facility.  Quite impressive.  I was very much struck by the setting on the intercoastal waterway in Ft. Lauderdale.  We had been visiting the Ft. Lauderdale Boat show and were able to jump on the water taxi from the hotel.  Very convenient.  We are looking into the possibility of picking up and dropping off our fishing customers directly at their dock.

title: This is a nicely appointed hotel offering excellence service and competitive rates in a very convenient location.
review: This hotel is located on stop 2 of the water taxi service, a block from the Galleria Mall and several good restaurants, 2 blocks from the beach, and a 15 minute taxi ride to either Port Everglades or the airport.  It is also a straightforward (but long) local transit bus ride to Sawgrass Mall.  We found the staff efficient, friendly and helpful, and the facility clean and well appointed.  The best part?  The warm chocolate chip cookies provided each day of our stay are to die for!

title: WONDERFUL
review: I recently spent the evening at the Doubletree Gallery ONE for my birthday. The service was great I was able to check in 2 hours early and was upgraded to a king suite on the 14 floor. My room service was GREAt, the room was nice and clean and the view of the ocean from my room was simply excellent.

title: 10+++++ Experience
review: - Outstanding staff...from housekeeping, valet, restaurant and catering through management. All were friendly, accommodating and caring. At the end of the stay, they felt like family. - Wonderful chef!!! You must eat here...with a group or individually! - Location on the Intracoastal Waterway is superb, and the hotel was designed to take advantage of that. So many places you can walk to as well...spa, shopping, sightseeing, beach, restaurants... - Rooms are spacious, attractive and comfortable suites with every feature you coud want. - Planning an event? You MUST have it here! You will definitely not be disappointed!

title: Great Hotel
review: We moved to this Doubletree from the one in Miami to be closer to the airport.  We were pleasantly surprised.  The rooms are fabulous, nice size suites with a small kitchenette.  It was in walking distance of the Galleria and several great restaurants.  Even though we didn’t go to the beach, it was in walking distance of that to.  The views of the inter-coastal waterways was beautiful.  The pool an Jacuzzi had this view as well. Everyone was nice – we had a great stay!

title: Affordable Elegance
review: The Gallery One Doubletree is the nicest Doubletree I have experienced.  It has a modern,updated decor, a wonderful restaurant, and quiet, gorgeous rooms.  I will definitely be back!

title: Great service + lovely suites = one great hotel!
review: My husband and I stayed at this hotel one night prior to a cruise.  As Hilton Honors members, we have stayed at almost every Hilton-family hotel in Fort Lauderdale.  This was certainly one of the nicest.  We landed at Fort Lauderdale airport and took at taxi to the hotel.  It is about 20 min away from the airport (and cruiseport, too), so it feels a bit far away, but it is worth the drive!  Check-in was a breeze and the front desk person was very welcoming and helpful.  We decided to have dinner in the hotel based on her recommendation.  We travel a lot and typically avoid hotel restaurants, but this was a very good choice.  The wine list was nice and their 3 course special was terrific.  Our room was on the 11th floor with a beautiful view of the intercoastal waterway.  These…

title: You got to go to see yourself
review: Enjoyed the bar and restaurant totally, our dessert was fabulous, the bartender made my drinks just right after telling him what I wanted since he had not heard of it  made the way I wanted it. The people that work there went out of their way to see you were comfortable or needed anything at all.   We take 4/5 pleasure trips each year to different places and Gallery ONE  rates high with us with what they have to offer compared to other hotels we have stayed at..

title: Wow!!
review: Our stay at the Double Tree - Galleria One in Ft Lauderdale was by far the best choice we made!  The service was outstanding right down to the call ahead valet that would have your car waiting for you when leaving the hotel.  The cleaniness of the room and the view was more than we expected for the price we paid.  The view overlooked the Intercoastal and was a 5 minute walk to the beach!  This hotel should definitely be rated a 5 STAR for amenities, location, customer service,  Cleanliness and value!!

title: Beautiful hotel, with very spacious suites, and great location
review: This is a beautiful hotel, perfectly located right next to water taxi and close to the beach (walking distance). We loved the spacious suites, making it easier to travel with two kids. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Parking in a little expensive (18 dollars per night), and the service in the restaurant a little slow, but those were the only downsides to this hotel.  Also the pool was located with a view over the river, it is absolutely beautiful, the pics on the internet of the pool does definitely not give it enough credit.

title: There is NO OTHER PLACE I will stay but here!!!
review: This hotel was great!!!  Hospitable, informed friendly staff, clean, in close proximity to the ocean and attractions.  Imagine...My husband and I had breakfast each morning on our balcony overlooking the Atlantic Ocean.  We watched sunsets both from our balcony and from the back pool area of the hotel.  The views were AMAZING!!!  There was a full kitchen (with dishes, pots, pans, etc.) in our 2 bedroom suite.  We had 2 teens and there was privacy and plenty of room for all of us without stepping on each other.  The decor was modern and appealing and we had the time of our life prior to going on our cruise.   We flew into Ft. Lauderdale for a Cruise leaving out of Miami (abt.  30 min away).  We stayed at the Doubletree for 3 days prior to leaving.  We almost didn't want to leave…

title: the best choice
review: By far, the best choice in Ft. Lauderdale. Unique location, in front  of the Galleria Shopping Mall and very few blocks from the Ocean.  Travelling with many members of my family,   and considering that not everyone is able to drive in USA,  the hotel gave us  the  freedom  to walk to the beach, to walk to the mall, or enjoy the beautiful facilities. We can have dinner there, and keep the family spirit but in Florida.  Nothing better.

title: Great Location
review: My family and I love this hotel. It is located a block away from the beach, in an upscale neigborhood with all the amenities we required. The Galleria Mall is very nice less than a block away from the hotel where nice restaurants and Martini bar is available as well. We were greated with fresh warm cookies and very friendly service. The suite was very confortable and large, complete with all amenities to make us feel relaxed the moment we step in it.  The pool  is nice located among palm trees and a fabolous lounge area facing the marina where beautiful yatchs are located. To help us further the water taxi stop is just steps from the lobby door. Greaat for all passes of the city via the beautiful Marina. We love the facility, the service location and the accomodation. I highly…

title: I would definitely choose this hotel again.
review: I stayed here recently (Aug., '09)   Everything in this hotel has been modernized since the last time I stayed here 9 years ago.   Very up-to-date decor.  The service check-in and check-out personnel were very efficient and helpful.  Oh, and the warm chocolate chip cookie given at arrival was a nice treat. The room I had was extremely comfortable.  Everything was very clean.  The hotel is within walking distance to the beach and to the mall.  You can also relax by the pool/patio and watch the boats go by.  It was nice to use the business center, with computers available to guests. Nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant.  I would stay here again, for sure.

title: Wish I could have stayed longer
review: I had stayed at this hotel just last week and couldnt wait to write a wonderful review about it.  The staff starting with valet that had helped us the moment we had arrived, the friendly front desk staff that was helpful with information about surrounding restaurants and things to do durring our stay to the waitress and excellent food that was served to us at the VUE Restraunt at the hotel.  Nice clean comfortable rooms with all that we needed, the pool was great with an outside bar and the hotel was located perfectly for a short walk to the beach and a wonderful mall.  I would definatley be back to this hotel on a return trip.  No doubt about it!

title: Grandparents with a 6 year old
review: Wonderful Hotel, very clean and great location. -Convinient & beautiful kitchen in the suite.

title: Last Minute Hotel with Exceptional Service and Value
review: I recently agreed to meet friends visiting Ft. Lauderdale from New York City.  While their hotel had no vacancy, I had no problem in using Hilton Honor Points for a one night stay on a Saturday night, which is often difficult at the Gallery One - Doubletree Guest Suties Hotel [--]  From the time of driving up to the front door to check in, to the departure of checkout, the staff demonstrated the best in customer service.    The rooms were amazing and very chic in design and quality, actually wished I was able to have stayed longer and would have loved just lounging in the room if my schedule had allowed.  I will definitely use this great hotel on a future visit to the sunny city of Ft. Lauderdale.  Thanks for putting an emphasis back to great hotel lodging and customer service! …

title: Great Hotel!
review: Mall is right across the street, and a five minute walk to great beach! On the walk to the beach their are good restaurants as well as a 711. So a very good location. There was a plaza across the street with cvs with was conveinient.  The room was very clean EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE BEDS! The bathroom was also big and had nice showers! Eating breakfast at the hotel can be a bit pricey but I would for sure reccomend eating in the food court at the galleria mall. HUGE selection, delicious pizzas. One of the best food courts you will ever eat at. And the warm cookies you get when you arrive are the best. The pool is also very nice.

title: Good value with a few small glitches
review: We got a good price on Hotwire (not many people choose Ft. Lauderdale in the August heat) and stayed three nights. We had adjoining suites for our family members and found that rooms were inconsistently stocked with toiletries and kitchen supplies. "Fully stocked" is kind of a joke when it comes to the kitchen, in fact. But it was fairly clean and comfortable, and well located despite not being right on the beach. Just know that parking (self- or valet-) is expensive and they charge for WiFi. For a family, they do not provide enough chairs on the balconies to relax outside and enjoy the views. Nice to have the Water Taxi stop right there by the outdoor pool area, even though we were unable to take advantage. For the rate we got, it was an excellent value.

title: Very Good experience
review: My room was upgraded to a King suite with a great balcony view of the water which was nice. The check in service and the romm left me with a great impression. I did not find that the desk people were quite as attentive in the following days. But I found everyone to be very helpful. The room was comfortable and clean and the beds very comfortable.  There is a parking fee for the parking garage of $18. For $3 more a day for valet service which I don't recommend if you don't need it.  The room service was okay. There were too many little extra fees for room services. Breakfast ended up costing me $32 once. However, service was timely.  The location was great in terms of access to shopping food and services. I never had to travel far to make copies or do other things.  I had an very…

title: Great Suprise
review: This was only my third business trip and I expected to be staying in another "alright hotel that just got by for a decent price."  We paid only $120 a night and to our suprise we stayed in actual suites.  The rooms included a room with a flat screen tv, nice fully furnished kitchen, dining table, and a couch and chairs.  The bedroom was a seperate room with a huge bathroom, huge bed, another tv, and a huge balcony with a great view of the city.  It felt like my own condo on the beach, too bad we were there for business.  When we arrived we were greated kindly and with a complementary cookie.  The hotel was very clean, elegant, on the bay, had a nice outdoor patio/pool, and within walking distance to some amazing restaraunts.  I think the mall was right there too.  The staff was…

title: This is a great hotel!
review: Huge rooms. Great bathrooms. Gret comfortable bed...TV may have been 60" flat screen. awesome place. great location

title: Great Deal with a great price
review: My son, my husband and I stayed at this hotel. What a great hotel. We had a very big room and breakfast included. The location is good, because there is a mall just on the other block, CVS, Starbucks, beach and it's close to Sawgrass. Very well located. The staff was very friendly and polite. We had a delay and they haven't cancelled our reservation. Great hotel. I would stay there again.

title: Great place to stay right inbetween the mall and beach in walking distanace
review: If you are visiting the Ft. Lauderdale area and would like a great deal and place to stay, try the Gallery One Doubltree Hotel. It is smack in the middle of a Great Mall with several resturants, and the Beach. The rooms are great, clean and the staff is very helpful.

title: Great 4th of July at the DoubleTree!
review: Very nice hotel in Fort Lauderdale! Pros: Near the beach, great suites, staff is very friendly and helpful, high-rise so very nice views from the higher up floors, able to check in early and actually got a room upgrade, good value Cons: Near the beach but NOT right across the street, its about a block and a half walk, parking $$ steep (but that's expected from a hotel near beach), ac in bedroom didn't work very well, slow elevators, pool area nice with bar and loungers but pool itself not so nice **A previous reviewer wrote that he noticed that the rate of his room at the hotel was drastically reduced a week or so before the date. This is true!!! I booked my room about 3 weeks ahead for the 4th of July. I checked back a week before our stay and it was $30 cheaper!! So naturally…

title: Loved this place
review: My husband, our 5-yr old daughter, and I stayed at this lovely hotel for a week after Christmas through January 3 of this year. We decided to go to Ft. Lauderdale on a whim, and after reading all the reviews chose this place. It exceeded our expectations! The suite had a wonderful kitchen, which was kept immaculate by the cleaning staff. We stocked on groceries on our second day there (took a taxi to the closest grocery store), and had most of our lunches right in the room, after a long morning on the beach.   The living room was very spacious and the master bedroom was a decent size as well. Our bed was very comfy and the door b/w the bedroom and a living room was a huge plus - nothing like a little privacy when traveling w/children. Our room was away from the bridge and was…

title: unwanted guest in the diswasher
review: 1.	Roaches in the dishwasher – day 1 room 1 - In an attempt to retrieve silverwares to enjoy my desert, I was greeted by a number of cockroaches.   2.	Balcony patio doors were filthy – day 1 room 1 - I had the water view room, which I could not enjoy the view because the patio doors were filthy. 3.	 The air ducts/vents is rotten/rusty – day 1 room 1 – It was very hot as expected in FL (in June), after searching for the thermostat to crank up the air, I was afraid to breath.  The air ducts/vents were rotten/rusted/dirty and the wall surrounding the vents had bad water damage. 4.	My Ipod radio unit - day 1 room 1 – I could not plug my small unit in the bathroom because it would shut off the power in the bedroom.  5.	The microwave did not work – day 2 room 2 – After a long day and…

title: Luxury On A Budget
review: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  Definitely the nicest hotel I have stayed at this price point. Very well appointed, and spacious. Looks just like the pictures.  Ideal for families, and couples. The beach is close BUT it is so hot in FL that you may not feel up to the walk. Water taxi in the rear is very convenient, and a day pass costs $13. As everyone notes parking is expensive, but  its the same all over South Fl.  This place is picture perfect.  TIP: I grew  up in NYC and I had never been to a drive-in movie.  The Swap Shop about 5 min drive from hotel shows new releases on the weekends. Cost:$6 adults $2 kids . It was great fun.  If you  have never been to a drive-in check it out.

title: The Gallery One Double Tree hotel offers high-quality suites, and customer service with reasonable rates.
review: The Gallery One Double Tree hotel offers high-quality suites, and customer service with reasonable rates.  My family vacationed in Fort Lauderdale  the first week of June 2009.  The day we arrived, the weather was raining heavily.   We arrived approximately 45 minutes before our check-in time, and the rooms were ready.  The gentlemen that greeted us at the valet were wonderful the first time and every time through the day we checked out.  The front desk attendants were professional and courteous the entire stay.  The maid service is comprised of a friendly and professional staff that does a great job.  I originally chose The Gallery One Double Tree hotel after reviewing numerous hotel websites, and reading their reviews on TripAdvisor.  My family and I stayed for a week.  The…

title: Very nice hotel at a great price!
review: My now husband and I stayed at the Gallery One the night of our wedding.  I also got ready there.  The entire staff was extremely friendly and professional.   We received a complimentary upgrade to a waterview room with an incredible view.  The suite was well appointed and the kitchen was fully stocked with everything necessary - I wish we could have spent more time there!   There is a lovely restaurant with a waterfront view and the bar inside is very nice if the weather outside is too warm.   The beach is just over the bridge, and easily walkable.  In the other direction there is a large mall which you will love if you're a shopper.   My only two criticisms are:  (1)  valet parking charge is high - $21 per night and (2) the closest ice machine was not on our floor.  Other than…

title: Spacious Hotel and Good Location
review: We stayed at the Doubletree for a week with a teenager and two young children. It was great because the hotel is next door to a mall, a few blocks from the beach and close to restaurants.  We had a two bedroom suite. It was very spacious with three televisions.We had a kitchen which is good with children. More importantly, the robes were to die for as were the delicious hot cookies. It was a nice touch to provide cookies to hotel guest. The robes were comfortable and gave us a high end feel to our vacation. The staff were friendly and accomondating.  The valet service is expensive but expected for the area. The dock area is nice but we never had an opportunity to ride the water taxis. It was a nice, relaxing stay.

title: a pleasant surprise
review: we reserved this room as part of a wedding block and did not expect very much from the stay, however once we saw the accommodations, we ended up spending more time in the room than we did about town! it was THAT spacious and well-appointed. would have enjoyed staying longer and could have very easily with the modern kitchen space. great location of the hotel (no more than 10 miles from the airport) with a dock in the back and lots of restaurants, stores and super friendly and helpful staff.

title: Wonderful Location, Excellent Staff
review: First time we stayed at this hotel while on our frequent trips to Ft. Lauderdale. Wonderful location. Views, Pool, Jacuzzi, Waterfront, Kitchenette, friendly staff, especially Marie at the front desk. So convenient to everything great about Ft. Lauderdale. No need to look anywhere else, this is the place to stay.

title: Excellent hotel for the area.
review: OK, the east coast of Florida leaves much to be desired as far as the friendliness of the people and wholesomeness of the culture. Some of that Miami/Lauderdale rudeness shows in the staff of area hotels. THAT ASIDE, this is a great hotel for the southeast coast of Florida. The location is prime, within walking distance to good restaurants, mall, coffee shop, bookstore, state park and the beach. Rooms are very nicely furnished and beds are comfortable. Hot tub and pool are warm and bar is net to the pool. The business center overlooks the intercoastal and has free internet. Rooms have great views. Front desk called to see if we needed anything 15 minutes into our stay. We asked for a couple more towels and they called again awhile later to make sure we got them! Very nice touch.…

title: Check your rate before your travel - or feel ripped off
review: If you want to save money at this hotel, check your reservation more than 72 hours beforehand as they cut the rate I paid by over $30 a night.  The reservation I had needed 72 hours for cancellation (unusually long) without penalty charges.  I checked the day before and even more unusually, the rate had dropped by over $30 a night.  When I checked in and told the desk clerk this just didn't register with him, even as a Gold Hilton VIP member it just didn't seem to bother him.  So, on check out I mentioned it again.  The lady at check-out empathised with me and said she would speak to the Revenue Manager and get back to me.  Glad I am not holding my breath as I have been back a couple of weeks now.  I understand how revenue management works and that prices fluctuate according to…

title: Hmmmmm....Where can i start!
review: Firstly, online this hotel appears to be the place to stay in Ft Lauderdale due to the great reviews they had, for the price my boyfriend and I paid.  Little did we know that we were going to be staying there in the worst possible week! Parking is charged at a rate of $18.00 plus tax per day and the parking does not even have proper lighting nor security nor  direct access to the hotel (You are required to walk across the parking lot back to the hotel) .Then on this particular week they were testing the fire alarm system, so we had to endure frequent bursts of "testing" which was very annoying to us, because honestly we used that annoying fire testing alarm as our personal alarm on a morning. Also following the fire alarm fiasco, they decided that they were going to clean the…

title: The best location and value for relaxing in Ft. Lauderdale
review: We enjoyed the friendly, efficient service at Gallery One, the valet was especially high quality. The room was hip and very comfortable. We liked the location two blocks from the beach, right on the Intercoastal, minutes from the airport. You are not in the middle of the busy, hectic atmosphere that can be found in South Beach and other places in Fort Lauderdale. That gave Gallery One a very relaxing feel that we enjoyed. The hotel is convenient to everything, we were able to explore Miami and beaches north of Fort Lauderdale. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Gallery ONE - Doubletree - Wonderful Location
review: This is our first trip to Ft Lauderdale.  We were there for a wedding and it was the perfect location.  The reception was on the yacht Sun Cruiser that departed from the hotel which made it so convenient.  Enjoyed the lounge area after the wedding and the staff was very friendly to accommodate our large group (40+).    It was walking distance to excellent restaurants/late night lounge and located by the mall (if you must go shopping - but why!!).  We also were able to walk a couple of block and were at the beach.  Perfect!!  Only spent 3 days there but would love to return again.  Great compliment coming from a California person!

title: Comfortable and Convenient
review: We spent four days here post cruise in March 2009 with our two sons.  This was our first time in Fort Lauderdale.  I found accomodations in the area in general are more expensive than other areas where we have vacationed.  Previously we had spent time in Orlando area of Florida during vacations and the pricing there was a lot lower if you shopped around for suite lodging, which is also more abundantly available in Orlando area.  I shopped around for accomodations and compared prices a lot before booking here at Gallery ONE.  Although I found Fort Lauderdale a little more pricey for some of the hotels in the area, the Gallery ONE was still a lot less than most beachfront suites here, yet it was not too far from the beach, you could walk there,  and it was definately great for a…

title: great hotel
review: my family and me stayed at the Gallery one- doubletree for 3 nights, the hotel is AMAZING located close to the beach and shopping centre, the suits are nice and clean very comfortable for family. the beds were VERY COMFORTABLE and the service was great!!!

title: Gallery one is exactly the right  place to stay in Ft.  Lauderdale
review: This spring break we stayed at the Hotel. The location is great. Walking distance from both the Beach , and the great shopping and dinning of Galleria Mall. The service was very pleasant and accomodating our needs. The rooms are spacious and the view of the intercostal in beautiful. The restaurant was good and resonable priced. The fact that the kitchens are equipped , made it easier with the kids and the baby. We could store and have light meals in the room. We took the water taxi. It was so fun. The kids loved it , and the fact that it goes right out from the hotel made in very convenient. The beach was only one stop down the water. At night we drove a 5 minute drive to Las Olas. It was fun to have that action type just 5 minutes away, and then come back to the Hotel.

title: You get what you pay for: spotty service, moldy toilets, adequate space
review: We are finishing up our stay at Gallery One with extended family. We chose the hotel for it's "full kitchens" and room suites.  The minute I walked into the room, I felt it smelled stuffy and moldy. There is cigarette ash on the balcony and in the window sills. There is mold under the toilet rims and in between the sink basin and counter top.  Kitchens do not have ovens (only microwaves) and only 1/2 fridges.  Elevators are slow-- and one has not worked all week. The space is adequate for our family of 4 (two toddlers), but there is no kiddy pool and the beach is a 4-block walk.  I could go on and on. Front desk seems eager to try to fix problems (broken toilet, broken clock light, cable that was not working), but the maid was very cranky (and seemingly lazy).  One good note,…

title: Great Trip to Fort Lauderdale at the DoubleTree
review: I went to Fort Lauderdale from 3/26 to 3/31 and stayed at the DoubleTree.  Overall it was a great trip.  I was traveling by myself, and think it's a great location and hotel for a getaway.  Here are some details about the DoubleTree that might be helpful for anyone considering staying:  1.  Internet access in your room is $9.95 for 24 hours, but there is free wi-fi in the lobby.  2.  The hotel is about a 7 minute walk from the beach.  3.  For $20 more you can upgrade to an ocean-view  4.  The outdoor bar usually closes around 7pm (at least in March when I was there) but the bartender said if there's a crowd out they sometimes will stay open later, until 9 or 10.  5.  The indoor bar closes at midnight.  6.  There's a mini-beach area by the inter-coastal with beach chairs, which…

title: Would definately return
review: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days.My daughter and I on business for a tradeshow and my mother and friend for leisure.Got an early check in which came in handy after a 14hr flight.Staff was helpful and  followed up any request with a call.Hotel and decor in excellent  state.Kitchen fully equpped though fridge with no freezer,no prob front desk kept my freezables in their freezer.We had an excellent 2 bedroom 1 king bed and 2 queen 2 bathroom.Perhaps as we were on business we felt the elevator could be faster.Business center  with free internet and printer  very handy also.Fitness room with Precor equipment the best.Very nice setting would like to be on leisure next time.

title: Hotel is perfect location to beach and great staff
review: I have stayed at the Gallery One Doubletree seven times in the last year and every stay has been very enjoyable.  The valet attendants, front desk staff, Vue Employees, housekeeping, and all the other employees are always helpful and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable.  The only complaint I have about the hotel would be the poorly running elevators.

title: Will Definitely  Return
review: We stayed one night post cruise at the Doubletree .We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am. Our room was not ready but for a $20.00 extra charge, we upgraded to a balcony room that was ready and waiting for us. Check in was a breeze. We were handed two warm chocolate chip cookies and were in our room 10 minutes after arriving.  Our room was large and clean with a well appointed kitchen. In the separate bedroom, we had a very attractive and comfortable king size bed. The bathroom had a large shower with great water pressure and Neutrogena products.  The hotel grounds were very nice, with a good sized pool. As others have written, the hotel in on the intercoastal waterway which makes for great sight seeing.  The location of the hotel was the big selling point for us. Shopping, and…

title: Much improved
review: I have written before about this place and had expressed some reservations along with the positives.   My husband and I recently stayed at the Doubletree (our third spring break in a row) and I have to say that the problems we had last year were taken care of this year.   For example, the elevators are in perfect working order.  The staff were friendly and efficient.   We did have some things that needed fixing - the safe, the shower head - and they sent someone immediately and we had great service.   The only thing I would say negative about service is the housekeeping - which seems rather irregular.   They never seemed to leave the same number of towels per day and some days left none or no bath mat etc - so we had to call about that - but the room was clean. I would recommend…

title: Great start to our vacation.
review: Stayed here one night prior to a cruise. We were very happy with all aspects of this hotel. Loved the location - there is a water taxi stop directly behind the hotel which allows you to enjoy this service very easily. I highly recommend touring the intracoastal waterways - fantastic scenery, lively narration from the taxi staff, and reasonably priced ($13/ticket). The hotel is only a 6 block walk to the beach as well. Our suite was very clean, modern and spacious. The king-sized bed was as comfortable as advertised. The bathroom featured a large glassed-in shower with a powerful showerhead, nice thick towels and complimentary robes.  Our balcony had views of both the intracoastal waterway and the ocean and, in the distance, downtown Ft. Lauderdale. Only complaint was the high…

title: Wonderful Rooms, Great Location, Awesome Cookies !!!
review: We arrived at the hotel before check in time and they immediatly took our bags to store while we went to the mall to wait for our room to be ready. Upon our return they upgraded us to a two bedroom suite and gave us 3 warm and delicious cookies....what an awesome touch. That night we ordered room service and the food was delicious. That night's sleep was the best that we all had in a very longtime. We got up the next morning and went to the fitness centre for our workout and the equipment was good. It''s not a top of the line gym but it certainly did the trick. Took a nice walk to the beach and went shopping at the mall next door to the hotel. That evening we booked our shuttle to the port to take us to our cruise the following day. The valet staff were more than helpful to make…

title: Great Rooms!! - Broken Elevators
review: This Doubletree has really excellent suites.  Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and great overall appearance for this hotel.  The one big detractor was the elevators.  We stayed for three nights.  On the first day, 2 of the 3 elevators worked, which was just fine.  On days two and three, only 1 of 3 elevators was working.  This was a problem because it caused long delays (approx. 5-10 minutes) in waiting for the elevator.  We were on the 6th floor and on several occassions, we would wait a while for an elevator to go down, just to find out that once it arrived on your floor, it was too full to fit anyone else since it had been picking up passengers on floors 7 thru 14.  Now the wait began again.  We finally stopped trying to use the passenger elevator and started using the…

title: Nice Place to stay, would stay again next time in Ft Lauderdale
review: Hotel was great, suites were good sized with kitchen / dining / living rooms, seperate bedrooms, big pool, nice hot tub, on intracoastal waterway, water taxi stop right there to take you to nightlife up and down the waterway.  Walking distance to Capitol Grille / Blue Martini, PF Changs, Parrot Lounge and Primanti Bros (Pizza & Sandwiches).  Could walk to the beach if you wanted, approx 2-3 blks.  staff was helpful and friendly.  would stay there again.

title: Great location
review: We booked online through their website and got a great room. Staff was excellent and when we had a couple of issues, they always called us to follow up and ensure we were taken care of. The grounds were well kept and our room met all our needs. It was a lot nicer than comparibly priced hotels on the beach and you're only a 5 minute walk away.

title: Great Stay
review: Was a little wary of staying here because of some of the reviews, but this hotel is really terrific.  The staff at the front desk couldn't have been nicer.  We had no elevator problems at all.  Our room was overlooking the intracoastal which was real nice plus and the bed was great.  There was a light bulb out in the bathroom and I had no sooner hung up the phone to the front desk and someone was knocking on our door to replace it.  Great Service and would definitely stay there again.

title: Loved it!
review: OK, let me start by asking that you read my other reviews . . . . then you will see how fussy I am.  This place was fantastic!    I thought the service was good and the size of the room was exceptional!    I would stay here again and would recommend it without a doubt.

title: Great Romantic Getaway
review: My guest and I choose this hotel for a romantic getaway weekend. Since we have different sleep patterns, staying in a suite is always best for us to avoid disturbing each other. The suite was spacious, yet intimate...and we especially enjoyed the large shower. We found the kitchen to be well equipped to prepare a light meal, eventhough we chose to eat out at night. The hot breakfast buffet was well appointed and exceptionally clean! Valet parking and check-in was fast and efficient. Express check-out was accurate, and without any problems. The pool and hot tub were great, with a waterway view of surrounding condos. The "beach-like" lounge area is very romantic for evening relaxing. If location is everything... then you can't miss with this hotel. Fort Lauderdale Beach is less…

title: Pleasantly surprised!
review: I stayed here with my husband Feb 6-8. I was worried because some people wrote that the service was bad, expensive valet parking and the elevators were broken. It was a great location- right on the intracoastal, 3 minutes walk to trendy restaurants and the upscale Galleria Mall. Very nice rooms. I stayed on the 12th floor and had views of the intracoastal and partial ocean. I also received 2 cookies per person on check in! The only downside is the parking. They now allow you to park yourself but you have to ask for the gate to be raised each time you come in and it still amounts to $19 a day- why, I dont know. There is plenty of parking and the mall also has plenty of parking. Maybe because the beach is close?   Anyway, I had a great time and would definitely recommend this…

title: Loved the Doubletree
review: We stayed at the Doubletree from January 12 – 16, 2009 prior to leaving on a cruise.   The room was great – balcony, bedroom, living room, and efficiency kitchen – with TV in each room. Everything was in great condition. However, there were 2 minor problems. The seal on the balcony door was faulty by design (there was a movable center section for security purposes) and allowed a draft into the room. The bathroom sink faucet was loose and simply needed to be tightened. This was repaired after we brought it to the addition of the front desk.  Everyone at the front desk was helpful and responsive to any problems or questions. They seemed eager to please.   There was never any problem with the elevators. Since a number of reviews mention the slowness of the elevators, I noted how…

title: Not Great
review: Our hotel stay was ok, but disappointing for a Hilton.   The front desk staff was not attentive.  When we checked in, I had to get the 2 ladies attention even though there were no guests at the front desk.   Valet parking for $21 a day is outrageous, not to mention that you feel obligated to always tip them.  Self-parking should be made an option, but it isn't available. The breakfast buffet is good, but it should have a better variety.  We were there for 4 nights and the buffet items were always the same. After our first night stay, our room was never checked by housekeeping.  For a Hilton hotel, the housekeeping was slow and below average. The pool area is deceiving.  Most of the pool area is in the shade and the area is small.  Get a spot early in the sun This is not a…

title: Stay Away - worst hotel we've ever stayed in !
review: I write this review to warn others not to waste your $300 + on this hotel, but rather to spend it elsewhere. My family and I booked in after a cruise in Decmber 2008 for a 6 night stay. On check-in we were told under no uncertain terms - by Johannes - at the front desk that "check-in time is 3pm". He took this down to the literal sense and made us wait until EXACTLY 3pm when miraculously the room became available ! The luggage took 1 hour to get from the ground floor to the 9th floor ! And then the porter expected a tip !! He was seen counting his wad of one dollar notes in full view of everyone. The lifts NEVER worked - we had to use the service lifts which were dirty and unsafe.  The housekeeping was very poor - room only cleaned at 4pm -except on the check-out day when they…

title: Pretty Good Hotel!
review: I stayed at the Gallery One on January 9 & 10, 2009 and enjoyed my stay. My friend and I had a 2 queen suite with a City View.  I thought I would miss having a water view, but I really didn't miss it at all.   Postives Although the suite appeared much larger in the photos, it was a good size and very comfortable. The bed was the best ever. Check in was a breeze. The staff was very friendly The shower was great The location was great  Negatives Housekeeping was lacking. They left our breakfast food containers on our table and the room smelled a bit when we returned. (I take some blame for this because we should have picked up after ourselves.)  I reserved for 2 nights, but my credit card was authorized for three nights. On the day of check out, my folio indicated that I had been…

title: Pre-Cruise Stop
review: We booked 2 ocean view suites.  Enjoyed the spacious rooms, spacious bathroom,  kitchenette with coffee-tea maker, refrigerator. Tv in living room; another in bedroom. Received complementary continental breakfast coupons at check-in, which could be upgraded to a full breakfast for $5 pp.  Suite offered a telephone help line, which was okay for routine inquiries. Excellent location-short walk to public beach, Galleria mall, with Capital Grille, Seasons 52 and Blue Martini Bar, CVS drug store. No movie theatre close by --(another costly cab ride to/from the "nightclub district" to view Jim Carrey in Yes  Man  in a very rundown theatre.) .   We did not have a rental car; had to rely on taxis. ($37 from  airport to hotel for 4 of us.) Water taxi stops at hotel dock.  Ate  lunch at…

title: Never Again
review: I read the reviews before we came, but we were travelling with relatives who had already booked in.  I will never stay here again and do not recommend this hotel for a variety of reasons.  Good points -rooms are lovely -breakfast is good, especially if you get a rate that includes is  Bad Points Booking -booking was annoying, rates are all over the board. Everyone is paying a different rate for the same thing.  If I were to split the booking into two periods, i could get a cheaper rate than if I had one 9 day booking.  Hotel reservations couldnt explain it, but the desk explained it was a condo hotel and therefore harder for them to book longer periods.   -asked about the city view to make sure it was not a parking lot view--well it was a parking lot and garbage view!    Check…

title: Great hotel if you are looking for a suite!
review: We decided on this hotel because of proximity to the beach, restaurants and decent ratings on TripAdvisor. Overall, I would give the hotel a 7.5 out of 10 and would likely go back unless there was a better deal offered at a hotel right on the main strip.   We rented a car from Dollar Rental Car which helped make things a little more flexible.  We arrived at about 11 am and after getting up around 4 am to fly out of Buffalo, we were hoping we could get an early check in. I don't think much effort was given and we had to wait till just before the regular check-in 3 pm to get a room. We asked for a room with a view of the water but were told that would be an additional $40 per night. We decided to stick with what we got. We were a little discouraged so far but the Manager on duty…

title: Could have been great.....
review: We chose this hotel primarily for it's location close to the shops and because of the large rooms. We were there for a girly shopping weekend prior to going on a Caribbean cruise. We read the reviews which were mixed but decided that location and size of the rooms were the key and in this we were not disappointed.  What did disappoint was arriving after 18 hours of travelling to find that the hotel was over booked and we were to be shunted elsewhere. In compensation we were told that that night would be complimentary. If we weren't dead on our feet we'd have said thanks for the free night and enjoyed staying at 2 different hotels, but we were exhausted and just wanted to get something to eat and go to bed! On arrival at Gallery One, we waited 20 mins at the desk for the manager…

title: Tipping is the key!
review: I read many of the nagtive feedback on this hotel, but still chose it based on the suites for my family and I which included an infant.  We arrived at 10:00 a.m. which is five hour before check in. My daughter needed a warm bottle and nap and we were all exhaused from our 7:00 am flight. I tried to check in and was told that it would be 3:00. So, I gave the guy $10 and asked if there was anything that could be done.  Long story short, we were in our room in 45 minutes. Heard complaints about the housekeeping and so did the same thing. Each day on my way out around 10:00 we gave the lady $5 and she immediately came cleaned our room perfectly and left us extra coffee as we requested. Had the best trip mainly because we were so well taken care of. You may not want to have to do…

title: Nice Place & Comfortable beds
review: Spent 12 nights  in a 2 bedroom unit during Christmas 2008 and never slept better at a hotel. Beds & pilows very comfortable.   The Hotel was very nice, with clean rooms,  but the place did have a few issues.  The elevators are defianately a problem, learn where the Service elevators are, and you will be just fine.  SInce there is not an oven in the kitchen, we were unable to cook that Christmas turkey we had planned.  Small refergerator, does NOT have a freezer, so dont buy any ice cream.  If you have a choice, pick a room on the south side of the building.  Sunrise can be a noisy at times, especially with the Fire Department across the street.    Stay away from the 7-11 near the beach at night,  walk the opposite direction to the 7-11 west of the hotel across from the…

title: Dissapointed upon arrival!
review: Several things went wrong upon our arrival at the hotel. We were traveling (from Orlando) with a 9 month old baby (who really needed to nap) and had asked for a crib to be ready  in our room . It was not. When we arrived in the room, the main sliding door was broken and the noise from the nearby street was very loud. It took the front desk 25 minutes to send the "engineer" up to our room and who offered little information except that he was going to "get a screw". We were in the room for over one hour when they finally agreed to move us to a different room. During this whole event, no apologies were made from the hotel staff. Both of the rooms were extremely smaller than they were advertised online (they were in a corner of the building). The balcony was ridiculously small (not…

title: Rude, Unresponsive Staff, dirty rooms, Stay Away!
review: Prior to a cruise, we stayed one night in early December at the Gallery One, Double Tree Guest Suites in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. As Double Tree is part of the Hilton family of hotels, I used my Hilton Honors points for this stay. In hindsight, I wish we had stayed somewhere--almost anywhere--else.  We arrived at the hotel after 1:30 p.m. Yet our room was not ready. The rude desk clerk was unwilling to check with housekeeping as to when the room would be ready, or to see if the room assigned for us could be cleaned next. He was totally non-responsive.  So, we had lunch in the dining room. The friendly, albeit not knowledgable, server was very nice, although the food was nothing special.  Our server, once we finished eating, kindly offered to ask the desk clerk if our room was…

title: Good hotel with good service
review: My husband and I stayed at the Gallery one Doubletree from Dec. 10, to Dec 15,. We were there for the boat parade and to visit family.  I had heard of elevator problems so I called the day before and asked for a lower floor because of my breathing problems. When we checked in our request was honored all that they had to do was to bring us in the robes we requested. The bellman who brought our bags up went up the the fourth floor and brought us ice.  The valet who took our car remembered us and even at the afternoon of the boat parade when the place was hopping we got right in. The elevators also were slow but worked.
