The rooms were spacious and very clean. We had a double queen bedded suite with a comfortable bed and tons of pillows.  We did not eat at the hotel but the food on…

title: Most Unplesant Service
review: Read reviews of this hotel on this site an it seemed like an ideal spot to stay in Ft. Lauderdale for 10 days.  I travel a great deal but I must say this was the worse front desk reception I have ever experienced. It seemed that anything I enquired about from the parking options to a change of rooms was responded by saying you either take this or find yourself another hotel.  Personally I do not have to put up with this kind of attitude. As such I checked out before I checked in.  This hotel has a great location with fairly nice suites but with a staff like this you are very likely to have an unplesant stay.

title: Nice Hotel - A Few Little Quirks
review: My party of 6 stayed very comfortably at this hotel on 11/19-11/22. Two nice separate bedrooms; one with a king bed, one with 2 queens each room with tvs. There was also a nice tv in the living area.  Maid service didn't seem to speak any English or understand any notes that were left for them. We constantly had to call and remind that we had 6 people in our room, so leave 6 towels....etc.  The grounds are very beautiful, very convenient to catch the water taxi.  We got cold! The day we arrived temp was a high of 70 making the eveing a bit chilly. Called the desk and someone was sent up to look at the heating unit (only blowing out cold air). Was told by maintenance guy that in order to have heat, they would have to turn the water off to the air unit. If we needed air…

title: Make Sure you book your dates correctly !
review: Make sure if you make an advance booking and prepay your dates are correct. We made two reservations totaling over $1000.00 and booked an extra day in error and Hilton was of no help. We did not seek a refund, and would have settled for a day's stay at some other future time, but were flately told "no" and given no options.  I guess we won't need it anyways since we its unlikely we will  book with them again.

title: Beautiful Hotel - Annoying housekeeping, stained furniture and watch your bill
review: The hotel and grounds were just beautiful...it was much prettier in person than on any of the websites.  The shower was heavenly.  The beds were very comfortable even the roll away bed and pull out sofa were comfortable.  The tv in the living room was really nice. I had a one bedroom suite for myself and 4 teenagers. However, I was extremely annoyed with housekeeping because they walked in on us during our first morning there even though the tv was loud. Every morning was a problem. Our last day at 8:15 am housekeeping knocked on our door and she was calling for us.  I told her that we were sleeping in and checking out at noon. They came 2 more times and knocked on our door before our check out time.  I was extremely annoyed to say the least. The furniture and extra blanket we…

title: Great!!
review: We had a great time at this hotel! Compared to other travellers written some reviews, we had no problems. I love guest suite hotels. Good products on the nice bathroom, great breakfast and perfect location (close to beach and Galleria...)

title: Great hotel especially if you have kids
review: We stayed there for one night prior to a cruise. I picked this hotel because with 2 big teenagers we were very comfortable in one room. Sometimes when we go away we need to rooms.  The bedroom had 2 Queen beds, not doubles and the sofabed in the livingroom was a queen as well. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom shower was one of the best I ever had in a hotel. We had a very large balcony with a great view. The coffee maker in the room was one of those individual pod machines. We called the front desk for more and within 5 minutes housekeeping was there with a weeks worh of coffee. Another reason I chose this hotel was because of the proximity to the water taxi which we couldn't use do to the weather. We ended up eating in the restaurant which was very…

title: We Got a Good Room
review: Aug. 30th we stayed for one night using Hilton Hhonors Points. Glad to say that we had none of the problems some have reported. I was aware of the parking fee. Would advise to self park for $18 vs the $21 for valet after witnessing a valet parker looking like he was off for a joy ride in a very nice car. Check in did seem to have some issues as the person who checked in just ahead of us returned to the desk to report that they had just unlocked the door to find a couple in the room (they were given the wrong room!) Not good. I didn't find the elevators to be extra slow although one made eerie sounds. Our room was a city view but you could see the intercoastal in the distance from the balcony. The room was very clean and everything was in working order. Comfy beds and great TV's.…

title: The lights not on - but someone is home !
review: Convenient location just a short walk to the beach and next door to the Galleria with some great resturants.   Each time I stay at this property I seem to find it less and less functional.  Besides being known for continual elevator problems here's an example.  When I entered my suite I flipped the light switch by the door - nothing happened.  I found my way into the dark room and into the ktichen where I was sure I would find a light switch - no luck.  I turned on a lamp and found my way to the bedroom where, once again, I flipped a  wall switch. Nothing.   After unpacking I sat down in the sitting area and saw a light switch on the wall. Guess what? It turned on the kitchen light.  I flipped on the large flat screen TV (to large for the room) and 10 minutes later it turned…

title: Many problems
review: This hotel looks nice and new. Its the small things that you expect that weren't there. On arrival, $18 dollars a night for self parking. Location is good about 10 minute walk to beach, no problem.  Galleria mall was nice next door. When arrived at room, tv did not work in the bedroom, maintenance came and fixed it.  Elevators are TERRIBLE.  Slow and miss floors.  Food extremely expensive.  We ate in with groceries and went to use the dishwasher, it was not on. After fiddling, it turns out one of many light switches in the room were controlling the power for some appliances.  The phone line did not work so maintenance came and fixed that. Then the microwave did not work.  Maintenance came and fixed it, third time to room.  This was all in a three night stay.  And then the door…

title: I GIve UP
review: I am a Diamond Hilton Member.  I have stayed at this hotel 10 times this year.   Each stay gets worse.   I wont come back.   There are good rooms (size, view, balcony) and there are bad (low shower water pressure, adjoining balconies enabling you to smell smoke from the other, broken appliances).     The front desk staff do no know the hotel.   A request for no adjoining balcony gets "i think this room doesn't" which of course is always wrong.  Calls to the front desk go unanswered.     Very slow elevators which change direction when they stop on certain floors.  I will not come back.

title: Great
review: After reading many reviews for this property I decided that the location was perfect for a group. The location on the intercoatal waterway made it so much fun and we did not need to rent cars! We just grabbed a cab from the airport and a shuttle to the cruise port.  The Water Taxi is the best bang for the buck very relaxing and informative just jump off and on at your pace for dining shopping and nitelife. We found the staff at Gallery One to be very friendly. The elevators were never a problem. The rooms were clean the beds were very comfy linens and towels were fresh and fluffy.  It was nice to have the kitchen,  we went to a Chinese take out a short walk down the street  eating on real plates was nice and so was the fact that we were able to store and reheat the leftovers.…

title: Great!
review: This hotel was beautiful and amazing!! Great bathroom! We had a balcony with a view of the front of the hotel. The pool area was nice. There were lounge chairs sitting on sand, looking out to the canal area. I would definitely stay there again.

title: No Rental Car Needed!!!
review: This hotel was well worth the discounted price. My wife and I stayed here for 5 days and we didn't need a rental car. The pool and hot tub were all functioning and nice. No elevator problems until the hotel started filling up our last night. I think it was just a lot of people at that time but the other nights were flawless.   Just a short walk to the beach which was beautiful!! The Galleria Mall is next door with an outstanding food court and great night dining and of course shops!! The Water Taxi is a plus with a $13 all-day pass which takes you up and down the inter-coastal waters for sights and shopping. The rooms are great with a full kitchen (minus a freezer).    The down side only one ice machine for the whole hotel, you can hear the traffic nearby, and if you rent a car…

title: As nice as expected
review: We stayed here for four days over the 4th of July weekend.  We weren't disappointed after reading the reviews.  We loved the contemporary decor and location next to the intercoastal waterway.  We had a mini suite that is a perfect size for 2 people.  I really don't have any problems to report.  The staff was friendly, housekeeping did a great job, the bed was very comfortable and the room quiet.  We didn't use the restaurant at all so I can't comment on that other than to say it seemed a little expensive.  We ate all our meals out.  The Galleria mall across the street is nice with an above average food court.   If you like coffee skip $tarbucks and go to St. Barts.  It right across from the beach and the coffee is better IMO.  They have good omelette's and breakfast sandwiches. …

title: Nice hotel but beware of bedbugs/fleas
review: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip in June 2008.  As a business traveler and Hilton Honors member, I do expect cleanliness and comfort on trips and I enjoy having a suite-type room to feel more like I'm in an apartment rather than a hotel room.  Upon checking in I found the suite to be really nice, I had a city-view which I would not recommend due to the noise from traffic going over the drawbridge however the view of the water was appreciated.  Housekeeping service was  terrible...the fitness center was okay...After the first night, I woke up the next morning with a feeling that I had been bitten by a mosquito.  During the course of the day, the itching became more intense and there were several insect-type bite bruises/swelling developing all on my back, arms, and legs…

title: Fix the Elevators!
review: Stayed at the Doubletree Gallery One June 14-18.  I was in town for a conference.  I was pleasantly suprised by how nice the room was.  Very nice suite with kitchenette and large flat screen tv.  The drawbacks were that two of the three elevators were broken my entire stay.  They had guest using the service elevators which was inconvenient. Also, the breakfast buffett was $18, which is at least $10 too much.

title: Great hotel BUT some problems persist & reduced amenities for Elite travelers
review: This is the third time we have stayed at this property for a weekend in the last six months. As previously reviewed the location can't be beat.  The water side suites with balconies are comfortably equipped with a conference table, kitchenette, dishwasher, coffee maker and great view of the intracoastal. Bathrooms are well configured with a boutique style glass shower.  The elevators are a persistent problem. Prior to arrival I called the front desk and was informed all 3 passenger elevators were functioning. When we arrived they were down to one, with only one service elevator working as well. For breakfast it took 14 minutes to get down from an upper floor. I can only imagine the wait times for room service. A waiter trying to deliver butter had to wait 10 minutes for an…

title: Nice hotel
review: The hotel is located on the inter-coastal waterway.  It’s away from the beach scene.  But it’s within walking distant to the beach.  The section of the beach near the hotel isn’t as nice as the beach south of it.  It’s next to the Gallery One mall.  We had a 2 bedrooms suite on the 11th floor.  The living room is in the middle and there is a bedroom on each side of the living room.  It gives each bedroom privacy.  The bathroom is in each of the bedroom.  The suite is very nice with new kitchen, new appliance, marble entry, marble bathrooms.  The bedroom with 2 queen beds has a shower only bathroom.  The bedroom with a king bed has a shower over tub.  New furniture in all rooms.  The buffet breakfast was good with the usual eggs, bacons, home fries, breads, etc.  The pool was…

title: Nice hotel but one problem after another
review: I booked a week long stay with my husband and baby at this hotel because of the many great reviews it had received.  The hotel is very nice...the rooms are newly renovated and the outdoor pool and eating area is nice, but small.  However, for the price we were paying I was surprised that things kept going wrong.  #1-when we checked in they told us it would be 1 hour until our room was ready.  The baby was very cranky but we went for a walk around the mall across the street.  When we came back the room still was not ready and it actually took another 1.5 hours until it was.  #2-the TV in our bedroom had static and it took 3 days to get it fixed.  #3-our cordelss phone had static, but it was not fixed at all as the repair man said he could not hear it.  #4-the AC was very noisy…

title: Elegant but a little noisy
review: We had a very nice room overlooking the waterway.  Our balcony had two chairs on it.  The room was very modern and clean.  The outdoor bar lends a nice resort feel to the hotel.  The pool was pleasant but felt a little enclosed between buildings. The staff were very pleasant even knowing we obtained the room through a very low Priceline bid.    I walked to the beach, which took approx 10 minutes. It's not the most pedestrian friendly area, and some might feel a bit unsafe at night.  There is a little alley near the beach with lingerie shops, tattoo parlors, and biker bars.  It was a little intimidating but worthwhile exploring because the Cafe Blue Fish bar provided a surprisingly good dinner.   There is a large pharmacy conveniently located across the street and slightly West…

title: Superb in Every Way - Top value - one of our best finds in the US so far
review: Wow - What can I say, after staying in hotels and motels all over America this place is the nuts! - You get a proper suite with separate livingroom with kitchen, large screen LCD in the livingroom (that can be hooked up to your laptop - note a lot of hotels block this). Lovely bedroom and bathroom.  Great location, great views, great staff, really nice bar staff and great outside eating and drinking by the water.  No complaints whatsoever, and all for $89 a night via a discount site.

title: A wonderful stay, couldn't have been better!
review: My husband and I went for a romantic getaway and left the kids at home. We had a cityview suite (which also ended up having a great side view of the ocean) The staff was very attentive, the room was spectactular and the location was great for our needs with a CVS pharmacy <1 block away and the beach approx two city blocks the other direction with a handful of restaurants around it including everything from a tavern to beach food to thai food (also mexican and italian places). I recommend the airport go shuttle if you need transport to/from the hotel. It's cheaper and more professional. The taxi we took to the hotel was $23 + tip and the airport go van was $9/each with much better service. If you drive you can valet for $9/day and they were also very efficient from what we could…

title: Wonderful Location, Great Hotel
review: We just returned from spending a week in Fort Lauderdale at the Gallery One Doubletree.  I really felt compelled to write a review because not only was this location terrific, the hotel was exceptional too.  The location is ideal.  It is located right on the intercoastal waterway and there are waterviews from every room.  They built a very nice white sand beach right on the water for those who do not want to walk the short distance to the ocean beach.  There is a water taxi service that stops right at the hotel dock and for $12 per person, you can travel on it all day.  It goes up and down the intercoastal from early morning until late at night.  There is a water taxi every 1/2 hour.  This was so convenient and fun.  The hotel is very clean and the staff service was superior. …

title: Gallery One Gets A #1 Rating From Me!
review: I spent several weeks researching all of the major hotels in Ft. Lauderdale and had a really tough time at first deciding on where to stay. When I came across detailed photos and reviews of Gallery One, I knew it had to be a winner, and it sure was! The hotel is most conveniently located ... an upscale shopping mall is across the street, and it's right on the intercoastal waterway, so you can pick up a water taxi and have a scenic and enjoyable ride to many other destinations. Also, the beach is only a couple of blocks away, so it was easy to go over and enjoy everything.  As for the hotel, it is top notch! Everything is very clean, with nice grounds, their own little beach area, and a nice outdoor pool which I really enjoyed. The suites are beautiful ... spacious, tastefully…

title: Comfortable Stay, Would Do It Again
review: Friendly staff welcomed me late at night with a warm cookie, and speedy check-in. The suite was clean and sleek with a huge LCD  tv (in addition to another smaller tv in the bedroom) and nice view of the intracoastal.  The room was quiet and I was able to get a goodnight's rest in a very comfortable bed. Hit the "fitness center" the next morning, which had good equipment, but was too small.  Enjoyed the terrace by the waterway, and already had been expressed checked-out.  All-in-all a very enjoyable experience.

title: Very happy!
review: We loved this hotel.  Came for two days before a cruise and didn't want to leave.  Lovely room with a view of the intercoastal. Staff was fantastic.  Front desk, I think his name was Johannis was wonderful.  Food in the restaurant was great.  Pool very clean.  What I loved the most was how quiet the hotel was and how spacious the room was.  I would go back in a second.  In fact, I will!

title: Good hotel with great suites
review: We spent two nights here after getting a great rate on Priceline, $85 a night.  I think because we are Hilton Honors members we got a better room than the average Priceliner might.  We had a suite on the 5th floor with two queen beds, a balcony (not all rooms have a balcony) and a decent view of the pool area and the Intercoastal.  We thought the kitchen area was great and very well stocked with glasses and dishes.  We did get more coffee packs from the maid for the Wolfgang Puck two cups at a time machine!!  Bathroom was very spacious and we loved the rainwater style shower head. Living room was comfortable with big flat screen TV (second tv in bedroom was not flat screen.)  Elevators were quirky as others have mentioned. We did self-parking which at $14 a day seems a bit high…

title: Good location, service below expectations
review: Good points - location, near the beach, spacious and clean room, comfortable bed.   Bad points - only one ice maker on the 4th floor for the entire hotel and no freezers in room fridge, very slow elevator system, hot tub under construction, bedroom TV was damaged and changed channels on its own,  business center computers are blocked from opening PDF documents (a pretty standard file type in business), three promises from front desk staff to return calls with answers to questions were not returned, horizontal bars on balconly look like ladders to kids.    Overall - pretty good, a decent place to sleep that is near the beach.  Don't expect anything more than that.

title: Pleasant place to stay
review: I've stayed here numerous times and love the location.  It is right next to the Galleria Mall and very convenient to the beach area.  The rooms are large, recently renovated and many have views of  the Intracoastal.    Facilities are good for this class of hotel.  While the gym is pretty limited, the outdoor lounging areas by the water are comfortable and have a great ambiance.  Other than breakfast and pretty reasonable room service, the hotel doesn't offer much in the way of dining, but there are many good options nearby.    Note: the elevators have a tendancy to be buggy--sometimes slow and unpredictable.  I don't know if this has been fixed since I've last stayed there, but it has been a consistent problem in the past.

title: Loved the Gallery One
review: Gallery One is one of the best hotel stays ever.  Fantastic location- one block to beach- on the intercoastal waterway- and water taxi stop.  Other reviews indicated long wait times for elevators and noice from street- we did not experience any of that.  The staff was great- the room was stellar- in-room dining was fantastic. If you love to shop- this is where you want to stay- next door to upscale mall.  Outdoor bar area is fun and relaxing.  Recommend to all ages.  Can't wait to go back!

title: AWESOME!!  Didn't want to leave!
review: Rooms were huge, sparkling clean, dreamy beds, giant bathroom and fully stocked kitchen area.  Waterway was beautiful with a white sandy beach are and large pool.  Beach short 5 minute walk down the road.  Location was PERFECT with the galleria mall next door and plenty of nightlife including the Blue Martini, which was packed and hopping on a Wednesday night!  We will definitely be back to this Doubletree in Ft Lauderdale.

title: Nice location, nice suites, elevators not really a problem
review: We stayed here during Spring Break, March 8-13. There were many positive things about the Doubletree. It's location was walking distance to the beach, CVS drugstore, Starbucks, and the restaurants and shops and food court at Galleria Mall. With the Water Taxi stop on the premises and lots of cabs in Ft. Lauderdale, o ne could easily stay here and not need a car. While this hotel was not on the beach, it was a short walk away and we noticed that it was colder and windier on the beach so we preferred to sunbathe at the hotel. Being on the Intracoastal Waterway and having the sandy sunbathing area, we did not miss the beach at all. Also, the hotels on the beach are across a five-lane road so they are not directly on the beach.   The rooms were comfortable and clean. Housekeeping…

title: Nice stay. Don't pay extra for "waterview".
review: I stayed at this hotel with my wife during a recent business seminar held in the hotel. The facilities are clean and modern. The staff was freindly and helpful when needed.  The "waterview" room we were given was on the 5th floor. "Waterview" gives you a view of the waterway which is nothing more than a channel for boats to get to and from the ocean. The bad part is, we were on the Sunrise Blvd. side of the hotel. The traffic on this busy blvd. was VERY noisy, even from the 5th floor. The wall and glass door are poorly insulated and you could hear traffic even with them shut.   Didn't have any of the elevator issues that previous reviewers had complained about. They were slow but there were 3 operating the whole time. The ice machine on the 4th floor broke down and was out of…

title: I'll be back.
review: Great all suite hotel, clean, comfy beds, good location. Stayed 2 nights, booked with priceline for $90/night, regular rate $200.  few negative observations, no airport shuttle,parking is expensive.

title: Lovely
review: We stayed at the Double Tree during Presidents Weekend which for us included Valentine's Day. It has a great location wedged between the intercoastal, short walk from the beach and an upscale mall with a very nice selection of restaurants. The beds  and baths were wonderful. The kitchen was very nice but could have been a little better stocked (we even had to ask for soup spoons for morning cereal and salt and pepper). Their restaurant is also lovely and served a tapas menu that was delicious. All staff was very helpful except the restaurant's Maitre d who basically invited us to eat elsewhere. I think that Double Tree's management needs to think again about that guy. But, if you go, ignore him and have a meal there. It's a beautiful setting. Our room also had a view from the…

title: OK, But Don't Count on the Elevators
review: It's a nice hotel, but there's nothing exceptional about it.  It's a standard "suite" hotel.  It's generally convenient to the beach and the Galleria mall, but be aware that it isn't directly connected to either of them, so some walking is required.   My primary complaint:  I found a sewing needle on the floor of my room.  That's not just a housekeeping issue but a guest safety issue.    Given that, I can't award the hotel more than two stars.  Additionally, a prior review mentioned problems with the elevators.  They still aren't working right.  An elevator alarm was sounding for hours on 2/22, and there are paper signs on the guest floors pointing out the location of the service elevators - apparently the hotel expects that guests will need to use the service elevators sooner…

title: Great hotel, plenty of space!!!
review: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway and we were pleasantly surprised. We wanted to stay on the beach but were not satisfied with many of the choices or prices. This was a short walk to the beach and it is directly on the intercoastal so we got that "waterfront" feel. There is a water taxi that picks you up directly at this hotel and will take you down the intercoastal. This was a nice treat at night. They greet you with warm cookies when you arrive and will give you extra all day long. They are great!!! The lobby is very clean and is not over decorated. It has a very contemporary feel to it. It has white marble everywhere. The rooms are all suites with separate living rooms and granite counter kitchens. This was nice although it was just us love birds so we did not…

title: This hotel a mixed bag
review: My first comment would be to warn families with infants or young children that there are NO TUBS in this entire hotel. All rooms have showers only, and though they are modern and nice, very slippery for little ones. Luckily, my five-year-old tolerated a shower but of course, this means you're in there with them, whether you want to or not! I have no idea how folks with babies or toddlers managed to bathe them. Odd for a hotel that features suites for families... Clearly an issue with maintnance here. As noted numerous times, the elevators are a problem and have been for a long, long time judging by other reviews. The hot tub/jacuzzi by the pool did not work at all during our five-day stay and I noted a review a month later saying the same thing. Very disappointing for us! We…

title: Spacious, well appointed accomodation, but loud (street noise)
review: This place is a condo complex managed by Doubletree. The location is not bad, you can walk to the beach within minutes, and there is a water-taxi ($12/day) stop directly at the hotel's pier on the waterway. The taxi from the airport cost about $22 for a 15min ride; from the hotel to Las Olas you would pay about $8 for the taxi.  Our first impression when entering the lobby was good, a nice and modern place. Check-in was fast and efficient, the staff professional but not over-friendly, rather military style. Our suite was on the 10th floor with a nice view of the ocean and waterway and Sunrise Boulevard.  What we liked: The interior design and amenities were very nice, each unit has a kitchen fully equipped with dishwasher and everything you need to cook a full meal, the living…

title: Pretty Good for Ft. Lauderdale
review: Recently visited Ft. Lauderdale and stayed at Gallery ONE on Sunrise Boulevard.  Was able to book it for $81 per night via Priceline.  It was a decent 'condo' style hotel for the area.  I would certainly stay there again.  Some things to note: the property appears to have been 'older' but recently 'renovated'.  The renovations suit the property well. However,  there were a few minor rough spots (door that sticks, dents in walls, slower elevators) but not significant enough to change hotels.   A few of the highpoints: The fresh, warm and delicous chocolate chip cookie that will be presented to you at check in. Location is prime. The units are very large and a well maintained and reasonably appointed. Very close to the beach and within walking distance to a very nice mall and…

title: Could be great with some improvements
review: Just returned from 3 nights at this Doubletree which was enjoyable but frustrating.  This hotel could be perfect but for some problems.  Good:  Large suite with very nice kitchen, 42" plasma tv, balcony with table/chairs, and tasteful decorations.  Good location with easy access to beach and freeways.  My room was on the 8th floor and faced South with nice views of the water and the city skyline.  It was nice to cook small meals and relax on the balcony.  Didn't use the pool or hotel restaurant. Staff was friendly  but seemed understaffed.  Bad:  2 of 3 elevators were out of order the whole time but hotel gave access to 2 service elevators which helped but were inconvenient.  Large parking structure and lot mostly empty yet hotel charges $14/day.  I just parked free a few blocks…

title: Outstanding for the Price!
review: I won two nights at the Doubletree on Priceline for $65 a night.  My wife and stepdaughter took a little trip together and only had positive things to say about this hotel. The price is what gives this place a 5 out of 5. If they paid the rack rate of $199, then they would have downgraded to a 4/5.  The good: -Service was fine, although they had little contact after checking in to the time they checked out. -Shopping center next door -One can walk to the beach -Big room that was clean and the beds were comfortable -Full kitchen with a dishwasher -Large flat screen TV on the wall -Water taxi is convenient, although they did not use it  Only negatives: -Parking fees, they did valet ($17) for convenience with a late arrival  -Nothing was open in the area to grab a bite to eat at…

title: Ok Property, but a little tired
review: Myself and three others stayed at this property for two nights prior to a Princess Cruise.   It is definitely away from the cruise terminal, so be prepared for a little drive. I used my Marriott Reward points for this trip, so it was a free stay which was nice.  Since there were 4 adults they did upgrade us to a two bedroom suite which was nice of them to do. The room had two ful bathrooms and the bedroom wth the two beds had a very nice walk in shower. The room as well as the Hotel overall did show some signs of being tired. I noticed some dry rot in the window sills in the restaurant which was  a little gross. The rooms themselves were clean, but it is definitely an older property. Each room has a nice setup with a refrigerator and a microwave. The room I stayed in had a nice…

title: This Property COULD Be Great...
review: We stayed here for three nights this week and most everything I had read on TA was true.  The elevators are basically non-functioning except for one (of three in the lobby).  The service elevators work, but who wants to ride in the service elevator?    I encountered an elevator repair person who told me there are "big problems" with the elevators and the situation has been this way for over a year, since prior to the renovation.  Sounds kind of scary.    Neither the pool Jacuzzi nor the poolside shower work.    Great location though!  And, yes, as another poster said, don't pay for parking, park in the Galleria Mall lot.  The parking fees are exorbitant.    The suites in this hotel are individually owned and apparently are now worth about 1/2 (or less) of what the individuals…

title: Less than perfect stay
review: CHECKIN: I booked this hotel via priceline for $150/night for one nights stay.  I called to ask if I could check in early, I was told I could try to check in early, but it all depends on availability. So we arrive right at 3pm for check-in.  We choose to self park as it was already overpriced. (Hint: you can park for free in Galleria Mall parking lot) The 3 parties checking in before us, all received a room immediately and we were told no rooms were ready. So we went out side to the mini man made beach to wait. We came back to find more people were getting rooms before us. The gentleman that checked us in was so fake and when I asked for a king room, I was told "none were available". I also saw a list of names for “early check in" but apparently not everyone can get on the list.…

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly!
review: My husband and I booked a one weeks stay at the hotel following a cruise out of Port Everglades. THE GOOD - We arrived at the hotel early (prior to check-in time) and were given a king bed suite immediately on the 10th floor. Aasha at the front desk was friendly and accommodated our request of a high floor facing the intercostal waterway & king bed. She also helped us obtain a really great second suite for two family members who came to visit us from Stuart. Our suite had a kitchen, a combined living/dining room, a seperate bedroom and nice size bathroom. Our room over looked the outdoor dining area, small beach and the intercostal waterway. The hotel has 2 coin washers and dryers available on the third floor. Since we are Hilton Honors members, we were provided with the buffet…

title: perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: We stayed for two nights. We had a great deal through priceline, and did not know what we were going to get. We were so pleasantly surprised to see the size of the rooms. Like everyone else said, the rooms are huge, clean (except for some stains on the couch) and beautiful! I have a 3 year old, a 2 year old and an infant, and we were all perfectly comfortable. The beds really are heavenly. The valet service for our car was quick - we never had to wait at all - we usually called for our car a couple minutes before we wanted it, and when we got there, our car was ready. The pool is small, but nice. The lobby and back of the hotel are beautiful. Service was great! It was really such a nice trip. I would come back in a flash!

title: Great, affordable hotel!
review: We stayed at the Gallery ONE on a business/pleasure trip.  My boyfriend had to work for business and I got to go along for pleasure. :)  We both loved this hotel.  We were in a corner room- 701.  We had views of the beach and the city.    The suites are huge!  The living/dining area is comparable to a NYC apartment.  They have great high def flat screens in the living rooms. The bedroom and bathroom are very roomy.  I can imagine that it would be a great space for families with children or friends traveling together.    The kitchen is much more than you expect.  It is small, but really well stocked.  It includes refrigerator, two burners, a microwave oven and a dishwasher.  They provide plates, flatware, a full set of pots, a salad bowl, a set of cooking utensils, place…

title: Modern, great beds, awesome living and kitchen area.
review: I just loved the room - It was like my own little modern, upscale apartment.  My son flew in from Phoenix where  he works at an upscale hotel there and said this room was nicer than some of the regular rooms there. The beds were perfect - so comfortable and the rain shower was amazing. I loved this room because it was not a "typical" hotel room. It was spacious, had a Wolfgang Puck Coffee Pot with great coffee and flat screen TV in living room.  Great view and large balcony from the upper floor.  The only negative I could say was the elevators were not working and I had to take the service elevator alot or the stairs and the other drawback was the parking.  The lot was a little far from the hotel and it was very dark at night and scary if you are by yourself. I would opt for the…

title: very good
review: We stayed at this hotel after flying into Fort Lauderdale airport on our way driving to Key West.  We had a 2 bedroom suite which consisted of one room with a king size bed/full bath and one room with 2 double beds and a bath with shower.  In between the two bedrooms was a living area with pull-out sofabed, table, chairs and a huge flat screen tv ... and a kitchen. The kitchen is fully stocked (sans corkscrew!) and has a dishwasher.  We had a balcony overlooking the pool (mostly -- it was also overlooking a construction debris dumpster -- room 809/811 so assume any suites with those types of numbers will be in this other wing of the hotel overlooking the dumpster and not the pool so much).  The room itself was great. The balcony did give a good view of the pool and intercoastal;…

title: Good option for a Ft. Lauderdale visit
review: My wife and I spent a night at this hotel alone and then went back again a night later with our three boys (9, 9 and 12).  We had the same room for each stay on a high floor looking over the intracoastal. We used HHonors points for the stays at 30,000 per night.  Our overall experience was very positive.  We found the staff to be exceptionally friendly. The room was very nicely appointed with the bed extremely comfortable and the kids really enjoyed the big wall-mounted television in the living room.   The hotel is convenient to, but not right on, the Ft. Lauderdale beach.  It is a "long two block" walk to the water.  We made the trade off for this walk in exchange for a two room suite and a lower cost room.    Only two downsides to report.  First, as others have reported, there…

title: Elevators a real problem!
review: Read reviews on this hotel prior to staying pre and post cruise on 13 & 28 November 2007. Reviews of hotel were generally accurate with good rooms and facilities - apart from road noise- and beds very comfortable and clean. But don't pay extra for waterview it's not worth it and doesn't guarantee a quiet room. Don't book this hotel until the problem with the elevators is resolved which won't be any time soon. We spent ages waiting for the elevator and eventually took to the stairs.We were travelling with a friend with mobility problems and he was confined to the room for 2 days! Also, 2 of our party were trapped in the service elevator and we had more than one "terror towers" experience in the elevators during our stay. Not worth the rates charged on the hotel website- if you…

title: Needs Repairs Overpriced
review: Unfortunatly this place could be a 5 star hotel with a little work. I stayed there pre cruise for two nights, booked a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the water.  A four lane highway with a draw bridge  separates the water view! Our room was booked on a floor low to the ground as I am handicapped,. We were given the only 2 bedroom suite  on the 14th floor!!!! Needless to say, I was not happy. All of  the elavators were broken. All of them, except for a single service elevator!!! I am not exagerating! We were given a generic letter which I have in my possesion without a date apologizing for the inconvience!!!! I was told by a worker that this a has been a problem for one year!!!!! Unfortunatly. the next day we had a bigger  problem, had to get to the cruise, and with one working…

title: One of the nicest hotels i've been to!
review: I booked this on priceline and paid around $90 with tax.  Parking was around $11 after tax.  It was well worth it and I would've paid more if I had to!  The lobby was nice, the room was amazing! Full kitchen (tho small), plasma tv, living area and very very comfy bed!  Had a big balcony and it was nice! There was nothing bad about this place.  Checkout was 12pm which was perfect as my flight left at 3pm the next day and I regret checking in at 8pm and leaving at 11am the next day.  I felt at home at this hotel.  The pool area was nice too, lots of chairs outside and good mood setting place to make you feel warm and at home.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone I know! Hotel staff was really nice too!

title: Save the money!
review: We stayed there for 2 days to see the Nascar Race in Homestead. Because we were 3 adults we shared a two bedroom suite for 279$ a night. The rooms are stylish but not very well appointed. In the second bedroom is no closet  so you have to live out of your suitcase!!??? Towels had been collected after the first night, but was'nt replaced so we had to call housekeeping to get new ones. Windows needed to be cleaned. Breakfast was offered at 11.95$; but we were charged 16$???? No information that we could get some eggs any style or bread fresh toasted-we found out when we left! Valet parking is a nightmare! The first night we heard 2 endless car alarms . If you try to get back your car you'd better bring some time!

title: Divine!
review: This was a heavenly surprise - I had never stayed at a Doubletree hotel before.  The suite had a great layout and a great view.  I can't remember the last time I was able to truly relax in a hotel as much as I did here.  Great bed and the plasma tv was a fun treat.  No bathtub, but very nice bath amenities.  And I enjoyed having the mini-kitchen which was also relaxing.

title: Very nice stay, reviews are right on
review: I recently stayed at the Doubletree Suites in Ft Lauderdale for business for 2 nights.  The reviews for this hotel are right on, the hotel is very nice.  The rooms are very spacious with their own kitchenette, living room, bedroom and bathroom.  The living room has a 42" plasma tv, the bedroom a regular tv.  The living room has a sofa, dining room table and chairs.  The bathroom is very nice size with a wonderful rainfall shower (there is no tub).  I will say it is noisy, you are better off getting a room facing the water, mine was on the corner facing the water but also by the bridge where most of the noise comes from...its not overwhelming but it would nice if it wasnt there.  The room service was prompt and very room.  The hotel has a nice fitness center with modern…

title: Nice hotel, but loud.
review: I will echo many of the sentiments of the other reviewers.  Nice hotel, especially for the price ( $129/nt.).   Very nicely decorated, good service, good location, etc.  However, I would recommend asking for a room on the intracoastal side, away from the road.  I have never been to a hotel with such a lack of exterior soundproofing.  I had two very restless nights of sleep due to the traffic noise.  Also, my shower water pressure was unbelievably strong and painful at times.  I alerted the front desk after my first night, but nothing was done about it.  I didn't have any trouble with the elevators as others did.  Overall, a good hotel, but major noise issues there.

title: Gallery One is a great deal!
review: Stayed at the Doubletree Gallery One in Ft. Lauderdale on 8/19/07 for a pre-cruise night before we sailed out of Miami. Hotel is 20 minutes from the Ft. Lauderdale/Hollywood Airport and a  45 minute ride to the Port of Miami. Located on the intercoastal in Ft. Lauderdale the hotel was prefect for our family of 6 including children 15,13,13,and 12.  We chose a 2 bedroom suite which gave us plenty of room. The lobby bar is a nice place to enjoy cocktails and the hotel also has a beautiful outside deck area with a beautiful pool. The water taxi stops directly behind the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for a pre/post cruise stay. We did not try the restaurant so can not comment on that. Only downside was our room was not ready for the 3:00pm check-in time. After…

title: Very updated hotel
review: Introduction: We stayed earlier this month on the 6th floor away from the elevator. I am a Silver HHonors member. _____ Overview: We got exceptionally lucky and booked a queen size suite for $99 (I don't know how we snagged such a great deal!).  When we arrived we were automatically upgraded to king size.  The front desk was very acknowledgeable and friendly. _____ Pros: There were quite a few things nice about this hotel.  First has to be the excellent service at the front desk.  The gentleman that helped us was very kind and upgraded us free of charge. - Wonderful updated decor...very contemporary and clean. - The flatscreen TV is huge!  One of the nicest I've seen in a hotel - The kitchen was nicely equipped and we had dishes and cups supplied to us.  All of the appliances…

title: Nice
review: This was a nicely updated hotel.  The room we stayed in was a bit small, but it still came with stainless appliances (dishwasher, fridge, stovetop, and microwave), a wall-mounted 42' flat panel tv, and a modern bathroom.  Overall, it was a great room for a reasonable price.  The hotel sits on the Intercoastal Waterway, not the beach.  The beach is a 10 minute walk, but once you get there, it was not too exciting.  The "happening" part of Ft. Lauderdale beach is a 5-10 minute drive north, where you will find all of the beach-front bars and restaurants. On the downside, the hotel restaurant and bar left a little to be desired, but the breakfast buffet was nevertheless very good.  The pool was nice but small.  Customer service was some of the best I've seen in a Hilton-brand hotel.

title: Wonderful Place to Stay
review: My daughter and I stayed at the Doubletree and had a wonderful time.  It is extremely clean and a very convenient location to the beach, restraunts and night life. The staff is great.  I highly recommend this place and will stay there again.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: I had a one-day stay in July 2007 and loved it.  I am a Hilton Gold, so I was able to comp to one of the nice balcony rooms facing the waterway (and beach).  The room was immaculate.  I was very happy with the kitchen area (although I did not cook), great sofas, etc.  The TV was a nice large flatscreen tv, larger than other Hilton hotel flatscreens.  The view was fantastic, although you are about 3 blocks from the ocean.  I loved the bathroom, including the shower.  The breakfast was also excellent.  Although I did not spend much time by the water, the area outside looked great as well, including some "sandboxes."  Unfortunately I only stayed here one night, but it was a great night.  I do have to admit that I saw the Hilton Ft. Lauderdale Resort on A1A, and I might want to try…

title: Not worth the price
review: I just returned from a couple days at the Gallery One-Doubletree Guest Suites. The hotel is JUST okay and I probably will never return. I checked in rather late so when I was given a room facing west looking at the city with 2 queen beds I didnt complain. I should have requested to be moved that night because the next morning I was awaken by demolition next door. So after I was awaken I called and requested to be moved and requested a room with a king bed. I was told that I would have to pay $40 to upgrade. $40 to upgrade for something out of my control I thought was ridiculous! But I paid it anyway in hopes that it was more quiet and I could stretch out in a king bed. Originally I was on the 11th floor (I think there is 14 total) but then was moved to 7th. The 2nd room I was…

title: Great Ft Lauderdale hotel
review: We stayed here July 13-15 during a convention and the room was a GREAT size! All rooms I believe are suites and we had the bay view, which had a view of the canal and the ocean ( with a couple of condos blocking a complete view) but it was great to sit out on the balcony. The kitchen was small, but updated and looked VERY SLICK!! I also loved the comfortable cushy bed, and the flat panel T.V...I can honestly say the room was well worth the price. We valet our car and the only thing I didnt care for was how packed the valet area got...also the elevators were Soooo slow...the hotel was at full capacity, it only has 3 elevators servicing I believe 14 floors and at one point I waited NO LIE 4 minutes before a elevator stopped at my floor. Housekeeping also took awhile the 2nd day,…

title: Very Impressive!
review: Ft. Lauderdale: The DoubleTree Galleria One Hotel Reviewer: Dottie, Van Nuys, California  Four of us stayed at this hotel (July 6 thru July 8)after returning from a cruise. We had a two bedroom two bath suite and it was fabulous. The suite was clean and luxurious. It had a nice kitchenette. The beds were very comfortable and bath towels were big in size. We loved the HDTV flat screen in the living room. There was a television in the other two bedrooms also. I was truly impressed with the place.  The king bed was actually a "king" bed. We stayed at a place before in Miami and their King bed  was the size of a double bed (disappointing).  We truly loved staying at the Doubletree Galleria One and we plan to stay here again. By the way, the chocolate chip cookies were great. Also,…

title: Loved it, great location
review: This hotel was recommended to me by my boss (a travel blogger) and it was one of the most pleasant lodging experiences I've ever had.   The hotel itself was clean, bright and beautiful. Service was friendly and accommodating. Loved the outdoor futons and furniture on the "beach" by the dock. The water taxi location couldn't have been more convenient.   I knew we had a suite, but I didn't expect it to be almost like a miniature apartment, with the bedroom separate and closed off from the living room/kitchen area. Very convenient for a five-day stay. We bought a few grocery items at the CVS across the street and had quick breakfasts in the morning. Also enjoyed the plasma TV in the living room area, though it would have been awesome to have more TV channels to choose from.  The…

title: Fantastic!!!!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Galleria Doubletree from May 27 - May 29 for a Memorial Day Weekend getaway. We absolutely loved this hotel.  Check-in was a breeze (5 minutes max) and the signature chocolate chip cookies were delicious. We were assigned to room 1128, which faced the bridge and Sunrise Road. Too noisy!!!! All it took was one phone call to the front desk. It seemed like I had just hung up the phone, and the bellman was at our door with keys to a room down the hall. We checked the room, and it was much quieter, so we opted for the second room (1118).  The room itself was clean and beautiful. A full kitchen (although all we used was the refrigerator), a dining area and a living room with a flat screen TV on the wall and a waterview balcony. The bathroom had a…

title: Three days at the double tree
review: We arrived at the Double tree early afternoon, April 26, 2007 and our room was ready.  We were given the delicious chocolate chip cookies that hit the spot since we hadn't eaten in awhile.  Our room was on the seventh floor city view.   Our room was generally clean, but it did need a few drywall repairs and a paint job. ( I notice those things since DH is a drywaller and a painter).  Also on the back of the bathroom door there were dirty fingerprints that were never cleaned.  We used the valet parking and found it to be quite fast and efficient, no complaints there.  On Saturday night there was a wedding there and it was a bit noisy, but we went into the bedroom and closed the door and didnt hear a thing.    The location is excellent right on the waterway with a beautiful view…

title: Fantastic
review: This is a terrific hotel.  Great location, very upscale rooms, attentive staff and excellent service.  As an example, we were looking for something to eat shortly after 11:00PM.  All restaurants and room service close at 11:00PM.  The dining room staff asked if they would be able to prepare something for us to take back to the room as the dining room was closed.  Of course, we were grateful for the accommodation.  They presented us with a fabulous meal and refused to accept payment as they were unable to set us in the dining room.  We encountered this "over the top" effort from all of the staff.  THIS IS A FANTASTIC LOCATION TO VIEW THE AIR & SEA SHOW.  We were able to watch the entire show from our balcony - terrific view, extra large balcony.  We highly recommend the Gallery…

title: Perfect hotel on the intercoastal
review: It seems like a brand new hotel. The rooms were spacious and beautiful. If you do not want to stay directly on the beach it is the perfect place,

title: Great Room - Mediocre Service
review: This hotel is located 3 blocks from the beach, has great rooms, is close to an upscale mall and restaurants, and an easy drive from the airport or nearby highways.  The rooms are essentially full 1 bedroom apartments with 42" flat panel displays and spacious bathrooms and nice balconies.  The staff, however, are spotty at best.  A few nice stars, but mainly aloof (almost cold) and not terribly efficient.  The elevators were incredibly slow, and the housekeepers did a poor job at vacuuming the room.  Oh yes - watch out for the carpet edges that abut tile floors.  The carpets are thin and you can hurt your feet on the carpet tacks.   All things considered, we would stay here again, but they could do so much better with a liitle customer service training!

title: Could be better than excellent - but!
review: Great hotel, great location, lovely room with a view over the Galleria Mall with the Fort Lauderdale skyline in the distance.  We were on the 12th floor with no traffic noise even though we had a city view room.  You do not really need a car if you are planning a Fort Lauderdale beach based vacation as you have the water taxi stop behind the hotel and you are within easy walking distance to the beach.  However if you do have a car and want to self park be ready for a minor strop from the valet park guy.  You have to register with him on arrival and he doesn't suggest self parking, you have to insist.  There is not much difference in price $11 self parking $14 valet - we just didn't want to have to wait for him to fetch the car when we were going out.    The rooms are very…

title: Excellent Stay at the Doubletree
review: The Doubletree Galleria is located in the northern section of Fort Lauderdale and is easy to get to from the FLL Airport by car. Could be costly by cab.    The  check-in had to be the fastest I have ever experienced and the desk staff was consistently friendly and cordial.  Our room was on the 9th floor and we had a nice view of the intercoastal waterway and the downtown in the distance.  The ocean could be seen at a distance.  The room is a two room suite with a large plasma tv in the family area. Another tv in bedroom.  There is also a small kitchen with plates, utensils, stove, microwave, and small refrigerator.  Beds were firm and yet very comfortable.  Clean throughout. No tub-just a large shower. Rooms were well sound proofed and appears to have been recently refurbished. …

title: Needs work in the guest service area!
review: The hotel is lcoated in a terrific spot-directly on the intracoastal waterway and about 2 blocks (a 5 minute walk) to the ocean. You can have a view facing north wehre you see the drawbridge open for taller boats and you can see the ocean as well or you can face directly east seeing the waterway and ocean facing that direction. There are enromous iguanas living on the property of the hotel near the pool and waterway and it's great to watch them, gentle, smelling for food in a tropical surrounding.  The rooms are large (all suites) and the flat tv's are an extra, however the hotel's workers need training from cleaning techniques to guest services. Don't expect to get your federal express packages or any apologies when you tell the front desk about any challenges, even a ringing…

title: Standards need to be maintained or the reputation will tarnish...
review: I recently returned from a one-week stay at the Gallerias.  This was my second stay.  The first, in Sept.  2006,  was just as renovations were being finished.  I couldn't fault it then; staff were universally friendly, room-service and housekeeping excellent, public areas and bedrooms were kept impeccable and...oh those beds... the most comfortable I have ever slept in any hotel around the world..  It's in a good location - close to the Galleria Mall and beach, walkable to beach-side night life.  Believe me, I am a tidy guest, and any servicing of the room generally consists of changing towels and a run round with a vacuum.  So, OK, the week before Easter was Spring Break and the hotel was close to capacity.  But that's really no excuse for shoddy housekeeping.  On more than one…

title: Not Quite Up to the Mark
review: We picked this hotel based on its location (close to airport--about 15 minutes away) and availablity of suites.  But for the money and the big name, we were disappointed in the details.  The room was supposed to be non-smoking, but clearly a smoker had recently been in residence.  The bath mat and two towels had holes.  I was not convinced the hide-a-bed sheets had been changed since the last user.  The door stuck, making it very hard to open.  The bellhop took over 30 minutes to bring up our luggage.  I expect these things at lesser priced hotels.  I find them annoying for the price I paid.  Yes, the suite was spacious and attractive.  The pool, work out room and beach are great.  The warm cookies are spectacular.  But next time, I would give my money to a place that's getting…

title: Say hello to Big Louie !
review: This is a beautiful hotel- the suites are spacious, well equipped with high quality granite and marble surfaces in the kitchen and bathroom. It's worth paying for a water view balcony suite for the views. The location is perfect- overlooking the intracoastal waterway over which big Louie, the resident iguana, holds court at the water's edge. The water taxi stops here so very convenient for car free travel round the city. Lots of wildlife to watch as well as the people- manatee, black vultures in abundance, pelicans and a resident grey heron on the opposite bank. Unfortunately, the weekend we stayed the restaurant was out of action - bit of a disappointment but the very helpful manager compensated us for that inconvenience. Maid service left much to be desired - we stared at a…

title: Brilliant!
review: This hotel is brilliant - from the warm cookies at check-in to the huge, comfy rooms and luxury bathrooms.  My dad and I stayed for one night and wished we could stay another. The room was fantastic and very high quality. The staff at the hotel were very polite and efficient, parking is easy, plus there's some decent shopping malls and restaurants only 3 minutes walk. What's not to like?!

title: Great Stay!
review: March 10, 2007, 2 adults, 1 child (Spring Break)  one night stay before cruise.  We got on Hotwire 119.99US.  I had origninally booked this hotel at 259.00US and lucked out by getting on Hotwire.    Hotel was very busy, being Spring Break.  Check in was not until 3:00pm but we were okay with this as it was busy and that is check in time as they list.   We were in walking distance to the beach and resturants, so we changed in the washroom and off we went.  We ate lunch at the Blue Fish? very good food and great astmosphere.  The beach was very busy with Spring Breakers and the sand and ocean looked nice.  The room check in was good!  The room was great, big screen TV, my husband was happy, and another TV in Bedroom.  We had 2 Queen beds and pullout couch.  The room was very…

title: Good Stay
review: Stayed two nights, Feb 23 and 24th.  Room was large and clean. Only exception was all of the dishes/silverware/cups were in the dishwasher and not clean.  There was dishwasher soap in the room so I just ran it when we found them.  Pool was large, heated and not too crowded.  We took the water taxi (stops right at hotel) downtown where their are many more restaurants.  It is expensive but nice to do once to see the boats in the marinas and the big houses on the intercoastal.  Beach was a short walk, we spent one day there.  Water was very clear and about 70 degrees.  But I think the city of FT L asking $10 a chair and $15 an umbrella rental on the Beach is a bit too much.  Stopped here on the way back from Key West so it was nice to park the car and walk where we wanted to go for…

title: Doubletree Disappointing
review: After reading reviews on-line, we were pleased to learn our priceline bid had been accepted for $125.  What a disappointment it turned out to be.  We were given an outdated information packet and when inquiring about proceedures and restaurants listed on the imformation packet, front desk acted like we were stupid.  The room was NOT CLEAN.  There were dirty dishes in dishwasher with stagnant water lying in the bottom.  When I called the desk, the reply was "Oh really?"!!  There was a baggage tag behind the bedroom door making it obvious it had not been vacuumed, large cookie crumbs and chocoate smudges on the upholstered chair , and the bedding on one of the beds was twisted, we choose the other bed!  The room itself was spacious and would be very comfortable if it were clean. …

title: Great rooms; great position but......
review: We are Brits who travel around the USA frequently( we love Florida). This hotel has been transformed by its renovation. The rooms are large suites with kitchen and balcony. The hotel's position is wonderful and a small,but nice beach,has been created. The  lovely pool is heated.Everything is close to hand- restaurants. beach, transportation and shopping.However,during our stay the restaurant was chaotic: quite the worst experience we have ever had in the USA( not the quality of food; the quality of service and organisation).  We were told it was because the restaurant has a new menu! Well, maybe this was the reason but I think the situation is more to do with this being a  ' Condo hotel' , with many longstay visitors who enjoy eating in the restaurant/from room service and the…

title: Nice Spot
review: I booked this hotel on short notice on the hotel website. I usually stay at The Atlantic when in Lauderdale, but their prices keep going up while their services seem to be going down. So I decided to try this spot because of the location.  The room was super for the price and for a couple more bucks, I imagine the Intercoastal views are worth the price as well. Marble bathroom, nice TV, good workspace, comfortable/clean bed, etc. I was traveling on business this trip, but I wouldn't hesitate to book this room for my family. We have a toddler and these suites would be perfect for the three of us.    It was cold so I didn't try any of the pool/spa amenities but they looked fine. I also didn't eat at the hotel or try room service this trip, all my meals were outside the hotel so I…

title: great hotel
review: Got this hotel through Hotwire for 119. At check in we were greated with warm chocholate chip cookies -very nice. Our room was on the third floor we looked out over the front entrance which was fine. Nice clean room. I love the kitchenette as it makes the vacation cheaper and more convienent. We went to the Publix just down the road and stocked up with lunch and breakfast treats.  The first night we went down to the pool. The water temp was just fine however the whirlpool was green and not working. There was not sign and my daughter briefly went it-yuck. I called the CARELINE to mention that it was green. After dinner we noticed that there was caution tape around the whirlpool. The next day it was up and running.  I really liked that the pool entrance was on a different level…

title: Loved this place.
review: Stayed here for 4 nights over new years while traveling to the Orange Bowl game.  We looked at several other properties, the Beach Place Towers, the Bahia Mar, and had friends staying at both.  Everyone we knew who visited said that our suite was far nicer than their room, with a huge flatscreen TV and nice Kitchenette, I didn't have trouble believing it.  Great little beach / sun area on the intercoastal waterway, friendly service, and a great property.    Would highly recommend this place, as long as you don't mind being off the beach.

title: horrible service
review: I stayed at this hotel over christmas. the rooms are nicely renovated however the housekeeping staff is slow and inefficient..front desk staff is not helpful and rude...no towels at the pool...noisy renovations ongoing(did not inforn us before) overall nice hotel with very poor service

title: great location on intercoastal
review: Loved enormous suite at Doubletree w/recent renovations: granite counters in kitchen that also had dishwasher/ plates/ utensils/ free bottled water/etc. We had 2 brdm suite: wonderfully comfortable beds - queens in one + king in other.  "W Hotel type sleek furniture in dining room/living room w/flat screen TV - marble floors & new carpeting.    Spacious bathrooms--lots of shelves, plenty of counter space & separate shower.  Only drawback was no fan!--really need them when 2 women are sharing/taking showers --OR put outlets at counter/mirror in foyer for makeup/hair.    Service drawback: housekeeping didn't cleam room 1 day & only dropped off 3 vs 6 towels requested for 3 people--but mgr took nice amt off hotel bill because of it--which is why I would stay again.  Water ferry…

title: Hard to argue ...
review: Just got back from our stay here (which was 12/10 - 12/15/06).  It is in a perfect location right on the Intracoastal waterway, and has amazing ocean views as well.  Good area, maybe 6 miles or so from I95, about a $20 cab ride from the airport.  There is an upscale mall right behind the hotel which features believe it or not a gourmet food court (which is excellent and has even been written about in local newspapers.)   The water taxi drops you off directly in front of the hotel.  It's $10 per ride.  For lunch, take it up the waterway for a nice ride past the iguanas and million dollar homes to Charley's Crab- maybe a 15 minute ride.   Overall, this is an excellent stay for anyone visiting Ft Lauderdale and/or Miami (latter is approximately 30 miles to the south- a very easy…

title: LOVED the Gallery One Doubletree, Ft. Lauderdale
review: Just returned from a week in Florida. Stayed at the Gallery One, Doubletree Suites Hotel in Ft. Lauderdale on E. Sunrise Blvd.  Totally loved it.  The renovations are great, the updates to the rooms couldn't be better.  The kitchens are all modern with stainless steel applicances, nice cabinets, marble floors in the kitchen and bath.  The living room/dining areas have been updated and have a more sleek, modern look with neutral colors.  The nicest additions are the 42" plasma tv in the living room and the updated styling in the bedroom.  Beds are very comfortable and pillows were great.  The all marble baths look great with large walk in shower featuring a rain shower head.   Overall, this hotel gets two thumbs up.  Service is good, cleanliness great and I will definitely be…

title: great place
review: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree for 10 days after a cruise. Being my first time to Florida, I didn't know for sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was large and new and really clean!! It was like having a small apartment. We ate at the restraunt for lunch one day. The portions were large and the food was good. The pool was nice as you could look onto the waterways. The front loby was being worked on but didn't pose a problem. The staff is nice but not overly friendly but maybe just because I was comparing them to the cruise we had just left where the staff are so willing to please you. I would go back again. I am really picky about where I stay . I have a really hard time staying at any hotels that are dirty or are a "party hotel" for teenagers.…

title: Great stay.
review: Stayed here for a couple nights and had a great experience. As Hilton Honors Diamond members we were upgraded to a beautiful and large suite overlooking the water way with windows wrapping the entire way around. Very excellent. We ordered room service one night and it was very, very good. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend the hotel. Doubletrees can be very risky, some are nice while others are terrible, but this was a very good example of one.

title: I Was Disappointed
review: We (my 3-year-old daughter and I) stayed here for two nights in September and given another chance, I would definitely choose another hotel.  I did know previous to our stay that there was a renovation going on. But I was told that this would not affect us because most of the renovation was done. Unfortunately, the pieces that were not done surrounded the dining area (NO FOOD!) and the pool area. I was very bummed about the food situation. Not only was there a lot of rough construction to walk around (not cool for a kid), but hardly any of the dining options for room service were available to us. When I ordered a sandwich, they told me that I could only get pasta salad and so I said, forget the side. Instead they went out and bought potato chips. That would have been great,…

title: A+ Hotel..Newly Renovated.
review: First and foremost, let me say that I got an excellent deal at this hotel.  I stayed here from Oct. 6 to Oct. 11. I booked on hotwire and got a deal for $556.00, all taxes included, for the hotel and a car for five days.  Checking in was hasstle free. It took approximately 3 minutes. All they need at check-in is a credit card to put a hold of $50.00 for incidental charges.  Also, you get freshly made chocolate chip cookies that taste awesome, before you go up to your room.  Every morning, daily newspapers are waiting for you, right outside your door.  Self Parking is $11.00 a day..valet I think is $25.00 daily.  Getting to the hotel from Fort Lauderdale airport is a peach.  As soon as you get off terminal drive, get onto US1. US1 takes you all the way up to the hotel...which is…

title: Doubletree -Galleria
review: We stayed at the Gallery One--Doubletree the week of Sept 3rd. The lobby was not done and the restaurant was in a temporary location. All rooms are done and quite nice. The only room complaint was you will flood the bathroom when you get a shower (Also read this on two other post's) the glass doors have about a 1/2 inch opening. Parking is $14.00 per day or $11.00 for self parking, self parking is about one block away. The movie theater next door is now closed. Nice water view of intercoastal but you will not see the ocean due to high rise condos across waterway. Ocean is a good three blocks away, nice walk but bringing along beach stuff you will want to drive. We would not stay at this place again just because we would want to be closer to the beach and have a ocaen view.

title: Nice but not really
review: Here we are, just came back from our stay in Galleria 1. Long waited vacation for me and my husband. I picked up this hotel, because it was close to the beach, lots of convenient stores, Galleria Mall etc. Needless to stay, I read all the reviews...I guess not the last ones.  Upon check-in, we were given the most noisiest room, overlooking the draw bridge and the highway. Luckily the front desk agent changed the room and gave us another one, thanks god better location. Overall the cleanliness of the room was fine. Be careful when taking a shower, you might make a flood in the bathroom, (one thing we disliked a lot) it was like the water didn't have anywhere to go but on the floor.:-( The desk agents were very nice, but apparently, just started working there and when we asked…

title: Love The Doubletree
review: I wasn't sure what to expect, I never heard of Doubletree before this trip, I was just looking for a overnight hotel for me and my family to be not to far from the Airport and also to have a chance to visit Fort Lauderdale and Miami and it was a awesome experience, we regret not staying longer.  The suite was amazing, a flat 52" TV in the living room with a sofa bed, a dining room and a full equiped kitchen we loved it. The bedroom like you can tell was well done but the safety box was a challenge too complicated to use, I guess that make it  really safe. We also like the shower bathroom it was really spacious and nice for the family to use.  Well located the hotel is just a block away to the galleria mall, the pool which is located near the intracoastal Waterway, lovely...  We…

title: Cool Place. Way Cool.
review: All in all, this is a fabulous hotel. When my family of four stayed here for a night before our Caribbean cruise in late July, the hotel was immaculately clean and snazzily decorated in a modern chic motif. Our newly-renovated suite was super attractive and spacious. The service was friendly and efficient. To top it all off, the hotel is in a great location! (A very short walk from the beach in one direction and a nice upscale shopping mall in the opposite direction.) In my opinion, the hotel is drastically underrated.  We had only three mild complaints: #1. There was no ice machine on our floor. (We were directed to a restaurant near the lobby for ice.) #2. Through the Hilton/Doubletree website, we booked a package that supposedly included  "free breakfast." But the breaksfast…

title: Outstanding Service and Lovely Accomodation
review: Spent one night at this property.  I read the trip advisor reports regarding the renovations and when i called the hotel directly i inquired as to what floors had been completed.  I was told everything above the seventh floor.  When making my reservation, I requested a high floor with an early check-in.  When we pulled in the valet was there, very hospitable and professional.  We not only received an early check-in, but were upgraded, without asking, to a water view on the ninth floor. The desk clerk was cheerful, polite and expedited our room keys quickly - check-in took less than 3 minutes.  The suite was freshly painted, decorated nicely and the bed one of the most comfortable i have slept in while traveling.  All for $189 with local properties in the area, without any of the…

title: Not a good time.
review: Okay we stayed in the two queens suite which was nice looking, if not a little small. The problem was service.  First, the pool is under renovation which is an eyesore and something they should be more vocal with divulging before people show up.  Second, the service (with the exception of the restaurant and room service) is terrible. I mean truly horrendous.  They won't clean your room before 2 unless you ask for it and they take their time regardless of the state of emergency. The pluses are their warm cookies they give when you check in and John who works in the restaurant. I was happy to check out. Book at your own peril but for all that money I would stay at the Atlantic and split it with some friends.

title: Fantastic hotel at a fantastic price
review: When we checked in - we couldn't believe how nice our 2 bedroom suite was for $ 189 a night.  Everyhting was new and tastefully remodeled.  The sitting room even had a 42" plasma tv.  Everyhting was fantastic - including the service of the employees.  The business room had full internet access (made checking my stocks easy) The proximity to the beach/mall etc was great too. Excellent value - this place will shock your pants off.

title: 2nd Stay at this Property
review: Let me start off by saying that I am a Hilton Honors Silver VIP, and usually stay in Hilton Brand Hotels 5-10 times a year, and other brands another 5-10 times a year.   Rate: $99/Per night, $109.89 W/ Tax Rooms: The Rooms are large 2 room suites with a bedroom with one queen or 2 double beds, Fairly large bathroom, and then the main room has a Pull out couch & TV, a table with 4 chairs, and small furnished kitchenette with a dishwasher, large fridge, sink, microwave, and stove.  There is a balcony large enough for two chairs and a table.   Service: Every employee we encountered was friendly, and willing to help us out with every request we had. I was extremely pleased with this aspect.  Condition of Rooms: The last time I stayed at this property was in April of 2002, and in my…

title: Wait til the renovation is complete before staying there.
review: The location is very good, with the water taxi right there. However, the hotel is under renovation and until it's complete, I would not recommend staying there again. The newly renovated rooms are not being rented yet, but I saw them and they are outstanding.  Most of the hotel is under construction, and the facilities are unavailable or in poor condition. When the renovation is complete, it will be a top pick. Perhaps they'll offer deep discounts if they rent one of the older rooms as they are in terrible condition. The staff is very accomodating and well trained, but I felt bad that they had to make excuses for the condition of the hotel. I'll go back when the hotel is finished.

title: Something weird is going on at this hotel...
review: I really, really wanted to like this place.  It's a great location if you're visiting Ft. Lauderdale, close to the beach, next door to a mall and the water taxi stops right there.  What happened with our stay?  Frankly I'm not sure.  We arrived around 11:30am after debarking a cruise ship on Christmas Eve and were told that while there was room at the inn our room wouldn't be ready until closer to 2:30pm.   So off we went with our 3-year-old to the beach, had lunch and came back at 2:15 to be reminded checkin wasn't until 3pm.   We're patient and rules are rules so we waited until 3pm to check-in.  Now keep in mind the hotel appeared more than half empty based on the number of cars in the parking lot.  Bottom line is room wasn't ready until 3:45 with no explanation other than…

title: Close to Everything!
review: Visited Ft. Lauderdale for a second time this year and stayed at the Doubletree Galleria again. I would definitely return.  PROS: -convenient location: -25 min. drive from the airport -5 min. walk to the beach -staff -water taxi stops directly in back of hotel -patio area in back with "mini beach" -nice heated pool -across the street from a CVS, Wholefoods Market & a pretty good Chinese restaurant -next to a nice mall that features, among other stores, Saks, Dillards and Neiman Marcus, etc., and one of the best food courts around -rooms are a good size, beds are comfortable and each suite has a full kitchen, living/dining area -rooms with balconies facing the waterway  CONS:  -traffic noise from busy E. Sunrise  -noise from the drawbridge -occasional loud party boats floating by…

title: Never had an enjoyable stay
review: I've stayed here many times since the location is convenient to the water taxi, beaches & mall. The hotel has been milked dry while the units are being converted into condos. I'm suprised that management allows the units to be so run down when they are trying to sell units. I would buy if not so turn off by the daily management and room condition. Checked in today, no doorman, no valet, just one person for check-in. TV's broke...carpet needs a good cleaning, but will probably jump the water taxi and enjoy the Intercoastal! After every stay I get a Doubletree e-mail to take a satisfaction survey, which I fill out, but nothing changes!

title: Wonderful Property
review: I have alot to tell about the DOubletree Galleria Suites. I just came home from spending an entire meeting day there. I went all over the hotel including the hallways,elevators, and the top floors. I did  not stay in a room but I did see and check out all of the property. The lobby and staff are extremely friendly! They helped us out with everything for our meeting. The bellboys were so helpful as well. The meeting rooms are very clean and nice but they will be renovated soon because the hotel is beginning its huge renovation project to turn half of the hotel into a CONDO development called Galleria Condo or some name like that. The top two floors are totally destroyed because of the current renovation to redo the rooms. The hallways of the hotel,currently, are nice but they are…

title: Great vacation, wonderful hotel.
review: My 7 year old daughter and I had a wonderful stay at the Oceanfront Hotel.  I would recommend this hotel highly and I look forward to staying there again with the rest of our family.

title: DOUBLETREE SUITES WAS GREAT!!
review: Stayed at Doubletree Suites Galleria for one night pre-cruise. Had a very enjoyable stay. The room was spacious and clean,  chocolate chip cookies were delicious. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only drawback would be if you have a room facing Sunrise Blvd. Traffic going over the bridge may keep you awake at night. Our room was facing the pool and noise was minimal.

title: Guest Suites--Great Hotel
review: Despite renovations in progress, this is a fine property--the only things keeping it from 4* is the lack of stronger services (room service and restaurant just OK, pool is unsupervised with no bar right by the pool). Excellent check-in, nice clean 1 BR suite (a real suite with a separate BR), and outstanding service from all hotel staff. As noted in earlier reviews, the hotel location is excellent, with the mall and shopping center right across the street. Should mention Tommy D's for breakfast--nice deli/diner just a block away. FYI, the renovation is part of a conversion to a resort/timeshare combo; they will be allotting part of their rooms to owners. The new name will be GalleryOne Place by Doubletree.

title: My Hotel Of Choice When I Visit!
review: In reading the reviews of this hotel, I must say I am surprised by some of the responses.  I understand, however, what some are saying.  This is definately a family oriented hotel.  Although it's been years since I was last there, I had a wonderful stay.  My room was clean.  I had a suite on the 14th floor overlooking the Intracoastal/Ocean View.  However, during my stay there in 1999, a highrise Condo was being built, so now there is no ocean view at all.  My room faced the drawbridge/A1A.  I had room service twice.  Room service is expensive, but you come to expect that.  I found the food served from the restaurant to be very nice!  The only complaints that I have is that the rooms are a bit dated.  My bathroom, while large, needed renovation.  Thie tile looked dirty from…

title: I liked it
review: We stayed here because we were attending a wedding on the yacht outside the hotel.  I was pleasantly surprised with our stay.  We had a room on the 11th floor with a balcony.  We faced the intracostal waterway.  The room was spacious with a living room and a small kitchen.  Friends stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the patio and the intracostal waterway which was even nicer because it was a little quieter.  I had breakfast at the hotel restaurant which I thought was good.  The pool area is not hugh but it served the purpose.  There was an outdoor tiki hut for drinks though I thought the Daquiris had too much crushed ice.  Beach is a few blocks away but this location was ideal for this wedding.  I would stay here again.
